<div id="page-1135198">
<h3><a name="page-1135198">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.  April 14^th 1875 [underlined] '>Trustees.  April 14^th 1875 [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Boston, April 14^th, 1875.  [underlined]</p>
<p>A regular monthly meeting of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held on Wednesday, April 14, 1875, <span class='line-break'> </span>at Four o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs.  John T. <span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, Little, Perkins,<span class='line-break'> </span>Pickering, Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Statements[underlined]'>Treasurer's Statements[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's Statement of the Receipts and <span class='line-break'> </span>Expenditures for the quarter ending March 31^st, 1875,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='referred to [underlined]'>referred to [underlined]</span><span class='line-break'> </span>also his Statement of the amounts due and uncollected <span class='line-break'> </span>for the same period, having been submitted to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Finance.[underlined]'>Com. on Finance.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the statements of the Treasurer be <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Committee on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t. [underlined]'>Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of bills, with ac=<span class='line-break'> </span>companying schedule, having been submitted to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said bills be referred to the President<span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval, and payment by the Treasurer if found<span class='line-break'> </span>correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watering streets for 1875.[underlined]'>Watering streets for 1875.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President having called the attention of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees to the importance of having the streets near <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery properly watered for the season, - on <span class='line-break'> </span>motion of M^r Choate, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], -  that the subject of making proper provisions</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135200">
<h3><a name="page-1135200">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 2</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>2</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.  April 14^th, 1875. [underlined]'>Trustees.  April 14^th, 1875. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>for watering the streets near the Cemetery be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Grounds with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rules and Regulations adopted at Meeting of April 12^th, 75. referred to Special Com. to cons. &amp; report. [underlined]'>Rules and Regulations adopted at Meeting of April 12^th, 75. referred to Special Com. to cons. &amp; report. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of M^r J. T. Bradlee, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the "Rules and Regulations"<span class='line-break'> </span>reported at the Proprietor's meeting of April 12^th, <span class='line-break'> </span>1875, be referred to a Committee of three trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>to be appointed by the chair, to consider and report, <span class='line-break'> </span>at a meeting to be held on the 23^rd inst., at 3 1/2 P. M.,<span class='line-break'> </span>what changes or additions may be necesssary in <span class='line-break'> </span>said Rules and Regulation as reported.</p>
<p>The President appointed Messrs. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate and Perkins to comprise said Committee.</p>
<p>On motion of M^r Bradlee, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the President be added to the Com^tee</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposed amendments; notice of intention to offer  from Messrs. Choate  [underlined] '>Proposed amendments; notice of intention to offer  from Messrs. Choate  [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Notice was received from M^r Choate of his <span class='line-break'> </span>intention to submit, at the next meeting, amend=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ment to said Rules and Regulations in the matter of <span class='line-break'> </span>the "deeds and other forms therein contained."  Also <span class='line-break'> </span>an amendment to the provisions respecting the <span class='line-break'> </span>"issue of permits."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='and Bradlee [underlined]'>and Bradlee [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Notice was received from M^r Bradlee of <span class='line-break'> </span>his intention to submit, at the next meeting, an am=<span class='line-break'> </span>mendment to said Rules and Regulations in the <span class='line-break'> </span>matters of "Interment Fees," "live hedges" and <span class='line-break'> </span>"Order of Business."</p>
<p>The above notices were stated to be given <span class='line-break'> </span>pursuant to the provisions of Art. XIII of the Rules &amp; Reg^ns</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135202">
<h3><a name="page-1135202">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 3</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>3</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.  April 14^th, 1875. [underlined] '>Trustees.  April 14^th, 1875. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest <span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='105'>105</span></p>
<p>James Cheever of Boston, son of James Cheever, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot number One hundred and five.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1876'>1876</span></p>
<p>Charles Forster of Buckfield, M^e, son of Charles Forster<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot number Eighteen hundred &amp; seventy=six.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3050'>3050</span></p>
<p>Miriam C. Pratt (M^rs Edward E.) } of Boston, daughter of Helen C. Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot number Three thousand fifty.</p>
<p>Dissolved. [underlined]</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder, Jr., Sec'y.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.  Aparil 23, 1875 [underlined]'>Trustees.  Aparil 23, 1875 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>April 23^d, 1875. [underlined]</p>
<p>A special meeting of the Board of Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Friday, April 23^d, at half past Three o'clk P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs J. T. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Pickering and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rules and Regulations.  Report of Spec. Com^tee on. [underlined]'>Rules and Regulations.  Report of Spec. Com^tee on. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The special committee appointed at the last<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting to consider and report what chanegs or additions<span class='line-break'> </span>may be necessary in the Rules and Regulations, sub=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mitted a written report, which was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>considered.  The yeas and nays having been ordered,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135204">
<h3><a name="page-1135204">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 4</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>4</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees- April 23^d 1875. [underlined]'>Trustees- April 23^d 1875. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>it was unanimously</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the report be accepted, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>amendments therein recommended be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rules and Regulations. [underlined]'>Rules and Regulations. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the notice given by him at the <span class='line-break'> </span>last meeting, M^r Choate moved the adoption of the <span class='line-break'> </span>following amendment to Article VI of the Rules and <span class='line-break'> </span>Regulations, viz:  to insert after the word "annually",</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr^ Choate&apos;s Amendment to Art. VI laid on the table. [underlined] '>Mr^ Choate's Amendment to Art. VI laid on the table. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>in the 5^th line of the second paragraph of said article, <span class='line-break'> </span>the words following, to wit;  "provided that a propri=<span class='line-break'> </span>"etor may employ any person to take charge of his lot <span class='line-break'> </span>"by filing with the Superintendent a written authority <span class='line-break'> </span>"so to do, giving the name of the person authorized, and <span class='line-break'> </span>"the time for which the authority is given."</p>
<p>After discussion, on motion of M^r Lawrence, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the proposed amendemnt be laid upon <span class='line-break'> </span>the table.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='M^r J. T. Bradlee&apos;s amendments to Articles VI &amp; XI adopted. [underlined]'>M^r J. T. Bradlee's amendments to Articles VI &amp; XI adopted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the notice given by him at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, M^r Bradlee moved the adoption of the following <span class='line-break'> </span>amendment to said Article VI, - viz;  to strike out from <span class='line-break'> </span>the 1^st line of the third paragraph of said Article, the <span class='line-break'> </span>words "live hedges."</p>
<p>Also to adopt as the "Order of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees," all that follows the first paragraph of Article<span class='line-break'> </span>XI of said Rules and Regulations.  Being the same words <span class='line-break'> </span>which, as recommended by the report of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Rules and Regulations, have now been struck out<span class='line-break'> </span>from that code.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135206">
<h3><a name="page-1135206">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 5</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>5</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 23^d, 1875. [underlined] '>Trustees. April 23^d, 1875. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the amendments proposed by M^r Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Francis Gould &amp; ^[?] Richardson Division of Lots 4335  4336  refused [underlined] '>Francis Gould &amp; ^[?] Richardson Division of Lots 4335  4336  refused [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots, to whom at the meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of March 12^th, 1875, was referred at the communication from <span class='line-break'> </span>parties interested in lots numbered 4335 and 4336 Perella <span class='line-break'> </span>Path, on requesting a re=location and division of said lots,<span class='line-break'> </span>reported, - "that by the Act of March 31, 1835, Sect. 8, it is <span class='line-break'> </span>"provided that 'lots in the said cemetery shall be indivisible,'<span class='line-break'> </span>"and it would therefore appear that the Trustees are not <span class='line-break'> </span>"permitted to re=locate the lots as requested."</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said report be accepted, and concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='J. C. Chase &amp; Moses E. Cushman sale of Lots 4367, 4368 to, without intermediate space, ratified. [underlined] '>J. C. Chase &amp; Moses E. Cushman sale of Lots 4367, 4368 to, without intermediate space, ratified. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The same Committee also reported a recommendation <span class='line-break'> </span>that the Secretary be authorized to prepare and deliver<span class='line-break'> </span>deeds of Lots N^os 4367 and 4368, Gerardia Path, contracted <span class='line-break'> </span>to be sold without reservation of intermediate space, as <span class='line-break'> </span>shown on Superintendent's report of April 15, 1875.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined[, - that said report be accepted and concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fence bet. Stone Farm &amp; land of J. Stone. Notice of intention to ask app^n for. [underlined] '>Fence bet. Stone Farm &amp; land of J. Stone. Notice of intention to ask app^n for. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the provisions of Article III of the Rules <span class='line-break'> </span>and Regulations notice of an intention to ask for an ap=<span class='line-break'> </span>=propriation exceeding $1000. - for the erection of a fence<span class='line-break'> </span>between the Stone farm and land of Joshua Stone, was <span class='line-break'> </span>given by the chairman of the C ommittee on Grounds,</p>
<p>On motion of M^r Choate it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Farm - Com. on Grounds to cons.&amp; rep. as to names of Av_es &amp; Paths on. [underlined]'>Stone Farm - Com. on Grounds to cons.&amp; rep. as to names of Av_es &amp; Paths on. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Committee on Grounds be requested <span class='line-break'> </span>to consider and report what action, if any, may be expedient <span class='line-break'> </span>or desirable with reference to the names of Avenues and <span class='line-break'> </span>Paths on the Stone farm district.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135208">
<h3><a name="page-1135208">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 6</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>6</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 23. 1875 [underlined] '>Trustees. April 23. 1875 [underlined] </span></p>
<p>On motion of the same gentleman, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined] - that the Committee on Lots be requested <span class='line-break'> </span>to consider and report as to the expediency of laying <span class='line-break'> </span>out lots less than 300 feet in area.  Also of apply=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ing to the Legislature for such amendments to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Acts of Incorporation as may be requisite in order<span class='line-break'> </span>to constitute proprietors of less than 300 feet members <span class='line-break'> </span>of the corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title='Hour fixed for Regular Meetings. [underlined] ='>Hour fixed for Regular Meetings. [underlined] =</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that until otherwise ordered, the hour<span class='line-break'> </span>for the regular meeting of this Board be fixed at <span class='line-break'> </span>Four o'clock in the afternoon,</p>
<p>Dissolved. [underlined]</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder, Jr., Sec'y.</p>
<p>===Trustees. May 12^th, 1875. [underlined]</p>
<p>May 12^th 1875 [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Board of Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Wednesday, May 12^th, at Four o'clock, P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President and Messrs J. T. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Pickering and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>

<div id="page-1135222">
<h3><a name="page-1135222">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 13</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>RULES AND REGULATIONS</p>
<p>FOR THE</p>
<p>CEMETERY OF MOUNT AUBURN.</p>
<p>ARTICLE I.</p>
<p>The Board of Trustees shall annually, at their first meeting after the annual meeting, elect a President, who shall preside at all meetings of the Corporation and of the Trustees, and in his absence a temporary chairman shall be chosen; they shall also at the same meeting, or at some adjournment thereof, elect a Secretary, a Treasurer, and a Superintendent, all by ballot; and all salaries for the ensuing year shall then be fixed.</p>
<p>ARTICLE II.</p>
<p>The following Standing Committees shall be appointed annually, upon nomination by the President, immediately after the organization of the Board of Trustees: -<span class='line-break'></span>A Committee on the Grounds, to consist of the President and four other Trustees, who shall have general charge of the grounds, trees, avenues and paths in the Cemetery. No avenues or paths shall be laid out, or changed in location or in name, without having been reported to the Board of Trustees and confirmed by them;<span class='line-break'> </span>A Committee on Lots, to consist of three Trustees, who shall have the supervision of all sales, locations or enlargements of lots or spaces; of questions of rights between individual proprietors or between proprietors and the Corporation; and of contracts with proprietors for the partial or the perpetual care of lots. They shall, at least once in each year, personally examine all lots for the care of which contracts may have been made, and see that the terms of such contrcts are complied with;</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135224">
<h3><a name="page-1135224">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 14</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>12</p>
<p>A Committee on Interments, to consist of two Trustees, who shall superintend the general subject of interments, and see that the Laws of the Commonwealth in relation thereto are complied with;<span class='line-break'> </span>A Committee on Finance, to consist of two Trustees, who shall direct the Treasurer in the custody, payment or investment of the funds of the Corporation. They shall also act as Auditors; shall examine the Treasurer's account, vouchers, certificates of stock, and other evidences of property belonging to the Corporation, quarterly, and append the result thereof to his annual report.</p>
<p>ARTICLE III.</p>
<p>APPROPRIATIONS AND PAYMENTS.</p>
<p>No appropriations exceeding the sum of one thousand dollars for a single purpose shall be made, unless notice thereof shall have been given at a meeting held not less than seven days before final action is taken.<span class='line-break'> </span>No expenditures shall be incurred, excepting in pursuance of orders by the Board of Trustees, nor unless an appropriation shall have been made to meet them.<span class='line-break'> </span>No payment shall be made until the bills or pay-rolls, as the case may be, shall have been examined by the appropriate committee and approved by the Board of Trustees, unless upon contract made by authority of, and approved by the Board, or in pursuance of a vote of the Trustees.</p>
<p>ARTICLE IV.</p>
<p>SALES AND CONVEYANCES.</p>
<p>Upon the selection of a lot, or parcel of ground, the Superintendent shall issue to the person proposing to purchase a certificate in the form provided therefor.<span class='line-break'> </span>When the terms and conditions of the sale shall have been approved, in writing, by a majority of the Committee on Lots, the purchaser shall pay to the Treasurer the stipulated price; whereupon the Secretary shall make, record and deliver a deed signed by the Treasurer, countedsigned by the Secretary, and</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135226">
<h3><a name="page-1135226">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 15</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>15</p>
<p>13</p>
<p>sealed with the common seal of the Corporation, which shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be receipted for in a book provided for that purpose.<span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup><i>And if the said Lot <span class='line-break'> </span>is within that portion <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery set a<span class='line-break'></span>part by vote of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees passed Nov. 19th, <span class='line-break'> </span>1873, the purchaser <span class='line-break'> </span>shall also pay to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer the further <span class='line-break'> </span>stipulated sum for its <span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care, and <span class='line-break'> </span>shall receive, in addition <span class='line-break'> </span>to such deed, a contract <span class='line-break'> </span>guaranteeing the perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>care of said Lot, in <span class='line-break'> </span>the manner provided by <span class='line-break'> </span>Art. VIII of the By-Laws.</i></sup> <span class='line-break'> </span><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>[Rep. of Com. on Rules &amp; Reg., <span class='line-break'> </span>adopted April 23, 1875. <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees Rec. Vol. VI, p. 4.] </i></sup></p>
<p>Lots for tombs may be sold, under the direction of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots, in places approved by the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees. The construction and position of tombs built therein <span class='line-break'> </span>must also be approved by the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p>A space of not less than three feet shall be reserved between <span class='line-break'> </span>the fence limits of different lots, unless otherwise ordered by <span class='line-break'> </span>special vote of the Trustees. The land so reserved, when it <span class='line-break'> </span>exceeds three feet and does not exceed ten feet in width <span class='line-break'> </span>between any two lots, may be sold to the nearest lot holder or <span class='line-break'> </span>holders, upon the condition that said land shall forever be kept <span class='line-break'> </span>open and without interments. Or if such space shall, in the <span class='line-break'> </span>opinion of the Committee on Lots, be greater than is needful <span class='line-break'> </span>for passageways, the land may be sold for burial purposes; <span class='line-break'> </span>written notice having first been given to the abuttors, who shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be entitled to a preference.</p>
<p>The same fees shall be paid to the Secretary for the record <span class='line-break'> </span>of transfers and other instruments for proprietors as for making <span class='line-break'> </span>and recording original deeds.</p>
<p>The Secretary shall make monthly reports to the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees of sales which have been approved by the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots.</p>
<p>ARTICLE V.</p>
<p>INTERMENTS.</p>
<p>No interment shall be made until the Superintendent shall <span class='line-break'> </span>have been furnished with such permits as may be required by <span class='line-break'> </span>the laws of the Commonwealth, or of the city or town from <span class='line-break'> </span>which the deceased may be brought, together with an order <span class='line-break'> </span>from the proprietor of the lot in which such interment is <span class='line-break'> </span>to be made or from his legal representative; nor until the fees <span class='line-break'> </span><del>hereinafter</del> provided ^<sup><i>for </i></sup><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>[Nov. 13. 1878 Vol VI p 198]</i></sup> shall have been paid.</p>
<p>^<sup><i>This P stricken out </i></sup><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>[Trustees Meeting Nov. 13, 1878 Trustees Rec. Vol. VI Page 198]</i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span><del>The charge for opening an adult grave and making an interment shall be five dollars; for the same service, in the case of a child under ten years of age, three ^<sup><i> four- </i></sup><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>Trustees Rec. Vol VI - p. 155</i></sup> dollars. The same fees shall be paid for opening a tomb as for preparing a grave.</del></p>
<p>Interments may be made in the public lots belonging to the Corporation, and the graves numbered on stone, upon the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>payment of <del> twenty five dollars each in addition to </del> the fees <span class='line-break'> </span><del> hereinbefore </del> provided ^<sup style='color:Tomato;'> <i>for</i></sup>; but no slab, monument or fence shall<span class='line-break'> </span>be erected upon or around such graves without the approval<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Lots. The Treasurer shall give to the <span class='line-break'> </span>purchaser of a grave a certificate therefor in the form provided<span class='line-break'> </span>for that purpose. Whenever any such grave <del> shall </del> become<i>s</i><span class='line-break'> </span>vacant by removal of the body interred therein, the land <del> shall </del><span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>thereby</i></sup> revert<i>s</i> to the Corporation; but in case the owner thereof, or<span class='line-break'> </span>his representative, becomes the purchaser of a lot ^<sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>from the Corporation</i></sup> <del> in the Ceme<span class='line-break'></span>tery, </del> the original price for the grave shall be allowed in part<span class='line-break'> </span>payment for the lot.</p>
<p>Not more than two interments shall be made in the same<span class='line-break'> </span>grave, whether in a private or a public lot, and the later inter<span class='line-break'></span>ment shall be at least three feet below the surface of the ground.</p>

otherwise the whole amount shall be retained by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, and the Superintendent may at any time thereafter<span class='line-break'> </span>remove the body to such place within the Cemetery as the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Interments may direct </del><span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup><i><s>For each body deposited <span class='line-break'> </span>in the Recieving Tomb Twemtu<span class='line-break'> </span>five dollars ($25.) shall be paid<span class='line-break'> </span>in advance, the whole amount<span class='line-break'> </span>to be refunded if removed to a<span class='line-break'> </span>private Lot in the Cemetery within<span class='line-break'> </span>Ten (10) days<span class='line-break'> </span>For each body remaining in <span class='line-break'> </span>the Tomb more than three (3) months<span class='line-break'> </span>an additional charge of four<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars for each month of part <span class='line-break'> </span>of a month thereafter will be<span class='line-break'> </span>made but any body which has<span class='line-break'> </span>remained in the Tomb three<span class='line-break'> </span>months may be removed by <span class='line-break'> </span>Supt at any time whenafter to<span class='line-break'> </span>such place within the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>as the Com. on Interments may <span class='line-break'> </span>direct.<span class='line-break'> </span>The usual charge for interment<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Vol VI. Page 124<span class='line-break'> </span>this paragraph stricken out</i></sup></p>
<p>^<sup style='color:Tomato;'><i> A body deposited in the Receiving Tomb may be delivered by</i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span>The Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span><del> shall deliver any such body </del>to the friends or relatives applying ^<sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>therefor</i></sup><del> for <span class='line-break'> </span>it </del> in a legal manner, for removal <del> at their own expense </del> from the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery.</p>
<p>At military funerals no firing of volleys shall be allowed <span class='line-break'> </span>within the Cemetery, excepting by special permission of the <span class='line-break'> </span>President.</p>
<p>No grave nor tomb shall be opened for interment or removal<span class='line-break'> </span>by any person not in the employ of the Corporation.</p>
<p>ARTICLE VI.</p>
<p>CARE AND CONDITION OF LOTS.</p>
<p>When a burial lot or other parcel of ground shall have been<span class='line-break'> </span>sold, it shall be graded, suitable boundary-stones erected, and<span class='line-break'> </span>its designation by number or otherwise legibly displayed by<span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietor, within sixty days from the sale of the deed;<span class='line-break'> </span>or the Committee on Lots may, at any time thereafter, cause<span class='line-break'> </span>such work to be done at the expense of said proprietor.</p>
<p><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>[Trustee meeting Nov. 13. 1878 - Trustee Rec. vol. VI. Page 198]</i></sup></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135230">
<h3><a name="page-1135230">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 17</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>17</p>
<p>15</p>
<p>No other person than the proprietor himself or the proper<span class='line-break'> </span>officers and servants of the Corporation, shall be allowed to<span class='line-break'> </span>perform any work on a lot or parcel of ground without a permit<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Secretary. Proprietors may obtain such permits <span class='line-break'> </span>upon a written application, to be renewed annually. All such<span class='line-break'> </span>employes shall be under the supervision and control of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent. <span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup><i> Provided that no work shall at any time be done by other persons than the <span class='line-break'> </span>proper officers or servants of the Corporation upon those lots of which the perpetual care, or the<span class='line-break'> </span>care of the turfing or sodding, has been aproved by the Corporation, by deed or contract.</i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>Trustees' Rec. Vol. VI, p 103 </i></sup></p>
<p>Proprietors may erect on their lots ^<sup><i>unless otherwise provided by the terms of the deed given therefor. </i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>Trustees Rec. Vol VI. pp 55,56</i></sup> fences, <del> live hedges, </del> ^<span class='line-break'> </span><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>(Trustees' Rec. Vol VI, pp 4,5,7)</i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span>monuments and stones, subject in all respects to the approval<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Lots. The use of wood or slate for<span class='line-break'> </span>any such purposes shall not be allowed. Trees shall only be <span class='line-break'> </span>removed therefrom by direction or consent of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds. ^<sup><i> Provided that if such <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot is in that portion of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery set apart by vote<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees passed Nov. 19, 1873, <span class='line-break'> </span>it shall be graded, sodded,<span class='line-break'> </span>marked, and thereafter <span class='line-break'> </span>kept in repair by the Corporation.<span class='line-break'> </span>And no other person <span class='line-break'> </span>than the proper officers and<span class='line-break'> </span>servants of the Corporation shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be allowed to perform any<span class='line-break'> </span>work thereon. And on any<span class='line-break'> </span>such Lot no fences, curbing or <span class='line-break'> </span>hedges will be permitted;<span class='line-break'> </span>and no head-stone at any <span class='line-break'> </span>grave shall exceed two feet<span class='line-break'> </span>and six inches in height from <span class='line-break'> </span>the ground, Except by vote of the Trustees upon special application.</i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>(Rep. of Com. on Rules &amp; Reg. adopted April 23 1875. Trustees Rec. Vol. VI. p. 4)</i> </sup></p>
<p>Catacomb tombs with entrance-doors above ground may be<span class='line-break'> </span>constructed in such places and manner as shall be approved<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on Lots. No bodies shall be placed therein<span class='line-break'> </span>except in single compartments to be hermetically closed with<span class='line-break'> </span>brick or stone and cement.</p>
<p>The devisee of a deceased proprietor shall furnish the Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>with the evidence of his title, which shall be recorded in <span class='line-break'> </span>a book kept for that purpose; and a person claiming to be <span class='line-break'> </span>the sole heir-at-law of a deceased proprietor, shall furnish an <span class='line-break'> </span>affidavit setting forth the facts necessary to establish such<span class='line-break'> </span>claim, which shall be filed with the papers of the Corporation;<span class='line-break'> </span>and in either case proper reference thereto shall be made upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the margin of the record of the original deed.</p>
<p>The devisees, or heirs-at-law of a deceased proprietor, or<span class='line-break'> </span>the guardian of such persons, desiring the appointment of a <span class='line-break'> </span>person to represent the lot owned in common by them, shall <span class='line-break'> </span>make written application to the Trustees for that purpose.</p>
<p>Any person designated by a company, society or association,<span class='line-break'> </span>whether corporate or not, which may own a lot of not less that<span class='line-break'> </span>three hundred square feet, shall represent such lot and may<span class='line-break'> </span>vote at all meetings of the Corporation.</p>
<p><b> ARTICLE VII. </b></p>
<p>RECORDS AND PLANS.</p>
<p>There shall be kept at the office of the Secretary all the <span class='line-break'> </span>books necessary for recording the original deeds of lots, of</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135232">
<h3><a name="page-1135232">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 18</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>18</p>
<p>16</p>
<p>ornamental grounds, and of spaces between lots; of transfers<span class='line-break'> </span>from proprietor to proprietor or to the Corporation, and trans<span class='line-break'></span>fers by will or by  operation of law; also, instruments of dona<span class='line-break'></span>tion in trust for the repair of lots or for any purpose consistent <span class='line-break'> </span>with the objects of the Cemetery; also, a register of interments; <span class='line-break'> </span>and such other records as may from time to time be found<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary or convenient by the Board of Trustees or any com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee thereof.</p>
<p>No record of any person's interest in a lot less than the <span class='line-break'> </span>entire ownership shall be made on the books of the Corporation.</p>
<p>A sectional plan of the Cemetery shall be kept at the office <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Secretary, on which shall be entered, under direction <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Grounds by a surveyor designated by <span class='line-break'> </span>them, all avenues and paths duly named, and all lots sold or <span class='line-break'> </span>laid out by the Corporation duly numbered; all changes shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be noted thereon, so that, at all times, it shall represent the <span class='line-break'> </span>condition of the Cemetery in the particulars named.  The orig<span class='line-break'></span>inal lines shall be in black and shall not be erased.  The <span class='line-break'> </span>changed lines shall be red.  Both the interior and exterior <span class='line-break'> </span>lines of lots shall be given; and the interior distances of the <span class='line-break'> </span>side lines and diagonals shall be expressed in figures.</p>
<p>Portfolios shall be kept at the office of the Secretary, in <span class='line-break'> </span>which he shall insert plans of lots procured by the proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>thereof.  Such plans shall be drawn upon paper of a uniform <span class='line-break'> </span>size, furnished by the Secretary, by a surveyor approved by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Comittee on Lots.  The plans, too, must be approved by the <span class='line-break'> </span>said committee, and certified as correct by the Superintendent.<span class='line-break'> </span>The fee for placing the plan in the portolio and the proprie<span class='line-break'></span>tor's name in the index shall be one dollar.</p>
<p><b> ARTICLE VIII. </b><span class='line-break'> </span>ADMITTANCE.{note this word all caps in smaller font]</p>
<p>The Secretary shall furnish, upon application, to each propri<span class='line-break'></span>etor, or to the properly designated representative of a lot, a <span class='line-break'> </span>ticket not transferable entitling him and his household to <span class='line-break'> </span>drive with a carriage into the Cemetery.  He may give like <span class='line-break'> </span>permits, not exceeding three for any one lot, to others, owners <span class='line-break'> </span>with the person holding the title.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135234">
<h3><a name="page-1135234">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 19</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>19</p>
<p>17</p>
<p>He may also furnish to a proprietor making special applica<span class='line-break'></span>tion therefor, for stated periods, a ticket to ride into the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery on horseback.</p>
<p>The public shall be admitted, to walk, on any day excepting <span class='line-break'> </span>Sundays and holidays.</p>
<p>Strangers or other persons may be admitted with carriages <span class='line-break'> </span>by written permission of any Trustee, of the Secretary, Treas<span class='line-break'></span>urer or Superintendent.</p>
<p>The tickets or permits herein provided for shall be subject in <span class='line-break'> </span>all respects to the further regulations of the Trustees.</p>
<p>The Trustees may at any time restrict the admission of non<span class='line-break'></span>proprietors.</p>
<p><b> ARTICLE IX. </b><span class='line-break'> </span>SECRETARY, TREASURER AND SUPERINTENDENT.[this phrase in smaller font]</p>
<p>The Secretary, Treasurer and Superintendent shall each <span class='line-break'> </span>communicate to the others promptly and fully upon all matters<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary to the most complete and efficient discharge of the <span class='line-break'> </span>duties of their respective positions.  They shall keep the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees and the various committees thereof constantly advised<span class='line-break'> </span>of the transactions in their several departments, to the end that<span class='line-break'> </span>nothing be omitted likely to aid the Board in the administration <span class='line-break'> </span>of their trust.  They shall render to proprietors and others<span class='line-break'> </span>having business at the office in Boston, or at the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>every facility and assistance consistent with the character and<span class='line-break'> </span>purposes of the Corporation.  They shall neither of them <span class='line-break'> </span>receive any other pay or fee than has been provided by the <span class='line-break'> </span>By-Laws or by the Rules and Regulations.  If a proprietor or <span class='line-break'> </span>any other person tender to either of them a payment, gift or <span class='line-break'> </span>service, intended as a reward, or calculated to influence or <span class='line-break'> </span>embarrass their official action, or to disturb confidence in them<span class='line-break'> </span>the circumstances shall be immediately reported to the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>for their consideration.  Neither shall they, or any other person <span class='line-break'> </span>in the employ of the Corporation, engage in buying and selling <span class='line-break'> </span>lots or parcels of ground in the Cemetery, excepting under the <span class='line-break'> </span>direction of the Committee on Lots, and in the manner provided <span class='line-break'> </span>by the By-Laws or by the Rules and Regulations.</p>
<p>The Secretary and Treasurer shall occupy the same office<span class='line-break'> </span>rooms in Boston.  Their office hours shall be from nine o'clock,<span class='line-break'> </span>[note: a number "3" below the word Boston, above, in a smaller font}<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135236">
<h3><a name="page-1135236">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 20</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>20</p>
<p>18</p>
<p>A.M. to three o'clock, P. M. daily, excepting Sundays and holi<span class='line-break'></span>days, unless by written direction or consent of the President.</p>
<p>The Secretary shall keep a register of all interments, includ<span class='line-break'></span>ing the names and ages of persons intered and the place and <span class='line-break'> </span>date of interment;  also the vouchers and orders for interment <span class='line-break'> </span>and for disinterment or removal properly filed.  He shall keep <span class='line-break'> </span>a duplicate of said register for use at the Cemetery.  He shall <span class='line-break'> </span>issue all notices made necessary in preparing for the care of <span class='line-break'> </span>lots, and in calling the attention of proprietors to neglected lots.<span class='line-break'> </span>He shall notify all meetings of committees; shall arrange their <span class='line-break'> </span>business for them and attend the meetings unless excused;<span class='line-break'> </span>making such records and performing such other work as may <span class='line-break'> </span>be required of him.</p>
<p>The Treasurer shall deposit to the credit of the  Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>all moneys received by him, in such bank in Boston as the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance may direct; and all checks drawn <span class='line-break'> </span>against such deposits shall be signed by him, and made payable <span class='line-break'> </span>to a member of that committee, to the President, or to a person <span class='line-break'> </span>whose bill shall have been approved by the Board of Trustees.<span class='line-break'> </span>He shall prepare, monthly, a schedule of bills contracted, <span class='line-break'> </span>including a pay-roll of laborers employed at the Cemetery, to <span class='line-break'> </span>be examined with the original bills therefor by the appropriate <span class='line-break'> </span>committees and presented for approval, or otherwise, at the <span class='line-break'> </span>next meeting of the Trustees thereafter.  He shall prepare <span class='line-break'> </span>quarterly accounts to be presented at the first meetings of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees in the months of January, April, July and October, <span class='line-break'> </span>exhibiting all the transactions for the quarter prior thereto;<span class='line-break'> </span>together with a detailed statement of balances held for the <span class='line-break'> </span>repair of lots, and of all amounts due to the Corporation for <span class='line-break'> </span>materials or labor furnished at the Cemetery.</p>
<p>The Superintendent shall reside near the Cemetery.  He shall, <span class='line-break'> </span>at all times and in all respects, be subject to the direction of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees, either directly or by any of its committees.<span class='line-break'> </span>He shall have the general care and custody of the Cemetery, the <span class='line-break'> </span>control and direction of all subordinate officers and workmen<span class='line-break'> </span>employed therein, and the enforcement of all laws, rules or <span class='line-break'> </span>regulations affecting the rights of proprietors or the conduct of <span class='line-break'> </span>visitors.  He shall negotiate the sales of lots.  He shall pay all <span class='line-break'> </span>fees received at the Cemetery, to the Treasurer.  He shall keep</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135238">
<h3><a name="page-1135238">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 21</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>21</p>
<p>19</p>
<p>such books of record, make such reports, and perform such <span class='line-break'> </span>other duties appropriate to his office, as the Trustees may from <span class='line-break'> </span>time to time require.  He shall engage, employ and discharge <span class='line-break'> </span>subordinate officers at the Cemetery under the direction of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds, but may engage and discharge laborers <span class='line-break'> </span>at his discretion, unless otherwise instructed.  He shall see that <span class='line-break'> </span>all such persons perform faithfully the servcies due from them <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Corporation; that the contracts and orders of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees or of committees thereof are strictly complied with.<span class='line-break'> </span>He shall also see that all persons, whether employed in the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery or visiting it, violating the laws of the Commonwealth,<span class='line-break'> </span>the By-Laws, the Rules and Regulations, or the proprieties of<span class='line-break'> </span>the place, are promptly dealt with by removal from the Ceme<span class='line-break'></span>tery, and by prosecution if so directed or authorized by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds.  He shall keep in suitable books, <span class='line-break'> </span>provided for the purpose, all orders for work to be done, or <span class='line-break'> </span>materials to be furnished for proprietors; which orders shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>explicit in their terms and signed by the persons giving them.<span class='line-break'> </span>The particulars of whatever is afterwards done or furnished in <span class='line-break'> </span>pursuance thereof shall be fully stated and made a part of the <span class='line-break'> </span>entry, together with the prices agreed upon or to be charged,<span class='line-break'> </span>so that the Treasurer can make bills therefrom.  He shall <span class='line-break'> </span>make immediate reports of all interments, with full particulars <span class='line-break'> </span>thereof; and return all orders and papers of whatever nature <span class='line-break'> </span>connected therewith, or with disinterments or removals, to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary for permanent disposition in his office.  He shall <span class='line-break'> </span>make ample provision for prompt and sufficient attendance upon <span class='line-break'> </span>funeral processions arriving at the Cemetery.</p>
<p><b> ARTICLE X. </b><span class='line-break'> </span>VISITORS TO THE CEMETERY. [CAPS, SMALLER FONT]</p>
<p>The gate of the Cemetery shall be open for visitors entitled <span class='line-break'> </span>to admission daily from sunrise until sunset.</p>
<p>Only proprietors, members of their households, or persons <span class='line-break'> </span>accompanying them, or others having written permits shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>admitted on Sundays or holidays, unless for special reasons <span class='line-break'> </span>satisfactory at the time to the Superintendent.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135240">
<h3><a name="page-1135240">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 22</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>22</p>
<p>20</p>
<p>No person shall be admitted at any time with refreshments;<span class='line-break'> </span>neither with flowers, unless for use as decorations or memorials, <span class='line-break'> </span>notice therof having been given before passing the gatekeeper.</p>
<p>No horse shall be driven in the Cemetery faster than a walk;<span class='line-break'> </span>or left unfastened without a keeper: or fastened except at posts <span class='line-break'> </span>provided for the purpose.  No person on horseback shall cross<span class='line-break'> </span>any lot, or drive upon a path.</p>
<p>The Superintendent shall see that the following provisions of <span class='line-break'> </span>law are strictly observed: -</p>
<p>Be it further enacted; [italics]   That any person who shall wilfully <span class='line-break'> </span>destroy, mutilate, deface, injure or remove any tomb, monument, <span class='line-break'> </span>gravestone or other structure placed in the Cemetery aforesaid, <span class='line-break'> </span>or any fence, railing or other work, for the protection or orna<span class='line-break'></span>ment of any tomb, monument, gravestone or other structure<span class='line-break'> </span>aforesaid, or of any Cemetery lot within the limits of the garden <span class='line-break'> </span>and Cemetery aforesaid, or shall wilfully destroy, remove, cut, <span class='line-break'> </span>break or injure, any tree, shrub or plant, within the limits of <span class='line-break'> </span>the said garden and Cemetery; or shall shoot or discharge any <span class='line-break'> </span>gun or other firearm within the said limits, shall be deemed <span class='line-break'> </span>guilty of a misdemeanor, and shall, upon conviction thereof <span class='line-break'> </span>before any justice of the peace or other court of competent <span class='line-break'> </span>juridsdiction with the County of Middlesex, be punished by a <span class='line-break'> </span>fine not less than five dollars, nor more than fifty dollars, <span class='line-break'> </span>according to the nature and aggravation of the offence; and <span class='line-break'> </span>such offender shall also be liable, in an action of trespass to <span class='line-break'> </span>be brought against him in any court of competent juristiction <span class='line-break'> </span>in the name of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, to pay all such damages as shall have been occasioned<span class='line-break'> </span>by his unlawful act, or acts; which money, when recovered, <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be applied by the said Corporation, under the direction of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees, to the reparation and restoration of the <span class='line-break'> </span>property destroyed or injured as above;   and members of the <span class='line-break'> </span>said Corporation shall be competent witnesses in such suits.<span class='line-break'> </span>(Laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, [italics] chap. 96, <span class='line-break'> </span>sect. 7.)</p>
<p>No fees whatever, other than those provided by the  By-Laws<span class='line-break'> </span>or the Rules and Regulations of the Corporation, shall be paid <span class='line-break'> </span>at the Cemetery.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135242">
<h3><a name="page-1135242">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 23</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>23</p>
<p>21</p>
<p>ARTICLE XI.</p>
<p><s>ORDER OF BUSINESS</s></p>
<p><sup><i>{Meetings of Trustees.</i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>[Rep. of Com. o Rules &amp; Reg.April 23/75. Rec. , VI, - 4]</i></sup></p>
<p>Stated meetings of the Trustees shall be held at the office in <span class='line-break'> </span>Boston, on the second Wednesday of each month, at half-past<span class='line-break'> </span>three o'clock, P. M. unless otherwise ordered.</p>
<p><sup><i>Order of the Board of Trustees.  </i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>[Records, Ibid.]</i></sup></p>
<p>Motions shall be made in writing when requested by the <span class='line-break'> </span>President or by a majoarity of those present.</p>
<p>Reports of committees shall be made in writing at the <span class='line-break'> </span>request of any member.</p>
<p>The order of business shall be as follows:, -</p>
<p>Reading the records</p>
<p>Election of officers.</p>
<p>Reports of committees.</p>
<p>Approval of bills and accounts,.</p>
<p>Unfinished businesss.<span class='line-break'> </span>Motions, orders and resolutions.<span class='line-break'> </span>Petitions or other papers from the Secretary.</p>
<p><sup><i>Strike out the whole of Article XII. </i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>[Records VI = 68, .]</i></sup></p>
<p><s>ARTICLE XII.</s></p>
<p><s>The following forms, made necessary by the provisions of the <span class='line-break'> </span>By-Laws and of the Rules and Regulations, shall be used for <span class='line-break'> </span>the purposes and in the manner indicated: -</s></p>
<p><s>SUPERINTENDENT'S CERTIFICATE OF SELECTION.</s></p>
<p><s>MOUNT AUBURN CEMETERY.</s></p>
<p><s>Certificate No.  _____  18</s></p>
<p><s>Mr. _____  of _____ has this day selected ot <span class='line-break'> </span>No. _____ in the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, situated on the <span class='line-break'> </span>way called _____ containing _____ square feet, at _____ cents <span class='line-break'> </span>per foot,  of which he may be the proprietor by the payment <span class='line-break'> </span>of [space] dollars to the Treasurer of said Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>within thirty days from this date, together with two dollars for <span class='line-break'> </span>making and recording the deed of the same; and provided, <span class='line-break'> </span>also, that this certificate shall be presented and surrendered <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Treasurer within thirty days from this date.  If not <span class='line-break'> </span>presented within the time aforesaid all right to the seleted lot </s></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135244">
<h3><a name="page-1135244">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 24</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>24</p>
<p>22</p>
<p><s>herein referred to shall cease.  The laying-out and sale of <span class='line-break'> </span>this lot are to be subjected to the approval of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on lots.</s></p>
<p>^<sup><i>and further provided that [if the selected lot is in that part of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery set apart by vote of the Trustees passed  Nov. 19, 1873] the purchase shall<span class='line-break'> </span>also pay to the treasurer the sum stipulated for the perpetual care of <span class='line-break'> </span>the [Lot] before receiving a deed thereof.  </i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span><sup style='color:Tomato;'><i>[Rep. of Com. on R.&amp; R. Apr. 23 '75. Rec., VI = 4.]</i></sup><span class='line-break'> </span><sup><i>Strike out the words included in brackets Insert the word "grass: in place of the word "Lot"<span class='line-break'> </span>Rec. VI, = 104]</i></sup></p>
<p><s>Payable to  _____  Treasurer,  No. _____ Street, Boston.</s></p>

<p><s>FORM FOR THE CONVEYANCE OF LOTS.</s></p>
<p><s>KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS,  That the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, in consideration of <span class='line-break'> </span>_____ dollars paid to them by _____  of <span class='line-break'> </span>_____  the receipt of which is hereby acknowledge, do <span class='line-break'> </span>hereby grant, bargain, sell, and convey to the said  _____<span class='line-break'> </span>_____ and _____ heirs and assigns, a lot of land in the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn, in the County of Middlesex, <span class='line-break'> </span>numbered __________ on the plan which <span class='line-break'> </span>is in the possession of the said Corporation for inspection by <span class='line-break'> </span>the said grantee _____  heirs and assigns, at all seasonable <span class='line-break'> </span>times, and situated on or near the _____ side of the <span class='line-break'> </span>way called __________, at a distance <span class='line-break'> </span>of about __________ feet therefrom, with a right <span class='line-break'> </span>of way from said [space] to said lot. _____<span class='line-break'> </span>Said lot is of form __________<span class='line-break'> </span>and contains __________  square feet.</s></p>
<p><s>To have and to hold the aforegranted premises unto the said <span class='line-break'> </span>__________ heirs and assigns, forever;<span class='line-break'> </span>subject, however to the conditions and limitations, and with <span class='line-break'> </span>the privileges following; to wit: -</s></p>
<p><s>First, That the proprietor of the said lot shall have the <span class='line-break'> </span>right to enlosed the same with a wall or fence (of other <span class='line-break'> </span>material than wood), not exceeding one foot in thickness,<span class='line-break'> </span>which may be placed on the adjoining land of the Corporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>exterior to the said lot, subject to all the conditions of the <span class='line-break'> </span>By-Laws of the Corporation.</s></p>

<p>23</p>
<p><s>Second, [italics] That the said lot of land shall not be used for <span class='line-break'> </span>any other purpose than as a place of burial for the dead; and <span class='line-break'> </span>no trees within the lot or border shall be cut down or <span class='line-break'> </span>destroyed without the consent of the Trustees of the said <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation.</s></p>
<p><s>Third, [italics] That the proprietor of the said lot shall have the <span class='line-break'> </span>right to erect stones, monuments, sepulchral structures, and <span class='line-break'> </span>to cultivate trees, shrubs, and plants in the same.</s></p>
<p><s>Fourth, [italics]  The proprietor of the said lot of land shall, under the <span class='line-break'> </span>direction of the Trustees, grade the same, and erect at his<span class='line-break'> </span>or her own expense suitable ladnmarks of stone or iron at <span class='line-break'> </span>the corners thereof;  and shall also cause the number thereof <span class='line-break'> </span>to be legibly and permanently marked on the premises.  And <span class='line-break'> </span>if the said proprietor shall omit, for sixty days after notice, <span class='line-break'> </span>so to grade the lot, to erect the landmarks, and mark the <span class='line-break'> </span>number, the Trustees shall have authority to cause the same <span class='line-break'> </span>to be done at the expense of the said proprietor.,</s></p>
<p><s>Fifth, [italics] That if the landmarks and boundaries of the said <span class='line-break'> </span>lot shall be effaced, so that the said lot cannot, with reason<span class='line-break'></span>able diligence, be found and identified, the said Trustees shall <span class='line-break'> </span>set off to the said grantee, [blank] heirs or assigns, a lot <span class='line-break'> </span>in lieu thereof, in such part of the Cemetery as they see fit;<span class='line-break'> </span>and the lot hereby granted shall, in such case, revert to the Corporation.</s></p>
<p><s>Sixh. [italics]  That if any trees or shrubs situated in said lot of <span class='line-break'> </span>land shall, by means of their roots, branches, or otherwise, <span class='line-break'> </span>become detrimental to the adjacent lots or avenues or dangerous <span class='line-break'> </span>or inconvenient, it shall be the duty of the said Trustees, <span class='line-break'> </span>for the time being, and they shall have the right, to enter into <span class='line-break'> </span>the said lot, and remove the said trees and shrubs, or such parts <span class='line-break'> </span>thereof as are thus detrimental, dangerous, or inconvenient.</s></p>
<p><s>Seventh, [italics] That if any monument or effigy, or any structure <span class='line-break'> </span>whatever, or any inscription, be placed in or upon the said <span class='line-break'> </span>land, which shall be determined by the major part of the said <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees, for the time being, to be offensive or improper, the </s></p>

<p>ARTICLE XIII.<span class='line-break'> </span>AMENDMENTS</p>
<p>Any alteration or amendment of these Rules and Regulations <span class='line-break'> </span>in conformity with the By-Laws of the Corporation may be <span class='line-break'> </span>made by a majority of the whole Board of Trustees, notice of <span class='line-break'> </span>the proposed change having been given at a previous meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>at least seven days before the action is taken upon it;  and all such <span class='line-break'> </span>alterations and amendments shall be reported to the proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>at the first annual meeting of the  Corporation after they shall <span class='line-break'> </span>have been made.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 9^th, 1875 [underlined]'>June 9^th, 1875 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>June 9^th, 1875. [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Board of Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday, June 9^th, at Four o'clock, P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs J. T. Bradlee, Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Pickering and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last monthly meeting, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>memoranda relative to a special meeting notified for <span class='line-break'> </span>the 26^th ult^o were read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Farm, Change of name of Avenues &amp; Paths. [underlined]'>Stone Farm, Change of name of Avenues &amp; Paths. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The C ommittee on Grounds, who were requested at <span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting of April 23^d, 1875, "to consider and report what <span class='line-break'> </span>"action, if any, may be expedient or desirable with regard <span class='line-break'> </span>"to the names of Avenues and Paths on the Stone Farm district,"<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted a partial verbal report, recommending that the <span class='line-break'> </span>name of "Wren" Path be changed to Nightingale Path, and <span class='line-break'> </span>"Mavis" Path or Oriole Path.  And it was</p>
<p>Voted,[underlined] - that said report be accepted, and the recom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Collidge Av. Designs &amp;c. of proposed fence exhibited; and  recommited with instructions [underlined]'>Collidge Av. Designs &amp;c. of proposed fence exhibited; and  recommited with instructions [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The same Committee exhibited designs and estimates<span class='line-break'> </span>for the proposed iron fence on Coolidge Avenue, pursuant to <span class='line-break'> </span>instructions given them by the Board of Trustees at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>monthly meeting.  And the same having been considered, <span class='line-break'></span>on motion of M^r Choate, it was unanimously</p>
<p>Voted,[underlined]. - that, in the opinion of this Board it is expe=<span class='line-break'> </span>=dient that an iron fence be erected upon the line specified,<span class='line-break'> </span>at an expense not exceeding ten thousand dollars, ($10,000.-)</p>
<p>On motion of M^r Bradlee, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the designs and estimates which have now</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 9, 1875. [underliend]'>June 9, 1875. [underliend]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots of less area than 300 feet. Rep. of Com. on Lots recom.sale of accepted.&amp;c.[underlined]'>Lots of less area than 300 feet. Rep. of Com. on Lots recom.sale of accepted.&amp;c.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Superintendent, embracing a design for laying out a system <span class='line-break'> </span>of lots of less than 300 feet area, in a given locality, leaving, <span class='line-break'> </span>between the respective lots, an intermediate space not greater<span class='line-break'> </span>than the width of the boundary posts; and recommended <span class='line-break'> </span>that the Superintendent be authorized to sell lots sub=<span class='line-break'> </span>stantially in accordance with this plan.  And it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlioned]- that the report of the Committee be accepted,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the recommendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perpetual care of grass on. [underlined]'>Perpetual care of grass on. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The chairman of the Committee on Lots moved<span class='line-break'> </span>that the sales authorized by the foregoing action shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>made only on condition that a sum sufficent, in the <span class='line-break'> </span>opinion of the Committee on Lots, is at the same time <span class='line-break'> </span>deposited by the purchaser for the perpetual care of the <span class='line-break'> </span>grass thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Price for. Motion of M^r Choate resp&apos;g. rejected [underlined], '>Price for. Motion of M^r Choate resp'g. rejected [underlined], </span></p>
<p>M^r Choate moved to amend the above motion <span class='line-break'> </span>by adding thereto the words "such deposit not to exceed <span class='line-break'> </span>the rate of fifty cents per square foot of area."</p>
<p>The yeas and nays having been called for on the <span class='line-break'> </span>above amendment, four Trustees voted in the affirmative, ^Browne, Choate, Pickering and Spelman^<span class='line-break'> </span>and four in the negative, ^J. T. Bradlee, Brewer, Lawrence and Snow^ it was</p>
<p>Not adopted. [underlined]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='To be left at the discretion of the Com. on Lots. [underlined]'>To be left at the discretion of the Com. on Lots. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The yeas and nays being then taken on the original <span class='line-break'> </span>motion it was</p>
<p>adopted[underlined]; six in the affirmative, two ^Choate and Spelman^ in the negative.</p>
<p>On motion of the chairman of the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the deeds for conveying lots sold as</p>
<p>=</p>

<p>aforesaid be modified in such manner as to <span class='line-break'> </span>prevent the erection of curbs or fences on land ex=<span class='line-break'> </span>=terior to said Lots.</p>

<p>A report was also submitted by the same <span class='line-break'> </span>committee on the subject contained in the second<span class='line-break'> </span>clause of the vote of reference to them at the meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>April 23^d, - to the effect that, in the opinion of a majority <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee, it was expedient to petition the next <span class='line-break'> </span>Legislature for such amendments to the Acts of incor=<span class='line-break'> </span>poration as may be necessary to constitute proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of not less than one hundred and fifty feet of land <span class='line-break'> </span>members of the corporation, and entitled to vote.</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined], - that the report be laid upon the table.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone farm; prices for lots, etc. on portions of. Rep. of Com. resp&apos;g. [underlined]'>Stone farm; prices for lots, etc. on portions of. Rep. of Com. resp'g. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The same Committee also reported that, as <span class='line-break'> </span>portions of the land on the Stone farm had been prepared <span class='line-break'> </span>for sale, they had voted to offer lots upon a portion of <span class='line-break'> </span>Eagle and Swan Avenues, as pointed out, at two dollars <span class='line-break'> </span>per foot for the land, and one dollar per foot deposit <span class='line-break'> </span>for the perpetual care of grass;  and upon Nightingale<span class='line-break'> </span>and Oriole Paths at one dollar and fifty cents per <span class='line-break'> </span>foot for the land, and one dollar per foot deposit <span class='line-break'> </span>for the perpetual care of grass; - which rates they subnit<span class='line-break'> </span>for the judgment and approval, or otherwise, of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board.</p>
<p>After discussions of the above report, it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the Committee on Lots be instructed <span class='line-break'> </span>to fix the following prices, for the present, upon such</p>

<p>land in the Stone Farm district as ha been described, viz: <span class='line-break'></span>for Lots upon the Avenues named one dollar and fifty cents <span class='line-break'> </span>per square foot; for lots upon the Paths named one dollar <span class='line-break'> </span>per square foot; and that the deposit required for the <span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care of grass on said lots shall not exceed <span class='line-break'> </span>the rate of one dollar per square foot of area.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lyman Nichols Request for release of restrictions on Lot # 3413, granted, &amp; [underlined] '>Lyman Nichols Request for release of restrictions on Lot # 3413, granted, &amp; [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The chairman of the Committee on Lots submitted <span class='line-break'> </span>a communication from M^r Lyman Nichols, under date <span class='line-break'> </span>of June 7^th, 1985, requesting a release of the restrictions upon <span class='line-break'> </span>his lot, N^o 3413 Fountain Av., requiring the same to be <span class='line-break'> </span>enclosed by "a granite curb, corresponding in character <span class='line-break'> </span>and finish with those upon neighboring lots; " - and <span class='line-break'> </span>recommended that said release be given.  And it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec&apos;y. authorized to accept re=conveyance &amp;c. [underlined] '>Sec'y. authorized to accept re=conveyance &amp;c. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted [underlineid], - that said request be complied with, pursuant <span class='line-break'> </span>to the recommendation of the Committee, and that the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary be instructed to accept a re=conveyance of <span class='line-break'> </span>said lot, for the purpose of issuing a new deed thereof <span class='line-break'> </span>in the present form.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t..[underlined]'>Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t..[underlined]</span></p>

<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the <span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of lot N^o 170, Samuel P. Langmaid, <span class='line-break'> </span>(flower bed appurtenant to,.[squiggle underline],) for $60. - Lot N^o 1383,</p>

<p>No other business being praesented, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meeting be adjourned for two weeks <span class='line-break'> </span>from this day, at Four o'clock, P. M.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder, Jr., Sec'y.</p>

<p>At the day and hour aforesaid, the President, and <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs J. T. Bradlee, Choate, Lawrence and Perkins were <span class='line-break'> </span>present.  In the absence of a quorum, it ws</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 24, 1875. [underlined] '>June 24, 1875. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>June 24^th, 1875. [underlined]</p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held on Thursday, 24^th of June, at half past<span class='line-break'> </span>Twelve o'clock, P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President and Messrs J. T. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>N. J. Bradlee, Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Little, Perkins <span class='line-break'> </span>and Pickering.</p>
<p>The reading of the records was dispensed with.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Coolidge Av. Designs, &amp;c. for proposed fence recommended by Com. on Grounds. [underlined] '>Coolidge Av. Designs, &amp;c. for proposed fence recommended by Com. on Grounds. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The President, in behalf of the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds, to whom, at the meeting of the 9^th inst., the <span class='line-break'> </span>designs and estimates for an iron fence on Coolidge Av. <span class='line-break'> </span>were recommitted, with instructions to recommend a <span class='line-break'> </span>plan for said structure at a meeting to be held two <span class='line-break'> </span>weeks from that date, submitted to the Board a full <span class='line-break'> </span>size diagram of the rails and post of the proposed<span class='line-break'> </span>fence, together with a smaller sketch showing the gates,<span class='line-break'> </span>ect.,  also, estimates of the cost of construction; - the <span class='line-break'> </span>above being all furnished by Messrs. Cook, Rymes &amp; Co.,<span class='line-break'> </span>of Charlestown.  The Committee unanimously recommended <span class='line-break'> </span>that the fence on Coolidge Avenue be constructed in sub=<span class='line-break'> </span>=stantial accordance with the plans, etc., submitted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted and work authorized [underlined]'>Report accepted and work authorized [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of M^r Little, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined, - that the report of the Committee be accepted,.</p>
<p>On motion of M^r Choate, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underliend], - that the Committee be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>contract for the construction of a fence, as aforesaid,<span class='line-break'> </span>upon substantially the same plan which has now been</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135283">
<h3><a name="page-1135283">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 45</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 24, 1875. [underlined]'>June 24, 1875. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>submitted to the Board, with such modifications thereof as <span class='line-break'> </span>they may deem expedient,.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='M^r N. J. Bradlee added to Com^tee [underlined]'>M^r N. J. Bradlee added to Com^tee [underlined]</span></p>
<p>At the suggestion of the President, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that M^r Nathaniel J. Bradlee be added to said <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title='App^n of $10,000.- for Fence [underlined] ='>App^n of $10,000.- for Fence [underlined] =</span></p>
<p>On motion of M^r Choate it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the sum of ten thousand collars, ($10,000.-)<span class='line-break'> </span>be, and the same is hereby appropriated for the erection of <span class='line-break'> </span>the fence aforesaid.</p>
<p>The above vote was taken by yeas and nays, and <span class='line-break'> </span>was uinanimously adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Buildings on Stone farm; Qu. as to disposition of referred to Spec. Com. [underlined] '>Buildings on Stone farm; Qu. as to disposition of referred to Spec. Com. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The question as to the disposition to be made of<span class='line-break'> </span>the house, stable, etc., now standing on the Stone farm <span class='line-break'> </span>territory, having been introduced and considered, - on <span class='line-break'> </span>motion of M^r J. T. Bradlee it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the subject of the proper disposition to <span class='line-break'> </span>be made of the buildings on the Stone farm, whether by <span class='line-break'> </span>removal and re=erection, sale or otherwise, be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the above named special Committee, to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='J. T. Badlee; notice of int^n to move app^n exceeding $1000.- [underlined]'>J. T. Badlee; notice of int^n to move app^n exceeding $1000.- [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Notice was given by M^r J. T. Bradlee of his intention <span class='line-break'> </span>to move at the next meeting for an appropriation ex=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ceeding one thousand collars, ($1000.-) to defray such <span class='line-break'> </span>expenses as may be incurred in this connection.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hour fixed for next monthly meeting. [underlined] '>Hour fixed for next monthly meeting. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the hour for the next monthly meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Board be fixed at Twelve o'clock, M.</p>
<p>Dissolved [underlined].</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Sec'y.</p>
<p>On motion of M^r Choate it was</p>

<p>At the day and hour aforesaid, the President <span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs. Choate, Lawrence, Perkins and Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>were present.  In the absence of a quorum, it was</p>

<p>Present, the President, and Messrs J. T. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>N. J. Bradlee, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Pickering <span class='line-break'> </span>and Snow.</p>
<p>The records of the meeting of the Board from <span class='line-break'> </span>June 8^th to July 14^th, 1875, inclusive were read and approved.</p>
<p>On motion of M^r J. T. Bradlee, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that a recess of five minutes be taken, <span class='line-break'> </span>in order to afford to the Special Committee on the Stone=<span class='line-break'> </span>=farm buildings, consisting of the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>and M^r N. J. Bradlee, an opportunity of maturing <span class='line-break'> </span>their report on the subject committed to them.</p>
<p>On a re=assembling, the chairman presented the</p>
