<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 19, 1875. [underlined]'>July 19, 1875. [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone farm Buildings: report of Spec. Com. on. [underlined]'>Stone farm Buildings: report of Spec. Com. on. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>report of the Committee, in the terms following, viz: that <span class='line-break'> </span>in their judgment it was expedient to take down and <span class='line-break'> </span>rebuild the barn in accordance with the plalns of M^r M^c<span class='line-break'> </span>Arthur, at an estimated cost of about three thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars: - with regard to the dwelling house the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>were not fully prepared to recommend either the removal <span class='line-break'> </span>of the old, or the erection of a new building, but desired<span class='line-break'> </span>that further time might be allowed them for consideration,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that full powers be granted,</p>
<p>on motion of M^r J. T. Bradlee, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted[underlined]'>accepted[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the report of the Committee be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone farm Buildings: auyhority granted to Spec. Com. respecting.[underlined]'>Stone farm Buildings: auyhority granted to Spec. Com. respecting.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Committee be authorized to cause the <span class='line-break'> </span>barn on the Stone=farm to be taken down, and re=built on <span class='line-break'> </span>the Stone meadow lot in general accordance witgh a plan<span class='line-break'> </span>drawn by the Superintendent, the cost not to exceed the <span class='line-break'> </span>sum of three thousand dollars; and that the same Com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mittee be authorized to cause the house on said Stone=farm<span class='line-break'> </span>to be removed to said Stone=meadow lot, and there repaired <span class='line-break'> </span>and put in good order and condition; or to sell the same <span class='line-break'> </span>as it now stands, without the land, and cause a new <span class='line-break'> </span>house to be erected on said Stone=meadow lot, at their <span class='line-break'> </span>discretion; the cost, in either case, not to exceed three <span class='line-break'> </span>thousand dollars.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appropriations of $6000.- [underlined]'>Appropriations of $6000.- [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined] , - tht a sum not exceeding six thousand dol=<span class='line-break'> </span>=lars be and the same is hereby appropriated to defray the <span class='line-break'> </span>expense of the work above specified,.</p>
<p>The above vote was taken by yeas and nays, and</p>

<p>The yeas and nays having been called upon <span class='line-break'> </span>the motion to re=consider, it was lost, [ Messrs</p>

<p>Spelman and C hoate voting yea, and Messrs. J T. <span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Lawrence, Perkins and Snow <span class='line-break'> </span>in the negative.</p>

<p>"the undersigned was made by the plan, on which the lot appears to be next to lot numbered 845, that of the late Nathaniel Tracy, while on the ground it is three lots distant from it, being enclosed by a doze nor more stone posts, on one of which is cut the number 1221.</p>
<p>On the 17th November, 1845, Mr Edwin Larson purchased lot No. 1227 on Gernanium Path, which, on the plan, occupies the same locality as the lot of the petitioner occupies on the ground, and vice versa.</p>
<p>The lots 1221 and 1227 are upon the Westerly side of Geranium Path, with butone intervening lot.</p>
<p>Mr. Larson evidently improved his lot early, having erected an iron fence, and made several interments.</p>
<p>Your petitioner has no doubt that the said lots were purchased understandingly by the respective proprietors, being selected in the usual manner on the ground, and the purchasers receiving conveyances corresponding to said selection, the number of your petitioners lots being the sixth before Mr Larson's, and seventeen days earlier in date, - and thinks that an error was probably made by the surveyor in transcribing the number from the stakes at the end of the season, 1221 and 1227 nearly resembling each other. He finds that they were placed erroneously on the first (Wadsworth) plan, and have ever remained so, appearing so upon the lithograph plan of 1846, and all subsequent ones, and upon the sectional plan in the same manner.</p>

<p>A regular monthly meeting of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held on Wednesday, December 8, 1875, at <span class='line-break'> </span>Four o'clock P. M.</p>

<p>The President submitted to the Board new <span class='line-break'> </span>bonds of the Treasurer, with the following named<span class='line-break'> </span>Sureties, viz: - H. W. Burditt, Henry Burditt, Francis <span class='line-break'> </span>Hunnewell and Joseph Stone, each for $2500. <span class='line-break'></span>given as a substitute for the existing bond with E. G. <span class='line-break'> </span>Burgess and H. Chickering as sureties, each for $5000. <span class='line-break'></span>and the F inance Committee, having by their chairman, <span class='line-break'> </span>stated that they had examined the same and recom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mended the approval thereof, - it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that said new bonds of the Treasurer be<span class='line-break'> </span>accepted and approved by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Iron Fence. Completion of, etc., reported. [underlined]'>Iron Fence. Completion of, etc., reported. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A verbal report was made by the chairman<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Groundsm, notifying the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>of the completion of the new iron fence on Coolidge Av.;<span class='line-break'> </span>the total cost, including three additional granite <span class='line-break'> </span>posts, granite curb, and necessary grading, being <span class='line-break'> </span>Ten thousand five hundred and seventeen dollars, ($10.517.)</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Also completion of new house on Coolidge Av. Old house sold. [underlined]'>Also completion of new house on Coolidge Av. Old house sold. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Also of the completion of the new house on Coolidge Av.<span class='line-break'> </span>at a net cost of two thousand three hundred and <span class='line-break'> </span>sixty=four dollars ($2364. -); the old house having <span class='line-break'> </span>been disposed of for Three hundred and fifty dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>($350.-)  The same Committee also reported</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Alex. A. Barker; Supt. of Int^nts GAte=Keeper, etc. [underlined]'>Alex. A. Barker; Supt. of Int^nts GAte=Keeper, etc. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>that they had selected Alexander A. Barker to fill the <span class='line-break'> </span>office of sexton, which is hereafter to be called <span class='line-break'> </span>"Superintendent of Interments"; that said Barker <span class='line-break'> </span>was also to occupy the position of Gate=Keeper, that<span class='line-break'> </span>officer having been dispended with, and his clerical</p>

<p>duties transferred to the Superintendent's clerk and en=<span class='line-break'> </span>=gineer; that M^r Barker was also to occupy the new</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Alex. A. Barker, other duties of, etc. [underlined]'>Alex. A. Barker, other duties of, etc. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>house on Coolidge Av. at a rent of one hundred and fifty <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars, ($150,-) per annum; it being understood that <span class='line-break'> </span>he was generally, night and day, to oversee and look <span class='line-break'> </span>after the property of the corporation.  And that these<span class='line-break'> </span>changes had all been made without increasing the <span class='line-break'> </span>total amount of the salaries paid heretofore.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said report be accepted, and the doings <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Permanent Fund. Report of Com. on Finance respecting. [underlined]'>Permanent Fund. Report of Com. on Finance respecting. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Comittee on Finance, to whom, at the <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of October 13^th, 1875, were referred the preambles <span class='line-break'> </span>and votes respecting the Permanent Fund offered by <span class='line-break'> </span>M^r J. T. Bradlee, submitted a written report, recom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mending "as a substitute for the vote presented for <span class='line-break'> </span>"their consideration, the following"; viz; -</p>
<p>"Voted [underlined[, - that the interest and income of the <span class='line-break'> </span>"Permanent Fund shall annually, or oftener, be added to <span class='line-break'> </span>"the capital for the purpose, and upon the principle <span class='line-break'> </span>"of accumulation, until the whole of the deposits or <span class='line-break'> </span>"investment, with accumulated interest, shall amount <span class='line-break'> </span>" to Five hundred thousand dollars, ($500.000. - )"</p>
<p>And it was, after discussion</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the report of the Committee be accepted;<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the vote offered by them be laid on the table, <span class='line-break'> </span>and the further consideration thereof deferred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>next meeting of the Board.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3892'>3892</span></p>

<div id="page-1135310">
<h3><a name="page-1135310">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 072</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>72</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='December 22, 1875. [underlined]'>December 22, 1875. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>December 22^nd, 1875. [underlined]</p>
<p>The adjourned special meeting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees was held on Wednesday, December 22^nd,<span class='line-break'> </span>1875 at Three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Presesnt, the President and Messrs J. T. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>N. J. Bradlee, Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Little, Perkins, <span class='line-break'> </span>Pickering and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read, and, <span class='line-break'> </span>after amendment, approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Permanent Fund, Vote respecting submitted by Com. on Finance, substitute for off^d &amp; accepted. [underlined]'>Permanent Fund, Vote respecting submitted by Com. on Finance, substitute for off^d &amp; accepted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The vote submitted by the Committee on Finance <span class='line-break'> </span>at the meeting of December 8^th, 1875, respecting the Permanent <span class='line-break'> </span>Fund which was considered at the meeting of December 15^th,<span class='line-break'> </span>and specially assigned for further consideration at this <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting was taken from the table and discussed.<span class='line-break'> </span>M^r Choate offered as a substitiute the following vote which <span class='line-break'> </span>was accepted, viz;</p>
<p>It is ordered [underlined] by the Trustees of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn that after the Permanent Fund provided<span class='line-break'> </span>for in the seventh Article of the By=Laws, shall, by <span class='line-break'> </span>accumulation or otherwise, have reached the amount of <span class='line-break'> </span>two hundred thousand dollars, the said Fund shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>further increased by adding thereto one third part of <span class='line-break'> </span>the gross proceeds of all lots, and parts of lots, and <span class='line-break'> </span>spaces between lots thereafter sold; the account<span class='line-break'> </span>thereof to be made up annually to the first day of <span class='line-break'> </span>December in each year, and invested by the Treasurer <span class='line-break'> </span>during said month in the manner provided for the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135311">
<h3><a name="page-1135311">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 073</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='December 22, 1875 [underlined]'>December 22, 1875 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Permanent Fund: the interest of all sums so added to said <span class='line-break'> </span>Fund shall annually or oftener be added to the capital for <span class='line-break'> </span>the purpose and upon the principle of accumulation,<span class='line-break'> </span>until the whole of said Permanent Fund, with the accumu=<span class='line-break'> </span>=lated interest amounts to five hundred thousand dollars.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Permanent Fund. Substitute vote referred to Spec. Com. [underlined]'>Permanent Fund. Substitute vote referred to Spec. Com. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - to refer said vote to a special Committee, <span class='line-break'> </span>consisting of the Committee on Finance and M^r Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>to confer with the officers of the Massachusetts Hospital <span class='line-break'> </span>Life Insurance Company to ascertain their views upon <span class='line-break'> </span>the subject matter and form of the vote, and to report to<span class='line-break'> </span>the next meeting of this Board; - suggesting any changes <span class='line-break'> </span>which, in their judgment, may be required to carry <span class='line-break'> </span>out the views of the Board.</p>
<p>M^r J. T. Bradlee renewed his notice of intention <span class='line-break'> </span>to offer certain amendments to the forms of deeds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Report to Proprietors Com^tee app^d. to prepare,. [underlined]'>Annual Report to Proprietors Com^tee app^d. to prepare,. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of the same gentleman it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that a Committee be appointed consisting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the President and two other members of the Board, to be <span class='line-break'> </span>designated by him, to prepare the Annual Report to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors.</p>
<p>Messrs J. T. Bradlee and Choate were selected <span class='line-break'> </span>by the President as members of said Committee.</p>
<p>No other business being prefsented, the meeting -</p>
<p>Dissolved. [underlined]</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Sec'y.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135312">
<h3><a name="page-1135312">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 074</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>74</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='January 12, 1876. [underlined]'>January 12, 1876. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>January 12^th, 1876 [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held on Wednesday, Jan'y. 12, 1876, at<span class='line-break'> </span>Four o'clock, P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs N. J. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Little, Perkins and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read<span class='line-break'> </span>and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='D. N. Skillings Hearing. [underlined]'>D. N. Skillings Hearing. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to the vote adopted at the meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of November 10, 1875, according a hearing to M^r David<span class='line-break'> </span>N. Skillings, that gentleman, attended by his <span class='line-break'> </span>architect, M^r Joseph E. Billings, appeared before <span class='line-break'> </span>the Board, and explained his wishes relative to a <span class='line-break'> </span>change of grade of Lot N^o 4391, Eagle Avenue.</p>
<p>The Board, after the withdrawal of the pe=<span class='line-break'> </span>titioners having considered the subject, on motion of <span class='line-break'> </span>M^r Choate it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Leave to withdraw granted[underlined]'>Leave to withdraw granted[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Trustees having already laid out <span class='line-break'> </span>this portion of the Cemetery under vote of Nov. 19, 1873, <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the landscape=lawn plan, and having es=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tablished grades and sold lots to other parties <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the representation that this plan should be <span class='line-break'> </span>carried out, do not feel at liberty to allow any change<span class='line-break'> </span>in the grade</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='With permission to exchange for another Lot,. [underlined]'>With permission to exchange for another Lot,. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that M^r Skillings be allowed to exchange <span class='line-break'> </span>for another lot, with the approval of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135313">
<h3><a name="page-1135313">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 075</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>75</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='January 12, 1876 [underlined]'>January 12, 1876 [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Permanent Fund Report of Spec. Com. app. to conf. with Mass. Hosp. Life Ins. Co. [underlined]'>Permanent Fund Report of Spec. Com. app. to conf. with Mass. Hosp. Life Ins. Co. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>M^r Little, in behalf of the special committee<span class='line-break'> </span>appointed at the last meeting to confer with the officers<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Massachusetts Hospital Life Insurance Company<span class='line-break'> </span>respecting the subject matter and form of the vote <span class='line-break'> </span>to be adopted by this Board in regard to the augmen=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tatoins of the Permanent Fund, reported verbally as <span class='line-break'> </span>follows, viz; - that he, in behalf of the Committee, <span class='line-break'> </span>had conferred with Judge Bigelow, the actuary of <span class='line-break'> </span>said company, who gave his approal of the vote<span class='line-break'> </span>above referred to, and expressed his willingness to <span class='line-break'> </span>receive deposits provided for in said vote, in the same<span class='line-break'> </span>manner and on the same terms as heretofore.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the report of the Committee be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Substitute order of M^r Choate laid on the table. [underlined]'>Substitute order of M^r Choate laid on the table. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The question being on the  passage of the sub=<span class='line-break'> </span>=stitute order of M^r Choate, - on motion of said <span class='line-break'> </span>gentleman, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - to lay it upon the table.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='forms of deeds &amp;c. [underliend]'>forms of deeds &amp;c. [underliend]</span></p>
<p>M^r J. T. Bradlee's notice of intention to offer <span class='line-break'> </span>certain changes in the forms of deeds, etc., was renewed <span class='line-break'> </span>by M^r Choate, in his own behalf, and on that of M^r Bradlee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t. [underlined] '>Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of bills with accom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=panying schedule having been laid before the Board,  -</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said bills be referred to the President <span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval, and payment by the Treasurer, if <span class='line-break'> </span>found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G. of Lot 4018 [underlined] '>Perp. Rep. with G. of Lot 4018 [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135314">
<h3><a name="page-1135314">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 076</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>76</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='January 12, 1876. [underlined]'>January 12, 1876. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>the perpetual repair of Lot N^o 4018, Fountain Av.<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to M^rs Sarah Folsom for $625, - it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said contract be conurred in <span class='line-break'> </span>on the part of this Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of land. Monthly Rep. accepted. [underlined]'>Sales of land. Monthly Rep. accepted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of land effected <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Superintendent from December 8^th, 1895, to <span class='line-break'> </span>January 12^th, 1876, having been submitted and read <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said statement be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>placed on file.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest <span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for lots as follows, viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='914'>914</span></p>
<p>Lavinia Stone of Waltham, widow of Peter R. L. Stone, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot number Nine hundred &amp; fourteen</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1613'>1613</span></p>
<p>Edward E. Hale of Boston, son of Nathan Hale<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased prorieetor of Lot number Sisteen hundred &amp; thirteen</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3321'>3321</span></p>
<p>Andrew G. Holmes of Boston, son of Andrew P. Holmes <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numberThirty=three hundred &amp; twenty=one</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3415'>3415</span></p>
<p>Edmund Daniels of Boston, son of Agnes R. Phelps <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot number Thirty=four hundred &amp; fifteen</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3868'>3868</span></p>
<p>Mary A. Simpson of Boston, Widow of Robert Simpson<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbr Thirty=eight hundred &amp; sixty=eight.</p>
<p>Dissolved.  Sam^l. Batchelderr Jr., Sec'y.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135315">
<h3><a name="page-1135315">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 077</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>77</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan&apos;y. 28, 1876. [underlined] '>Jan'y. 28, 1876. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>January 28, 1876 [underlined]</p>
<p>A special meeting of the Board of Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Friday, January 28, 1876, at three o'clk. P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs J. T. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>N. J. Bradlee, Choate, Lawrence, Little and Perkins</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer Ann. Report of acc. &amp; ord to be printed. [underlined] '>Treasurer Ann. Report of acc. &amp; ord to be printed. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>A report having been received from the com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mittee on Finance, approving as correct the annual <span class='line-break'> </span>report of the Treasurer, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Treasurer's annual Report be <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted and printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent Ann. Report of Acc. &amp; ord. to be printed [underlined]'>Superintendent Ann. Report of Acc. &amp; ord. to be printed [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The annual report of the Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>having been submitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p>Voted underlined], - that the Superintendent's annual Report be <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted and printed.</p>
<p>On motion of M^r Choate, the votes which were <span class='line-break'> </span>offered by him at the meeting of December 15, 1875, were <span class='line-break'> </span>taken from the table.  After discussion, the following <span class='line-break'> </span>votes were passed unanimously, the yeas and nays <span class='line-break'> </span>being taken.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rules ^ Reg^ns amended by striking out old forms [underlined] '>Rules ^ Reg^ns amended by striking out old forms [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - to amend the Rules and Regulations by <span class='line-break'> </span>striking out all forms of deeds, certificates and contracts,<span class='line-break'> </span>said forms being the whole of Article XII.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New forms adopted. [underlined]'>New forms adopted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the new forms submitted by M^r Choate<span class='line-break'> </span>for deeds of lots, - (a)[underlinead], of less area than 300 feet, -<span class='line-break'> </span>(b)[underlined], on the Stone farm territory, ("landscape lawn"), - and</p>
<p>Voted [underlined],</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135316">
<h3><a name="page-1135316">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 078</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>78</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jany. 28, 1876. [underlined]'>Jany. 28, 1876. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>(c),[underlined] in immediate vicinity of Halcyon Lake be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Old forms to be used unless otherwise ord^d. [underlined]'>Old forms to be used unless otherwise ord^d. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the forms of deeds, certificates<span class='line-break'> </span>contracts and papers heretofore used, and by vote <span class='line-break'> </span>stricken out of the Rules and Regulations, as enlarged <span class='line-break'> </span>and amended by the votes passed this day, be adopted<span class='line-break'> </span>and used in all cases, unless otherwise ordered, and</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary to prepare sched. [underlined]'>Secretary to prepare sched. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>that a schedule of such forms be prepared by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.  [See p.68.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Permanent Fund substitute order of M^r Choate withdrawn. [underlined]'>Permanent Fund substitute order of M^r Choate withdrawn. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of M^r Choate, the substitute <span class='line-break'> </span>order offered by him at the last meeting in <span class='line-break'> </span>regard to the augmentation of the Permanent Fund, <span class='line-break'> </span>was taken from the table, and withdrawn by <span class='line-break'> </span>unanimous consent.</p>
<p>M^r Choate then presented a new draught<span class='line-break'> </span>of the same, as follows, viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New draught offered &amp; unanimously adopted. [See p. 80.} [underlined]'>New draught offered &amp; unanimously adopted. [See p. 80.} [underlined]</span></p>
<p>It is ordered [underlined] by the Trustees of the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, that, after the <span class='line-break'> </span>Permanent Fund shall have reached the sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>two hundred thousand dollars, as provided for in <span class='line-break'> </span>the Seventh Article of the By=Laws, it shall be further <span class='line-break'> </span>increased until it shall reach the sum of five <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred thousand dollars, in the following manner.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Treasurer of the corporation in the month of December <span class='line-break'> </span>of each year, after the year 1876, shall deposit with <span class='line-break'> </span>the Massachusetts Hospital Life Insurance Company, <span class='line-break'> </span>in trust, in the same manner as has been provided <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Seventh By=Law for the investment of the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135317">
<h3><a name="page-1135317">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 079</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>79</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan&apos;y. 28, 1876 [underlined]'>Jan'y. 28, 1876 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Permanent Fund, a sum equal to one third part of <span class='line-break'> </span>the gross proceeds of the lots, parts of lots, and intermediate <span class='line-break'> </span>spaces between lots, which shall have been sold subse=<span class='line-break'> </span>=quently to the first day of December in the year preceding, <span class='line-break'> </span>the interest of which sums so deposited shall annually,<span class='line-break'> </span>or oftener, be added to the capital, for the purposes of <span class='line-break'> </span>accumulation, until the whole of the deposits made <span class='line-break'> </span>in pursuance of this order, with the accumulated interest <span class='line-break'> </span>thereo, shall amount to three hundred thousand dollars.</p>
<p>The Trustees shall have the same powers to withdraw<span class='line-break'> </span>the principal of the additional Fund hereby created, and <span class='line-break'> </span>reinvest the same, as can be exercised over the Permanent <span class='line-break'> </span>Fund under the provisions of the Seventh By=Law.</p>
<p>And when the addition hereby provided for to said <span class='line-break'> </span>Permanent Fund shall have reached the amount of three <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred thousand dollars, the income thereof may be <span class='line-break'> </span>withdrawn and appropriated by the Trustees to the <span class='line-break'> </span>preservation and keeping in order of the Cemetery, and <span class='line-break'> </span>its appurtenances, to the payment of salaries, and <span class='line-break'> </span>other necessary expenses of the corporation.  Provided,<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Trustees may, if they see fit so to do, direct<span class='line-break'> </span>such further accumulation of said Fund, by the addition <span class='line-break'> </span>of the income thereof to the principal, to such amount <span class='line-break'> </span>as they may deem for the best interest of the Corporation.</p>
<p>It is also ordered that in all deeds which shall <span class='line-break'> </span>hereafter be given to the purchasers of lots, parts of lots <span class='line-break'> </span>or other parcels of land in the Cemetery, the following</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135318">
<h3><a name="page-1135318">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 080</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>80</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan&apos;y. 28, 1876. [underlined]'>Jan'y. 28, 1876. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>words shall be added to the covenant respecting the <span class='line-break'> </span>Permanent Fund: - "and the provisions of an order <span class='line-break'> </span>"respecting said Fund adopted by said Trustees on <span class='line-break'> </span>"the twenty=eighth day of January, 1876, shall also <span class='line-break'> </span>"be forever kept, observed and performed by said corporation."</p>
<p>After discussion the orders were</p>
<p>Adopted [underlined], by a unanimous vote, the yeas <span class='line-break'> </span>and nays being taken.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors: - Ann. Report of the Trustees to the; adopted &amp; ordered to be printed. [underlined]'>Proprietors: - Ann. Report of the Trustees to the; adopted &amp; ordered to be printed. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President, in behalf of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>appointed at the last meeting to prepare the Annual <span class='line-break'> </span>Report to the Proprietors, submitted and read the <span class='line-break'> </span>report drafted in compliance with the vote aforesaid;<span class='line-break'> </span>and the same having been considered, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the report which has now been read <span class='line-break'> </span>be and the same is hereby approved and adopted<span class='line-break'> </span>as and for the Report of the B oard of Trustees to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors, and ordered to be printed, the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>having leave  to make verbal alterations if deemed <span class='line-break'> </span>expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rules &amp; Reg^us changes in the Pres^t - authorized to make verbal report to Proprietors. [underlined] '>Rules &amp; Reg^us changes in the Pres^t - authorized to make verbal report to Proprietors. [underlined] </span></p>

<p>The names of the Trustees elected at the annual <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Proprietors on the 7^th instant were announcaed <span class='line-break'> </span>by M^r Spelman, who stated that the business first in</p>

<p>order would be the election of officers for the ensuing year.  And it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Board proceed to ballot for a <span class='line-break'> </span>President.</p>
<p>M^r. Perkins having been designated as a <span class='line-break'> </span>committee to collect and count the votes, announced <span class='line-break'> </span>the result as follows, viz: -</p>

<p>Whole number of ballots cast for President = 7;<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for</p>
<p>M^r Israel M. Spelman [underliend]; and he was accordingly <span class='line-break'> </span>declared elected to the office aforesaid.</p>
<p>On motion of M^r J. T. Bradlee, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the election of Treasurer and Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>be laid upon the table.</p>
<p>The Board then proceeded to ballot for a <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent with the following result.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of M^ J. W. Lovering as Superintendent.[underlined]'>Election of M^ J. W. Lovering as Superintendent.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the salary of the Superintenadent be <span class='line-break'> </span>fixed at two thousand five hundred dollars ($2500. - )<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year, and that he shall have the use<span class='line-break'> </span>of a house with the grounds thereto belonging, the <span class='line-break'> </span>use of a horse and vehicle, and the services of one<span class='line-break'> </span>man at the expense of the corporation,.</p>

<p>The President made a verbal report on the <span class='line-break'> </span>reference "to the Hon. E. E. Rockwood Hoar,<span class='line-break'> </span>and, after hearing, by consel, an award was made <span class='line-break'> </span>by said referee in favor of the town of Watertown, <span class='line-break'> </span>amounting to $594.20, including one half the costs <span class='line-break'> </span>of reference, and that this award has accordingly <span class='line-break'> </span>been paid by the corporation.</p>

<p>The Secretry having stated that the committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty <span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair of Lot n^o 355, Narcissus Path, <span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to the heirs of the late Nancy Dana, for $600. -</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said contract be concurred in on<span class='line-break'> </span>the part of this Board.</p>

<p>A statement of the sales of land reported <span class='line-break'> </span>by the  Superintendent, February 16 to March 8, 1876, <span class='line-break'> </span>having been submitted by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said statement be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>placed on file.</p>

<p>Sam^l Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>

<p>===March 29, 1876. [underlined]</p>
<p>March 29, 1876. [underlined]</p>
<p>The adjourned monthly meeting of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was convened on Wednesday, March 29, 1876<span class='line-break'> </span>at Four o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs J. T. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>N. J. Bradlee, Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins &amp; Pickering.</p>
<p>The record of the adjourned monthly meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of the 8^th inst. and of the regular monthly meeting held <span class='line-break'> </span>on the same day were read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on uniting offies of Treas^r &amp; Sec&apos;y. [underlined] '>Report of Com. on uniting offies of Treas^r &amp; Sec'y. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The Committee appointed at the meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>February 16^th, 1876 to consider and report with reference to <span class='line-break'> </span>uniting the offices of Secretary and Treasurer submitted <span class='line-break'> </span>a written report.  And it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said report be accepted.</p>
<p>The Board then proceeded to ballot for the offices <span class='line-break'> </span>of Secretary and Treasurer, with the folloiwng result, as <span class='line-break'> </span>announced by M^r Perkins, the Committee designated to <span class='line-break'> </span>collect and count said votes, viz:-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Secretary &amp;  Treasurer [underlined]'>Election of Secretary &amp;  Treasurer [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Whole number of ballots cast for Secretary [underlined], 8<span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for Samuel Batrchelder Jr.,[underlined]<span class='line-break'> </span>and he was accordingly declared elected to that office <span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuring year.</p>
<p>Whole number of ballots cast for Treasurer [underlined] 8,<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for H. B. Mackintosh [underlined],<span class='line-break'> </span>and he was accordinly declared elected to that office<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year.</p>
<p>On motion of M^r J. T. Bradlee, it was</p>
</div>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Treas^r &amp; Sec&apos;y fixed. [underlined] '>Salary of Treas^r &amp; Sec'y fixed. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the salary of the Treasurer be fixed at <span class='line-break'> </span>#2250. - and the salary of the Secretary at $1500. -<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Offie hours.[underlined]'>Offie hours.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined] - that the office hours be fixed at from <span class='line-break'> </span>9 A. M. to 3 P. M.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Benjamin Rogers heirs of Pet^n by for naming Path.[underlined]'>Benjamin Rogers heirs of Pet^n by for naming Path.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Grounds, to whom at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting was referred the petition of the heirs of the <span class='line-break'> </span>late Benjamin Rogers requesting the assignment of a <span class='line-break'> </span>name to the Path running from the Chapel to Lawn Av.<span class='line-break'> </span>sumibtted a report recommending that it  be con=<span class='line-break'> </span>=sidered a continuation of Laburnum Path, and <span class='line-break'> </span>have the same name.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Labornum P. (continuation of) name assigned,. [underlined]'>Labornum P. (continuation of) name assigned,. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the report be accepted, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>Path be so named.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='B. Daily Advertiser Bill of ap^d. [underlined] '>B. Daily Advertiser Bill of ap^d. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the bill of the Boston Daily Advertiser <span class='line-break'> </span>for advertising the notice of the hearing before the <span class='line-break'> </span>Judiciary Committee on the subject of the Watertown <span class='line-break'> </span>taxes be approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title='Town of Watertown, Notice of int. to move app^n of $2500. - in settlement of tax=claims of. [underlined] ='>Town of Watertown, Notice of int. to move app^n of $2500. - in settlement of tax=claims of. [underlined] =</span></p>
<p>The President in behalf of the special com=<span class='line-break'> </span>mittee on the subject of taxation by the town of <span class='line-break'> </span>Watertown, briefly reported - that an arrangement <span class='line-break'> </span>had been made with that town, which would require, <span class='line-break'> </span>after the passage of an Act now before the Legislature, <span class='line-break'> </span>an appropriation of $2500,. - for the settlement of <span class='line-break'> </span>said tax claims.</p>
<p>Notice was therefore given of an intention <span class='line-break'> </span>to more for an an appropriation for that amount at a</p>

<p>The President having called the attention of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board to the mportance of having the streets near the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery properly watered for the season, it was, on <span class='line-break'> </span>motion of M^r Bradlee</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the subject of making proper provision <span class='line-break'> </span>for watering the streets near the Cemetery be referred to 'th eCommittee on Grounds, with full powers. <span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p>Present, the President, and Messrs N. J. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>J. T. Bradlee, Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, <span class='line-break'> </span>Pickering and Snow.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Brick graves. Report of Com.resp. accepted, &amp; rec. adopted. [underlined]'>Brick graves. Report of Com.resp. accepted, &amp; rec. adopted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>[check mark]  The report of the special committee with <span class='line-break'> </span>regard to the mode of construction of brick graves, <span class='line-break'> </span>action upon which was deferred at the last meeting, <span class='line-break'> </span>was taken up and considered; and it was</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving Tomb. Repo. of Spec. Com. as to re=construction of. etc. [underlined]'>Receiving Tomb. Repo. of Spec. Com. as to re=construction of. etc. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A verbal report was received from the <span class='line-break'> </span>President, in behalf of the special committee ap=<span class='line-break'> </span>=pointed at the last meeting upon the subject of <span class='line-break'> </span>putting a portion of the Receiving Tomb in readiness<span class='line-break'> </span>for immediate use;  stating that a careful exami=<span class='line-break'> </span>=nation of the premises, and the portion of the Tomb <span class='line-break'> </span>already built, they had ascertained that, owing to <span class='line-break'> </span>the removal of Fountain Avenue towards the South,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the raising of the grade of that Avenue for the <span class='line-break'> </span>purposes of securing good drainage, it was no<span class='line-break'> </span>longer practicable to carry out the plan for the <span class='line-break'> </span>Receiving Tomb as originallyt designed by G. J. F. Bryant,<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>

<div id="page-1135343">

<p>101</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 17, 1876. [underlined] '>May 17, 1876. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Esq., having an entrance and vestibule on Fountain Av.,<span class='line-break'> </span>similar to the one already constructed on Roseby Av^e,<span class='line-break'> </span>and having a level grade throughout.  That they had <span class='line-break'> </span>concluded, therefore, to recommend the abandonment <span class='line-break'> </span>of that design, and to propose the construction of a <span class='line-break'> </span>Tomb with one entrance only, that on Rosebay Avenue,<span class='line-break'> </span>consisting of the vestibule already constructed, and of <span class='line-break'> </span>a hall lighted and ventilated from above, and containing <span class='line-break'> </span>about one hundred and twenty eight (128) catacombs,<span class='line-break'> </span>one half on each side of the hall, agreeably to plans<span class='line-break'> </span>prepared for them by the Superintendent, and herewith<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted.  That the estimated cost of completing the <span class='line-break'> </span>Tomb, ready for use, including repairs of the present <span class='line-break'> </span>vestibule, grading, etc., would probably not exceed twelve <span class='line-break'> </span>thousand dollars, ($12,000. -)  That they therefore re=<span class='line-break'> </span>=commended the adoption of the Superintendent's plans<span class='line-break'> </span>for Receiving Tomb herewith presented, and the appro=<span class='line-break'> </span>=priation of a sum not exceeding twelve thousand<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars ($12,000. -) for its construction and completion.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Recp. accepted. Plans adopted. [underlined]'>Recp. accepted. Plans adopted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>[check mark]  Voted [underlined], - that the foregoing report be accepted, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the plans submitted by the Sueprintendent, and recom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mended in said report nbe adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='App^n pf $12,000.- for work on,'>App^n pf $12,000.- for work on,</span></p>
<p>On motion of M^r Browne, it was</p>
<p>[check mark]  Voted [underlined], - that an amount not exceedin tweleve thousand dollars, ($12,000. -), be placed at the disposal <span class='line-break'> </span>of a special Committee, consiting of the President, <span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs. N. J. Bradlee and Choate, for the completion of the</p>

<p>(c[underlined]) Deed of ornamental ground.<span class='line-break'> </span>(d[underlined]) Deed of intermediate space.</p>

<p>M^r Snow submitted the following amendments <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Rules and Regulations, pursuant to the notice<span class='line-break'> </span>given by him at the last meeting, viz: - Article VI. p. 15,<span class='line-break'> </span>7^th line, after the word "Superintendent,"  add the words<span class='line-break'> </span>following, viz: - "Provided that no work shall at any time <span class='line-break'> </span>"be done by other persons than the proper officers or servants<span class='line-break'> </span>"of the corporation upon those lots of which the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>"care, or the care of the turfing or sodding has been assumed<span class='line-break'> </span>"by the corporation, by deed or contract.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said amendment be adopted.</p>
<p>The above vote was taken by yeas and nays, <span class='line-break'> </span>and was unanimous.</p>
<p>The following amendment to the certificate of <span class='line-break'> </span>selection of lots sold with a covenant for the perpetual</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Omitted Entries of Minutes of Meeting of April 12, 1876.'>Omitted Entries of Minutes of Meeting of April 12, 1876.</span></p>
<p>[The following was inadvertently omitted from the<span class='line-break'> </span>minutes of the meeting of April 12, 1876, - ante, p. 96.]</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that M<sup>r</sup> Choate be joined to the Commit<span class='line-break'></span>-tee on Lots for consideration and report on the above subject.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee on Interments be re<span class='line-break'></span>-quested to consider and report on the subject of<span class='line-break'> </span>the mode of construction of brick graves, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>price proper to be charged by the corporation for con<span class='line-break'></span>-structing the same.</p>
