<p><u>May 23<sup>d</sup>, 1876.</u></p>
<p>An adjourned special meeting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees was held on Tuesday, May 23<sup>d</sup>, 1876,<span class='line-break'> </span>at Four o'clock. P.M.</p>
<p>Preesent, the President, and Messrs, J.T. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>N.J. Bradlee, Browne, Choate, Perkins and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secy&apos;s resignation: - report in favor of accepting, &amp;c'>Secy's resignation: - report in favor of accepting, &amp;c</span></p>
<p>The committee, to whom, at the last meeting,<span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the resignation of the Secretary, reported<span class='line-break'> </span>verbally in favor of accepting the same, to take Effect<span class='line-break'> </span>at such time as may be hereafter determined.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comtee instructed'>Com<sup>tee</sup> instructed</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be ac<span class='line-break'></span>-cepted, and that they be requested to report further,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135349">
<h3><a name="page-1135349">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 107</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>107</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 23d, 1876. [?] rec. time for [?] to take Effect, nom. candidate.'>May 23<sup>d</sup>, 1876. [?] rec. time for [?] to take Effect, nom. candidate.</span></p>
<p>recommending a date for the said resignation to take<span class='line-break'> </span>Effect, and nominating a candidate to fill the vacancy.</p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> John T. Bradlee desired to be Excused from<span class='line-break'> </span>serving on the Committee, in consequence of intended<span class='line-break'> </span>absence from the city, but subsequently withdrew his<span class='line-break'> </span>request. M<sup>r</sup> Choate was, by vote, added to said Com<sup>tee</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repair Fund. Loan of $10,000.- from the Report from Com. on Finance respecting.'>Repair Fund. Loan of $10,000.- from the Report from Com. on Finance respecting.</span></p>
<p>A verbal report was received from^M<sup>r</sup> Browne, in behalf of^ the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Finance, in response to the vote adopted at the last<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, instructing them to report the facts in relation<span class='line-break'> </span>to the loan of $10,000.- from the Repair Fund; stating the<span class='line-break'> </span>circumstances under which the loan had been paid,<span class='line-break'> </span>from funds lying idle in the bank, and that it was<span class='line-break'> </span>not contemplated as a permanent arrangement; but<span class='line-break'> </span>that the matter had been overlooked by the chairman<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee, longer than he had intended, in con<span class='line-break'></span>-sequence of his detention at home by illness.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted.'>accepted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be accepted.</p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> John T. Bradlee offered the following votes: -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repair Fund Loan, &amp;c. Votes offered by Mr J.T. Bradlee respecting.'>Repair Fund Loan, &amp;c. Votes offered by M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee respecting.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Treasurer be, and hereby is instructed,<span class='line-break'> </span>-pay to the Repair Fund the sum of $10,000.- borrowed<span class='line-break'> </span>there from February 8, 1876, and to pay said Fund in<span class='line-break'></span>under the direction of the Committee on Finance to re<span class='line-break'></span>-terest on said loan from February 8<sup>t</sup>, 1876, to the date<span class='line-break'> </span>of payment of the same, at the rate of 5% per annum,</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee on Finance are hereby<span class='line-break'> </span>instructed, in all investments or loans of the Repair<span class='line-break'> </span>Fund, to be governed by the letter and spirit of the<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135350">
<h3><a name="page-1135350">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 108</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>108</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 23d, 1876'>May 23<sup>d</sup>, 1876</span></p>
<p>Eighth By-Law of the Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='referred to spec. Comtee consisting, &amp;c.'>referred to spec. Com<sup>tee</sup> consisting, &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>After discussion, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the whole subject be referred to a<span class='line-break'> </span>special committee, consisting of the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Finance, M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee and M<sup>r</sup> Choate, to report<span class='line-break'> </span>at the next meeting of the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deeds: amendment to forms of adopted at meeting of May 17, 1876;'>Deeds: amendment to forms of adopted at meeting of May 17, 1876;</span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Snow submitted the following amendment<span class='line-break'> </span>to the covenant for the perpetual care of grass, in<span class='line-break'> </span>the forms for deeds of lots reported at the last meeting; -<span class='line-break'> </span>viz: after the word "acknowledged," in the third<span class='line-break'> </span>line of said covenant, add the words following, viz; -<span class='line-break'> </span>"and which shall be added to the Repair Fund"; - so that<span class='line-break'> </span>the covenant, as amended, will read as follows; viz; -<span class='line-break'> </span>"And the said Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn,<span class='line-break'> </span>"in consideration of the further sum of [blank] dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>"to them paid by the said grantee, the receipt whereof is<span class='line-break'> </span>"hereby acknowledged, <u>and which shall be added to the<span class='line-break'> </span>"Repair Fund</u>, do further covenant to and with the said<span class='line-break'> </span>"grantee, heirs and assigns, that they will forever<span class='line-break'> </span>"keep in suitable condition and preservation, the<span class='line-break'> </span>"sodding or turfing upon said lot hereby conveyed."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='adopted.'>adopted.</span></p>
<p>And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the foregoing amendment be adopted.</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>Sam Batchelder Jr. Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135351">
<h3><a name="page-1135351">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 109</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>109</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 14, 1876'>June 14, 1876</span></p>
<p><u>June 14, 1876</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Wednesday, June 14, 1876, at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Perkins and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gilman, T.F. &amp; al. claim for allowance,'>Gilman, T.F. &amp; al. claim for allowance,</span></p>
<p>A verbal report was received from the President, in<span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of the Committee on Grounds, to whom, at the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of June 10, 1874, was referred the claim of T.F. &amp; F.L. Gilman<span class='line-break'> </span>for allowance for damages occasioned by the overturning of<span class='line-break'> </span>their team loaded with stone for the tomb of Hollis Moore,<span class='line-break'> </span>Hazel-Dell Path, stating the circumstances of the accident,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that a proposition had been made by F.L. Gilman to<span class='line-break'> </span>settle the claim, if the corporation would allow one half<span class='line-break'> </span>their claim for damages. On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Choate, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refd to Prest with powers'>Ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup> with powers</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above claim be referred to the President<span class='line-break'> </span>with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Wilbur G.B. Comn from refd to Com. on Lots'>Wilbur G.B. Com<sup>n</sup> from ref<sup>d</sup> to Com. on Lots</span></p>
<p>The President also submitted to the Board a<span class='line-break'> </span>communication from M<sup>r</sup> George B. Wilbur, dated May<span class='line-break'> </span>25<sup>t</sup>, 1876, in relation to the prices charged by the corpo<span class='line-break'></span>-ration for work on Lots. And the same having been<span class='line-break'> </span>considered, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that M<sup>r</sup> Wilbur's communication be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Browne, in behalf of the special Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to whom, at the last meeting, was referred the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>of the loan of ten thousand dollars from the Repair Fund,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135352">
<h3><a name="page-1135352">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 110</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>110</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 14, 1876.'>June 14, 1876.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repair Fund, Loan of $10,000.- from the Report &amp; votes submitted.'>Repair Fund, Loan of $10,000.- from the Report &amp; votes submitted.</span></p>
<p>and the votes offered by M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee relating<span class='line-break'> </span>thereto, made a report recommending the passage<span class='line-break'> </span>of the following votes, and requesting time for the<span class='line-break'> </span>further consideration of the general subject; [to wit:-]</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Finance Committee be, and are<span class='line-break'> </span>hereby instructed to dispose of all investments<span class='line-break'> </span>that are now held for the Repair Fund, not <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized by the Eighth By-Law.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that, in the opinion of this Board, the<span class='line-break'> </span>holding of stocks National Banks in this<span class='line-break'> </span>state, and of the bonds of the City of Boston is<span class='line-break'> </span>authorized by the Eighth By-Law.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that all money of the Repair Fund, while<span class='line-break'> </span>awaiting investment, be deposited in the New<span class='line-break'> </span>England Trust Company, in the name of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation as trustee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted. Votes adopted.'>Report accepted. Votes adopted.</span></p>
<p>The report was accepted, and, after dis<span class='line-break'></span>-cussion, <u>the votes</u> recommended by the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span><u> were Unanimously adopted.</u></p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Browne, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr authorized to borrow $10,000.-'>Treas<sup>r</sup> authorized to borrow $10,000.-</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Treasurer, under the direction<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Finance, be, and be hereby is<span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to borrow a sum not Exceeding fifteen<span class='line-break'> </span>thousand dollars, ($15,000.-) to meet the Expenses<span class='line-break'> </span>of the corporation.</p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Choate, in behalf of the special committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on the subject of taxation by the town of Watertown,<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135353">
<h3><a name="page-1135353">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 111</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>111</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 14, 1876'>June 14, 1876</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watertown; tax-claims of Town of instrument xd-by select-men for certain purposes'>Watertown; tax-claims of Town of instrument x<sup>d</sup>-by select-men for certain purposes</span></p>
<p>reported that the sum of twenty-five hundred dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>($2500.-) appropriated at the meeting of April 12, 1876,<span class='line-break'> </span>for the settlement of the tax-claims of said town, subject<span class='line-break'> </span>to the approval of said special committee, had been paid<span class='line-break'> </span>to said town, in consideration whereof the town, by its<span class='line-break'> </span>selectmen, had Executed an instrument permitting the<span class='line-break'> </span>use for the purposes of burial, of all lands in said town<span class='line-break'> </span>included within the present enclosure of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of said Corporation.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be accepted,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the instrument therein referred to, be spread<span class='line-break'> </span>upon the record. [See beyond, p. 113.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills refd to Prest'>Monthly Bills ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of bills, with accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule, having been submitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President<span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval, and payment by the Treasurer, if<span class='line-break'> </span>found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. rep. with [?] of lot 738.'>Perp. rep. with [?] of lot 738.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual care of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 738, Yarrow Path, belonging<span class='line-break'> </span>to [Nahmn?] Jones, for the sum of Four hundred and<span class='line-break'> </span>twenty-five dollars ($425.-), it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said contract be concurred in, on<span class='line-break'> </span>the part of this Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of land Monthly Report accepted.'>Sales of land Monthly Report accepted.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having submitted a statement<span class='line-break'> </span>of the sales of land reported by the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>May 10<sup>t</sup> to June 14<sup>t</sup>, 1876, together with a statement<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135354">
<h3><a name="page-1135354">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 112</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>112</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 14, 1876'>June 14, 1876</span></p>
<p>of the aggregate of sales January 1<sup>st</sup> to June 8, 1876,<span class='line-break'> </span>as compared with the corresponding period in<span class='line-break'> </span>1875, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statements be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for lots as follows, viz:-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='445'>445</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Isabella P. Curtis of Boston, daughter of James F. Curtis<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Four hundred &amp; forty-five.</p>
<p>===1168}<span class='line-break'> </span>2068}===<span class='line-break'> </span>George H. Peters of Boston, {trustee est. of ^son in law &amp;^} Sam. K. Williams<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lots numbered {Two thousand and sixty-eight^Eleven hundred &amp; sixty-eight &amp;}</p>
<p>===2452}<span class='line-break'> </span>3988}===<span class='line-break'> </span>Mercy Richardson of Cambridge, widow of Edward Richardson,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lots numbered {Thirty-nine hundred &amp; Eighty-Eight^Twenty-four hundred &amp; fifty-two &amp;}</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2796'>2796</span><span class='line-break'> </span>J. Nelson Borland^M.D.^ of Boston, son of John Borland<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot number Twenty-seven hundred and}<span class='line-break'> </span>ninety-six}</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3451'>3451</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Ellen D. Stearns of Boston, daughter of Williams Stearns,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot number Thirty-four hundred &amp; }<span class='line-break'> </span>fifty-one.}</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4410'>4410</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Susan A. Mullay of E. Somerville, widow of John Mullay,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot number Forty-four hundred &amp; ten.</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u><span class='line-break'> </span>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135355">
<h3><a name="page-1135355">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 113</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>113</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 14, 1876.'>June 14, 1876.</span></p>
<p>[Copy of instrument referred to at page #111.]</p>
<p>Know all men by these presents that the town of<span class='line-break'> </span>Watertown, by its selectmen thereto duly authorized by<span class='line-break'> </span>vote passed at a town meeting held on the sixth day<span class='line-break'> </span>of March, 1876, in consideration of the sum of twenty<span class='line-break'></span>-five hundred dollars, ($2500.-) to it paid by the Pro<span class='line-break'></span>-prietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, the receipt<span class='line-break'> </span>of which is hereby acknowledged, hereby permits the<span class='line-break'> </span>use, for the purposes of burial of all the lands in said<span class='line-break'> </span>town included within the present Enclosure of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of said corporation. A plan of the lands re<span class='line-break'></span>-ferred to has been filed in the Registry of Deeds of the<span class='line-break'> </span>County of Middlesex, Southern District.</p>
<p>Dated this ninth day of June, 1876.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Town of Watertown by its selectmen<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed) W.H. Ingraham<span class='line-break'> </span>" Oliver Shaw<span class='line-break'> </span>" H.W. Macurdy<span class='line-break'> </span>" N.C. Sanger<span class='line-break'> </span>" Ward M. Otis.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135356">
<h3><a name="page-1135356">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 114</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>114</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 12, 1876'>July 12, 1876</span></p>
<p><u>July 12, 1876.</u></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was notified to be held on Wednesday,<span class='line-break'> </span>July 12, 1876, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>At the day and hour above - named there<span class='line-break'> </span>were present the President and Messrs. Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Perkins and Snow</p>
<p>No quorum being in attendance, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be adjourned to<span class='line-break'> </span>Friday, July 14<sup>t</sup>, at Eleven o'clock A.M.</p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 14, 1876.'>July 14, 1876.</span></p>
<p><u>July 14, 1876.</u></p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held on Friday, July 14<sup>t</sup>, 1876, at Eleven o'clk.^A.M.^</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs. J.T. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins and Snow.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee, the reading of<span class='line-break'> </span>the record of the meeting of June 14, 1876, was dispensed<span class='line-break'> </span>with, and the said record was approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec&apos;y.&apos;s resignation Report of sp. Com. fixing date for, &amp; nom. candidate.'>Sec'y.'s resignation Report of sp. Com. fixing date for, &amp; nom. candidate.</span></p>
<p>A verbal report was received from the special<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee which was instructed, at the meeting of May 23<sup>d</sup>,<span class='line-break'> </span>1876, to fix a date for the resignation of the Secretary to<span class='line-break'> </span>take Effect, and nominate a candidate to fill the<span class='line-break'> </span>vacancy, - recommending that said resignation take<span class='line-break'> </span>Effect from and after August 1<sup>st</sup>, 1876, and submitting<span class='line-break'> </span>the name of M<sup>r</sup> J. Harris Reed of Boston, (Dorchester, Dist.)<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135357">
<h3><a name="page-1135357">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 115</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>115</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 14, 1876'>July 14, 1876</span></p>
<p>as a candidate for the Secretary-ship. And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be accepted -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Mr J. Harris Reed as Secretary, unanimously by ballot.'>Election of M<sup>r</sup> J. Harris Reed as Secretary, unanimously by ballot.</span></p>
<p>A ballot was then had for the choice of Secretary,<span class='line-break'> </span>with the following result, viz: -<span class='line-break'> </span>Whole number of ballots, 7<span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for M<sup>r</sup> J. Harris Reed, and<span class='line-break'> </span>he was accordingly declared duly Elected as Secretary of<span class='line-break'> </span>the corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comtee authd to procure office furnishings, Etc.'>Com<sup>tee</sup> auth<sup>d</sup> to procure office furnishings, Etc.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the special Committee have full powers to<span class='line-break'> </span>provide such office furnishings, Etc., as the new Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>may require, and to make with him such arrangements<span class='line-break'> </span>as may be necessary or Expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Geo. B. Wilbur&apos;s Comn. Rept of Com. on.'>Geo. B. Wilbur's Com<sup>n</sup>. Rep<sup>t</sup> of Com. on.</span></p>
<p>A verbal report was made by the chairman of the Com.<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, to whom was referred, at the meeting of June 14<sup>t</sup>, 1876, M<sup>r</sup> George B.<span class='line-break'> </span>Wilbur's communication of May 25, 1876, respecting the prices charged<span class='line-break'> </span>by the corporation for work on lots, to the Effect that satisfactory Expla<span class='line-break'></span>-nations had been made to M<sup>r</sup> Wilbur on the subject matter of his<span class='line-break'> </span>letter, and that no further action was requisite on the part of the Board.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr Quar.^15.^ statements refd to Com. on Finance.'>Treas<sup>r</sup> Quar.^15.^ statements ref<sup>d</sup> to Com. on Finance.</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's statement ^15.^ of the receipts &amp; Expenditures<span class='line-break'> </span>for the quarter Ending June 30<sup>t</sup>, 1876, also his statement of the a<span class='line-break'></span>-mounts due and uncollected for the same period, having been sub<span class='line-break'></span>-mitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the statements^15.^ of the Treasurer be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills refd to Prest'>Monthly Bills ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of bills with accompanying sched<span class='line-break'></span>-ule, having been submitted to the Board, it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135358">
<h3><a name="page-1135358">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 116</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>116</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 14, 1876 [underlined]'>July 14, 1876 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said bills be referred to the President for his appro=<span class='line-break'> </span>=val, and payment by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of land. Monthly Report accepted, &amp;c. [underlined]'>Sales of land. Monthly Report accepted, &amp;c. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of land reported by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent June 14 to July 12, 1876, together with a statement <span class='line-break'> </span>of the aggregate of sales, Jan'y. 1 to July 12, 1876, as compared with the <span class='line-break'> </span>corresponding period in 1875, having been submitted by the Secretary it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said statement be accepted &amp; placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. rep. with G. of Lot #1586 [underlined]'>Perp. rep. with G. of Lot #1586 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual care of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot N^o 1586, *Mary Harris, deceased, for $450. - it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined] , that said contract be concurred in, on the part <span class='line-break'> </span>of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest, representa=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tives were designated for Lots as follows. viz:-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='207'>207</span><span class='line-break'> </span>{Sarah H. Bettinson of Lexington, daughter of Henry Kinsley,<span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Two hundred and seven.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='566'>566</span></p>
<p>{E. Herbert Whitney of Boston, son=in=law of Josiah L. Fairbanks,<span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Five hundred and sixty=six.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='953'>953</span></p>
<p>{Mary F. Littlehale of Boston, daughter of Sargent S. Littlehale, <span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Nine hundred and fifty=three.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='965'>965</span></p>
<p>{Benjamin B. Appleton, M. D., of Boston, son of Catharine Appleton,<span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Nine hundred and sixty=five.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1090'>1090</span></p>
<p>{Francis A. Hall of Boston, brother of Andrew T. Hall, <span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot numbered one thousand and ninety.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1245'>1245</span></p>
<p>{Horace P. Milton of Boston, son of Ephraim Milton,<span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twelve hundred and forty=five.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1348'>1348</span></p>
<p>{Grace A. Stone of  Watertown, daughter of Isaac Stone, <span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirteen hundred and forty=eight.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1582'>1582</span></p>
<p>{Joshua B. Holden of Boston, son of George Holden, <span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Fifteen hundred and eighty=two.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2204'>2204</span></p>
<p>{David Snow of Boston, son of David Snow,<span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty=two hundred and four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3376'>3376</span></p>
<p>{Frank W. Reynolds, of Boston, Trustee of Henry V. Ward, <span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty=three hundred &amp; seventy=six</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4040'>4040</span></p>
<p>{E. Pierson Beebe of Falmoth, son of James M. Beebe, <span class='line-break'> </span>{deceased proprietor of Lot nubmered Four thousand and forty.</p>
<p>Dissolved. [underliend]  Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135359">
<h3><a name="page-1135359">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 117</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>117</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts <span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss September 13, 1876</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oath of Secretary.[underlined]'>Oath of Secretary.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Personally appeared J. Harris Reed and <span class='line-break'> </span>made oath that he would faithfully discharge the<span class='line-break'> </span>duties appertaining to the office of Secretary of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Before me</p>
<p>John T. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Aug. 9. 1876 [underlined]'>Aug. 9. 1876 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was notified to be held on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>August 9^th at four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='No quorum.[underlined]'>No quorum.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>On the day and hour above named <span class='line-break'> </span>there was present Mr. William Perkins, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting was</p>
<p>Dissolved [underlined].</p>
<p>J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135360">
<h3><a name="page-1135360">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 118</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>118</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sept. 13. 1876[underlined]'>Sept. 13. 1876[underlined]</span></p>
<p>September 13. 1876[underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified, on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>Sept. 13^th at four o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. J. T. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>N. J. Bradlee, Browne, Choate, Perkins and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of July 14^th was<span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of August 9^th was <span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1. Report of Finance Com. on Repair Fund [underliend].'>1. Report of Finance Com. on Repair Fund [underliend].</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne of the Committee on Finance <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted the following report: ^1.^:</p>
<p>The undersigned begs to report that in <span class='line-break'> </span>furtherance of the instructions of the Board, all <span class='line-break'> </span>the investments held for the Repair Fund that were <span class='line-break'> </span>not authorized by the 8^th By-Law, have been placed</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale of Investments[underlined].'>Sale of Investments[underlined].</span></p>
<p>on the market for sale, and a part of them are <span class='line-break'> </span>already sold, and the remainder will be as <span class='line-break'> </span>soon as practicable without sacrifice from current<span class='line-break'> </span>quotations.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Money of Repair Fund deposted with N. E. Trust Co. [underlined]'>Money of Repair Fund deposted with N. E. Trust Co. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>All the money of the Repair Fund has <span class='line-break'> </span>been deposited with the New England Trust Co.<span class='line-break'> </span>In the name of athe "Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mt. Auburn in trust for their Repair Fund"<span class='line-break'> </span>at 2  1/2% Interest subject to check at call.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='General Fund Loan $30.000.[underlined]'>General Fund Loan $30.000.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The requirements of the General Fund, <span class='line-break'> </span>necessitated a loan of $30.000 which has been <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135361">
<h3><a name="page-1135361">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 119</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sept. 13. 1876 Votes given, for Loan.[underlined]'>Sept. 13. 1876 Votes given, for Loan.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>made at 4 1/2% to Int. of the N. E. Trust Co. on the notes <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation at three, for and five months<span class='line-break'> </span>$10.000 each which you are requested to confirm.</p>
<p>T. Quincy Browne<span class='line-break'> </span>of Finance Com.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accep^d action of Com ratified. [underlined]'>Report accep^d action of Com ratified. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined] : That the report be accepted and placed <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the record, and that the Board confirm the <span class='line-break'> </span>action of the Committee and ratify the making <span class='line-break'> </span>of the notes named in said report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^2^ Report Spec. Com. on Repair Fund app^d May 23. 1876. [underlined]'>^2^ Report Spec. Com. on Repair Fund app^d May 23. 1876. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne from the Special Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on the Repair Fund presented a written report, <span class='line-break'> </span>which was accepted and ordered to be placed<span class='line-break'> </span>on file, ^2.^ and as recommended therein it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Transfer of Investments Repair Fund authorized. [underlined]'>Transfer of Investments Repair Fund authorized. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined]: That the Finance Committee are <span class='line-break'> </span>hereby instructed to cause transfers to be made <span class='line-break'> </span>of all investments, except United States Bonds, <span class='line-break'> </span>now held for the Repair Fund to "The Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mt. Auburn in trust for their <span class='line-break'> </span>Repair Fund"  and to make all future invest<span class='line-break'></span>ments of said Fund in trust as above.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^3^ Com^n G. W. Gond, Report Com. on [inderlined]'>^3^ Com^n G. W. Gond, Report Com. on [inderlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow of the Committee on Lots pre<span class='line-break'></span>sented a written report in regard to the com<span class='line-break'></span>munication of George W. Bond in relation to <span class='line-break'> </span>a new Deed of Lot numbered 158 and it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted[underlined]'>accepted[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: that the report be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>placed on file. ^3.^</p>
<p>Mr. Snow of the Committee on Lots</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135362">
<h3><a name="page-1135362">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 120</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>120</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^4.^ Sup&apos;s Certif. Selection Lots [underliend]'>^4.^ Sup's Certif. Selection Lots [underliend]</span></p>
<p>reported a new form for the Superintendent's <span class='line-break'> </span>Certificate of the selection of a Lot; the report <span class='line-break'> </span>was accepted and it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New form adopted.  Fees[underlined]'>New form adopted.  Fees[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: that the new form be adopted &amp; filed ^4.^</p>
<p>The President presented a communica<span class='line-break'></span>tion from the Superintendent recommending<span class='line-break'> </span>certain fees for the use of the new Receiving <span class='line-break'> </span>Tomb;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Com. on Lots. [underlined]'>Referred to Com. on Lots. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. J. T. Bradlee the <span class='line-break'> </span>communication ws referred to the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t.[underliend]'>Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t.[underliend]</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bills and <span class='line-break'> </span>schedule of same having been submitted to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Board it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: that said Bills be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the President for his approval and payment <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^5^ Sales of land, Monthly Report[underlined]'>^5^ Sales of land, Monthly Report[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having submitted a <span class='line-break'> </span>statement of the sales of land reported by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent from July 12^th to Sept. 7^th<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='acecepted[underliend]'>acecepted[underliend]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: that said statement be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file^5^.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G. of Los #210 #265 &amp; # 1926.[underlined]'>Perp. Rep. with G. of Los #210 #265 &amp; # 1926.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots having re<span class='line-break'></span>commended the Trustees to guaranty the <span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Repair of Lot #710 [sic] Samuel Torry<span class='line-break'> </span>for $500; #2625 Heirs of James K. Frothingham</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135363">
<h3><a name="page-1135363">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 121</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>121</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sept. 13 1876 [underlined]'>Sept. 13 1876 [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='concurred in'>concurred in</span></p>
<p>for $460; and #1926 Avery Plumer for $400 it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined[: that said contracts be concurred <span class='line-break'> </span>in by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representations[underlined]'>Representations[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Upon petitions of the parties <span class='line-break'> </span>in interest representatives were designated<span class='line-break'> </span>for Lots as follows, viz:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot No. [underlined]'>Lot No. [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1457'>1457</span></p>
<p>Mrs Ianthe Martin of Baltimore, daughter of late Proprietor</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3511'>3511</span></p>
<p>" Susan B. Sturgis " Philadelphia widow "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1945'>1945</span></p>
<p>"  Eliza A. Chadler " Charlestown "   "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2749'>2749</span></p>
<p>William H. Towne  "  Boston  son  "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2000'>2000</span></p>
<p>Abraham H. Flanders  "  New YOrk  "   "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1704'>1704</span></p>
<p>Mrs. Mary F. Stevens  "  Boston  widow  "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2593'>2593</span></p>
<p>Edward W. Davis  "  New York  son  "   "   "</p>
<p>Dissolved. [underlined]   J. Harris Reed, Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. ll. 1876. [underlined]'>Oct. ll. 1876. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>October 11, 1876 [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>October 11^th at Four o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present: the President, Mess. J. T. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Browne, Choate, Perkins, Pickering<span class='line-break'> </span>and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of Sept. 13^th<span class='line-break'> </span>was read and approved.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135364">
<h3><a name="page-1135364">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 122</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>122</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. 11. 1876 [underlined] '>Oct. 11. 1876 [underlined] </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #3044 Addition to. [underlined]'>Lot #3044 Addition to. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow from the Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>reported in regard to the sale of an addition <span class='line-break'> </span>to Lot #3644 owned by Mrs. Elizabeth H. Underwood,<span class='line-break'> </span>and on his motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reconveyance of. for purpose of issuing New Deed, authorized. [underliend]'>Reconveyance of. for purpose of issuing New Deed, authorized. [underliend]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined]: that the Secretary be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>accept a re=conveyance of Lot #3644 for the pur<span class='line-break'></span>pose of issuing to the same proprietor a deed <span class='line-break'> </span>of the lot as now enlarged by Superintendents<span class='line-break'> </span>Report Oct. 5. 1876 - making such alterations <span class='line-break'> </span>in the said deed as may be necessary to pro<span class='line-break'></span>tect the corporation from any new obligations.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repair Fund Sale of Invesments. [underlined] '>Repair Fund Sale of Invesments. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne of the Committee on Finance <span class='line-break'> </span>reported verbally, that the balance of the invest<span class='line-break'></span>ments of the Repair Fund not authorized by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Eighth by-Law had been sold and the <span class='line-break'> </span>proceeds deposited in the New England <span class='line-break'> </span>Trust Co. to the credit of said Fund.</p>
<p>^6.^ Communication of Henry S. Jones, referred to President.[underlined]===</p>
<p>The President read a communication ^6.^<span class='line-break'> </span>from Mr. Henry S. Jones in relation to a head<span class='line-break'></span>stone said to have been left in charge of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Safford and on motion it was referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the President.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills, ref^d to President. [underliend]'>Monthly Bills, ref^d to President. [underliend]</span></p>
<p>The usual mothly file of Bills and <span class='line-break'> </span>Schedule of same having been laid before <span class='line-break'> </span>the board it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined]: that said bills be referred to the President <span class='line-break'> </span>for his apparoval &amp; payment by Treas. if found correct,.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135365">
<h3><a name="page-1135365">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 123</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>123</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. ll. 1876. [underlined]'>Oct. ll. 1876. [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos;r&apos;s Quart&apos;ly Statements,^15^ [underlined] '>Treas'r's Quart'ly Statements,^15^ [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's Statements ^15.^ of receipts and <span class='line-break'> </span>expenditures for the quarter ending Sept. 30^th<span class='line-break'> </span>1876, and also of the amounts due and un<span class='line-break'></span>collected for the same time having been <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted to the board it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Com. on Finance [underlined]'>Referred to Com. on Finance [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined]: that said statements ^15^ be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of land Monthly Statement, [underlined]'>Sales of land Monthly Statement, [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having submitted a <span class='line-break'> </span>Statement of the Sales of land reported by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent from Sept 7^th to Oct. 11^th<span class='line-break'> </span>and also a Statement of Sales from Jan 1^st<span class='line-break'> </span>1876 as compared with same period of 1875.<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted.[underliend]'>Accepted.[underliend]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underliend]:  that said Statement be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file. ^7.^<span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives,Lot No. [underlined]'>Representatives,Lot No. [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='694'>694</span></p>
<p>John W. Cumings of Boston,  grandson of late Proprietor</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2582'>2582</span></p>
<p>Miss Hattie E. Cleaver  "  Medford,  daughter  "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2842'>2842</span></p>
<p>Russell A. Ballou  "  Boston  son-in-law  "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4261'>4261</span></p>
<p>Joseph H. Ladd  "  Holliston  son  "  "  "</p>
<p>Dissolved. [underlined]</p>
<p>J. Harris Reed, Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135366">
<h3><a name="page-1135366">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 124</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>124</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 8. 1876. [underlined]'>Nov. 8. 1876. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>November 8. 1876. [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>November 8. at four o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. J. T. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins <span class='line-break'> </span>and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of Oct. 11. was<span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^8.^ Committee Report [underlined]'>^8.^ Committee Report [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow of the Com. on Lots to whom <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the Communication of the Superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent in regard to the Fees to be charged for <span class='line-break'> </span>the use of the new Receiving Tomb made the <span class='line-break'> </span>following Report: ^8.^</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^8.^ Fees for use of Receiving Tomb. [underlined]'>^8.^ Fees for use of Receiving Tomb. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Fees to be charged for Deposit of bodies in the <span class='line-break'> </span>Receiving Tomb and regulations relating thereto;<span class='line-break'> </span>in place of Fees heretofore charged. [underlined]</p>
<p>For each body deposited in the Receiving <span class='line-break'> </span>Tomb Twenty five dollars ($25) shall be paid in <span class='line-break'> </span>advance, the whole amount to be refunded if <span class='line-break'> </span>removed to a private lot in the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>within Ten (10) days.</p>
<p>For each body remaining in the Tomb <span class='line-break'> </span>more than three (3) months an additional <span class='line-break'> </span>charge of Four dollars ($4) for each month or<span class='line-break'> </span>part of a month thereafter will be made, but</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135367">
<h3><a name="page-1135367">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 125</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>125</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 8. 1876. [underlined]'>Nov. 8. 1876. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>any body which has remained in the Tomb for <span class='line-break'> </span>three months may[double underline] be removed by the Superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent at any time thereafter to such place <span class='line-break'> </span>within the Cemetery as the Committee on Inter<span class='line-break'></span>ments may direct.</p>
<p>The usual charge for interment &amp; record<span class='line-break'> </span>shall be made for each deposit in the Receiving <span class='line-break'> </span>Tomb and the same for removal therefrom.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='adopted.[underlined]'>adopted.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined]:  that the report be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>the Fees fixed therein be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^9.^Communication of W^m. Bertsch [underlined]'>^9.^Communication of W^m. Bertsch [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow presented a communication ^9.^<span class='line-break'> </span>from William Bertsch addressed to the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees, complaining that the Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>had refused him entrance into the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>and grossly insulted him, accusing him of <span class='line-break'> </span>staining one of the monuments, which he denied.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Special Com. [underlined]'>Referred to Special Com. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow the communication <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred to a Committee consisting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>President and Mr. Choate.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Committee. [underlined]'>Report of Committee. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Committee reported: That it appeared <span class='line-break'> </span>that Mr. Bertsch without permission of the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent, and without the consent of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietor had entered upon Lot #994 and <span class='line-break'> </span>taken an impression of the monument erected <span class='line-break'> </span>to the memory of Mrs. James Parton (Fanny Fern)-<span class='line-break'> </span>that the marble was subsequently found to be</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135368">
<h3><a name="page-1135368">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 126</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>126</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 8. 1876.'>Nov. 8. 1876.</span></p>
<p>stained, probably resulting from the taking of<span class='line-break'> </span>said impression - that although the stains have<span class='line-break'> </span>been removed the Committee have been inform<span class='line-break'></span>ed by experts, that being of an oily nature they<span class='line-break'> </span>would probably reappear - that the act of</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Wm Bertsch,'>W<sup>m</sup> Bertsch,</span></p>
<p>Mr. Bertsch in entering upon the premises<span class='line-break'> </span>without proper authority was in their opinion<span class='line-break'> </span>unjustifiable - that the Superintendent was<span class='line-break'> </span>only acting in the performance of his duty<span class='line-break'> </span>in refusing Mr. Bertsch further entrance<span class='line-break'> </span>into the Cemetery without proper authority - <span class='line-break'> </span>that they have no reason to suppose that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent used any insulting language,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that they therefore offer the following<span class='line-break'> </span>vote, which was unanimously adopted:</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: Tha the action of the Superin-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt&apos;s action approved.'>Supt's action approved.</span></p>
<p>tendent, in refusing admission to the grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mt Auburn Cemetery to William Bertsch<span class='line-break'> </span>without a permit to do work for a Proprietor<span class='line-break'> </span>or a proper pass, be approved.</p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bills and<span class='line-break'> </span>Schedule of same having been laid before the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills refd to Prest.'>Monthly Bills ref<sup>d</sup> to Prest.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the said Bills be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the President for his approval and payment<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p>The Secretary having submitted a</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="page-content">
<p>127</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 8. 1876.'>Nov. 8. 1876.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of land [monthly?] Stat&apos;mt'>Sales of land [monthly?] Stat'mt</span></p>
<p>statement of the sales reported by Superinten<span class='line-break'></span>dent from Oct. 11<sup>th</sup> to Nov. 8<sup>th</sup> and also a State<span class='line-break'></span>ment of Sales from Jan. 1<sup>st</sup> to date as compared<span class='line-break'> </span>with the same period of 1875, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted.'>accepted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Statement be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file.<sup>10.</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G. of Lot #3616.'>Perp. Rep. with G. of Lot #3616.</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual repair of<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #3616 *Sophia B. Read for $250.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='concurred in.'>concurred in.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said contract be concurred<span class='line-break'> </span>in by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot No.'>Representatives Lot No.</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of parties in interest repre<span class='line-break'></span>sentatives were designated for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='595'>595</span><span class='line-break'> </span>James Derby of Chicago Ills. son of late Proprietor</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2228'>2228</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Withrop L. Chenery " Belmont " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2238'>2238</span><span class='line-break'> </span>B. Joy Jeffries " Boston " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2992'>2992</span><span class='line-break'> </span>L. Maria Garvin (Mrs.) " Somerville daughter " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u></p>
<p>J. Harris Reed, Secretary</p>
</div>

<div id="page-1135370">
<h3><a name="page-1135370">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 128</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>128</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 13. 1876'>Dec. 13. 1876</span></p>
<p><u>December 13. 1876</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held as notified on Wednesday Dec. 13 at<span class='line-break'> </span>4 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. J.T. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>N.J. Bradlee, Brewer, Browne, Choate, Lawrence<span class='line-break'> </span>and Perkins.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of Nov. 8 was read<span class='line-break'> </span>and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Finance Renewal of $10,000 note'>Com. on Finance Renewal of $10,000 note</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne of the Com. on Finance reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that he had renewed the note of $10.000 due on<span class='line-break'> </span>the 11<sup>th</sup> inst with the N.E. Trust Co. for 3 months<span class='line-break'> </span>at 4%, and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Action ratified.'>Action ratified.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the action of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>be approved and ratified.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Prest to prepare Annual Report.'>Pres<sup>t</sup> to prepare Annual Report.</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. N.J. Bradlee it was,<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>: that the President be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to prepare the Annual Report to the Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bill refd to Prest.'>Monthly Bill ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup>.</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bills &amp; schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>of same having been laid before the Board it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that he said Bills be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the President for his approval and payment<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Treasurer if found correct</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G. Lots #1958, &amp; 1907.'>Perp. Rep. with G. Lots #1958, &amp; 1907.</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual repair of</p>
<p>Lot #<u>1958</u> Waldo Flint for $550<span class='line-break'> </span>and " <u>1907</u> *Annie L. [Wuman?] by Rufus J. King Est. for $270<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<h3><a name="page-1135371">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 129</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>129</p>

<p><u>Voted</u>: that said contracts be concurred in<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot No.'>Representatives Lot No.</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of parties in interest Repre<span class='line-break'></span>sentatives were designated for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='732'>732</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Henrietta J. Sampson of Cambridge sister of Late Prop'tr.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1701'>1701</span><span class='line-break'> </span>John Dorr " Boston son " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4307'>4307</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Lydia Ann Barker " " widow " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 10. 1877'>Jan. 10. 1877</span></p>
<p><u>January 10. 1877</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, on Wednesday Jany. 10<span class='line-break'> </span>at 4 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the Pres<sup>t</sup>, Mess. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Pickering<span class='line-break'> </span>and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of Dec. 13 was<span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition for Re-conveyance Lot #4371.'>Petition for Re-conveyance Lot #4371.</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow from the Com. on Lots presented<span class='line-break'> </span>a request for the reconveyance of Lot #4371 Mrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Lorana S. Potter for the purpose of issuing a<span class='line-break'> </span>new deed of same to the three Trustees under<span class='line-break'> </span>the will of Ira Potter, deceased, as it should<span class='line-break'> </span>have been originally issued and on motion it was,</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135372">
<h3><a name="page-1135372">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 130</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>130</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ja. 10. 1877 Recon&apos;ce authorizd'>Ja. 10. 1877 Recon'ce authoriz<sup>d</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Secretary be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to accept reconveyance of said Lot for the<span class='line-break'> </span>purpose named.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Finance Renewal of $10.000 Note'>Com. on Finance Renewal of $10.000 Note</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne of Com on Finance reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that a note of $10.000 matured on the 11<sup>th</sup> inst.,<span class='line-break'> </span>which is was necessary to renew and on motion<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='authorized.'>authorized.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Com. on Finance be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to renew said note.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on Lots on price for An Care &amp; T.D. for 1877.'>Report Com. on Lots on price for An Care &amp; T.D. for 1877.</span></p>
<p>The Chairman of the Com. on Lots Mr. Snow,<span class='line-break'> </span>after submitting a Table prepared by Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>showing the cost of labor and material in the<span class='line-break'> </span>annual care of Lots and Top Dressing, reported<span class='line-break'> </span>the prices fo rthe same for the year 1877 as fixed<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee.</p>
<p>After discussion on motion of Mr. Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. J.T. Bradlee calling for a division of the<span class='line-break'> </span>question on the prices fixed, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted.'>Accepted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the report be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>on a division of the question it was unanimously</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Prices for Top Dressing adopted.'>Prices for Top Dressing adopted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the prices for Top Dressing<span class='line-break'> </span>for the year 1877 as fixed by the Committee be<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted and recorded.</p>
<p>it was also, Mr. J.T. Bradlee voting in the negative,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Prices for Annual Care adopted.'>Prices for Annual Care adopted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the prices for the Annual care<span class='line-break'> </span>for the year 1877 as fixed by the Committee be<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted and recorded.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bill and schedule of<span class='line-break'> </span>same having been laid before the Board it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refd to Prest'>Ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the said Bills be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the President for his approval &amp; payment by Treas. if correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot No.'>Representatives Lot No.</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of parties in interest Repre<span class='line-break'></span>sentatives were designated for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='296'>296</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Miss. Ann J. Howe of Boston daughter of late Prop'tr.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1345'>1345</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Thomas Wigglesworth " " son " " "</p>
