<div id="page-1135374">
<h3><a name="page-1135374">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 132</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>132</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 24. 1877'>Jan. 24. 1877</span></p>
<p><u>January 24. 1877.</u></p>
<p>A special meeting of the Board of Trustees,<span class='line-break'> </span>as notified was held on Wednesday Jany. 24<span class='line-break'> </span>at 4 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. J.T. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>N.J. Bradlee, Brewer, Browne, Choate, Pickering<span class='line-break'> </span>and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of Jany. 10<sup>th</sup> was<span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='11. Annual Report submitted,'><sup>11.</sup> Annual Report submitted,</span></p>
<p>The President, having been authorized at<span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting of Dec. 13. 1876 to prepare the<span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Report to the Proprietors, submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>a draft of same <sup>11/</sup> and on motion it was,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted and ordered to be printed.'>Accepted and ordered to be printed.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Report was read is<span class='line-break'> </span>hereby approved and adopted as the Report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board of Trustees to the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>and ordered to be printed, the President<span class='line-break'> </span>to make such verbal alterations as he deems<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Change in Rules &amp; Regul&apos;ns Pres. author&apos;d to report to Proprietors.'>Change in Rules &amp; Regul'ns Pres. author'd to report to Proprietors.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the President be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to make to the Proprietors a verbal report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the change made in the Rules and Reg<span class='line-break'></span>ulations approved at the meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation April 12. 1875.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='12. Supt&apos;s Annual Report.'><sup>12.</sup> Supt's Annual Report.</span></p>
<p>The Annual Report <sup>12.</sup> of Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>having been submitted to the board<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135375">
<h3><a name="page-1135375">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 133</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>133</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 24. 1877 accepted.'>Jan. 24. 1877 accepted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Report be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and printed. <sup>12.</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='13. Treas&apos;s Annual Report'><sup>13.</sup> Treas's Annual Report</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne of the Com. on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted the Treasurer's Annual Report<span class='line-break'> </span>approved and certified as correct, and on<span class='line-break'> </span>motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted.'>Accepted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Report be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and printed <sup>13.</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Portion of Treas&apos; Report referred to Special Com.'>Portion of Treas' Report referred to Special Com.</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Choate it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that so much of the Treasurer's<span class='line-break'> </span>Report as relates to the Statement of the<span class='line-break'> </span>"Property of the Corporation and the Repair<span class='line-break'> </span>Fund" be referred to the President and Mr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Browne to arrange in proper form for<span class='line-break'> </span>printing.</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u> J. Harris Reed, Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135376">
<h3><a name="page-1135376">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 134</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>134</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby 14. 1877'>Feby 14. 1877</span></p>
<p><u>February 14. 1877</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>Feby. 14. at 4 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. A. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Brewer, Browne, Choate, Cotting, Lawrence,<span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Rice and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of Jany. 24 was<span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p>The President announced the names of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees electred at the annual meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors on the 5<sup>th</sup> inst. as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Names of Trustees elected Feby. 5. 1877'>Names of Trustees elected Feby. 5. 1877</span></p>
<p>Henry A. Rice}<span class='line-break'> </span>Alanson Bigelow} for the term of 6 years<span class='line-break'> </span>Charles U. Cotting " " " " 2 "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of J.M. Spelman President'>Election of J.M. Spelman President</span></p>
<p>Mr. William Perkins, having been appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>to collect &amp; count the ballots for Officers for the<span class='line-break'> </span>ensuing year, announced, that the whole<span class='line-break'> </span>number of ballots for <u>President</u> was 10.<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J.M. Spelman</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and he was declared elected</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='H.B. Mackintosh Treasurer. J. Harris Reed Secretary'>H.B. Mackintosh Treasurer. J. Harris Reed Secretary</span></p>
<p>whole number for <u>Treasurer</u> 11<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>H.B. Mackintosh</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and he was declared elected<span class='line-break'> </span>whole number for <u>Secretary</u> 11<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J. Harris Reed</u></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135377">
<h3><a name="page-1135377">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 135</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>135</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby. 14. 1877.'>Feby. 14. 1877.</span></p>
<p>and he was declared elected.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Treas. &amp; Sect&apos;y. 1877.'>Salary of Treas. &amp; Sect'y. 1877.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the salary of the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>be fixed at $2,250; and the salary of Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>at $1.500 for the ensuing year</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of W. Lovering Superintendent'>Election of W. Lovering Superintendent</span></p>
<p>The whole number of ballots for <u>Superintendent</u><span class='line-break'> </span>was 11.<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J.W. Lovering</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and he was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Supt.'>Salary of Supt.</span></p>
<p>On motion it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>: that the salary of Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>be fixed at $2.500 for the ensuing year and<span class='line-break'> </span>that he shall have the use of a house with the<span class='line-break'> </span>grounds thereto belonging, the use of a horse<span class='line-break'> </span>and vehicle, and the services of one man at<span class='line-break'> </span>the expense of the Corporation.</p>
<p>As provided in the Rules &amp; Regulations<span class='line-break'> </span>the President appointed the Standing Commit<span class='line-break'></span>tees as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Standing Committees appointed for 1877 &amp; 78.'>Standing Committees appointed for 1877 &amp; 78.</span></p>
<p><u>Standing Committees</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>1877</u> &amp; <u>1878.</u></p>
<p><u>Committee</u> on <u>Grounds.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>[The President, ex officio and<span class='line-break'> </span>[Mess. Lawrence<span class='line-break'> </span>[Choate<span class='line-break'> </span>[A. Bigelow and<span class='line-break'> </span>[Cotting<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135378">
<h3><a name="page-1135378">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 136</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>136</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby. 14. 1877.'>Feby. 14. 1877.</span></p>
<p><u>Committee</u> on <u>Lots.</u> <span class='line-break'> </span>[Mess. Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>[Perkins and<span class='line-break'> </span>[Bradlee</p>
<p><u>Committee</u> on <u>Interments.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>[Mess. Brewer and<span class='line-break'> </span>[Choate</p>
<p><u>Committee</u> on <u>Finance.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>[Mess. Browne and<span class='line-break'> </span>[Rice</p>
<p><u>Special Committee</u> on <u>Birds.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>[Mr. Brewer</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Unfinished business, Com&apos;s. continued.'>Unfinished business, Com's. continued.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Committees of last year<span class='line-break'> </span>having unfinished business be continued.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='14. Petition of E.L. Kinsley Lot #4431 about headstone'><sup>14.</sup> Petition of E.L. Kinsley Lot #4431 about headstone</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow from Com. on Lots presented<span class='line-break'> </span>the Petition of Mr. E.L. Kinsley, Proprietor of Lot<span class='line-break'> </span>#4431 situated on Stone Farm, that a headstone<span class='line-break'> </span>exceeding 2 feet 6 inches in height erected on<span class='line-break'> </span>said Lot may be allowed to remain for reasons<span class='line-break'> </span>stated in the petition on file.<sup>14.</sup></p>
<p>After the facts in the case had been stated<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Granted.'>Granted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the headstone on Lot #4431<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to in said petition be allowed to remain.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition of Heirs of'>Petition of Heirs of</span></p>
<p>The President presented the Petition of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Heirs of Leavitt Gardner that</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135379">
<h3><a name="page-1135379">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 137</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>137</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby. 14. 1877.'>Feby. 14. 1877.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Leavit Gardner Lot #3655 referred to Com. on Lots.'>Leavit Gardner Lot #3655 referred to Com. on Lots.</span></p>
<p>Mr. Pelham Bonney be appointed Representative<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lot #3655 which had been reconveyed to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation in trust by Leavit Gardner before<span class='line-break'> </span>his decease. On motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Petition be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Com. on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='15. Treasurer&apos;s Quart&apos;ly Stat&apos;me'><sup>15.</sup> Treasurer's Quart'ly Stat'me</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne from Com. on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span>reported that the Quarterly Statements of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer for 1876 had been examined and<span class='line-break'> </span>found correct and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted &amp; ordered filed.'>Accepted &amp; ordered filed.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the report be accepted and<span class='line-break'> </span>said statements placed on file.<sup>15.</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Renewal of Note $10.000'>Renewal of Note $10.000</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne also reported that he had<span class='line-break'> </span>renewed the note for $10.000 due 11<sup>th</sup> inst. with<span class='line-break'> </span>the N.E. Trust Co. for 4 months at 4 1/2%, and<span class='line-break'> </span>on motion it was,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ratified.'>Ratified.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the action of the Com. be<span class='line-break'> </span>approved and ratified.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='16. Plans for enlargement of Bridge at Rec&apos;g Tomb,'><sup>16.</sup> Plans for enlargement of Bridge at Rec'g Tomb,</span></p>
<p>The President presented a plan^16.^ and<span class='line-break'> </span>estimates prepared by Superintendent for the<span class='line-break'> </span>new Receiving Tomb and on motion of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Snow it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted &amp; work authorized'>Accepted &amp; work authorized</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Plan presented be adopted<span class='line-break'> </span>and the Committee on the Receiving Tomb con<span class='line-break'></span>sisting of the President, Mess. Bradlee &amp; Choate<span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to proceed with the work according<span class='line-break'> </span>to said plan at their discretion.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135380">
<h3><a name="page-1135380">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 138</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>138</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby. 14. 1877.'>Feby. 14. 1877.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Unpaid Bills for work on Lots,'>Unpaid Bills for work on Lots,</span></p>
<p>The President laid before the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>several outstanding Bills due from Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>and stated that the Treasurer &amp; Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>desired definite instructions as to how long a<span class='line-break'> </span>time the Corporation should continue to per<span class='line-break'></span>form work for Proprietors who neglected to<span class='line-break'> </span>pay their Bills.</p>
<p>After discussion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Com. on Finance'>Referred to Com. on Finance</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the whole subject be<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Com. on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bills and<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule of same having been laid before the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='refd to Prest.'>ref<sup>d</sup> to Prest.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Bills referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Pres<sup>t</sup> for his approval &amp; paym't by Treas. if correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G. Lots #464, 465, 466, 468, 469 &amp; 268.'>Perp. Rep. with G. Lots #464, 465, 466, 468, 469 &amp; 268.</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual repair of<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots {464, 465, 466<span class='line-break'> </span>{468, 469 William Appleton for $2.000.<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; 268. Mary S. Gerry " 350.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='concurred in.'>concurred in.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said contracts be concurred<span class='line-break'> </span>in by this board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition of Mary A. Patterson to be appointed Representative Lot #3931.'>Petition of Mary A. Patterson to be appointed Representative Lot #3931.</span></p>
<p>The Petition of Mrs. Mary A. Patterson the<span class='line-break'> </span>daughter of Jarvis Lothrop deceased Prop'tr.<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lot #3931, that she may be appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>Representative of said Lot was presented</p>
<p>Mr. Lawrence stated that he had been<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135381">
<h3><a name="page-1135381">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 139</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>139</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby. 14. 1877.'>Feby. 14. 1877.</span></p>
<p>informed that the son, (he and the petitioner<span class='line-break'> </span>being the only heirs) was not a proper person<span class='line-break'> </span>to be appointed &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representative Lot #3931 appointed.'>Representative Lot #3931 appointed.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the board of Trustees hereby<span class='line-break'> </span>appoint and designate Mrs. Mary A. Patterson<span class='line-break'> </span>Representative of Lot #3931.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lots No.'>Representatives Lots No.</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of parties in interest Repre<span class='line-break'></span>sentatives were designated for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='178'>178</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Mrs. Emma Rogers of Boston daughter of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='470'>470</span> <span class='line-break'> </span>George J. Marsh " Gloucester grandson " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='783'>783</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Henry S. Potter " Boston son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2791'>2791</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Mrs. Hepsa J. Bradlee " Medford daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4371'>4371</span><span class='line-break'> </span>" Leonora S. Potter " Boston</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u> J. Harris Reed, Secretary</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk S.S. February 15. 1877.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oath of Secretary.'>Oath of Secretary.</span></p>
<p>Personally appeared J. Harris Reed and<span class='line-break'> </span>made oath that he would faithfully discharge the<span class='line-break'> </span>duties appertaining to the office of Secretary of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Before me<span class='line-break'> </span>H.B. Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135382">
<h3><a name="page-1135382">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 140</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>140</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 14. 1877'>March 14. 1877</span></p>
<p><u>March 14. 1877.</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held as notified on Wednesday Mch. 14. at<span class='line-break'> </span>4 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present Mess. A. Bigelow, Brewer, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Perkins, Rice &amp; Snow.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p>Voted: that Mr. Choate act as Chairman<span class='line-break'> </span>in the absence of the President.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of Feby. 14 was<span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^17.^Pet. Heirs of Leavit Gardner* #3655'>^17.^Pet. Heirs of Leavit Gardner* #3655</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow from Com. on Lots reported<span class='line-break'> </span>on the Petition for the appointment of Mr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Pelham Bonney as Representative of Lot #3655<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com.'>Report Com.</span></p>
<p>The Lot referred to having been recon<span class='line-break'></span>veyed to the Corporation in trust no Represen<span class='line-break'></span>tative can be appointed On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adopted.'>Adopted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the report be accepted and<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted, and Petition filed.^17.^</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^18.^Unpaid Bills of Prop&apos;t&apos;rs. for Work.'>^18.^Unpaid Bills of Prop't'rs. for Work.</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne from the Com. on Finance,<span class='line-break'> </span>to whom the subject of the unpaid Bills of<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors was referred, presented the follow<span class='line-break'></span>ing Report:^18.^</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^18.^Report of Com.'>^18.^Report of Com.</span></p>
<p>Boston Mch. 14. 1877.<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Committee beg to report having<span class='line-break'> </span>considered the subject referred to them,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135383">
<h3><a name="page-1135383">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 141</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>141</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mch. 14. 1877.'>Mch. 14. 1877.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on Unpaid Bills'>Report Com. on Unpaid Bills</span></p>
<p>and that they find the loss to the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>very considerable through the neglect of<span class='line-break'> </span>some Proprietors, and others, to settle<span class='line-break'> </span>accounts rendered, and in order to enable<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation to furnish labor and<span class='line-break'> </span>materials at the minimum rates to those<span class='line-break'> </span>who do pay promptly, they recommend<span class='line-break'> </span>the adoption and enforcement of the<span class='line-break'> </span>following votes:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Recommend.'>Recommend.</span></p>
<p><u>1<sup>st</sup></u>:<span class='line-break'> </span>That all Bills for Labor, Materials,<span class='line-break'> </span>Fees &amp;c. are considered due on presentation,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that no orders be executed for Pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietors whose accounts remain unpaid<span class='line-break'> </span>over one year nor for Undertakers, Marble,<span class='line-break'> </span>Stone or Iron Workers, or others whose ac<span class='line-break'></span>counts remain unpaid over thirty days.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Recommend.'>Recommend.</span></p>
<p><u>2<sup>d</sup></u><span class='line-break'> </span>That the Treasurer is instructed<span class='line-break'> </span>to send notices of the above vote to all<span class='line-break'> </span>parties whose accounts are thereby over<span class='line-break'></span>due, and of the intention of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>to enforce the payment of accounts that<span class='line-break'> </span>remain unsettled one month after receipt<span class='line-break'> </span>of such notices.</p>
<p>(signed) J. Quincy Browne} Finance<span class='line-break'> </span>Henry A. Rice} Committee<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135384">
<h3><a name="page-1135384">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 142</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>142</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mch 14. 1877.'>Mch 14. 1877.</span></p>
<p>On motion it was unanimously</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted and Adopted.'>Accepted and Adopted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Report be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and the votes therein recommended be<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Clothing for Inter. Corps.'>Clothing for Inter. Corps.</span></p>
<p>A communication from the Supt. in<span class='line-break'> </span>regard to suits of clothing for the interment<span class='line-break'> </span>corps was presented, and it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said com'tn be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Interments with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^19.^Lots sold &amp; not paid for.'>^19.^Lots sold &amp; not paid for.</span></p>
<p>A List of Lots sold and unpaid,^19.^<span class='line-break'> </span>prepared by the Secretary, was presented<span class='line-break'> </span>and on motion of Mr. Snow it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Com. on Finance.'>Referred to Com. on Finance.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that it be referred to the Com.<span class='line-break'> </span>on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^20.^A. Rino-Petition to Photograph, also a ^20.^Request for Plans &amp;c from Paris,'>^20.^A. Rino-Petition to Photograph, also a ^20.^Request for Plans &amp;c from Paris,</span></p>
<p>A Petition^20.^from Mr. A. Rino for per<span class='line-break'></span>mission to take Photographs of Monuments<span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery, and also a letter^20.^ from<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Sargent referring to a letter from his<span class='line-break'> </span>friend Mons. Andre in Paris requesting<span class='line-break'> </span>plans and printed matter relating to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery were presented and on motion<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Com. on Grounds.'>Referred to Com. on Grounds.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that both communications be<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Com. on Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bills and<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule of same having been laid before<span class='line-break'> </span>the Board it was<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135385">
<h3><a name="page-1135385">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 143</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>143</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mch. 14. 1877.'>Mch. 14. 1877.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refd to Prest'>Ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the said Bills be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the President for his approval &amp; payment by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G #1819'>Perp. Rep. with G #1819</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lot <u>#1819</u> George Baird for $475.<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurred in'>Concurred in</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said contract be concurred<span class='line-break'> </span>in by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representation Lot Nos.'>Representation Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>Representatives were designated for Lots as <span class='line-break'> </span>follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='107'>107</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Epes S. Dixwell of Cambridge Nephew of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='532'>532</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Benjamin R. Curtis " " Son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1179'>1179</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Arthur Dixwell " W. Roxbury " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1428'>1428</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Joseph A. Ordway " Dorchester " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1802'>1802</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Adaline Andrews (Miss.) " Boston Daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3948'>3948</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Ezra J. Trull " " Son " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>J. Harris Reed,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135386">
<h3><a name="page-1135386">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 144</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>144</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 11. 1877'>April 11. 1877</span></p>
<p><u>April 11. 1877.</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees was held as notified<span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday April 11<sup>th</sup> at 4 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. A. Bigelow<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Brewer, Browne, Chate, Cotting,<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Perkins and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of March 14<span class='line-break'> </span>was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watering Streets'>Watering Streets</span></p>
<p>The President having called the atten<span class='line-break'></span>tion of the Board to the necessity of having<span class='line-break'> </span>the streets near the Cemetery properly<span class='line-break'> </span>watered, on motion of Mr. Choate it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to President.'>Referred to President.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the matter be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the President with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposed Map of Cemetery'>Proposed Map of Cemetery</span></p>
<p>The President having presented a<span class='line-break'> </span>plan of the Cemetery prepared by the Supt.,<span class='line-break'> </span>which it was proposed to have printed<span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose of sale to visitors it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Com on Grounds'>Referred to Com on Grounds</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the subject be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com. on Grounds with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^21.^Lot #887 McBride, Statement about,'>^21.^Lot #887 M<sup>c</sup>Bride, Statement about,</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow from Com. on Lots presented<span class='line-break'> </span>the following facts in regard to Lot #887^21.^:</p>
<p>This Lot was owned by Miss. Cecilia<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>c</sup>Bride, she and her mother have been<span class='line-break'> </span>interred therein; no other interments have<span class='line-break'> </span>been made in it; it has been for some time<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135387">
<h3><a name="page-1135387">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 145</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>145</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 11. 1877.'>April 11. 1877.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #887'>Lot #887</span></p>
<p>a neglected Lot. Miss. Sarah Parker of New<span class='line-break'> </span>York, the sole-heir-at-law of Miss. M<sup>c</sup>Bride,<span class='line-break'> </span>proposes that the Corporation take the<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot and dispose of it at their discretion,<span class='line-break'> </span>on condition that a smaller Lot under<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care is provided for said<span class='line-break'> </span>remains, and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec&apos;t&apos;y to accept Deed re-conveyance of.'>Sec't'y to accept Deed re-conveyance of.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Secretary be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to accept a Deed of re-conveyance of<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #887 for the purpose indicated above.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^22.^Lot #2282 O.G. to'>^22.^Lot #2282 O.G. to</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow from Com. on Lots presented<span class='line-break'> </span>the request^22.^ of Mr. G.H. Chickering Rep. of<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #2282 to be allowed "to give up the<span class='line-break'> </span>purchase" of 468 feet of land as Orna<span class='line-break'></span>mental Ground to said Lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement about'>Statement about</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow explained that the date of<span class='line-break'> </span>the sale of this land was May 16<sup>th</sup> 1876,<span class='line-break'> </span>that the date on which the new form of<span class='line-break'> </span>Deed requiring a deposit for the care of<span class='line-break'> </span>grass was May 17<sup>th</sup> 1876, that he understood<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. C. would be able to take the land if a<span class='line-break'> </span>deposit for the care of the grass was not<span class='line-break'> </span>required of him and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec&apos;t&apos;y to issue Deed for without deposit for P.C. of G.'>Sec't'y to issue Deed for without deposit for P.C. of G.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Secretary be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to issue a Deed without such deposit, the under<span class='line-break'></span>standing being that the Corporation is to be<span class='line-break'> </span>employed for its annual care.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135388">
<h3><a name="page-1135388">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 146</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>146</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 11. 1877'>April 11. 1877</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^20.^Petition of A. Rino'>^20.^Petition of A. Rino</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on.'>Report on.</span></p>
<p>The President for the Com. on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>to whom was referred the petition^20.^ of A. Rino<span class='line-break'> </span>to take Photographs made a verbal report,<span class='line-break'> </span>that Mr. Rino had been informed that<span class='line-break'> </span>no general^permit^ could be granted, but that<span class='line-break'> </span>a special permit would be given on the<span class='line-break'> </span>application of any Proprietor to have said<span class='line-break'> </span>Rino photograph monuments on his Lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trea&apos;s&apos; Quart&apos;ly Statements^30.^'>Trea's' Quart'ly Statements^30.^</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's statement^30.^ of receipts<span class='line-break'> </span>and expenditures for the quarter ending<span class='line-break'> </span>March 31<sup>st</sup> 1877, also of the amounts due and<span class='line-break'> </span>uncollected for the same period having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Com. on Finance'>Referred to Com. on Finance</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said statements be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com. on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bills and<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule of same having been laid before<span class='line-break'> </span>the Board it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to President'>Referred to President</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Bills be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Pres<sup>t</sup> for his approval and payment<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Treas. if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G Lots #1776 4215 &amp; 16 818'>Perp. Rep. with G Lots #1776 4215 &amp; 16 818</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots as follows:<span class='line-break'> </span><u>#1776</u> Mary J. Aldrich for $650<span class='line-break'> </span><u>4215 &amp; 16</u> John C. Bucknam " 2.500<span class='line-break'> </span><u>818</u> Emma Fagnani " 425<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135389">
<h3><a name="page-1135389">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 147</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>147</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 11. 1877'>April 11. 1877</span></p>
<p>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurred in'>Concurred in</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said contracts be concurred<span class='line-break'> </span>in by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'>Representatives Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>Representatives were designated for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='134 &amp; 149'>134 &amp; 149</span><span class='line-break'> </span>John A. Buckingham of Newton son of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='561'>561</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Edward E. Lovejoy " Boston " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='813'>813</span></p>
<p>Flavel C. Stratton " Cambridgep't " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1102'>1102</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Charles U. Cotting " Boston Extr. " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1137'>1137</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Charles H. Dalton " " son in law " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1452'>1452</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Allen A. Brown " " " son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1724'>1724</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Ellen M. Baker " " Widow " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1992'>1992</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Hannah H. Drew " " " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1824 &amp; 2856'>1824 &amp; 2856</span><span class='line-break'> </span>William E. Carleton " " son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1848'>1848</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Deborah S. Gore " " Widow " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2041'>2041</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A. Lawrence Edmands " " son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2201'>2201</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Walter J. Bent " Cambridge</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2365'>2365</span><span class='line-break'> </span>William C. Newell " Albany N.Y. Grandson " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2564'>2564</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Anna L. Bradshaw " Orange N.J. Widow " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2598'>2598</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Christine Noll " E Boston " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3270'>3270</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Eliza B. Craft " Cambridge " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3357'>3357</span><span class='line-break'> </span>William H. Blood " Auburndale son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3538'>3538</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Laura L. Rudolphsen " Boston Widow " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3784'>3784</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Caroline J. Abbot " Cambridge " " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u> J. Harris Reed, Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135390">
<h3><a name="page-1135390">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 148</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>148</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 9. 1877'>May 9. 1877</span></p>
<p><u>May 9. 1877.</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>May 9. 1877 at 4 o'clk P.M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. A. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Browne, Choate, Perkins &amp; Rice.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of April 11<span class='line-break'> </span>was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition of^24^ Heirs of Dalphon Osborn Lot #1854'>Petition of^24^ Heirs of Dalphon Osborn Lot #1854</span></p>
<p>The President presented the Petition^24^<span class='line-break'> </span>of several of the heirs of the late Dalphon<span class='line-break'> </span>Osborn, who was the Proprietor of Lot #1854,<span class='line-break'> </span>requesting permission to inter in said Lot<span class='line-break'> </span>the remains of James D. Osborn son of said<span class='line-break'> </span>Dalphon Osborn, stating that Eldorado<span class='line-break'> </span>Osborn who is the Representative refused<span class='line-break'> </span>to sign the order for interment, &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Special Com.'>Referred to Special Com.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the above Petition be<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to a special Committee consisting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Com. on Lots and Mr. Choate.</p>
<p>The attention of the Board having been<span class='line-break'> </span>called to the subject it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Decoration Day.'>Decoration Day.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that all matters relating to<span class='line-break'> </span>Decoration Day be referred to the President<span class='line-break'> </span>with full powers.</p>
<p>Mr. Perkins from Com. on Lots stated<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Heirs of Thomas Wigglesworth, deceased,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135391">
<h3><a name="page-1135391">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 149</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>149</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mauy 9. 1877'>Mauy 9. 1877</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Addition to Lot #1345'>Addition to Lot #1345</span></p>
<p>Proprietor of Lot #1345 has recently purchased<span class='line-break'> </span>an addition to said Lot - that the following<span class='line-break'> </span>vote was adopted April 26. 1876 "that no<span class='line-break'> </span>further sales of land be made in any part<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery without a suitable deposit,<span class='line-break'> </span>in addition to the price of the land, for<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual care of the grass thereon" -<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Com. do not wish to require a<span class='line-break'> </span>a deposit in this case, &amp; therefore on his<span class='line-break'> </span>motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary to issue Deed without deposit for P.C. of G.'>Secretary to issue Deed without deposit for P.C. of G.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Sec't'y be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to issue a Deed fo rthe addition to Lot<span class='line-break'> </span>#1345 without a deposit for "the care of the<span class='line-break'> </span>sodding and turfing."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Exchange Lot #4455 for Lot #4483,'>Exchange Lot #4455 for Lot #4483,</span></p>
<p>Mr Perkins also stated that Mrs. Louisa<span class='line-break'> </span>M. Simmons Proprietor of Lot #4455 wished<span class='line-break'> </span>to exchange said Lot for a new Lot #4483<span class='line-break'> </span>paying the difference of price in cash, and<span class='line-break'> </span>on his motion is was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Re-conveyance authorized.'>Re-conveyance authorized.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Sec't'y be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to receive a Deed of re-conveyance of Lot<span class='line-break'> </span>#4455 for the above purpose.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills referred to Prest.'>Monthly Bills referred to Pres<sup>t</sup>.</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bills and<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule of same having been laid before the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Bills be referred to Prest.<span class='line-break'> </span>for approval &amp; payment by Treas. if found correct</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135392">
<h3><a name="page-1135392">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 150</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>150</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 9. 1877'>May 9. 1877</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='^23.^ Monthly statement Sales of Land'>^23.^ Monthly statement Sales of Land</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having submitted Statement<span class='line-break'> </span>of sales of Land reported by Supt. from<span class='line-break'> </span>April 12<sup>th</sup> to May 3<sup>d</sup> &amp; approved by Com. on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted &amp; filed.'>accepted &amp; filed.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Statement be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file.^23.^</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G.'>Perp. Rep. with G.</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual repair of<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#3239'>#3239</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>#3239</u> Fred. E. Weber for $225.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4401'>4401</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>4401</u> Betsey Freeman " 475.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3079'>3079</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>3079</u> *Reuben S. Wade " 900.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurred in'>Concurred in</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said contracts be concurred<span class='line-break'> </span>in by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'>Representatives Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>Representatives were designated for Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2'>2</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Thomas J. Homer of Boston Son-in-law of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='818'>818</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Charles P. Fagnani " New York Grandson " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='991'>991</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Thomas J. Homer " Boston Brother " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1078'>1078</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Edward A. Holman " " Grandson " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1357'>1357</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Frank W. Andrews " " Guardian of Grandchildren} " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2835'>2835</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Warren G. Fletcher " " Son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3468'>3468</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Henry D. Austin " Wakefield Guardian of only child} " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u> J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135393">
<h3><a name="page-1135393">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 151</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>151</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 13. 1877'>June 13. 1877</span></p>
<p><u>June 13. 1877.</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>June 13. 1877 at 4 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. A. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Brewer, Cotting, Lawrence, Rice and<span class='line-break'> </span>Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the meeting of May 9<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Special Com. ^4.^on Petition Heirs of D. Osborn Lot #1854 ^24.^ report &amp;'>Special Com. ^4.^on Petition Heirs of D. Osborn Lot #1854 ^24.^ report &amp;</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow, from the special Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to whom was referred the Petition^24.^of a major<span class='line-break'></span>ity of the Heirs of the late Dalphon Osborn,<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietor of Lot #1854, presented a written<span class='line-break'> </span>report^24.^recommending,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='recommend'>recommend</span></p>
<p>"that the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>be instructed to permit the interment of<span class='line-break'> </span>the body of James D. Osborn in Lot 1854<span class='line-break'> </span>upon presentation of an order signed by<span class='line-break'> </span>a major part of the aforesaid owners of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Lot, and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted &amp; adopted.'>accepted &amp; adopted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Report be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and the recommendation therein adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comn Supt. Fee Int&apos;mt children, Referred to Com. on Int&apos;m&apos;ts'>Com<sup>n</sup> Supt. Fee Int'mt children, Referred to Com. on Int'm'ts</span></p>
<p>The President presented a Communi<span class='line-break'></span>cation from the Superintendent in regard<span class='line-break'> </span>to the fee charged for interment of children.^25.^</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Com<sup>n</sup> be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Interments.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135394">
<h3><a name="page-1135394">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 152</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>152</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 13, 1877 [underlined]'>June 13, 1877 [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com^n Supt. ^26^ Repair of Greenhouse[underlined]'>Com^n Supt. ^26^ Repair of Greenhouse[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President presented a Com^n from <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent in relation to the repair<span class='line-break'> </span>needed on Greenhouses ^26^ and on motion it <span class='line-break'> </span>was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref^d Com. on Lots. [underlined]'>Ref^d Com. on Lots. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That said Com^n. be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com. on Lots to consider and report.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr Snow of the Com. on Lots  it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary to issue Deed without deposit P.C. of G for Addt^n to #3870.[underlined]'>Secretary to issue Deed without deposit P.C. of G for Addt^n to #3870.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That the Secretary be au<span class='line-break'></span>thorized to issue a Deed for the Addition <span class='line-break'> </span>to Lot #3870 (recently purchased by Lewis <span class='line-break'> </span>Putnam) without a deposit for the care<span class='line-break'> </span>of the sodding and turfing.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow, he having <span class='line-break'> </span>explained the reasons therefor, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Permission granted to erect Headstone Lots #4491 &amp; 92 [underlined]'>Permission granted to erect Headstone Lots #4491 &amp; 92 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: that permission be granted <span class='line-break'> </span>to erect headstones exceeding 2 feet 6 inches <span class='line-break'> </span>in height on Lots #4491 &amp; 4492 owned <span class='line-break'> </span>respectively by Mrs. Foster and the Heirs <span class='line-break'> </span>of W. N. Tyler.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Change of grade Lot #4391 D. N. Skillings. [underlined]'>Change of grade Lot #4391 D. N. Skillings. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The question of the change of the grade of Lot #4391 purchased by Mr. <span class='line-break'> </span>D. N. Skillings having been brought to the <span class='line-break'> </span>attention of the board, after discussion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Special Com. [underlined]'>Referred to Special Com. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]:  That the subject be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>a special Committee consisting of Messrs Rice,<span class='line-break'> </span>Cotting &amp; A. Bigelow to investigate &amp; report.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135395">

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 13. 1877'>June 13. 1877</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills and the<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule of same having been submitted to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Board, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refd to Prest'>Ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Bills be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the President for his approval &amp; payment<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Stat&apos;mt^27.^ Sales of Land'>Monthly Stat'mt^27.^ Sales of Land</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having submitted a<span class='line-break'> </span>Statement of the Sales of Land^27.^ reported<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Supt. from May 10<sup>th</sup> to June 13<sup>th</sup> and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved by the Com on Lots it was</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G.'>Perp. Rep. with G.</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>the Perpetual Repair with guaranty of<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#1402'>#1402</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>1402</u> Mary Haynes for $275.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='524'>524</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>524</u> *W<sup>m</sup> J. Loving " 600.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3270.'>3270.</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>3270</u> *W<sup>m</sup> B. Craft " 750.</p>

<div id="page-1135397">
<h3><a name="page-1135397">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 155</a></h3>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 11. 1877. Report of Com. Fee Int. of Children accepted &amp; adopted.^25.^ [underlined]'>July 11. 1877. Report of Com. Fee Int. of Children accepted &amp; adopted.^25.^ [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Brewer of the Com on Interments pre<span class='line-break'></span>sented a written report ^25.^ reconsidering that the <span class='line-break'> </span>Fee for the Interment of children should here<span class='line-break'></span>after be four dollars ($4.) and on motion it was</p>
<p>Voted:[underlined]:  That the Report be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and the recommendation therein be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com on Repair of Greenhouses.^26^[underlined]'>Report of Com on Repair of Greenhouses.^26^[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow of the Com. on Lots made a <span class='line-break'> </span>report on the Superintendent's communication ^.26^<span class='line-break'> </span>in regard to the repair of the Greenhouses <span class='line-break'> </span>and on his motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Recommen&apos;tn expend $500 adopted.[underlined]'>Recommen'tn expend $500 adopted.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]:  That the Superintendent be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to make the necessary repairs to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Greenhouses at an expense not exceeding <span class='line-break'> </span>Five hundred dollars ($500).</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Spec. Com on Skillings Lot ask for further time [underlined]'>Spec. Com on Skillings Lot ask for further time [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Rice from the Special Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>appointed to investigate and report in <span class='line-break'> </span>regard to the grade of Lot #4391 purchased <span class='line-break'> </span>by Mr. D. N. Skillings asked further time for <span class='line-break'> </span>consideration and on motion of Mr. Perkins <span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='granted.[underlined]'>granted.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That further time be granted to said committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Re-conveyance authorized Lots: 2120 &amp; 3943 [underlined]'>Re-conveyance authorized Lots: 2120 &amp; 3943 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow of Com. on Lots having stated <span class='line-break'> </span>the reasons therefore on his motion it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That the Secretary be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to accept deeds of re-conveyance of Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>numbered 2120 and 3943 purchased by</p>
</div>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Com. on Finance. [underlined]'>Referred to Com. on Finance. [underlined]</span></p>

<div id="page-1135401">

<p>October 10. 1877[underlined]</p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees was held as notified on Wed<span class='line-break'></span>nesday October 10. 1877 at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, Mess. A. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins and <span class='line-break'> </span>Rice.</p>
<p>The Records of the meetings of July 11^th,<span class='line-break'> </span>August 8^th and Sept. 12 were read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Spec. Com. on Skilling&apos;s Lot on request [underlined]'>Spec. Com. on Skilling's Lot on request [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Special Copmmittee, to whom was <span class='line-break'> </span>referred the subject of the change of grade of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #4391 purchased by D. N. Skillings, asked <span class='line-break'> </span>to be discharged as the matter had been <span class='line-break'> </span>settled and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='discharged.[underlined]'>discharged.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That said Com. be discharged <span class='line-break'> </span>from further consideration of the subject.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Expiration of Lease of offices 16 Pemb. Sq. Referred to President. [underlined]'>Expiration of Lease of offices 16 Pemb. Sq. Referred to President. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President having called the attention <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board to the fact that the Lease of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Offices No. 16 Pemerton Square expired<span class='line-break'> </span>Jan'y. 1. 1878 it was</p>
<p>Voted[underliend]:  That the matter be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the President with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos;s Quarterly Statements ^30^ Referred to Finance Com.[underlined]'>Treas's Quarterly Statements ^30^ Referred to Finance Com.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer' Statements ^30^ of receipts <span class='line-break'> </span>and expenditures for the quarter end'g Sept 30^th<span class='line-break'> </span>and of amounts due &amp; uncollected were presented &amp; it was</p>
<p>Voted[underliend]:  That said Statements be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com. on Finance.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Statement^29.^ be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to President.'>Referred to President.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Bills be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Pres<sup>t</sup>. for his approval &amp; payment by Treas.<span class='line-break'> </span>if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G.'>Perp. Rep. with G.</span></p>

<p>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurred in.'>Concurred in.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Contracts be concurred<span class='line-break'> </span>in.</p>

<p>Upon petition of parties in interest Rep<span class='line-break'></span>resentatives were designated for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot Nos. 19'>Lot Nos. 19</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Louisa R. Southwick of Middlebury [St?]. widow of D.P.</p>

<div class="page-content">
<p>162</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. 10. 1877'>Oct. 10. 1877</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3631'>3631</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Emeline Rolfe of Boston widow of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3901'>3901</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Ruth C. Stinson " " niece " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4145'>4145</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A. Ward Samson " " " " "</p>
