<p><u>Dissolved.</u> J. Harris Reed, Sec't'y</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. 17. 1877.'>Oct. 17. 1877.</span></p>
<p><u>October 17. 1877.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Special Meeting at Cemetery'>Special Meeting at Cemetery</span></p>
<p>A <u>special meeting</u> of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, at the Cemetery on Wed<span class='line-break'></span>nesday October 17 at 3 1/4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, Mess. A. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins,<span class='line-break'> </span>Rice and Snow.</p>
<p>After inspecting certain parts of the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery <u>adjourned</u> to meet at same hour and<span class='line-break'> </span>place on Wednesday October 24<sup>th</sup>.</p>
<p>J. Harris Reed,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135405">
<h3><a name="page-1135405">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 163</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>163</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct 24. 1877.'>Oct 24. 1877.</span></p>
<p><u>October 24 1877.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjourned Special Meeting at Cemetery'>Adjourned Special Meeting at Cemetery</span></p>
<p>An adjourned <u>special meeting</u> of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees was notified to be held at<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery on Wednesday October 24<sup>th</sup> at<span class='line-break'> </span>3 1/4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, Mess. Brewer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Rice and Snow.</p>
<p>The members present completed the<span class='line-break'> </span>inspection of the Cemetery and the meeting</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>J. Harris Reed, Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 14 1877.'>Nov. 14 1877.</span></p>
<p><u>November 14. 1877</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>November 14 at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. A. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Rice and<span class='line-break'> </span>Snow.</p>
<p>The Records of the regular meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>October 10<sup>th</sup> &amp; the special meetings of Oct. 17<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>and 24<sup>th</sup> were read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Quarterly Statements^30.^ Mch. June &amp; Sept. 1878'>Treasurer's Quarterly Statements^30.^ Mch. June &amp; Sept. 1878</span></p>
<p>Mr. Rice of Com. on Finance reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Treasurer's Statements^30.^ for the quarters <span class='line-break'> </span>ending March 31. June 30 and Sept. 30. 1877</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135406">
<h3><a name="page-1135406">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 164</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>164</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 14. 1877'>Nov. 14. 1877</span></p>
<p>had been examined and found correct, and<span class='line-break'> </span>on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='reported correct acceptd &amp; order filed^30.^'>reported correct accept<sup>d</sup> &amp; order filed^30.^</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the report be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and said Statements^30.^ be placed on file.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Grounds to report on Improvement Fountain Av. Bank.'>Com. on Grounds to report on Improvement Fountain Av. Bank.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Com. on Grounds consider<span class='line-break'> </span>and report at the next meeting on the ex<span class='line-break'></span>pediency of improving the bank on Fountain<span class='line-break'> </span>Avenue north of Indian Ridge Path.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Choate it was,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Extending Landscape Lawn Plan Com. on Grounds to report on.'>Extending Landscape Lawn Plan Com. on Grounds to report on.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Com. on Grounds consider<span class='line-break'> </span>and report on the expediency of extending the<span class='line-break'> </span>"Landscape Lawn Plan" to the whole or any<span class='line-break'> </span>portion of the remaining part of "Stone Farm"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bills and<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule of same having been submitted, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refd to Prest'>Ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Bills be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Pres<sup>t</sup> for his approval &amp; payment by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treas. if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statem&apos;t^31.^ Sales Land'>Monthly Statem't^31.^ Sales Land</span></p>
<p>The Sec't'y presented a Statement^31.^ of<span class='line-break'> </span>Sales of land reported by the Supt. &amp; approved by<span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Lots from Oct. 10<sup>th</sup> to Nov. 14 &amp; it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted and ordd filed.'>Accepted and ord<sup>d</sup> filed.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Statement be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file. ^31.^</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G.'>Perp. Rep. with G.</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended the<span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Repair with guaranty of Lots</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#249'>#249</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>#249</u> *Thirza L. Tilton for $425</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3630.'>3630.</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>3630</u> *John C. Bundy " 325 it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135407">
<h3><a name="page-1135407">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 165</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>165</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 14. 1877.'>Nov. 14. 1877.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='concurred in Representatives Lot Nos.'>concurred in Representatives Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Contracts be concurred in.</p>
<p>Upon Petition of parties in interest Represen<span class='line-break'></span>tative were designated for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='110'>110</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Edw<sup>d</sup> C. Richardson of Savannah Ga Grandson of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='315'>315</span><span class='line-break'> </span>William F. Davis " Boston Son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='985'>985</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Lydia H. Cutler " Cambridge Widow " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1120 &amp; 1488'>1120 &amp; 1488</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Waldo Adams " Boston Son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1403'>1403</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Frances K. Harris " do. Grand-daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2231'>2231</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Edward Copeland " do Son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2348'>2348</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Charles P. Horton " do " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2366'>2366</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Charles E. Leighton " Portland Me " " " "</p>
<p>In regard to the appointment of Mr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Charles E. Leighton above, the Sec't'y stated<span class='line-break'> </span>verbally the facts as on file with the Petition.</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>J. Harris Reed,<span class='line-break'> </span>Sec't'y.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 12. 1877.'>Dec. 12. 1877.</span></p>
<p><u>December 12. 1877.</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>Dec. 12 at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present: the Pres<sup>t</sup> Mess. Brewer, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Perkins &amp; Rice.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135408">
<h3><a name="page-1135408">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 166</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>166</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 12. 1877.'>Dec. 12. 1877.</span></p>
<p>Records of the meeting of Nov. 14 were<span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Improvement Fountain Av. Bank'>Improvement Fountain Av. Bank</span></p>
<p>The President for the Com. on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>to whom was referred the subject of the ex<span class='line-break'></span>pediency of improving the bank on Fountain<span class='line-break'> </span>Avenue north of Indian Ridge Path reported<span class='line-break'> </span>verbally:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on by Committee on Grounds.'>Report on by Committee on Grounds.</span></p>
<p>That the Committee had visited the<span class='line-break'> </span>locality and carefully examined a plan for<span class='line-break'> </span>the improvement prepared by the Supt., while<span class='line-break'> </span>they had decided to recommend for adoption<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; which plan^32.^ they submitted - the prominent<span class='line-break'> </span>feature of this was the laying out of a path</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Plan for ^32.^ improvement.'>Plan for ^32.^ improvement.</span></p>
<p>from between Lots #4305 &amp; 1530 on Indian Ridge<span class='line-break'> </span>Path down the slope of the bank by a gradual<span class='line-break'> </span>grade to Fountain Avenue passing between<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots #3708 &amp; 3710 on said Avenue the lines of<span class='line-break'> </span>the grading conforming naturally &amp; easily<span class='line-break'> </span>to the path.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Expense of, '>Expense of, </span></p>
<p>That the expense outside of rough grading,<span class='line-break'> </span>which would be done during the winter by the<span class='line-break'> </span>regular force of men &amp; horses without any addition<span class='line-break'></span>al expense, would not probably exceed $900. -<span class='line-break'> </span>that by adopting this plan four (4) new small<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots could be laid out in the rear of those<span class='line-break'> </span>fronting on Fountain Avenue, ranging from<span class='line-break'> </span>240 to 330 square feet, which when disposed</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135409">
<h3><a name="page-1135409">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 167</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>167</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 12. 1877.'>Dec. 12. 1877.</span></p>
<p>of would probably defray the cost of the whole<span class='line-break'> </span>improvement.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted &amp; work ordered to be done.'>Report accepted &amp; work ordered to be done.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Report be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>the plan^32.^ therein referred to adopted, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>Supt. be directed to forthwith commence and<span class='line-break'> </span>complete the improvement under the direc<span class='line-break'></span>tion of the Com. on Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Extending &apos;Landscape Lawn&apos; system'>Extending 'Landscape Lawn' system</span></p>
<p>The President in behalf of the Com. on<span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds to whom was referred the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>of the expediency of extending the "Landscape<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawn" system to all or any postion of the re<span class='line-break'></span>maining part of the "Stone Farm" reported<span class='line-break'> </span>verbally</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on by Committee on Grounds'>Report on by Committee on Grounds</span></p>
<p>That they were convinced of the expe<span class='line-break'></span>diency of such extension and recommend that<span class='line-break'> </span>the "Landscape Lawn" system be extended so<span class='line-break'> </span>as to embrace not only all of the "Stone Farm"<span class='line-break'> </span>so called, but also that portion of the old<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery lying Southerly &amp; Easterly of Mag<span class='line-break'></span>nolia Avenue.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Choate it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted, action deferred.'>Report accepted, action deferred.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the report be accepted.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that as several members of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board were absent, the report be laid on the<span class='line-break'> </span>table for future action.</p>
<p>Mr. Browne from the Com. on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135410">
<h3><a name="page-1135410">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 168</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>168</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 12. 1877.'>Dec. 12. 1877.</span></p>
<p>to whom was referred the subject of Lots sold<span class='line-break'> </span>and not paid for"^19.^ reported</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Finance on &apos;Lots sold &amp; not paid&apos;.'>Report of Com. on Finance on 'Lots sold &amp; not paid'.</span></p>
<p>That most of the cases had been<span class='line-break'> </span>settled or were in course of settlement -<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Com. recommended, that the two cases<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots #4090 &amp; 4116, respectively purchased by<span class='line-break'> </span>Mrs. E. Dexter Dyer &amp; Mrs. Samuel A. Hanscom,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots #4090 &amp; 4116 Recommendation concerning.'>Lots #4090 &amp; 4116 Recommendation concerning.</span></p>
<p>and for whom one interment in each Lot had<span class='line-break'> </span>been made be referred to Com. on Interments<span class='line-break'> </span>to instruct the Supt. if they should see fit, to<span class='line-break'> </span>remove the remains and resell the Lots.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted Recommend&apos;n adopted.'>Report accepted Recommend'n adopted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the report be accepted &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>the reference recommended be made to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Interments.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Prices for Annual Care &amp; Top Dressing for 1878^33.^ Reduction of 25 cents recommended.'>Prices for Annual Care &amp; Top Dressing for 1878^33.^ Reduction of 25 cents recommended.</span></p>
<p>Mr. Perkins for the Com. on Lots presented<span class='line-break'> </span>a table^33.^ prepared by the Supt. [shining?] the<span class='line-break'> </span>amount expended for the Annual Care and<span class='line-break'> </span>Top Dressing of Lots - the receipts for the same<span class='line-break'> </span>and the profil thereon - &amp; the Com. recommend<span class='line-break'> </span>a reduction from the prices fixed for the year<span class='line-break'> </span>1877 of 25 cts. on each Lot for both Annual<span class='line-break'> </span>Care &amp; Top Dressing for the year 1878.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Recommendation adopted.'>Recommendation adopted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the recommendation of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Com. reducing the prices for the year 1878 25 cts.<span class='line-break'> </span>from the prices for the year 1877 be adopted.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135411">
<h3><a name="page-1135411">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 169</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>169</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 12. 1877.'>Dec. 12. 1877.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lease of Office 6 Pemb. Sq. Report of Prest on.'>Lease of Office 6 Pemb. Sq. Report of Pres<sup>t</sup> on.</span></p>
<p>The President, to whom was referred with full<span class='line-break'> </span>powers the matter of the renewal of the Lease<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Office No. 16 Pemberton Square, reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that he had arranged for a Lease of the<span class='line-break'> </span>present Office for the term of Five years from<span class='line-break'> </span>Jan. 1. 1878 at an annual Rent of $600 <u>net</u>,<span class='line-break'> </span>the present safe to the enlarged by connecting<span class='line-break'> </span>and adding to it the safe heretofore connected<span class='line-break'> </span>with the adjoining room.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Report Prest authorized to prepare.'>Annual Report Pres<sup>t</sup> authorized to prepare.</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Choate it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the President be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to prepare the annual Report of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills refd to Prest'>Monthly Bills ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bills having been<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the said Bills be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the President for his approval &amp; payment by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statm&apos;t^34.^ Sales Land'>Monthly Statm't^34.^ Sales Land</span></p>
<p>The Sec't'y presented a Statement^34.^ of Sales of<span class='line-break'> </span>Land made by Supt. &amp; approved by Com. on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>from Nov 14<sup>th</sup> to Dec 12 &amp; it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted.'>accepted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Statement be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P.C. with G. #4524'>P.C. with G. #4524</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended the<span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Repair with guaranty of the marble on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #4524 Mrs. J.W. Hyde for $50. it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurred in.'>Concurred in.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Contract be concurred in.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135412">
<h3><a name="page-1135412">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 170</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>170</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 12. 1877.'>Dec. 12. 1877.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'>Representatives Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>Representatives were designated for Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='182'>182</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Francis Boyd of Hyde Park son of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='517'>517</span><span class='line-break'> </span>J. Rogers Rich " Boston " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1141'>1141</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Edmund Quincy " " grand" " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1794'>1794</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Alexander M. Smith " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3156'>3156</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Edwin R. Horn " " son of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3508'>3508</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Martha G. Blake " Chelsea daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3750'>3750</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Sophia Jackman " Boston</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4347'>4347</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Charles P. Shelton " son of D.P.</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u> J. Harris Reed, Secty.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135413">
<h3><a name="page-1135413">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 171</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>171</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dan. 9. 1878.'>Dan. 9. 1878.</span></p>
<p><u>January 9. 1878.</u></p>
<p>Monthly meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, on Wednesday Jan. 9<span class='line-break'> </span>at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the Pres<sup>t</sup> Mess. A. Bigelow, Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Cotting, Perkins, Rice and Snow.</p>
<p>The Records of the meeting of Dec. 12<span class='line-break'> </span>were read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos;s Annual Report^35.^ Referred to Com. on Finance'>Treas's Annual Report^35.^ Referred to Com. on Finance</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's Annual Report^35.^ for the<span class='line-break'> </span>year 1877 was presented &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Report be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statm&apos;t^36^ Sales Land - also Sales for 1877.^37.^'>Monthly Statm't^36^ Sales Land - also Sales for 1877.^37.^</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement^36.^ of<span class='line-break'> </span>Sales of Land reported by Supt. &amp; approved<span class='line-break'> </span>by Com. on Lots from Dec. 12^1877^ to Jan. 9. 1878.,<span class='line-break'> </span>and also a Statement^37^ of Sales reported by<span class='line-break'> </span>Supt. &amp; the payments for the same for the<span class='line-break'> </span>year 1877. &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted &amp; ordd filed'>Accepted &amp; ord<sup>d</sup> filed</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Statements^36 &amp; 37.^ be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of Bills &amp; schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>of same having been submitted it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refd to Prest.'>Ref<sup>d</sup> to Prest.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Bills be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Pres<sup>t</sup> for his approval &amp; payment if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representative Lot Nos.'>Representative Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>On petition of parties in interest Representatives<span class='line-break'> </span>were appointed for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='853'>853</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Clarissa N. Walker of Watertown widow of D.P.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135414">
<h3><a name="page-1135414">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 172</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>172</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 9. 1878.'>Jan. 9. 1878.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1912'>1912</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Frances W. Cushing of Brookline daughter of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2241'>2241</span><span class='line-break'> </span>James M. Ballard " Boston son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2460'>2460</span><span class='line-break'> </span>J. Augusta Palmer " " daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2490'>2490</span><span class='line-break'> </span>N. James Deblois " Mobile Ala Nephew " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4253'>4253</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Mary W. Allen " Cambridge daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4433'>4433</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Eliza J. Marshall " Boston</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>J. Harris Reed, Secty.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 15. 1878.'>Jan. 15. 1878.</span></p>
<p><u>January 15. 1878.</u></p>
<p>A special meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held as notified on Tuesday January 15.<span class='line-break'> </span>at 3 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the Pres<sup>t</sup>, Mess. A. Bigelow, Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Choate, Perkins, Rice and Snow.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President submits Annual Report^38.^'>President submits Annual Report^38.^</span></p>
<p>The President, having been authorized at<span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting of Dec. 12 1877 to prepare the Annual<span class='line-break'> </span>Report of the Board of Trustees to the Proprietors,<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted said Report^38^ &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted &amp; ordered to be printed.'>accepted &amp; ordered to be printed.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Annual Report as read<span class='line-break'> </span>is hereby approved and adopted as the Report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board of Trustees to the Proprietors and<span class='line-break'> </span>and ordered to be printed, the President to make<span class='line-break'> </span>such verbal alterations as he deems necessary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135415">
<h3><a name="page-1135415">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 173</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>173</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 15. 1878.'>Jan. 15. 1878.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appendix^39.^ explaining Perpetual Repair adopted and orderd printed.'>Appendix^39.^ explaining Perpetual Repair adopted and order<sup>d</sup> printed.</span></p>
<p>The President submitted an explanation^39.^<span class='line-break'> </span>of the different modes of providing for the<span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Repair of Lots prepared by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary as an Appendix to the Annual Report<span class='line-break'> </span>and it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said paper^39.^ be adopted and<span class='line-break'> </span>printed as an Appendix to the Report.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Changes in Rules &amp; Reg&apos;ns to be reported to Proptr&apos;s'>Changes in Rules &amp; Reg'ns to be reported to Proptr's</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the President be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to make to the Proprietors a verbal report<span class='line-break'> </span>of teh changes made in the Rules &amp; Regula<span class='line-break'></span>tions approved at the meeting of the Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion held April 12. 1875.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt&apos;s Annual Report^40^ accepted, ordd printed.'>Supt's Annual Report^40^ accepted, ord<sup>d</sup> printed.</span></p>
<p>The Annual Report^40.^ of the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>having been submitted it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Report^40.^ be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos;s Annual Report^35.^ accepted and ordd printed.'>Treas's Annual Report^35.^ accepted and ord<sup>d</sup> printed.</span></p>
<p>Mr. Rice of the Com. on Finance having sub<span class='line-break'></span>mitted the Annual Report^35.^ of the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>approved &amp; certified as correct it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Report^35.^ be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and printed.</p>
<p>Records of Meeting Jany. 9. read and approved.,<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Dissolved</u></p>
<p>J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135416">
<h3><a name="page-1135416">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 174</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>174</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby 13. 1878.'>Feby 13. 1878.</span></p>
<p><u>February 13. 1878.</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>Feby. 13. at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, Mess. A. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Brewer, Browne, Choate, Lawrence and<span class='line-break'> </span>Rice.</p>
<p>The Record of the special meeting of Jany. 15<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Names of Trustees elected at Annual Meeting'>Names of Trustees elected at Annual Meeting</span></p>
<p>The President announced the names of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees elected at the annual meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors Feby. 4<sup>th</sup> as follows:</p>
<p>Mr. Charles F. Choate} for the term of<span class='line-break'> </span>Edward Lawrence} Six (6) years.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of J.M. Spelman President'>Election of J.M. Spelman President</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne having been appointed to<span class='line-break'> </span>collect and count the Ballots for Officers fo rthe<span class='line-break'> </span>ensuing year announced that the whole number<span class='line-break'> </span>for <u>President</u> was <u>6</u></p>
<p>all of which were for <u>J. M. Spelman</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and he was declared elected</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='H.B. Mackintosh Treasurer'>H.B. Mackintosh Treasurer</span></p>
<p>whole number for <u>Treasurer 7</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>H.B. Mackintosh</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and he was declared elected</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='J. Harris Reed Secretary'>J. Harris Reed Secretary</span></p>
<p>whole number for <u>Secretary 7</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J. Harris Reed</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and he was declared elected.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135417">
<h3><a name="page-1135417">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 175</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>175</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby. 13. 1878'>Feby. 13. 1878</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='J.W. Lovering Superintendent'>J.W. Lovering Superintendent</span></p>
<p>whole number for <u>Superintendent 7</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J.W. Lovering</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and he was declared elected.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Treas &amp; Secty. 1878.'>Salary of Treas &amp; Secty. 1878.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Salary for <u>Treasurer</u> be fixed<span class='line-break'> </span>at <u>$2.250</u>; and the Salary of <u>Secretary</u> at <u>$1.500</u><span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Supt. 1878.'>Salary of Supt. 1878.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Salary of <u>Superintendent</u><span class='line-break'> </span>be fixed at <u>$2.750</u> for the ensuing year, and<span class='line-break'> </span>that he shall have the use of a house and<span class='line-break'> </span>the grounds thereto belonging, the use of a<span class='line-break'> </span>horse and vehicle and the services of one<span class='line-break'> </span>man at the expense of the Corporation.</p>
<p>As provided in the Rules &amp; Regulations<span class='line-break'> </span>the President appointed</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Standing Committees 18-8-9'>Standing Committees 18-8-9</span></p>
<p><u>The Standing Committees</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>the same as last year.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>[see Page 135 &amp; 136 of this Volume]</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Unfinished business Cont&apos;s. continued.'>Unfinished business Cont's. continued.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Committees last year<span class='line-break'> </span>having unfinished business be continued.</p>
<p>The Report of the Com. on Grounds, to whom<span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the expediency of extending the<span class='line-break'> </span>Landscape Lawn Plan to all or any portion of<span class='line-break'> </span>the remaining part of the "Stone Farm", was<span class='line-break'> </span>taken from the table,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135418">
<h3><a name="page-1135418">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 176</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>176</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby. 13. 1878.'>Feby. 13. 1878.</span></p>
<p>and it was unanimously</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Landscape Lawn Plan^41^ adopted for Stone Farm &amp; vicinity.'>Landscape Lawn Plan^41^ adopted for Stone Farm &amp; vicinity.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Landscape Lawn Plan<span class='line-break'> </span>be extended so as to embrace not only all of<span class='line-break'> </span>the "Stone Farm" so called, but also that portion<span class='line-break'> </span>of the old Cemetery lying Southerly &amp; Easterly of<span class='line-break'> </span>Magnolia Avenue as shown by a plan prepar<span class='line-break'></span>ed by Superintendent, on fil.^41^</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Bradlee it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Names for Avenues &amp; Path on above portion referred to Com. on Grounds.'>Names for Avenues &amp; Path on above portion referred to Com. on Grounds.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the subject of names for<span class='line-break'> </span>the Avenues and Paths on all that portion<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery embraced in the above vote<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Com. on Grounds to report<span class='line-break'> </span>at the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual File of Monthly Bills and Schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>of same having been submitted to the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='refd to Prest'>ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Bills be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>President for his approval and payment by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G. #1425'>Perp. Rep. with G. #1425</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots having recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair with guaranty of Lot <u>#1425</u><span class='line-break'> </span>*Anne E.P. Sever for <u>$575.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='concurred in.'>concurred in.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Contract be concurred<span class='line-break'> </span>in by the Board.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135419">
<h3><a name="page-1135419">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 177</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>177</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby. 13. 1878.'>Feby. 13. 1878.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales Land^42^'>Statement Sales Land^42^</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Sales of Land reported by Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>and approved by Committee on Lots from<span class='line-break'> </span>Jany. 1. 1878 to date<span class='line-break'> </span>and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted &amp; filed.^42^'>accepted &amp; filed.^42^</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Statement be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file.^42^</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'>Representatives Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>On Petition of parties in interest Repre<span class='line-break'></span>sentatives were designated for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='88'>88</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Albert W. Putnam of E. Boston son of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2711'>2711</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Mary Porter " Boston widow " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4042'>4042</span><span class='line-break'> </span>William P. Jones " " son " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u> J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135420">
<h3><a name="page-1135420">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 178</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>178</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk S.S. February 28<sup>th</sup> 1878:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oath of Secretary.'>Oath of Secretary.</span></p>
<p>Personally appeared J. Harris Reed and<span class='line-break'> </span>made oath that he would faithfully discharge the<span class='line-break'> </span>duties appertaining to the <u>Office</u> of Secretary of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Before me<span class='line-break'> </span>H.B. Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 13. 1878.'>March 13. 1878.</span></p>
<p><u>March 13. 1878.</u></p>
<p>Monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>March 13. at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, Mess. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Choate, Cotting, Perkins &amp; Snow.</p>
<p>The Record of the meeting of Feby 13 was<span class='line-break'> </span>read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watering Streets'>Watering Streets</span></p>
<p>The President having called the attention<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board to the necessity of arranging for<span class='line-break'> </span>the watering the streets in the vicinity of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, it was on motion of Mr. Choate</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to President'>Referred to President</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the matter be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the President with full power.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135421">
<h3><a name="page-1135421">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 179</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>179</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 13. 1878.'>March 13. 1878.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots #1902 &amp; 1903^43^'>Lots #1902 &amp; 1903^43^</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow of the Com. on Lots presented a<span class='line-break'> </span>Petition^43^ of William Arnold &amp; A.T. Frothingham<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of Lots #1902 &amp; 1903 requesting a<span class='line-break'> </span>second conveyance of the same land to be<span class='line-break'> </span>equally divided, &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Re-conveyance authorized [?] the purpose issuing New Deeds.'>Re-conveyance authorized [?] the purpose issuing New Deeds.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the Sec't'y. be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>accept a re-conveyance of Lots #1902 and 1903,<span class='line-break'> </span>contain^in^g respectively 20 &amp; 300 square feet, for<span class='line-break'> </span>the purpose of issuing new Deeds of same land<span class='line-break'> </span>to contain 160 square feet each.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Grounds ask time to report.'>Com. on Grounds ask time to report.</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Grounds asked for further<span class='line-break'> </span>time to consider &amp; report names for Avenues<span class='line-break'> </span>and Paths for that portion to which the<span class='line-break'> </span>Landscape Lawn Plan was extended by<span class='line-break'> </span>vote. Feby. 13. &amp; in motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='granted.'>granted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the request be granted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual file of Bills and schedule of<span class='line-break'> </span>same having been submitted to the Board</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refd to Prest'>Ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Bills be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Pres<sup>t</sup> for his approval and payment by Treas.<span class='line-break'> </span>if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales Land accepted &amp; filed.^44^'>Statement Sales Land accepted &amp; filed.^44^</span></p>
<p>The Secty. presented a Statement^44^ of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Sales of land reported by Supt. and approved<span class='line-break'> </span>by Com. on Lots from Feby 13. to date &amp; it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Statement be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file.^44^<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135422">
<h3><a name="page-1135422">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 180</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>180</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 13. 1878.'>March 13. 1878.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G. #4145'>Perp. Rep. with G. #4145</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended the<span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Repair with guaranty of<span class='line-break'> </span><u>#4145</u> Heirs of *Artemas Ward for <u>$450.</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Contract be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'>Representatives Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>On Petition of parties in interest Representa<span class='line-break'></span>tives were designated for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='47'>47</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Henry Woodberry of Boston son of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='927'>927</span><span class='line-break'> </span>W<sup>m</sup> H. Wilkinson " " " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1072'>1072</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Charles Parker " " grandson " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1555 &amp; 2068'>1555 &amp; 2068</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Susan A. Peak (Miss.) " " daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1588'>1588</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Edward M. Endicott " Chicago son " " "</p>

<div id="page-1135423">
<h3><a name="page-1135423">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 181</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>181</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 10. 1878.'>April 10. 1878.</span></p>
<p><u>April 10. 1878.</u></p>
<p>Monthly meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, on Wednesday April 10<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President Mess. A. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Brewer, Cotting, Lawrence, Perkins and<span class='line-break'> </span>Snow.</p>
<p>The Record of the Meeting of March 13.<span class='line-break'> </span>was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on Grounds Names Paths &amp; Avenues'>Report Com. on Grounds Names Paths &amp; Avenues</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Grounds, to whom was<span class='line-break'> </span>referred the subject of Names for the Paths<span class='line-break'> </span>and Avenues in that part of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>to which the Landscape Lawn plan was ex<span class='line-break'></span>tended by vote Feby. 13. 1878, reported a list<span class='line-break'> </span>and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted names adopted.^45^'>accepted names adopted.^45^</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the report be accepted and<span class='line-break'> </span>the names written on the plan^45^ submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Int. Corps Clothing for'>Int. Corps Clothing for</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Brewer it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that the purchase of clothing<span class='line-break'> </span>for the Interment Corp's be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Interments with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos;s Quar&apos;ty Statements^46^'>Treas's Quar'ty Statements^46^</span></p>
<p>The Treasurers Statements^46^ of Receipts and<span class='line-break'> </span>Expenditures for the quarter ending March 30<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>and of amounts due &amp; uncollected were presented.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Com. on Finance'>Referred to Com. on Finance</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Statements^46^ be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com. on Finance.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135424">
<h3><a name="page-1135424">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 182</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>182</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 10. 1878'>April 10. 1878</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales Land'>Statement Sales Land</span></p>
<p>The Se'ty. presented a Statement^47^ of Sales<span class='line-break'> </span>of land from March 13 to date as reported<span class='line-break'> </span>by Supt. and approved by Com. on Lots</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepd &amp; filed^47^'>accep<sup>d</sup> &amp; filed^47^</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Statement be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file.^47^</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual Monthly file of Bills &amp; Schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>of same been submitted it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='refd to Prest'>ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: that said Bills be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>President for his approval &amp; payment by Treas.<span class='line-break'> </span>if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G. #613'>Perp. Rep. with G. #613</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended the<span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Repair with guaranty of Lot<span class='line-break'> </span><u>#613</u> *S.H. Walley for $500</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurred in'>Concurred in</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u> that said Contract be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives for'>Representatives for</span></p>
<p>On Petition the following Representatives were appointed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#503'>#503</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Clarissa H. Haven of Philadelphia daughter of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='613'>613</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Henshaw B. Walley " Boston son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='733'>733</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Mary P. Frye (Miss.) " " daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='787'>787</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Henry H. Brown " " son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1258'>1258</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Stephen W. Bowles " Springfield " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1386'>1386</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Bernard Jenney " Boston son-in-law " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1580'>1580</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Edward S. Atwood " East Orange N.J. son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2888'>2888</span><span class='line-break'> </span>E. Cabot Wilde " Boston grandson " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3358'>3358</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Martha T. Washburn (Miss.) " Middleboro daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3635'>3635</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Caroline A. Parrott (Mrs. G.B.) " Hyde Park " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3819'>3819</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Thomas Niles " Boston son " " "</p>

</div>

<p>May 8.1878 [underlined]</p>
<p>Monthly meeting of the Board of Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held as notified on Wednesday May 8<span class='line-break'> </span>at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Cotting, Lawrence, Rice &amp; Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the Meeting of April 14 was <span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p>The attention of the Board having been <span class='line-break'> </span>called to the subject, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Decoration Day[underlined]'>Decoration Day[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined[: That all matters relating to <span class='line-break'> </span>Decoration Day be referred to the President <span class='line-break'> </span>with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fees for use of Receiving Tomb. [underlined]'>Fees for use of Receiving Tomb. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President presented the matter of <span class='line-break'> </span>the present Fees for use in the Receiving Tomb,<span class='line-break'> </span>after discussion it was on motion of Mr. Cotting</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Special Com.[underlined]'>Referred to Special Com.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underliend]: That the subject of the Fees <span class='line-break'> </span>to be charged for the use of the Receiving Tomb <span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to a special Committee consisting</p>

<div class="page-content">
<p>184</p>
<p>===May 8. 1878 [underliend]</p>
<p>of the President, Mess. Snow &amp; Bradlee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Notice of Proposed Amend&apos;t Rules &amp; REgulations.[underliend]'>Notice of Proposed Amend't Rules &amp; REgulations.[underliend]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Cotting then gave notice of his inten<span class='line-break'></span>tion at the next meeting to propose as an <span class='line-break'> </span>admendment to Article V. of the Rules and <span class='line-break'> </span>Regulations the Report of the Special C om.<span class='line-break'> </span>on Fees for use of Receiving Tomb.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representation, Sect&apos;ys Com^n.[underlined]'>Representation, Sect'ys Com^n.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President read a Comunication ^48^<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Secretary in regard to the appoint<span class='line-break'></span>ment of Representatives, ^ on motion it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That said Com'^n ^48^ be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Chate to consider &amp; report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reconveyace authorized Interment. Spaces [underlined]'>Reconveyace authorized Interment. Spaces [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow of the Com. on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, he explained the reason therefor, it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That the action of the Sec't'y,<span class='line-break'> </span>in receiving a Deed of re-conveyance of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Intermediate Spaces adjouring Lot #869 (owned)</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #869[underlined]'>Lot #869[underlined]</span></p>
<p>by Henry Kennard in exchange of a Deed of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot as approved by the Com. on Lots, be <span class='line-break'> </span>confirmed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #4516[underlined]'>Lot #4516[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined] That the Sect'y be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>receive a Deed of re-conveyance of Lot #4516<span class='line-break'> </span>(owned by William Fletcher) in exchange for Deed <span class='line-break'> </span>of Lot #4536, as approved by Com. on Lots, the <span class='line-break'> </span>difference in price to be paid in Cash.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statem&apos;t Sales. [underliend]'>Monthly Statem't Sales. [underliend]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement ^49^<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Sales of land from April 10 to date</p>
<p>an addition of Thirty square feet to said</p>

<div class="page-content">
<p>185</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 8.1878. [underlined]'>May 8.1878. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>as reported by Supt. &amp; approved by Com. on Lots,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted &amp; filed[underlined]'>accepted &amp; filed[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted underlined] That said Statement ^49^ be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills[underlined]'>Monthly Bills[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The usual Monthly file of Bills and <span class='line-break'> </span>schedule having been submitted,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Pres^t.[underlined]'>Referred to Pres^t.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That said Bills be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the President for his approval &amp; payment by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Treas^r if found correct.</p>

<div id="page-1135428">
<h3><a name="page-1135428">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 186</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>186</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 12. 1878. [underlined] '>June 12. 1878. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>June 12. 2878 [underlined]</p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held, as notified on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>June 12, at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, The President Mess. A. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Brewer, Choate, Cotting, Lawrence, <span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Rice and Snow.</p>
<p>The Record of the meeting of May 8^th<span class='line-break'> </span>was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fees for use of Receiving Tomb Spec. Com asks further time[underlined] '>Fees for use of Receiving Tomb Spec. Com asks further time[underlined] </span></p>
<p>Mr. Spelman from the Special Com. on <span class='line-break'> </span>Fees for Receiving Tomb asked for further <span class='line-break'> </span>time to report - a communication from <span class='line-break'> </span>Supt. on the subject was read &amp; it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Granted[underlined]'>Granted[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined]:  That said Com^n. be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the above Special Com. &amp; that they have <span class='line-break'> </span>further time to report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale of Single graves on Private Lots [underlined]'>Sale of Single graves on Private Lots [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow having called the attention <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board to the fact that some Propri<span class='line-break'></span>etors had sold single graves in their Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>it was on his motion</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Subject fef^d to Spec. Com. on Rec&apos;g Tomb. [underlined]'>Subject fef^d to Spec. Com. on Rec'g Tomb. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]:  That the Special Com. on <span class='line-break'> </span>Fees for the Receiving Tomb consider and <span class='line-break'> </span>report on the sale of single graves in <span class='line-break'> </span>private Lots by Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposed amen&apos;t of Rules &amp; Regulations notice of intention [underlined]'>Proposed amen't of Rules &amp; Regulations notice of intention [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow gave notice, that at the next <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Board of Trustees he should <span class='line-break'> </span>propose to alter that portion of Article V.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135429">
<h3><a name="page-1135429">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 187</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>187</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 12. 1878 [underlined]'>June 12. 1878 [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='to offer by Mr. Snow. [underlined]'>to offer by Mr. Snow. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>of the Rules and Regulations concerning <span class='line-break'> </span>the use of a Receiving Tomb, and also to <span class='line-break'> </span>strike out therefrom the enumeration of <span class='line-break'> </span>Fees for its use.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Sect&apos;y Com^n[underlined]'>Representatives Sect'y Com^n[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Choate, to whom was referred the <span class='line-break'> </span>Communication ^48^ of the Secretary in regard <span class='line-break'> </span>to the appointment of Representatives <span class='line-break'> </span>made a verbal report as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Mr. Choate[underlined] on'>Report of Mr. Choate[underlined] on</span></p>
<p>While by the Charter the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees had power to designate a Rep<span class='line-break'></span>presentative, whose only duty was to vote at <span class='line-break'> </span>the meetings of the Proprietors, yet the <span class='line-break'> </span>custom had heretofore been to appoint a <span class='line-break'> </span>Representative upon Petition of the Heirs or<span class='line-break'> </span>Devisees of the deceased Proprietor, and <span class='line-break'> </span>it appeared that the Secretary had <span class='line-break'> </span>succeeded in materially reducing during <span class='line-break'> </span>the past year the number of unrepresented <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, therefor if the parties did not feel <span class='line-break'> </span>interest enough to petition he deemed it <span class='line-break'> </span>inexpedient for the Trustees to designate <span class='line-break'> </span>any one as Representative.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted.[underlined]'>accepted.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]:  That the Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Swan attack on Mrs. Greenough.[underlined]'>Swan attack on Mrs. Greenough.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President called the attention of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board to the recent attack on and injury <span class='line-break'> </span>to Mrs. Greenough by one of the Swans, after </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135430">
<h3><a name="page-1135430">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 188</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>188</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 12. 1878.[underlined'>June 12. 1878.[underlined</span></p>
<p>discussion and suggestions D. Brewer re<span class='line-break'></span>qusted authority to see the above named</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Authority to sell 2 Swans asked [underlined]'>Authority to sell 2 Swans asked [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Swan and another of the unmated one,<span class='line-break'> </span>and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='granted[underlined]'>granted[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: that the authority requested <span class='line-break'> </span>be granted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secty authorized to issue Deeds without deposit for P.C. of grass for Adt&apos;n to #1772 &amp; O.G. to #4393 [underlined]'>Secty authorized to issue Deeds without deposit for P.C. of grass for Adt'n to #1772 &amp; O.G. to #4393 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow an explanation <span class='line-break'> </span>of the reasons therefor having nbeen given it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined]:  That the Sect'y be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>issue Deeds without the deposit for the per<span class='line-break'></span>petual care of the turfing and sodding to <span class='line-break'> </span>George Hyde for an Addition to Lot #1772<span class='line-break'> </span>and to Ezra Towne for "Ornamental Ground<span class='line-break'> </span>adjoining Lot #4393.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='to accept a reconveyance of Lot #1587.[underlined]'>to accept a reconveyance of Lot #1587.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]:  That the Secty. be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to accept a Deed of reconveyance of Lot #1587<span class='line-break'> </span>in exchange for a Deed to W^m B. Stevens of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #4540 purchase by him he paying <span class='line-break'> </span>the amount required for the perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>care of the turfing and sodding.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Impurity of Water in Lakes[underlined].'>Impurity of Water in Lakes[underlined].</span></p>
<p>The President brought before the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject of the impurity of the water <span class='line-break'> </span>in the lakes in the Cemetery in consequence<span class='line-break'> </span>of the drainage which is emptied into the <span class='line-break'> </span>Brook on the Northerly side of Mt. Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>St., which furnishes in great part the <span class='line-break'> </span>supply of these lakes.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135431">
<h3><a name="page-1135431">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 189</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>189</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 12.1878. [underlined]'>June 12.1878. [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposal to supply pure water '>Proposal to supply pure water </span></p>
<p>He stated that a successful attempt had <span class='line-break'> </span>been made to bore for water near the engine <span class='line-break'> </span>house, and a proposal had been made <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Corporation, that for the sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>One thousand dollars a supply of 200<span class='line-break'> </span>gallons per minute of pure water would <span class='line-break'> </span>be guaranteed - after explanation and <span class='line-break'> </span>discussion it ws on motion of Mr. Bradlee</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Subject laid on table [underlined]'>Subject laid on table [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That the subject of a supply <span class='line-break'> </span>of pure water be laid upon the table.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills [underlined]'>Monthly Bills [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The usual Monthly file of Bills &amp; schedule <span class='line-break'> </span>of same having been submitted it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref^d to President.[underlined]'>Ref^d to President.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That said Bills be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the President for his approval &amp; payment <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Treas^r if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement of Sales of Land[underlined]'>Statement of Sales of Land[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary submitted a Statement ^50^<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Sales of Lots from May 8 to date as <span class='line-break'> </span>reported by Supt. &amp; approved by Com. on Lots,</p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title='accepted &amp; filed[underlined]='>accepted &amp; filed[underlined]=</span></p>
<p>Voted[underliend]: That said statement be <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted and filed. ^50.^</p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title='=Representatives, Lot Nos. [underlined]'>=Representatives, Lot Nos. [underlined]</span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 12. 1878. [underlined]'>July 12. 1878. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>July 12. 1878. underlined</p>
<p>A Special meeting of he Boad of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Friday, July <span class='line-break'> </span>12 at 2 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present.  The President, Mess. A. Bigelow, <span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Cotting, Perkins, Rice &amp; Snow.</p>
<p>Records of the meeting of June 12 read &amp; <span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p>Spec. Com. on Fees Rec'g Tomb further time granted. [underlined===</p>
<p>The President of Special Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Fees for Receiving Tomb asked further time to <span class='line-break'> </span>report &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined]:  That the request be granted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Notice of Amend to Rules &amp; Regs renewed.[underlined]'>Notice of Amend to Rules &amp; Regs renewed.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow renewed his <del>his </del> notice of proposed <span class='line-break'> </span>amendment of Rules &amp; Regulations.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secty. to receive re-conveyance of #3119 in exchange for # 4541 &amp; 42 [underlined]'>Secty. to receive re-conveyance of #3119 in exchange for # 4541 &amp; 42 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted[underlined]: That the request be granted.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow it was</p>
<p>Votead[underlined[:  That the Secretary be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>accept a reconveyance of Lot #3119 from John R. Poor<span class='line-break'> </span>in exchange for Deeds of Lots #4541 and 4542 he <span class='line-break'> </span>paying Eight hundred and sixty five ($865) dollars for <span class='line-break'> </span>the P. C. of grass on the two Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos; Quarterly Statements Referred to Com. on Finance. [underliend]'>Treas' Quarterly Statements Referred to Com. on Finance. [underliend]</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's Statements ^51^ of Receipts &amp; Expenditures <span class='line-break'> </span>for the quarter ending June 30^th &amp; of amounts due <span class='line-break'> </span>and uncollected were presented.</p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That said Statements ^51^ be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Com. on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statm&apos;t Sales,[underlined]'>Statm't Sales,[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement ^52^ of the Sales <span class='line-break'> </span>of land from June 12 to date as reported by Supt.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135436">
<h3><a name="page-1135436">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 194</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>194</p>
<p>Oct. 9. 1878. [underlined]===</p>
<p>October 9. 1878. [underlined]</p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held on Wednesday Oct. 9<span class='line-break'> </span>a 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. A. Bigelow, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Cotting, Lawrence Perkins, Rice &amp; Snow.</p>
<p>The Records of the meetings of July 12,<span class='line-break'> </span>August 14, &amp; September 11 were read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Spec. Com. on Fees for Rec&apos;g Tomb - further time granted. [underlined]'>Spec. Com. on Fees for Rec'g Tomb - further time granted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Spelman of the Special Com. on <span class='line-break'> </span>Fees for the Receiving Tomb asked for further <span class='line-break'> </span>time to report &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined]:  That the requrest be granted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='General Fund loan for by Com. on Finance note given; [underlined]'>General Fund loan for by Com. on Finance note given; [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Rice from the Com. on Finance reported:</p>
<p>The requirements of the General Fund <span class='line-break'> </span>necessitated a loan of Two thousand dollars <span class='line-break'> </span>($2,000) which was made Sept. 12. at the <span class='line-break'> </span>Atlantic National Bank at 4% on a <span class='line-break'> </span>note of the C orporation; on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='action of Com. confirmed &amp; note ratified. [underliend]'>action of Com. confirmed &amp; note ratified. [underliend]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That the Board confirm the <span class='line-break'> </span>action of the Committee and ratify the<span class='line-break'> </span>making of the note named in the Report.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow of Com. on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>he explaining the reasons therefor it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sect&apos;y authorized to issue Deed for Ad&apos;tn to #692 without deposit for P.C. of grass. [underlinead]'>Sect'y authorized to issue Deed for Ad'tn to #692 without deposit for P.C. of grass. [underlinead]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined]. That the Secretary be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to issue a Deed for an Addition to <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #692 (purchased by the Heirs of Lois Mason)<span class='line-break'> </span>without a deposit for the care of the turfing &amp; sodding</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135437">
<h3><a name="page-1135437">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 195</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>195</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. 9. 1878.[underlined]'>Oct. 9. 1878.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow read a Communication ^53^ from <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent in regard to certain Lots</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Neglected Lots Com^n of Supt. presented - consideration deferred. [underlined]'>Neglected Lots Com^n of Supt. presented - consideration deferred. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>which "look very badly" and the fences around <span class='line-break'> </span>them "are in a bad condition", after some <span class='line-break'> </span>discussion as to the action to be taken, on <span class='line-break'> </span>his motion further consideration of the subject <span class='line-break'> </span>was deferred until the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Notice of Amend&apos;t to Rules &amp; R. renewed. [underlined]'>Notice of Amend't to Rules &amp; R. renewed. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow renewed his notice of proposed <span class='line-break'> </span>amentment of "Rules &amp; Regulations."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale of Catacomb in R. T. action delayed. [underlined]'>Sale of Catacomb in R. T. action delayed. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President informed the Board that <span class='line-break'> </span>an appliation had been made by Mrs. <span class='line-break'> </span>S. H. Moulton for the purchase for permanent <span class='line-break'> </span>occupancy of a Catacomb in the Receiving <span class='line-break'> </span>Tomb;  after discussion as to the expedience<span class='line-break'> </span>of selling Catacombs it was decided to<span class='line-break'> </span>delay action until the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petitions of Alex^r M^cDonald for permit [underlined]'>Petitions of Alex^r M^cDonald for permit [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President presented the petition ^54^ of <span class='line-break'> </span>Alexander M^cDonald to be allowed to <span class='line-break'> </span>set stones of his own manufacture on <span class='line-break'> </span>those Lots on which the Deed provides <span class='line-break'> </span>"no work shall be done by other persons <span class='line-break'> </span>than the proper officers &amp; servants of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation", on motion of Mr. Snow it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Granted under direction of Com. on Lots [underlined]'>Granted under direction of Com. on Lots [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underliend]: That leave be granted to Alex^r<span class='line-break'> </span>M^cDonald from time to time to set monuments <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; headstones of his own manufacture on such Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>under direction of the Com. on Lots, he obtaining <span class='line-break'> </span>a special permit in each case.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>A Communication from Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>in regard to the price of grass on the <span class='line-break'> </span>Public Lots ws read &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Prices of Grass on Public Lots,  referred[underlined]'>Prices of Grass on Public Lots,  referred[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined]: That said Com^n. be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Special Com. on fees for Receiving Tomb.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills July, Aug, &amp; Sept. [underlined]'>Monthly Bills July, Aug, &amp; Sept. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Monthly Bills &amp; Schedules of same for <span class='line-break'> </span>July, August &amp; September having been sub<span class='line-break'></span>mitrted to the Board it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='referred to Pres^t.[underlined]'>referred to Pres^t.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]:   That said Bills be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Pres^t for his approval ^ payment by Treas.<span class='line-break'> </span>if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos; Quarterly Statements,[underlined]'>Treas' Quarterly Statements,[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's Statements ^55^ of Receipts and <span class='line-break'> </span>Expenditures for the Quarter ending Sept. 30^th<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; of Amounts due &amp; uncollected were presented <span class='line-break'> </span>and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='referred to Com. on Finance. [underlined]'>referred to Com. on Finance. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]: That said Statements ^55^ be<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to Com. on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales of Land, accepted &amp; filed.[underlined]'>Statement Sales of Land, accepted &amp; filed.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement ^56^ of <span class='line-break'> </span>Sales of land reported by Supt. &amp; approved<span class='line-break'> </span>by Com. on Lots from July 14 to date, on motion</p>
<p>Voted[underliend]: That said Stat'mt be accepted &amp; filed ^56^</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G. [underlined]'>Perp. Rep. with G. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended the</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perpetual Repair with guaranty of Lots[underlined]'>Perpetual Repair with guaranty of Lots[underlined]</span></p>
<p>#633-1506 [underlined] ===</p>
<p>#633[underlined]- Godnow .. $175           #2966 [underlined] - York - - %525</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2868 - 2966 [underlined]'>2868 - 2966 [underlined]</span></p>

<p>The monthly meeting of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held as notified on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>Nov. 13. at 4 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present The President, Mess. Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Lawrence, Perkins, Rice &amp; Snow.</p>
<p>Records of the meeting of Oct. 9 read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Spec. Com. on Fees for Receiving Tomb - Sales of graves in private Lots -[underlined]'>Report of Spec. Com. on Fees for Receiving Tomb - Sales of graves in private Lots -[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Spelman of Special Committee ap<span class='line-break'></span>pointed May 8, 1878 to consider &amp; report on the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Fees for the use of the Receiving Tomb, to <span class='line-break'> </span>which Com. was also referred June 12. 1878<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject of the sale of graves in private</p>
