<div class="page-content">
<p>198</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 13. 1878. [underlined]'>Nov. 13. 1878. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Lots: and also Oct. 9. 1878 the subject of the <span class='line-break'> </span>price of graves in Public Lots, presented</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='and Price of grave in Public Lots[underlined]'>and Price of grave in Public Lots[underlined]</span></p>
<p>a written report ^57^ with schedule of prices re=<span class='line-break'> </span>commended, on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted Prices adopted. [underlined]'>Report accepted Prices adopted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]:  That the report ^57^ be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and the prices for use of Receiving Tomb and <span class='line-break'> </span>graves in Public Los recommended be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposed Amen&apos;t Article V. Rules &amp; Regulations [underlined]'>Proposed Amen't Article V. Rules &amp; Regulations [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow according to his notice at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, presented Article V of the Rules <span class='line-break'> </span>and Regulations with his proposed altera=<span class='line-break'> </span>tions and amendments ^58^; after a careful <span class='line-break'> </span>reading of the Article as altered &amp; amended<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Alterations &amp; Amendments adopted. [underlined]'>Alterations &amp; Amendments adopted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]:  That the alterations and <span class='line-break'> </span>amendments of Article V of the Rules and <span class='line-break'> </span>Regulations as propose ^58^ by Mr. Snow be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #4208 Deed for Add&apos;n to without Deposit for care of grass - authorized[underlined]'>Lot #4208 Deed for Add'n to without Deposit for care of grass - authorized[underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow of Com. on Lots, he<span class='line-break'> </span>explaining the reason therefor it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined]:  That the Secretary be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to issue a Deed for an addition to Lot #4208<span class='line-break'> </span>(purchased by John Baldwin Jr.) Without a <span class='line-break'> </span>deposit for the care of the turfing &amp; sodding.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #4502 permission to erect Headstones exceeding 2feet 8inches = granted [underlined]'>Lot #4502 permission to erect Headstones exceeding 2feet 8inches = granted [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined:  That Mr. J. A. Woolson, Proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of Lot #4502 be permitted to erect on said <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot a headstone exceeding two feet, six inches <span class='line-break'> </span>in height. ^59^.</p>

<p>as requested by Mrs. S. H. Moulton ^60^ having been <span class='line-break'> </span>postponed from the last meeting, after a full <span class='line-break'> </span>discussion as to the expediency of selling any <span class='line-break'> </span>Catacombs at present it was unanimously</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Voted inexpedient&apos;[underlined]'>Voted inexpedient'[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underliend]:  That it is not advisable to sell<span class='line-break'> </span>a Catacomb in the Receiving Tomb for permanent <span class='line-break'> </span>occupancy ^60.^ as requested by Mrs. S. H. Moulton.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Death of Jacob Bigelow[underlined]'>Death of Jacob Bigelow[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Special Meeting to take action in <span class='line-break'> </span>regard to the death of D^r Jacob Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>one of the Trustees, was held on Saturday Jan.<span class='line-break'> </span>11 at  2 1/4 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present The President, Mess. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Rice &amp; Snow.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolutions adopted.[underlined]'>Resolutions adopted.[underlined]</span></p>

<div id="page-1135448">
<h3><a name="page-1135448">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 206</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>206</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. ll. 1879.[underlined]'>Jan. ll. 1879.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>of one with whom originated the idea of our <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery as a place of repose for the departed, <span class='line-break'> </span>far removed from city noise and turmoil, amid <span class='line-break'> </span>trees and flowers and the beauties of nature;<span class='line-break'> </span>as the founder therefore of the numerous garden <span class='line-break'> </span>cemeteries which have sprung up all over our <span class='line-break'> </span>country in imitation of our example.</p>
<p>We rememer him also as connected <span class='line-break'> </span>with our Board from its first inception; as our <span class='line-break'> </span>President for more than fifteen years, under ^whose^<span class='line-break'> </span>fostering care, wise judgement and love of <span class='line-break'> </span>nature our Cemetery hs been developed to <span class='line-break'> </span>its present beauty and attractiveness; as one <span class='line-break'> </span>who, as Trustee, continued to aid us with his <span class='line-break'> </span>judgement, experience and advice, as long as <span class='line-break'> </span>advancing years allowed him tp take any active <span class='line-break'> </span>part in the affirs of life.</p>
<p><ins>Resolved</ins>: That we tender our respectful <span class='line-break'> </span>sypathy to his afflicted wife and family.</p>
<p><ins>Resolved</ins>: That the Secretary transmit a <span class='line-break'> </span>copy of thes resolutions to Mrs. Bigelow &amp; family.</p>
<p><ins>Adjourned</ins>.</p>
<p>J. Harris Reed</p>
<p>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135449">
<h3><a name="page-1135449">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 207</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>207</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 17. 1879'><ins>Jan. 17. 1879</ins></span></p>
<p><ins>January 17. 1879</ins></p>
<p>A special meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held as notified on Friday Jany. 17 at<span class='line-break'> </span>3 o'clockP.M.</p>
<p>Present The President, Mess Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Perkins, Rice &amp; Snow.</p>
<p>On motion the^reading of the^ Records of the last two <span class='line-break'> </span>meetings was dispenssed with.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President Submits Annual Report'><ins>President Submits Annual Report</ins></span></p>
<p>The President, having been authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>at the meeting of Dec. 11. 1878 to prepare the <span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Report, submitted said Report ^70^<span class='line-break'> </span>and on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='adopted and ordered to be printed.'><ins>adopted and ordered to be printed.</ins></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted:</ins> The Annual Report^70^ as read <span class='line-break'> </span>is hereby approved and adopted as the Report <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board of Trustees to the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>and ordered to be printed, the President <span class='line-break'> </span>to make such verbal alterations as he deems <span class='line-break'> </span>necessary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Title to Lots. Com^n of Secty. in regard to'><ins>Title to Lots. Com^n of Secty. in regard to</ins></span></p>
<p>The President presented a Communi<span class='line-break'></span>cation from the Secretary^71^ giving information <span class='line-break'> </span>to Proprietors in regard to title to Lots and <span class='line-break'> </span>the appointment and powers of Representatives<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted and ordered printed as Appendix to An. Report.'><ins>accepted and ordered printed as Appendix to An. Report.</ins></span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>: that said Communication ^71^ be <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted and printed as an Appendix to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Annual Report.</p>
<p>Mr. Browne of the Com. on Finance reported</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135450">
<h3><a name="page-1135450">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 208</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>208</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 17. 1879[underlined]'>Jan. 17. 1879[underlined]</span></p>
<p>that Treasurer's Annual Report ^65^ had been <span class='line-break'> </span>examined and certified as correct, &amp; also the <span class='line-break'> </span>Quarterly Reports ^(46.51.55)^ for the year 1878. &amp; it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas Report certified by Com. on Finance and ordered printed.[underlined]'>Treas Report certified by Com. on Finance and ordered printed.[underlined]</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>: that the report of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>be accepted &amp; the Annual Report ^65^ of the Treas.<span class='line-break'> </span>be printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Changes in Rules &amp; Regulations to be reported by Pres^t to Proptrs.[underlined]'>Changes in Rules &amp; Regulations to be reported by Pres^t to Proptrs.[underlined]</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>: That the President be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to make a verbal report of the changes made <span class='line-break'> </span>in the Rules and Regulations approved at the <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Corporation held April 12. 1875.</p>
<p><ins>Dissolved.</ins>   J. Harris Reed, Secty.</p>

<p>===<ins>Feby 12. 1879.</ins></p>
<p><ins>February 12. 1879</ins></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>Feby 12 at 4 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present The President, Mess. Bigelow, Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Rice, Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>and Whitney.</p>
<p>The records of the meeting of Jan. 17 were <span class='line-break'> </span>read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Names of Trustees elected Feby. 3. 1879'><ins>Names of Trustees elected Feby. 3. 1879</ins></span></p>
<p>The President announced the names of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees elected at the Annual Meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors Feby 3^d as follows:</p>
<p>Mr. <ins>Charles U. Cotting</ins> } for the term <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp;  "  <ins>David R. Whitney</ins>} of <ins>6 years.</ins></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of M. Spelman President'><ins>Election of M. Spelman President</ins></span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne having been appointed to collect <span class='line-break'> </span>and count the Ballots for Officers for the ensuing <span class='line-break'> </span>year announced that the whole number for <ins>President</ins> was  <ins>8</ins></p>
<p>all of which were for <ins>I. M. Spelman</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>and he was declared elected.</p>
<p>===<ins>H. B. Mackintosh Treasurer</ins></p>
<p>whole number for <ins>Treasurer</ins>  <ins>9</ins></p>
<p>All of which were for <ins>H. B. Mackintosh</ins></p>
<p>and he was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='J. Harris Reed Secretary'><ins>J. Harris Reed Secretary</ins></span></p>
<p>whole number for <ins>Secretary</ins>   <ins>9</ins></p>
<p>all of which ere for <ins>J. Harris Reed</ins></p>
<p>and he was declared elected</p>
</div>
</div>

<p><ins>Voted</ins>:  That the <ins>Salary</ins> of the <ins>Treasurer</ins> be <span class='line-break'> </span>fixed at <ins>$2.250</ins>; and the<ins>Salary</ins> of <ins>Secretary</ins> <span class='line-break'> </span>at <ins>$1.500</ins>for the ensuing year.</p>
<p>===<ins>Salary</ins> of <ins>Supt.</ins> for 1879.</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>: that the <ins>Salary</ins> of the <ins>Superintendent</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>be fixed at <ins>$2.759</ins> for the ensuing year, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>he shall have the use of a house and the <span class='line-break'> </span>grounds thereto belonging, the use of a horse <span class='line-break'> </span>and vehicle and the services of one man at <span class='line-break'> </span>the expense of the Corporation</p>
<p>As provided in the Rules &amp; Regulations <span class='line-break'> </span>the President appointed</p>
<p>===<ins>Standing Committees</ins> for <ins>1879</ins> &amp; <ins>80.</ins></p>

<p>Voted: That the Commitees of last year <span class='line-break'> </span>having unfinished business to be continued.<span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of Mr. Lawrence it was,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted: that the vote passed April 23, 1875<span class='line-break'> </span>fixing the hour of the regular meeting of this<span class='line-break'> </span>Board at 4 o clock P.M. be rescinded.<span class='line-break'> </span>The President stated that by this action<span class='line-break'> </span>the hour of meeting would be 3 1/2 o'clock. P.M. as<span class='line-break'> </span>fixed by teh Rules + Regulations.<span class='line-break'> </span>The President called the attention of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board to the question, whether, owing to the <span class='line-break'> </span>resumption of (?) payment and the general<span class='line-break'> </span>fall of prices there should not be a reduction<span class='line-break'> </span>in the price of Lots + after discussion it was <span class='line-break'> </span>in motion of Mr. Choate<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted: that the subject of reduction<span class='line-break'> </span>of prices of Lots be referred to the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots to consider and report.</p>

<div id="page-1135454">

<div class="page-content">
<p>212</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feb. 12. 1879'><ins>Feb. 12. 1879</ins></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t'><ins>Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t</ins></span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills &amp; Schedule of <span class='line-break'> </span>same having been submitted to the Board it was</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>: Tht said Bills be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Pres^t for his approval &amp; payment by the Treas. if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statement Sales Land accepted &amp; filed.'><ins>Monthly Statement Sales Land accepted &amp; filed.</ins></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement ^72^ of Sales<span class='line-break'> </span>of land reported by Supt &amp; approved by Com. on.<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots from Jany. 8^th to date &amp; it was</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>:  That said Statement ^72^ be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Rep. with G. #2886. concurred in. '><ins>Perp. Rep. with G. #2886. concurred in. </ins></span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended the <span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Repair with guaranty of Lot</p>
<p>#<ins>2886</ins> W. A. Mason for  <ins>600</ins></p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>:  That said Contract be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'><ins>Representatives Lot Nos.</ins></span></p>
<p>On petition of parties in interest Representatives <span class='line-break'> </span>were designated for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1656'>1656</span></p>
<p>George L. Brastow of Somerville  Son of D. P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1177'>1177</span></p>
<p>Mary F. W. Homer  "  Belmont  daugh-in-law   "   "</p>
<p><ins>Dissolved.</ins></p>
<p>J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oath of Secretary'><ins>Oath of Secretary</ins></span></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts</p>
<p>Suffolk S. S. Feby. 28. 1879</p>
<p>Personally appeared J. Harris Reed and <span class='line-break'> </span>made oath that he would faithfully discharge the <span class='line-break'> </span>duties appertaining to the <ins>Office</ins> of <ins>Secretary</ins> of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Before me</p>
<p>H. B. MacKintosh</p>
<p>Justice of the peace.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Mch.12 1879.'><ins> Mch.12 1879.</ins></span></p>
<p><ins>March. 12. 1879</ins></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>March 12 at 3 1/2 o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Rice and <span class='line-break'> </span>Whitney.</p>
<p>The Records of the Meeting of Feby. 12 read &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reduction of Prices of Los Report of Com. on Lots on'><ins>Reduction of Prices of Los Report of Com. on Lots on</ins></span></p>
<p>Mr. Perkins for the Com. on Lots, to whom <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the subject of reductionof prices <span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots, presented a written Report ^73^ and on <span class='line-break'> </span>motion of Mr Choate it was</p>
<p><ins>Voted</ins>:  That so much of the Report as</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135456">
<h3><a name="page-1135456">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 214</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>214</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mch.12 1879 Small Lots to be laid out adopted. Prices for Lots unsold laid on table.'><u>Mch.12 1879 Small Lots to be laid out adopted. Prices for Lots unsold laid on table.</u></span></p>
<p>relates to the laying out small Lots of 93 sq feet<span class='line-break'> </span>near St. Mathew Public Lot be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>adopted.^73^</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That so much of the Report as <span class='line-break'> </span>relates to the prices ^of Lots^ remains unsold in the <span class='line-break'> </span>older part of the Cemetery be laid on the table.</p>
<p>===<u>New Path Cyclamen report by Com. on Grounds.</u></p>
<p>The President for the Com. on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>reported, that the Cem. in order to render <span class='line-break'> </span>accessible the small Lots to be laid out by <span class='line-break'> </span>the above vote had decided to lay out <span class='line-break'> </span>a new Path from Mound Avenue to<span class='line-break'> </span>St. Mathew Lot, parallel to Spruce Avenue,<span class='line-break'> </span>and give to it the name "Cyclamen," on <span class='line-break'> </span>motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='action confirmed, name adopted.'><u>action confirmed, name adopted.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the action of the Com. <span class='line-break'> </span>be confirmed &amp; the name adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watering Streets referred to President with full power'><u>Watering Streets referred to President with full power</u></span></p>
<p>The President having called the attention <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board to the subject it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> That the matter of watering <span class='line-break'> </span>the streets in the vicinity of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>for the season of 1879 be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>President with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'><u>Monthly Bills</u></span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills &amp; Schedule <span class='line-break'> </span>of same having been submitted it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='referred to President.'><u>referred to President.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said bills be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>President for his approval &amp; payment by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer if found correct.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<div id="page-1135458">
<h3><a name="page-1135458">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 216</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>216</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 9.1879'><u>April 9.1879</u></span></p>
<p><u>April 9. 1879</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified, on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>April 9. at 3 1/2 P. M.</p>
<p>Present The President, Mess. Bigelow, <span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Brewer, Browne, Choate, Lawrence<span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Rice &amp; Snow.</p>
<p>Records of the meeting of March 12 read <span class='line-break'> </span>and approved.</p>
<p>===<u>Report Com. on Los that part relating to Prices of Los unsold taken from table, accepted and adopted</u>---</p>
<p>On motion, that portion of the Report <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Com. on Lots relating to the Prices of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots remaining unsold in the older part of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery, which, at the last meeting ws <span class='line-break'> </span>laid on the table, was taken up; after a <span class='line-break'> </span>full discussion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Report ^73^ of the Com.<span class='line-break'> </span>be accepted and their suggestions be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. care of grass Com. on Los to report cost.'><u>Perp. care of grass Com. on Los to report cost.</u></span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Choate it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Com. on Lots consider <span class='line-break'> </span>and report at the next meeting of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>the cost of the perpetual care of the grass <span class='line-break'> </span>under the contract in the Deeds.</p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title='Monthly Bills='><u>Monthly Bills</u>=</span></p>
<p>The usual file of Montly Bills &amp; schedule <span class='line-break'> </span>of same having been submitted it was</p>
<p>===<u>referred to President</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the said bills be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Pres^t. for his approval &amp; payment by Treas. if <span class='line-break'> </span>found correct.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135459">
<h3><a name="page-1135459">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 217</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>217</p>
<p>===<u>April 9. 1879</u></p>
<p>The Treas's. Statements^74^ of Receipts &amp; Expenditures <span class='line-break'> </span>for the Quarter ending March 31^st &amp; of amounts<span class='line-break'> </span>due &amp; uncollected were presented &amp; it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos; quarterly Stat&apos;t referred to Com. on Finance.  State&apos;m&apos;t Monthly Sales accepted &amp; filed'><u>Treas' quarterly Stat't referred to Com. on Finance.  State'm't Monthly Sales accepted &amp; filed</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Statements ^74^ be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Com. on Finance.</p>
<p>The Sect'y presented a Statement^75^ of Sales of Land<span class='line-break'> </span>made by Supt. for the month end'g April 9. &amp; it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Statement^75^ be accepted &amp; filed.</p>
<p>===<u>Perp. Rep. wtih G. #278  &amp; 3288</u></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended the <span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair with G. of Lots #3288    *Warren   $500.</p>

<div id="page-1135460">
<h3><a name="page-1135460">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 218</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>218</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 14. 1879'><u>May 14. 1879</u></span></p>
<p><u>Boston May 14 1879</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified, on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>May 14, at 3 1/2 P. M.</p>
<p>Present:  The President, Mess. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Brown, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Rice<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Snow.</p>
<p>The records of Meeting of April 9 read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cost of P.C. of grass Report of Com'><u>Cost of P.C. of grass Report of Com</u></span></p>
<p>t\The Com. on Lots who, at the last meeting were <span class='line-break'> </span>instructed to report the cost of the Perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>care of the grass under the contract in the Deeds, <span class='line-break'> </span>made through their Chairman a verbal report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Motion to lay on the table'><u>Motion to lay on the table</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>After a full discussion Mr. Lawrence moved<span class='line-break'> </span>that the subject be laid upon the table to be <span class='line-break'> </span>acted on by the full board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Prices of Lots, motion to reconsider Vote accepting report &amp; adopting Pries'><u>Prices of Lots, motion to reconsider Vote accepting report &amp; adopting Pries</u></span></p>
<p>Mr. Choate then moved that the vote,<span class='line-break'> </span>by which at the last meeting, the report of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Com. on Lots in regard to the price of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots offered for sale was accepted and their <span class='line-break'> </span>suggestions adopted, be reconsidered and <span class='line-break'> </span>moved that the motion to reconsider be laid <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the table; it was then</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on cost P. C. of grass laid on table.'><u>Report Com. on cost P. C. of grass laid on table.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the report of the Com on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>in regard to the cost of the Perpetual care of <span class='line-break'> </span>the grass be laid upon the table, also</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Motion to reconsider Vote laid on table.'><u>Motion to reconsider Vote laid on table.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That Mr. Choate's motion to reconsider <span class='line-break'> </span>be laid upon the table.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135461">
<h3><a name="page-1135461">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 219</a></h3>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 14 1879'><u>May 14 1879</u></span></p>
<p>===<u>Protest of W. C. Richardson against removals from #1933</u></p>
<p>The President presensted a Communication^76^<span class='line-break'> </span>from William C. Richardson protesting against <span class='line-break'> </span>certain removals from Lot#1033, belonging to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Heirs of Alfred Richardsson, decease, and <span class='line-break'> </span>on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref^d to Com on Inter'><u>Ref^d to Com on Inter</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the said Communication ^76^ be <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Com. on Interments to consider<span class='line-break'> </span>and reort what action, if any, is necessary.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow from the Com. on Lots, <span class='line-break'> </span>he explaining the ^reasons therefor it was,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' #2867 re-conveyance authorized'><u> #2867 re-conveyance authorized</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Secretary be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to accept Deeds of reconveyance from Joseph <span class='line-break'> </span>H. White of Lot #2867 &amp; the Ornamental <span class='line-break'> </span>ground &amp; passage ways adjoining the same <span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose of issuing new Deeds as <span class='line-break'> </span>relocatted, without a deposit for the perpet<span class='line-break'></span>ual care of the grass.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#1727 Deed for Add&apos;n. authorized'><u>#1727 Deed for Add'n. authorized</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Secretary be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to issue a Deed for an Adition to Lot <span class='line-break'> </span>#1727, Heirs of Martin Lane without a deposit <span class='line-break'> </span>for the Perpetual care of grass.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Decoration Day ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>Decoration Day ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That all arrangements for <span class='line-break'> </span>Decoration Day be referred to Pres^ with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p>The usual Monthly Bills &amp; Schedule of same <span class='line-break'> </span>were submitted &amp; it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Bills be referred to the Pres^t<span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval &amp; payment by Treas. if found correct.</p>
</div>
</div>

<p><u>Boston June 11. 1870</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>June 11. 1879 at 3 1/2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present The President, Mess. Bigelow, Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Cotting, Perkins, Snow &amp; Whiteney.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Interment on Protest Lot #1933 W. C. Richardson'><u>Report of Com. on Interment on Protest Lot #1933 W. C. Richardson</u></span></p>
<p>Mr. Brewer for Com. on Interments, to whom <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the Protest of W. C. Richardson against <span class='line-break'> </span>certain removals rom Lot #1933 belonging to the Heirs <span class='line-break'> </span>of Alfred Richrdson, made a written Report ^77^ and <span class='line-break'> </span>on motion it was</p>
<p>===<u>accepted &amp; adopted.  Schedule Amt to be entered on Records.</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the report^77^ be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>the recommendation therein be adopted.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Cotting it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That hereafter the amount of the Schedule <span class='line-break'> </span>of Monthly Bills be entered in the Records.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June ll. 1879'><u>June ll. 1879</u></span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow for Com on Lots he ex<span class='line-break'></span>plaining the reasons therefor it was</p>
<p>===<u>#2142 Deed for Addition without deposit for P. C. of grass</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Secretary be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to issue a Deed, to the Heirs of Fred^k Nickerson <span class='line-break'> </span>for an Addition to Lot #2242 without a Deposit<span class='line-break'> </span>for the care of the sodding &amp; turfing</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#1124 Petition for removal of Representatives'><u>#1124 Petition for removal of Representatives</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented the Petition ^79^ of Mr. <span class='line-break'> </span>W. C. Williamson, Trustee of Estate of Henry Plympton <span class='line-break'> </span>who was Proprietor of Lot #1124, for the removal <span class='line-break'> </span>of Charles H. P. Plympton as Representative and<span class='line-break'> </span>the appointment of another &amp; it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hearong on ordered'><u>Hearong on ordered</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That a hearing be given to the <span class='line-break'> </span>parties in interest at the next meeting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board July 9^th &amp; the Secretary notify them.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'><u>Monthly Bills</u></span></p>
<p>The usual File of Monthly Bills &amp; schedule of <span class='line-break'> </span>same amounting to $5.732 36/100, was submitted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>Ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the same be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>President for his approval &amp; payment by Treasuirer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales.'><u>Statement Sales.</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretry presented a Statement ^80^ of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Sales of land reported by Supt. &amp; approved by <span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Lots from May 14 to date.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted &amp; filed'><u>accepted &amp; filed</u></span></p>

<p>223</p>
<p>===<u>July 9.1879</u></p>
<p><u>July 9. 1879</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was notified to be held on Wednes<span class='line-break'></span>day July 9. at 3 1/2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess Brewer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow, Brown, Choate &amp; Rice.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='No Quorum'><u>No Quorum</u></span></p>

<p>Secty</p>

<p><u>August 13. 1879</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was notified to be held on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>August 13 at 3 1/2 P.M.</p>
<p>===<u>No Quorum</u></p>
<p>No quorum being present the meeting</p>

<div id="page-1135466">
<h3><a name="page-1135466">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 224</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>224</p>
<p>===<u>Sept. 10. 1879</u></p>
<p>The record of the meetings of June 11,<span class='line-break'> </span>July 9, and Aug. 13 read and approved</p>
<p>===<u>#756 Protest against removals.</u></p>
<p>The President presented the Protest ^81.^ of <span class='line-break'> </span>certain interested parties against certain removals<span class='line-break'> </span>from Lot #756 Henry Clary, deceased and on <span class='line-break'> </span>motion it was</p>
<p><u>Ref^d to Com. on Interments.</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the above Protest ^81.^ be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com. on Interments to consider &amp; report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#2441 Injuinction of Supreme Court to prevent removals.'><u>#2441 Injuinction of Supreme Court to prevent removals.</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary stated than an injunc<span class='line-break'></span>tion had been served upon the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery by the Supreme Court to <span class='line-break'> </span>prevent certain removals from Lot #2441<span class='line-break'> </span>until the question of title is decided by the Court.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Pure Water   supply of '><u>Pure Water  </u> supply of </span></p>
<p>The President called the attention of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Board to the subject of the supply of <span class='line-break'> </span>pure water for the use of the Cemetery, which <span class='line-break'> </span>subject was laid on the table at the meeting</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='subject of'><u>subject</u> of</span></p>
<p>of June 12.1878 &amp; after an explanation by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Supt. of the plan proposed it was <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref^d to Spec. Com. '><u>Ref^d to Spec. Com. </u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the subject be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Com. on Grounds &amp; Mr. Bradlee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'><u>Monthly Bills</u></span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills for July,<span class='line-break'> </span>August &amp; September &amp; the Schedules for same <span class='line-break'> </span>amounting respectively to $<u>4.918.58</u> - <u>4.595.52</u> + <u>4.428.09</u><span class='line-break'> </span>was submitted.  <u>Voted</u>:  That said Bills be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>President for his approval &amp; payment by Treasurer.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>The Treas's Statements ^82^ of Receipts &amp; Expenditiures <span class='line-break'> </span>for the quarter ending June 30. 1879 the amouns<span class='line-break'> </span>due &amp; uncollected were presented &amp; it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Statements ^82.^ be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com. on Finance.</p>

<div id="page-1135469">
<h3><a name="page-1135469">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 227</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>227</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. 8. 1879'><u>Oct. 8. 1879</u></span></p>
<p><u>October 8. 1879</u></p>
<p>Teh monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>October 8^th at 3 1/2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. Browne, <span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Rice &amp; Snow.</p>
<p>Record of the meeting of Sept. 10 was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Int&apos;ments Report on Protest Lot #756'><u>Com. on Int'ments Report on Protest Lot #756</u></span></p>
<p>the Com. on Interments to whom was <span class='line-break'> </span>referred the Protest ^81^ against removals from <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #750 submitted a written report ^81^ and <span class='line-break'> </span>on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted &amp; Adopted,'><u>Accepted &amp; Adopted,</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Report ^81^ be accepted &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>The recommendation therein be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on Petition of W. L. Bowker'><u>Report on Petition of W. L. Bowker</u></span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow from Com. on Lots reported <span class='line-break'> </span>that no action was necessary in regard to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Petition ^63^ of W. L. Bowker referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Lots &amp; Mr Choate Dec. 11. 1878.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#2214 Add. &amp; O.G. Deeds for without P.C. of grass.'><u>#2214 Add. &amp; O.G. Deeds for without P.C. of grass.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Secretry be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to issue Deeds for an Addition ^ Ornamental <span class='line-break'> </span>Ground to Lot #2214 Elizabeth Lawrence <span class='line-break'> </span>without a deposit for the Perpetal Care of <span class='line-break'> </span>the turfing &amp; sodding.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on Finance Treas&apos; Quar. Statements.'><u>Report Com. on Finance Treas' Quar. Statements.</u></span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne of Com. on Finance reported <span class='line-break'> </span>that the Treasurer's Statement for the quarters ending March 31 ^74.^ and June 30 ^82.^ have been <span class='line-break'> </span>examined &amp; found correct &amp; it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135470">
<h3><a name="page-1135470">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 228</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>228</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. 8. 1879  accepted &amp; filed'><u>Oct. 8. 1879  accepted &amp; filed</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the REport be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and the Statements ^74 &amp; 82^ be placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Loan for General Fund  authorized.'><u>Loan for General Fund  authorized.</u></span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne stated that the requirements <span class='line-break'> </span>of the General Fund necessitated a temporary <span class='line-break'> </span>loan until the collection of the Bills of 1879<span class='line-break'> </span>could be made &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Com. on Finance be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to borrow for the General Funds <span class='line-break'> </span>a sum not exceeding $5.000.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t.'><u>Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills and Schedule <span class='line-break'> </span>of same amounting ot $5.934.93  was submitted</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Bills be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the President for his approval &amp; payment by Treas.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos; Quar&apos;ly Statements referred to Com. on Finance. '><u>Treas' Quar'ly Statements referred to Com. on Finance. </u></span></p>
<p>The Treasurer 's Statements ^84^ for the quarter <span class='line-break'> </span>ending Sept. 30 were presented.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Statements^84^ be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to Com. on F inance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales of land acepted &amp; filed.'><u>Statement Sales of land acepted &amp; filed.</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a statement ^85^ of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Sales of land reported by Supt. &amp; approved by <span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Lots from Sept. 10 to date.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  that said Statement ^85^ be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos. '><u>Representatives Lot Nos. </u></span></p>
<p>On Petition the following Representativs appointed</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1132'>1132</span></p>
<p>Samuel Batchelder   of Cambridge   son   of D. P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1671'>1671</span></p>
<p>Eliza W. Farwell   "   Brooklyn N. Y.   widow   "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1938'>1938</span></p>
<p>Samuel H. Pook   "   Boston   son   "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3835'>3835</span></p>
<p>Henry H. Williams   "   Brookline   "   "   "   "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u>   J. Harris Reed, Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135471">
<h3><a name="page-1135471">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 229</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>229</p>
<p>===<u>Nov. 12. 1879. </u></p>
<p><u>Novmber 12. 1879</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held, as notified on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>Nov. 12 at 3 1/2 P. M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Cotting, Perkins, Rice, Snow, Whitney.</p>
<p>Records of the meeting of Oct 7 read &amp; approved.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Snow of Com. on Lots, he<span class='line-break'> </span>explain^in^g the reason therefore it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#2154 Re-conveyance authorized in exchange for #4594.'><u>#2154 Re-conveyance authorized in exchange for #4594.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>  The Secretary be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to accept a re-conveyance of Lot #2154  from <span class='line-break'> </span>Henry C. Hutchins the Cem. having agreed to <span class='line-break'> </span>exchange said Lot for Lot #4594  Mr. Hutchins<span class='line-break'> </span>paying in cash Fifty dollars.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Interments of animals referred to Com. opn Int&apos;s.'><u>Interments of animals referred to Com. opn Int's.</u></span></p>
<p>The President stated to the Board that <span class='line-break'> </span>an application had been made to him <span class='line-break'> </span>for permission to inter in a Lot the remains <span class='line-break'> </span>iof a pet dog &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the subject of the interment <span class='line-break'> </span>of the bodies of animals in Lots in the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery be referred to the Com. on Interments <span class='line-break'> </span>to consider &amp; report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t.'><u>Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p>The usual File of Monthly Bills &amp; Schedule <span class='line-break'> </span>of same amounting to $4874.44 having been <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted to the Board it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the said Bills be referred to Pres^t.<span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval &amp; payment by Treas.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135472">
<h3><a name="page-1135472">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 230</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>230</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 12. 1879'><u>Nov. 12. 1879</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement ^86^ of the <span class='line-break'> </span>sales of land reported by Supt. &amp; approved by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Lots from Oct 8. to date.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales of Land accepted &amp; filed'><u>Statement Sales of Land accepted &amp; filed</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Statement ^86^ be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P. C. with G. #2214 concurted in.'><u>P. C. with G. #2214 concurted in.</u></span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended the <span class='line-break'> </span>Perpet. Repair with Guaranty of</p>
<p>Lot #2213 - Lawrence for $850</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Contract be concurred in.</p>

<p><u>Dissolved</u>   J. Harris Reed  Secty.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 10. 1879'><u>Dec. 10. 1879</u></span></p>
<p><u>December 10. 1879</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>Dec. 10. at 2 1/2 P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, Mess Bigelow, Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins &amp; Rice</p>
<p>Record of Meeting Nov. 12. read &amp; approved.</p>

<div id="page-1135473">
<h3><a name="page-1135473">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 231</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>231</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 10. 1879.'><u>Dec. 10. 1879.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Spec. Com. on Rights of Widows'><u>Spec. Com. on Rights of Widows</u></span></p>
<p>The Special Committee consisting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the President &amp; Mess. Choate &amp; Snow to whom was <span class='line-break'> </span>referred Jan. 8. 1879 the subject of the rights <span class='line-break'> </span>of widows to Lots of deceased Proprietors report:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report'><u>Report</u></span></p>
<p>That they have been the subject careful <span class='line-break'> </span>consideration, &amp; while they deem it a subject <span class='line-break'> </span>of importance they are not prepared to advise <span class='line-break'> </span>any decisive action at the present time, but <span class='line-break'> </span>recommend the  passage of the following</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote Recommended'><u>Vote Recommended</u></span></p>
<p><u>Vote</u>:  That the Pesident be authorised <span class='line-break'> </span>to act with the Presidents of other Cemeteries <span class='line-break'> </span>in this vicinity in taking any steps they <span class='line-break'> </span>may deem necessary either by application to the<span class='line-break'> </span>legislature or otherwise to secure to widows <span class='line-break'> </span>rights to the Lots of their deceased husbands; <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; also in regard to the transfer of Lots with<span class='line-break'></span>out the consent of the Trustees after interments <span class='line-break'> </span>have been made therein.''</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted &amp; Vote passed.'><u>Report accepted &amp; Vote passed.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President to prepare Annual Report'><u>President to prepare Annual Report</u></span></p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Pesident be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to prepare the Annual Report of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'><u>Monthly Bills</u></span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills &amp; schedule of <span class='line-break'> </span>same having been submitted it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the President be <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135474">
<h3><a name="page-1135474">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 232</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>232</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 10. 1879.'><u>Dec. 10. 1879.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Bills be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the President for his apparoval &amp; payment by Treasr.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales of Land accepted &amp; filed.'><u>Statement Sales of Land accepted &amp; filed.</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement ^87^ of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Sales of Land reported by Supt &amp; approved<span class='line-break'> </span>by Com. on Lots from Nov. 12 to date</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Statement ^87^ be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts P. C. with G. '><u>Contracts P. C. with G. </u></span></p>
<p>The Com. on having recommended the <span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Repair with guaranty of</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='531'><u>531</u></span></p>
<p>Lots  #  <u>531</u>  * Bryant   for   <u>$450</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2867'><u>2867</u></span></p>
<p><u>2867</u>   White   "   <u>800</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3372'><u>3372</u></span></p>
<p><u>3372</u>   Stearns   "   <u>650</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='concurred in.'><u>concurred in.</u></span></p>
<p>Voted:  That the said Contracts be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'><u>Representatives Lot Nos.</u></span></p>
<p>On petition Representatives apointed as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='638'>638</span></p>

<p>Elizabeth Cook  "   Lincoln   Widow   "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3422'>3422</span></p>

<p>Secretary</p>

<div id="page-1135475">
<h3><a name="page-1135475">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 233</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>233</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 14. 1880'><u>Jan. 14. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><u>January 14. 1880</u>===</p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday,<span class='line-break'> </span>Jan. 14. 1880 at 3 1/2 P. M.</p>
<p>Present:  The President, Mess. Browne, Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Rice, Snow &amp; Whiteney.</p>
<p>Records of Meeting Dec 10 read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President submits Annual Report.'><u>President submits Annual Report.</u></span></p>
<p>The President having been authorized at the<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of Dec. 10 to prepare the Annual Report <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted the said Report ^88^''</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adopted &amp; order^d Printed.'><u>Adopted &amp; order^d Printed.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Annual Report ^88^ as read <span class='line-break'> </span>is hereby approved &amp; adopted as the Report of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees to the Proprietors &amp; ordered printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt&apos;s Report accept^d &amp; Printed'><u>Supt's Report accept^d &amp; Printed</u></span></p>
<p>The Supts Report ^89^ for the year 1879  was submitted</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Report ^89^ be accepted &amp; printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasur&apos;s Report ordered Printed'><u>Treasur's Report ordered Printed</u></span></p>
<p>The Com. on Finance reported that they <span class='line-break'> </span>had examined &amp; certified as correct the Treas'rs<span class='line-break'> </span>Report ^90^ for the year 1879. &amp; also for Quarter end'g Sept, 30^th'79</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the report ^90^ be accepted and printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Ints . on Interment of Animals accep^d &amp; adopted'><u>Com. on Ints . on Interment of Animals accep^d &amp; adopted</u></span></p>
<p>The Com. on Interments to whom was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>Nov. 12. 1879 the subject of the Interment of the <span class='line-break'> </span>bodies of animals in Proprietors Lots presented a<span class='line-break'> </span>written Report ^91^</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the report ^91^ be accepted &amp; adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#917 Add&apos;n to without deposit for Care of grass'><u>#917 Add'n to without deposit for Care of grass</u></span></p>
<p>Mr. Snow of Com. on Lots explaining the reason it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Secty issue Deed for add'n to #917<span class='line-break'> </span>J. O. Wetherbee without a deposit for P. C. of grass.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135476">
<h3><a name="page-1135476">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 234</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>234</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 14. 1880'><u>Jan. 14. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills ref^d to President'><u>Monthly Bills ref^d to President</u></span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills &amp; schedule of <span class='line-break'> </span>same amounting to $2.567.12 having been submitted.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Bills be referred to Prest.<span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval &amp; payment by Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales of Land'><u>Statement Sales of Land</u></span></p>
<p>The Sec't'y submitted a Statement ^92^ of Sales <span class='line-break'> </span>of land reported by Supt &amp; approved by Com<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots from Dec. 10 to date</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted &amp; Filed'><u>Accepted &amp; Filed</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Statement ^92.^ be accepted &amp; filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P.C. with G  #404 concurred in.'><u>P.C. with G  #404 concurred in.</u></span></p>
<p>Lot #404 *Thwing for  <u>$550</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u> That said Contract be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'><u>Representatives Lot Nos.</u></span></p>
<p>On Petition of parties in interest Representatives<span class='line-break'> </span>were appointed as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3714'>3714</span></p>
<p>Charles Clarke   of Lawrence   son-in-law of D. P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4233'>4233</span></p>
<p>William G. Carocker  "  Somerville   Son   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Final Report Com. on Lots 1871-1879 Submitted accepted &amp; ordered recorded.  (see next page 235)'><u>Final Report Com. on Lots 1871-1879 Submitted accepted &amp; ordered recorded. </u> (see next page 235)</span></p>
<p>Mr. S. T. Snow made a Report ^93^ of the <span class='line-break'> </span>work of the Committee on Lots during a period <span class='line-break'> </span>of nine years (1871 - 1879 both inclusive) which he <span class='line-break'> </span>read to the Board &amp; it as unanimously</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Report ^93) be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>entered upon the Record. (See next Page 235)</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u>.  J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
