<div id="page-1135477">
<h3><a name="page-1135477">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 235</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>235</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 14. 1880'><u>Jan. 14. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><u>Final Report ^93^ of the Committee on Lots for the years</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>1871-1879</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on Lots 1871-9.'><u>Report Com. on Lots 1871-9.</u></span></p>
<p>The undersigned have been associated as the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots uninterruptedly for a period of nine <span class='line-break'> </span>years.  One of its members whose term of Office, as a Trustee, <span class='line-break'> </span>expires at this time will not be a candidate for reelection <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; a change must consequently take place.  It cannot <span class='line-break'> </span>therefor be deemed inappropriate for them to present<span class='line-break'> </span>some facts &amp; figures growing out of he work upon which <span class='line-break'> </span>they have been engaged.</p>
<p>On the 1^st of Jan. 1871 there had been sold in <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery                               4.073 lots containing 1.357.666 sq. feet<span class='line-break'> </span>since then the sales have been  526  "   "   158.100   "   "</p>
<p>The averate yearly sales since Jany 1871 have<span class='line-break'> </span>been                                    58 Lots containing 15.566 sq. feet.</p>
<p>The land still unsold, after allowing for paths <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Avenues appears to be as follows:</p>
<p>In the older part of the Cemetery    125.913 sq.feet<span class='line-break'> </span>"   "   Stone Farm      218.458  "  "<span class='line-break'> </span>"  "  Chant &amp; Watriss Lots  <u>130.000</u>  "  "</p>
<p>Making a total of   474.371  "  "</p>
<p>If sales are continued at the same average rate as far <span class='line-break'> </span>the past nine years all this land will be disposed of in <span class='line-break'> </span>twenty seven years.  Blut it is believed the sales will be larger <span class='line-break'> </span>for some time to come than they hgave been for a consider<span class='line-break'></span>able portion of period under review.  The constant</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135478">
<h3><a name="page-1135478">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 236</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>236</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 14. 1880.'><u>Jan. 14. 1880.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on Lots 1871-9.'><u>Report Com. on Lots 1871-9.</u></span></p>
<p>of population in our immediate neighborhood will <span class='line-break'> </span>naturally create a growing demand for places of burial.<span class='line-break'> </span>The manifestly permanent improvement in all depart<span class='line-break'></span>ments of business will enable very many people to carry <span class='line-break'> </span>out their plans for purchasing who have felt constrained<span class='line-break'> </span>for prudential or economic reasons to defer the outlay <span class='line-break'> </span>during the protrated depression.  It may be considered <span class='line-break'> </span>reasonably certain that all the land now for sale <span class='line-break'> </span>will be taken within twenty five years at the very farthest.<span class='line-break'> </span>This conclusion is of the utmost importance in deter<span class='line-break'></span>mining the limit of time within which the necessary <span class='line-break'> </span>funds must be accumulated for the care &amp; repair of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery forever thereafater.</p>
<p>A different policy from the one formerly passed, <span class='line-break'> </span>in laying out &amp; selling lots, has lately been adopted.<span class='line-break'> </span>Before that the standard size of a lot was 300 sq.feet<span class='line-break'> </span>and the sale of anything smaller was discouraged.<span class='line-break'> </span>The purchaser had to choose, excepting in rare instances, <span class='line-break'> </span>between that size &amp; a single grave in one of the public lots.<span class='line-break'> </span>Applications for smaller lots became so frequent that it <span class='line-break'> </span>seemed a necessity to meet them more promptly &amp; freely <span class='line-break'> </span>than had been till then been thought  advisable.<span class='line-break'> </span>Arrangements were therefore made to furnish lots of almost <span class='line-break'> </span>any size down to 93 sq. feet &amp; costing but $150. including <span class='line-break'> </span>the necessary deposit for its care by the Corporation.<span class='line-break'> </span>the wisdom of this provision has been fully justified by the <span class='line-break'> </span>character of the sales made during the past year.  The average size <span class='line-break'> </span>of all the lots sold for the year has been 196 1/2 sq. feet.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135479">
<h3><a name="page-1135479">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 237</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>237</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 13. 1880'><u>Jan. 13. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on Los 1871-9.'><u>Report Com. on Los 1871-9.</u></span></p>
<p>The Committee have given constant &amp; careful attention <span class='line-break'> </span>to the annual care of lots for proprietors.  Their aim has <span class='line-break'> </span>been threefold.  To have the Lots kept in the most satis<span class='line-break'></span>factory condition as well to meet the expectations of <span class='line-break'> </span>individual proprietors as to produce a general effect, <span class='line-break'> </span>giving an agreeable impression when viewing he Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>as a whole.  To reduce the annual charge to the lowest <span class='line-break'> </span>possible sum.  With the hope &amp; purpose that ultimately <span class='line-break'> </span>all the lots may be entrusted to the care of the Corporation.</p>
<p>Nowithstanding every effort yet made there are <span class='line-break'> </span>still many neglected lots objects of offence in themselves <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; seriously marring the appearance of the neighborhood.<span class='line-break'> </span>Some progress has been made in securing the attention <span class='line-break'> </span>of proprietors to such lots but much still remains to be done.<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemeteries of more recent date, profiting by the experience <span class='line-break'> </span>of older ones, have provided at the outset for a sufficient <span class='line-break'> </span>deposit, in addition to the selling price, to be made when <span class='line-break'> </span>the lot is taken, for its perpetual care.  This plan awas<span class='line-break'> </span>finally adopted by the trustees on the 26^th April 1876<span class='line-break'> </span>since which no land has been sold without such deposit.<span class='line-break'> </span>The difficulty is therefore now confined to those lots <span class='line-break'> </span>sold prior to that date.  There are some lots, whose <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors cannot be found &amp; it will be a question for <span class='line-break'> </span>the trustees to consider before long, how these  shall be cared<span class='line-break'> </span>for in the interest of the lots contigous to them &amp; sufering <span class='line-break'> </span>by their neglect.  The annual charge has from time <span class='line-break'> </span>to time been materially reduced.  For the year 1871 it was $5.<span class='line-break'> </span>for care &amp; $4 for topdressing when needed, for a lot of 300 sq. feet.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135480">
<h3><a name="page-1135480">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 238</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>238</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 14. 1880'><u>Jan. 14. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on Lots 1871-9.'><u>Report Com. on Lots 1871-9.</u></span></p>
<p>and so continued till for the <span class='line-break'> </span>year   1876  it ws made $4. for year &amp; $3 for top dressing<span class='line-break'> </span>"   1877   "   "   "   3.75   "   "   "   2.50   "   "   "<span class='line-break'> </span>"   1878   "   "   "   3.50   "   "   "   2.25   "   "   "<span class='line-break'> </span>"   1879   "   "   "   3.00   "   "   "   2.00   "   "   "</p>
<p>It is expected these last figures can be adhered to notwith- <span class='line-break'> </span>standing the advance which is now taking place in the <span class='line-break'> </span>cost of both labor &amp; material.  Proprietors have been given <span class='line-break'> </span>the benefit of all the economies which could be made use <span class='line-break'> </span>of, on the ground that whatever can be accomplished <span class='line-break'> </span>is for the mutual interest of all the parties concerned.<span class='line-break'> </span>The trustees are but servants of the proprietors &amp; are bound<span class='line-break'> </span>to do the work undertaken by them for the smallest possible <span class='line-break'> </span>collection from those paying annually consistent with the <span class='line-break'> </span>strictest care of deposits made by others.  And these methods<span class='line-break'> </span>will unquestionably result in the employment of the Corpo<span class='line-break'></span>-ration solely for all such work.  The Committee do not <span class='line-break'> </span>believe that any other gardeners than those employed <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Corporation should be permitted to undertake <span class='line-break'> </span>the care of Lots within the Cemetery.  In 1871 the Corpo<span class='line-break'></span>-ation had the care of 1454 individual lots for an <span class='line-break'> </span>annual charge &amp; in 1879  the number was 1872 lots.</p>
<p>By far the most important duty of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Com. has been to examine &amp; decide upon estimates <span class='line-break'> </span>for deposits to be made for the perpetual care of lots and <span class='line-break'> </span>monuments or other sturctures thereon.  These estimates are <span class='line-break'> </span>required not only for imediate use but to enable <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors to determine when a suitable provision in</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135481">
<h3><a name="page-1135481">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 239</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>239</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 13. 1880'><u>Jan. 13. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Lots 1871-9.'><u>Report of Com. on Lots 1871-9.</u></span></p>
<p>The final settlement of their estates.  The number of estimates <span class='line-break'> </span>acted upon by the Com. is 552 while for the same time but <span class='line-break'> </span>158 Contracats embracing 171 different lots have been made.<span class='line-break'> </span>For these contracts the total sum of $91.325 has been deposited.<span class='line-break'> </span>In addition Donations have been made on 50 lots amounting <span class='line-break'> </span>to $14.162.  Thirty four lots, for the care of which contracts <span class='line-break'> </span>had been concluded, have been reconveyed in trust to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation, thirteen of them within the past  year.<span class='line-break'> </span>The total number of lots reconveyed is now 63.</p>
<p>The Com. have from time to time scrutinized <span class='line-break'> </span>the results of these transactions as far as they have been <span class='line-break'> </span>developed &amp; have tried in every way possible for them to <span class='line-break'> </span>determine certainly whether their action could be justified<span class='line-break'> </span>or not.</p>
<p>The Repair Fund, into which all these deposits &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>donations are carreid stood on the 1^st January 1871<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows:  Its value then was    69.466.63<span class='line-break'> </span>made up as follows: Donations in Trust 34 Lots   $7.575<span class='line-break'> </span>Deposits for Per. Care with Guaranty   114   "   47.763.50   <u>55.338.80</u><span class='line-break'> </span>Showing the increase on original deposits at that time was   $14.127.83<span class='line-break'> </span>Of this amt. there belongs to the "donation in Trust" liable to ^be used^ at any time   <u>1.878.47</u><span class='line-break'> </span>Leaving the net accumulation of    $12.249.36<span class='line-break'> </span>This constituted a reserve with which to protect &amp; replace<span class='line-break'> </span>in case of destruction, marble monuments &amp; headstones, <span class='line-break'> </span>valued at $64.241;  granite, monuments &amp; headstones<span class='line-break'> </span>"   "   "   10.300;  62 Fences, 30 curbs. 1 Catacomb Tomb.<span class='line-break'> </span>and one vault.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135482">
<h3><a name="page-1135482">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 240</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>240</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 14. 1880.'><u>Jan. 14. 1880.</u></span></p>
<p>===<u>Report of Com. on Lots 1871-9.</u></p>
<p>On the 31^st Dec. 1879 the Fund stood s follows:</p>
<p>Value by Treas's Report   $239.562.30<span class='line-break'> </span>made up as follows:  Donations in Trust on 84 Lots   22.187.</p>
<p>Deposits   "   285   139.088.80<span class='line-break'> </span>"   for grass   "191"   45.952.50<span class='line-break'> </span>"    "  myrtle &amp; c.   <u>450   207.678.30</u><span class='line-break'> </span>showing increase on original deposits at that time   31.884</p>
<p>Of this Amt. there was "Donation in Trust" liable to be used at any time  <u>   2.084.38</u><span class='line-break'> </span>Leaving net accumulation   29.799.62</p>
<p>This constitutes a reserve with which to protect and replace <span class='line-break'> </span>in case of destruction, <u>marble</u> monuments &amp; headstones <span class='line-break'> </span>valued at $134.637; <u>granite</u>   "   "   "<span class='line-break'> </span>"   "   35.435;  108 Fences; 67 curbs; 8 Catacomb Tombs<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; 14 Vaults.</p>
<p>On analyzing it still further, a careful ex<span class='line-break'></span>-amination of all the marble guaranteed has <span class='line-break'> </span>been made for the purpose of ascertaining how <span class='line-break'> </span>large an amount should at this time be set <span class='line-break'> </span>aside for it.  From the best information to be ob<span class='line-break'></span>tained it has been estimated that from the <span class='line-break'> </span>accumulated blance of    19.799.62<span class='line-break'> </span>there should be reserved for marble alone <u>16.331.47</u><span class='line-break'> </span>13.468.15<span class='line-break'> </span>In 1844 $1.000 was voluntarily deposited on Lot <span class='line-break'> </span>#313 and a like sum in 1855 on Lot #1697.<span class='line-break'> </span>The two deposits have increased to $8.203</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135483">
<h3><a name="page-1135483">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 241</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>241</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 14. 1880.'><u>Jan. 14. 1880.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Lots 1871-9.'><u>Report of Com. on Lots 1871-9.</u></span></p>
<p>while the sum needed for the work required is <span class='line-break'> </span>now but $2.439.  Deducting the difference between <span class='line-break'> </span>these two sums say $5.764.00 there is still a balance <span class='line-break'> </span>left of $7.704.15  with which to protect and replace <span class='line-break'> </span>if destroyed <u>granite</u>, monuments &amp; headstones, <span class='line-break'> </span>valued at $35.435;  108 Fences; 67 Curbs, 8 Catacomb <span class='line-break'> </span>Tombs &amp; 14 Vaults.</p>
<p>The condition of the Fund, while it seems to <span class='line-break'> </span>be quite ample for the perforance of everything <span class='line-break'> </span>undertaken, judging of the future by the ex<span class='line-break'></span>perience of the past fifty years, cannot be <span class='line-break'> </span>considered too large for extraordinary emer<span class='line-break'></span>gencies, which may be enountered fifty years <span class='line-break'> </span>or a century hence.  The guaranty given is <span class='line-break'> </span>not for a limited period but for all time.</p>
<p>The Committee have always kept in mind <span class='line-break'> </span>both parties to the contract: the single Proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>who is making provision for the perpetual care <span class='line-break'> </span>of his Lot &amp; all the other Proprietors who are <span class='line-break'> </span>assuming that trust for him.  They have in every <span class='line-break'> </span>case endeavoared to be as true and just by the one <span class='line-break'> </span>as by the other.</p>
<p>The Committee have given no little<span class='line-break'> </span>thought to two other matters which whey will surely <span class='line-break'> </span>be pardoned for alluding to briefly at this time.</p>
<p>One is the rights of widows under the law.<span class='line-break'> </span>As understood now the widow of a deceased proprietor</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135484">
<h3><a name="page-1135484">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 242</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>242</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 14. 1880.'><u>Jan. 14. 1880.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Lots 1871-79.'><u>Report of Com. on Lots 1871-79.</u></span></p>
<p>in the absence of any other special provision has <span class='line-break'> </span>only the right of occupancy during life.  She cannot, <span class='line-break'> </span>if objected to, be appointed a representataive of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot.  She cannot give directions as to its care and <span class='line-break'> </span>use.  She cannot claim the right of burial in <span class='line-break'> </span>it inasmuch as her life interest, whatever that <span class='line-break'> </span>may mean, vanishes at her death. The answer <span class='line-break'> </span>now made to this is that the law is or should<span class='line-break'> </span>be well understood and the remedy, if one <span class='line-break'> </span>is desired, is in the hands of the Proprietor if <span class='line-break'> </span>any embarrassment ensues it is only his own fault.</p>
<p>The fact remains however that as often as <span class='line-break'> </span>these conditions are explained it is a surprise <span class='line-break'> </span>to the proprietor or to the widow as the case may <span class='line-break'> </span>be. The difficulty undoubtedly grews out of the <span class='line-break'> </span>confused nature of the property.  The Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>really sells the right of burial; in a sense &amp; as an <span class='line-break'> </span>ultimate result retaining to itself the fee of the land;<span class='line-break'> </span>which at the same time an unnecessary form is <span class='line-break'> </span>adopted for the conveyance &amp; the charter expressly <span class='line-break'> </span>provides that this right shall be held as real estate.</p>
<p>The other subject referred to is the alienation <span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots after interments have been made.  Instances <span class='line-break'> </span>have come to the knowledge of the Committee where <span class='line-break'> </span>the person inheriting a lot has had the original <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor &amp; member of his family removed therefrom <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; has sold the lot for the purpose of turning it</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135485">
<h3><a name="page-1135485">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 243</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>243</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 14. 1880.'><u>Jan. 14. 1880.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of the Com. on Lots 1871-9.'><u>Report of the Com. on Lots 1871-9.</u></span></p>
<p>To the best possible account for his pocket; an ex<span class='line-break'></span>hibition of theft which could scarcely have been<span class='line-break'> </span>contemplated by the first purchaser.  Some pro<span class='line-break'></span>vision should certainly be devised which would <span class='line-break'> </span>make such vandalism absolutely impossible.</p>
<p>The Committee venture to hope that <span class='line-break'> </span>neither of the subjects will be lost sight of <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Trustees until fairly settled in the <span class='line-break'> </span>interest of the Proprietors.</p>
<p>The Committee cannot close <span class='line-break'> </span>this report without testifying heartily to the prompt<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; cheerful assistance they have invariable received <span class='line-break'> </span>from Mr. Lovering, the Supt. of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>and Mr. Reed, the Secretary of the Corporation.<span class='line-break'> </span>These two officials are named because <span class='line-break'> </span>they are the only ones with whom the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>have been constantly brought in contact.</p>
<p>All of which is respectfully submitted.</p>
<p>Signed {S. T. Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>{W^m {Perkins<span class='line-break'> </span>{Natl J. Bradlee</p>
<p><u>Boston Jan. 14. 1880    Commitee on Los </u></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135486">
<h3><a name="page-1135486">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 244</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feb. 11. 1880'><u>Feb. 11. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><u>February 11. 1880</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>Feby. 11. at 3 1/2 P. M.</p>
<p>Present:  the President, Mess. Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Eaton, Jones, Lawrence, Payson, Rice,<span class='line-break'> </span>Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>The record of the Meeting Jan 14. read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Names of Trustees elected Feby 2. 1880'><u>Names of Trustees elected Feby 2. 1880</u></span></p>
<p>By request of the  President the Secretary read<span class='line-break'> </span>the Record of the Annual Meeting of Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>held Feby 2^d at which Trustees were elected as <span class='line-break'> </span>follows:</p>
<p>Mr.<u>I. M. Spelman</u>} For the term of <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; " <u>Jerome Jones</u>} <u>6 years</u> ending <u>1886</u>  [note "6" double underline]</p>
<p>Mr. <u>Samuel R. Payson</u> For <u>2 years</u> ending <u>1882</u>  [note "2" double underline]</p>
<p>Mr. <u>William S. Eaton</u> } For the term of <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp;  "  <u>Roger Wolcott</u> } <u>1 year</u> ending <u>1881</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of I. M. Spelman President'><u>Election of I. M. Spelman President</u></span></p>
<p>Mr. Wolcott having been appointed to <span class='line-break'> </span>collect &amp; count the ballots for Officers for the <span class='line-break'> </span>ensuing year announced that the whole number for <span class='line-break'> </span><u>President</u> was    <u>10</u></p>
<p>all of which were for <u>I. M. Spelman</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and^he^ ws declared elected.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135487">
<h3><a name="page-1135487">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 245</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>245</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby 11. 1880'><u>Feby 11. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='H. B. Mackintosh Treasurer'><u>H. B. Mackintosh Treasurer</u></span></p>
<p>whole number for <u>Treasurer </u>  <u>11</u></p>
<p>all of which were for <u>H.B.Mackintosh</u></p>
<p>and he was declared elected.</p>
<p>whole number for <u>Secretary</u>  <u>11</u></p>
<p>all of which were for <u>J.Harris Reed</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and he was declared elected.</p>
<p>whole numbmer for <u>Superintendent</u>  <u>11</u></p>
<p>all of which were for <u>J. W. Loveirng</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and he was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Treas. &amp; Secty.'><u>Salary of Treas. &amp; Secty.</u></span></p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the <u>Salary</u> of the <u>Treasurer</u><span class='line-break'> </span>be fixed at <u>$2.250</u>;  and the <u>Salary</u> of <u> Secretary</u><span class='line-break'> </span>at <u>$1.500</u> for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Supt.'><u>Salary of Supt.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the <u>Salary </u> of the <u>Superintendent</u><span class='line-break'> </span>be fixed at <u>$12.759</u> for the ensuing year, and that he <span class='line-break'> </span>shall have the use of a house &amp; the grounds thereto belonging, the use of a horse &amp; vehicle<span class='line-break'> </span>and the services of one man at the expense <span class='line-break'> </span>of the corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Standing C ommittees 1880-1'><u>Standing C ommittees 1880-1</u></span></p>
<p>As provided in the Rules &amp; Regulations <span class='line-break'> </span>the President appointed</p>
<p>The <u>Standing Committees</u></p>
<p>for <u>1880 &amp; 1881</u></p>
<p>as follows:</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feb 11. 1880'><u>Feb 11. 1880</u></span></p>
<p>made a motion to reconsider the acceptance &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>adoption of the Report of the Com. on Lots fixing <span class='line-break'> </span>prices &amp; which motion was laid on the table]<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Com. on Lots'><u>Referred to Com. on Lots</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the two subjects of the Prices<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots and the deposit required for the per<span class='line-break'></span>petual care of grass be referred to the new<span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t.'><u>Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t.</u></span></p>

<div id="page-1135490">
<h3><a name="page-1135490">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 248</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>248</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk S. S. March 11. 1880</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary&apos;s Oath 1880.'><u>Secretary's Oath</u> 1880.</span></p>
<p>Personally appeared J. Harris Reed and <span class='line-break'> </span>made oath that he would faithfully discharge the <span class='line-break'> </span>duties appertaining to the Office of Secretary of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Before me</p>
<p>H. B. MacKintosh</p>
<p>Justice of the peace</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 10. 1880'><u>March 10. 1880</u></span></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified, on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>March 10. 1880.</p>
<p>Present The President, Mess. Bigelow,Browne<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Eaton, Jones, Lawrence,Rice, Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>The Records of the Meeting of Jan. 14. read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on Lots on Prices of Lots Accepted and Prices adopted.'><u>Report Com. on Lots on Prices of Lots Accepted and Prices adopted.</u></span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots, to whom was referred the <span class='line-break'> </span>the two subjects of the price of Lots and the price <span class='line-break'> </span>for perpetual care of grass, made a written report ^95^<span class='line-break'> </span>and on motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Report ^95^ be acceted and the<span class='line-break'> </span>prices shown on the plan presented with said report <span class='line-break'> </span>be adopted.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135491">
<h3><a name="page-1135491">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 249</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>249</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 10.1880'><u>March 10.1880</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Plan for small Lots'><u>Plan for small Lots</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented a plan,^96^ prepared by <span class='line-break'> </span>the  Superintendent, for a series of Lots of two sizes<span class='line-break'> </span>namely 165 and 80 square feet on Clethra and <span class='line-break'> </span>Kalmia Paths, on motion it was,</p>
<p>===<u>adopted</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the plan ^96^ presented be adopted <span class='line-break'> </span>and the Supt. be authorized to prepare the Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>as shown thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perpetual care of grass, statement concerning'><u>Perpetual care of grass, statement concerning</u></span></p>
<p>The President in calling the attention of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board to the subject of the price for the per<span class='line-break'></span>petual care of grass, which in the written <span class='line-break'> </span>report of the Com. on Lots was referred back <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Board without recommendation, presented <span class='line-break'> </span>a Statement^97^ prepared from figures furnished <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Superintendent, and after a full ex<span class='line-break'></span>planation it was unanimously</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='deposit for fixed at 75 cts pr. foot on [quote]Landscape Lawn, Com. on Lots to increase on certain Lots.'><u>deposit for fixed at 75 cts pr. foot on [quote]Landscape Lawn, Com. on Lots to increase on certain Lots.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the deposit required for <span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual care of grass on lots laid out <span class='line-break'> </span>on the landscape lawn plan be seventy five <span class='line-break'> </span>(75) cents per square foot:  and that the Com.<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots be authorized to increase that charge, <span class='line-break'> </span>as in their judgement it shall seem best, on <span class='line-break'> </span>all Lots which from steep banks, fencing &amp; <span class='line-break'> </span>obstructions of any kind involve a greater <span class='line-break'> </span>expense to keep them in good order.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watering Streets'><u>Watering Streets</u></span></p>
<p>On motion <u>Voted</u>:  That the matter of watering the streets<span class='line-break'> </span>in the vicinity of the Cemetery for 1880 be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the President with full power.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135492">
<h3><a name="page-1135492">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 250</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>250</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 10. 1880.'><u>March 10. 1880.</u></span></p>
<p>The Chairman of the Com. on Lots explaining<span class='line-break'> </span>the reasons it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deeds #4610-11 with inter&apos;vn. Space'><u>Deeds #4610-11 with inter'vn. Space</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Secretary issue Deeds <span class='line-break'> </span>for Lots #4610 &amp; 11 without intervening space.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secty&apos;s Salary incarease of ref^d to Spec. Com.'><u>Secty's Salary incarease of ref^d to Spec. Com.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the subject of the increase <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Salary of Secretary be referred to the Pres^t<span class='line-break'> </span>and the Com. on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Special Com. appointed to report on '><u>Special Com. appointed to report on </u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That a Committee consisting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the President &amp; Mess Choate &amp; Wolcott be appointed <span class='line-break'> </span>to report full information under the following<span class='line-break'> </span>Vote passed at the last Annual Meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors Feby 2 1880,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote in relation to Hort. Society passed at Annual Meeting Feby 2. 1880. '><u>Vote in relation to Hort. Society passed at Annual Meeting Feby 2. 1880. </u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Trustees be and hereby are <span class='line-break'> </span>directed to examine into the continued payments <span class='line-break'> </span>made to the Horticultural Society, to employ<span class='line-break'> </span>Counsel and to take such other steps as may <span class='line-break'> </span>seem advisable for the purpose of finally <span class='line-break'> </span>adjusting and separating whatever interests <span class='line-break'> </span>may still appear to exist between the two <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporations and report their action hereunder<span class='line-break'> </span>at the next meeting of the Proprietors.^33^[?]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills Ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>Monthly Bills Ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills &amp; Schedules <span class='line-break'> </span>of same amounting to $3.025 21/100 having been submitted</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Bills be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>President for his approval &amp; payment by Treasurer.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135493">

<p>The Secretary presented a Statement ^98^of Sales of <span class='line-break'> </span>land reported by Supt. &amp; approved by Com. on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>from Feby 11 to date</p>

<div id="page-1135494">
<h3><a name="page-1135494">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 252</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>252</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 14. 1880'><u>April 14. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><u>April 14. 1880. </u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>April 14. 1880.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Cotting, Jones, Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>Records of the Meeting Mch. 10. read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com^n John R. Poor ref^d to Com. on Lots'><u>Com^n John R. Poor ref^d to Com. on Lots</u></span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr Choate it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Communication ^94.^ of John <span class='line-break'> </span>R. Poor, which was laid on the table, be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com. on Lots with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#4491 Petition to erect Headstone over 1&apos;-6inches granted'><u>#4491 Petition to erect Headstone over 1'-6inches granted</u></span></p>
<p>The Petition ^99^ of J. D. Lilly atty. for Mrs. Foster <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietor of Lot #4491, asking permission to <span class='line-break'> </span>erect on said Lot a headstone exceeding 2 feet <span class='line-break'> </span>6 inches in height, was presented &amp; it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That permission be granted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='The granting of similar petitions'><u>The granting of similar petitions</u></span></p>
<p>In connection with the above vote Mr. Cotting <span class='line-break'> </span>called attention to the granting Petitions<span class='line-break'> </span>similar to the above, after a full discussion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt. to prepare Statement in regard to No.'><u>Supt. to prepare Statement in regard to No.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Supt., at the next meeting, <span class='line-break'> </span>furnish a statement of the number of headstones<span class='line-break'> </span>exceeding 2'6" in height erected on Lots sold <span class='line-break'> </span>under Deed form "B" "Landscape Lawn," &amp; also the <span class='line-break'> </span>number of Interments made in said Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secty&apos;s Salary Report on accepted.'><u>Secty's Salary Report on accepted.</u></span></p>
<p>The Com. to whom was ref^d the subject of increase of <span class='line-break'> </span>Secty's Salary report no action, as Secty. has withdrawn his application.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  To accept said report</p>
</div>

<p>The Treasurer's Statements^100^ for the quarter ending <span class='line-break'> </span>March 31^st were presented.<span class='line-break'> </span>Secty's Statement ^101^ Sales of Land accepted &amp; ordered filfed ^101.^</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That they be referred to Com. on Finance.</p>

<p><u>Dissolved</u>  J. Harris Reed, Secretary</p>

</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135496">
<h3><a name="page-1135496">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 254</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>254</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May.12.1880'><u>May.12.1880</u></span></p>
<p><u>May 12. 1880</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was notified to be held on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>May 12. at 3 1/2 o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. Bigelow, Jones,<span class='line-break'> </span>Rice, Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>No quorum being present the meeting</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u></p>
<p>J.Harris Reed</p>
<p>Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 9. 1880'><u>June 9. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><u>June 9. 1880</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>June 9 at 3 1/2 o'clock P. M.   Records of last meeting read &amp; app^d.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. Browne, Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>Eaton, Jones, Lawrence, Rice &amp; Whitney.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Proposition of Hiram W. Fisher in regard to bequest of $2.000 for Lot #2786'><u> Proposition of Hiram W. Fisher in regard to bequest of $2.000 for Lot #2786</u></span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne presented a proposition^102.^<span class='line-break'> </span>from Mr. Hiram W. Fisher, Extr. of the Will of <span class='line-break'> </span>Hiram Fisher, deceased, who was Proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of Lot #2786, to erect a Sarcophagus on said <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot to be paid for from the bequest in said <span class='line-break'> </span>Will of $2.000 to the Proprietors of Mt. Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, on motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref^d to Com. on Los.'><u>Ref^d to Com. on Los.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  Taht the proposition be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com. on Lots with full power</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135497">
<h3><a name="page-1135497">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 255</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>255</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 9. 1880'><u>June 9. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Headstones Supt&apos;s Report on'><u>Headstones Supt's Report on</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented the Report ^103^ of Superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent showing the number of Headstones ex<span class='line-break'></span>ceeding 2' - 6" on Lots sold under Deeds Form <span class='line-break'> </span>B. "Landscape Law plan;" on motion of Mr. Choate</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secty to notify Proprietors on Stone Farm in regard to Headstones Conditions in Deed to be enforced'><u>Secty to notify Proprietors on Stone Farm in regard to Headstones Conditions in Deed to be enforced</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That <del>that</del> the Secretary is hereby <span class='line-break'> </span>directed to notify owners of Lots on the "Stone <span class='line-break'> </span>Farm" who have erected, without authority of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees, headstones now there more than <span class='line-break'> </span>2'-6" in height that the same should be <span class='line-break'> </span>removed in accordance with the condition of <span class='line-break'> </span>their deeds.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Superintendent is hereby <span class='line-break'> </span>directed in allowing the erection of headstones <span class='line-break'> </span>in Lots on the "Stone Farm" to enforce the conditions <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Deeds of Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Headstones on Small Lots Subject ref^d to Com. on Lots.'><u>Headstones on Small Lots Subject ref^d to Com. on Lots.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the subject of Headstones<span class='line-break'> </span>on the small lots (sold under Deeds Form B.<span class='line-break'> </span>in the older part of the Cemetery) already <span class='line-break'> </span>erected exceeding 2'-6" in height, be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com. on Lots to consider &amp; report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition of W. B. Churchill Lot #244 action on.'><u>Petition of W. B. Churchill Lot #244 action on.</u></span></p>
<p>The Petition ^104^ of William B. Churchill in <span class='line-break'> </span>regard to the Petition for Rep. of Lot #244<span class='line-break'> </span>now on file was presented; on motion</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That his name be inserted in <span class='line-break'> </span>said Petition ^&amp; his Petition filed therewith ^or he may present a new Petition <span class='line-break'> </span>for action <del>on</del> by the Board of Trustees.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135498">
<h3><a name="page-1135498">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 256</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>256</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 9.1880 changed Hour of Meeting Board of Trustees.'><u>June 9.1880 changed Hour of Meeting Board of Trustees</u>.</span></p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the hour of the regular <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Board of Trustees be at 2 P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>until otherwise ordered.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deed of Add&apos;n to #310 to be issued without deposit.'><u>Deed of Add'n to #310 to be issued without deposit</u>.</span></p>
<p>The President for the Com. on Lots, he <span class='line-break'> </span>explaining the reasons therefor, presented the <span class='line-break'> </span>following votes which were passed</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Secretary be author<span class='line-break'></span>ied to issue a Deed for an Addition to <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #310 Heirs of W^m. Stlurgis, without a deposit <span class='line-break'> </span>for the perpetual care of grass.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#3303 Re-conveyance of authorized.'><u>#3303 Re-conveyance of authorized.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Secty. be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to accept a re=conveyance of Lot #3303 from<span class='line-break'> </span>the Heirs of Mary Pycott as part payment <span class='line-break'> </span>for Lot #2154 sold to William S. Pycott and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved by Com. on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Treasurer 1870 to 1880'><u>Statement Treasurer 1870 to 1880</u></span>[note double underline under dates]</p>
<p>The President presented a Statement ^105^<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Treasurer showing the transactions <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Repair Fund &amp; the General Fund with <span class='line-break'> </span>the Amounts due &amp; uncollected during the ten <span class='line-break'> </span>years 1870 to 1880 &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Statement ^105^ be filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p>The file of Monthly Bills (2 months) and the <span class='line-break'> </span>Schedules of same amounting to $6.408.27 &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>$5.110.24 were presented</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Bills be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Pres^t for his approval &amp; payment by Treas.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135499">

<div class="page-content">
<p>257</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 9. 1880'><u>June 9. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Sales Stat^mt^ filed.'><u>Monthly Sales Stat^mt^ filed.</u></span></p>
<p>The Secty presented two Statements ^106 &amp;107.^of Sales of <span class='line-break'> </span>land reported by Supt &amp; approved by Com. on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>from April 14 to date.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Statements be filed.</p>

<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended the <span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual care with guaranty of Lots as follows:</p>

<div id="page-1135500">
<h3><a name="page-1135500">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 258</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>258</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 14. 1880'><u>July 14. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><u>July 14. 1880</u>===</p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>July 14.  at 2 o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present - The President, Mess. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Eaton, Jones, Lawrence, Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>The Record of the last meeting read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #788 &amp; 875.  Proprietors petition to re-convey for Re-location.'><u>Lot #788 &amp; 875.  Proprietors petition to re-convey for Re-location.</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented the request of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of Lots #788 &amp; 875, A. H. Ramsay and <span class='line-break'> </span>David Humphrey, that they might reconvey their <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots to the Corporation for the purpose of re-location.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref^d to Com. on Lots &amp; Mr. Wolcott.'><u>Ref^d to Com. on Lots &amp; Mr. Wolcott.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the question of the re-location<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots #788 &amp; 875 in a legal form be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Com. on Lots &amp; Mr. Wolcott.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deed for Add&apos;n to #2545 to be issued without deposit.'><u>Deed for Add'n to #2545 to be issued without deposit.</u></span></p>
<p>The Chairman of the C om. on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>explaining the reason therefor</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Secretary be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to issue  Deed for an Addition tol ot #1545 <span class='line-break'> </span>Geo. B. Neal without a deposit for the care of<span class='line-break'> </span>the sodding &amp; turfing thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos; Quarterly Reports Com. on Finance report on - filed.'><u>Treas' Quarterly Reports Com. on Finance report on - filed.</u></span></p>
<p>the Com. on Finance reported that they <span class='line-break'> </span>had examined &amp; found correct the Treasurer's <span class='line-break'> </span>Quarterly Report Mch 31^100^ &amp; June 30. ^109^ 1880</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Report be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>the Reports ^{100,109^ be filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposition of H. W. Fisher'><u>Proposition of H. W. Fisher</u></span></p>
<p>In connection with the proposition^102^ of Hiram <span class='line-break'> </span>E. Fisher (in regard to the bequest of $2.000 by his</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135501">
<h3><a name="page-1135501">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 259</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>259</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 14. 1880'><u>July 14. 1880</u></span></p>
<p>father, deceased, Proprietor of Lot #2786)  which at the <span class='line-break'> </span>last meeting was referred to the Com. on Lots,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='deposition in regard to the intention of Testator laid on table'><u>deposition in regard to the intention of Testator laid on table</u></span></p>
<p>the President presented a deposition ^102 1/2^ explaining <span class='line-break'> </span>the Testator's ^intentions^ as to the use of the $2.000 bequeathed,<span class='line-break'> </span>after a discussion it was, owing to the absence <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mr. Browne, who presented the proposition</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the deposition ^102 1/2^ be laid on <span class='line-break'> </span>the table.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Headstones over 2 feet 6 inches  Sketch of presented, Report Com. on Lots on Headstones in small Lots.'><u>Headstones over 2 feet 6 inches  Sketch of presented, Report Com. on Lots on Headstones in small Lots.</u></span></p>
<p>The subject of the erections of Headstones<span class='line-break'> </span>exceeding 2' - 6" in height was again brought <span class='line-break'> </span>up and the President presented sketches ^108^<span class='line-break'> </span>prepared by Supt. showing the stones already <span class='line-break'> </span>erected above that height;  he also reported erbally <span class='line-break'> </span>on behalf of the Com. on Lots, that no action <span class='line-break'> </span>was required in regard to the stones exceed<span class='line-break'></span>-ing 2'-6" already erected on Clether, Althaea<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Cyclamen Paths, but recommending that in <span class='line-break'> </span>the future ^the^ condition in the Deeds of these Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>be strictly enforced &amp; to attain that object <span class='line-break'> </span>most effectively not only on those paths, but <span class='line-break'> </span>also in the "Stone Farm" presenting the follow<span class='line-break'> </span>-ing-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary&apos;s duty in issuing Permits for Headstones'><u>Secretary's duty in issuing Permits for Headstones</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That it sahll be the duty of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary before giving Permits for the en<span class='line-break'></span>trance of headstones &amp; monuments into the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery to inquire into the dimensions, shape, <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; other particulars of said stones &amp; measurements</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135502">
<h3><a name="page-1135502">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 260</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>260</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 14. 1880'><u>July 14. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='authorized to require rough sketch'><u>authorized to require rough sketch</u></span></p>
<p>and the place where they are to be erected;<span class='line-break'> </span>and for this purpose he is authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>require a rough sketch of the same if <span class='line-break'> </span>necessary; and if the Secretary is satisfied<span class='line-break'> </span>conditions of the deeds of the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Lots on which it is proposed they<span class='line-break'> </span>shall be placed &amp; to the other regulations<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery he shall grant no permit<span class='line-break'> </span>for their entrance unless authorized so to do <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Board of Trustees.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. accepted &amp; Voted passed.'><u>Report Com. accepted &amp; Voted passed.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  To accept the Report of the Com. &amp; <span class='line-break'> </span><u>pass the <i>vote</i> as recommended.</u> [note double underline inder word "vote"]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secty to notify Proprietors'><u>Secty to notify Proprietors</u></span></p>
<p>It was also</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Secretary notify <span class='line-break'> </span>those Proprietors, who have alredy erected, <span class='line-break'> </span>without permission of the board, headstones <span class='line-break'> </span>on the "Stone Farm" over 2'-6" high, of the fact <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; that they must petition the Board to <span class='line-break'> </span>allow such stones to remain.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos;s Quarterly Statement Ref^d to Com. on Finance'><u>Treas's Quarterly Statement Ref^d to Com. on Finance</u></span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's Statements for the Quarter <span class='line-break'> </span>ending June 30.^109^ were presented</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That they be ref^d to Com. on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales Statement filed.'><u>Sales Statement filed.</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented Statement ^110^ of land<span class='line-break'> </span>sold from June 9 to date</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Statement ^110^ be accepted &amp; filed.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135503">
<h3><a name="page-1135503">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 261</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>261</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 14. 1880 Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>July 14. 1880 Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p>The usual File of Bills and Schedule of <span class='line-break'> </span>same amounting $5.585.21 was presented.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Bills be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Pres^t. for his approval &amp; payment by Treas.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'><u>Representatives Lot Nos.</u></span></p>
<p>Representatives were appointed as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='162'>162</span></p>
<p>Francis G. L. Henderson   of   Newton   nephew   of D. P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='945'>945</span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Aug. 11. 1880'><u>Aug. 11. 1880</u></span></p>
<p>August 11. 1880</p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting, was notified <span class='line-break'> </span>for Wednesday Aug 11. at 2 P.M.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='No Quorum'><u>No Quorum</u></span></p>
<p>No quorum being present <span class='line-break'> </span>no meeting was held.</p>

<div id="page-1135504">
<h3><a name="page-1135504">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 262</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>262</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sept. 8. 1880. '><u>Sept. 8. 1880. </u></span></p>
<p><u>September 8. 1880</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>Sept. 8. at 2 o'clk P. M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. Bigelow, Browne, <span class='line-break'> </span>Cotting, Eaton, Jones &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Browne, the reading of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Record of the last meeting was dispensed with.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Re-location Lots #788 &amp; 875  Report on accepted &amp; adopted.'><u>Re-location Lots #788 &amp; 875  Report on accepted &amp; adopted.</u></span></p>
<p>The special Com. to whom was referred <span class='line-break'> </span>the application for re-location of Lots # 788 &amp; 875<span class='line-break'> </span>presented a written Report ^111^, on motion</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Report ^111^  be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>the recommendation therein be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition John R. Poor for re-location #3119 granted.'><u>Petition John R. Poor for re-location #3119 granted.</u></span></p>
<p>The Pres^t. presented the Petition ^112^ of John R. <span class='line-break'> </span>Poor for the re-location &amp; division of his Lot #3119.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Petition ^112^ be granted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition of Thos. L. Smith Lot #451  about Headstone laid on table.'><u>Petition of Thos. L. Smith Lot #451  about Headstone laid on table.</u></span></p>
<p>The Petition ^113^ of Thos. L. Smith, that a head<span class='line-break'></span>stone exceeding 2'-6" erected ^on^ his Lot #4531<span class='line-break'> </span>on the "Stone Farm: be allowed to remain, was <span class='line-break'> </span>presented, on motion of Mr. Brown it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Petition ^113^ be laid on the <span class='line-break'> </span>table until the Petitions in several cases, (under<span class='line-break'> </span>Vote July 14) be presented.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition Miss Bartlett for Headstone on #4494 refused'><u>Petition Miss Bartlett for Headstone on #4494 refused</u></span></p>
<p>the Petition ^114^  of Miss. Bartlett to erect a headstone <span class='line-break'> </span>over 2'-6" on Lot #4494 "Stone Farm: was presented.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Secty notify Miss Bartlett, that <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees cannot grant the permission asked.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135505">
<h3><a name="page-1135505">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 263</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>263</p>
<p>===<u>Sept. 8. 1880</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Petition of T. M. Merriman for 3 Interments'><u> Petition of T. M. Merriman for 3 Interments</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented a Communication ^115^ from <span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. T. M.Merriman asking the privilege of making <span class='line-break'> </span>Three (3) interments in grave #156 St. James Lot</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='granted.'><u>granted.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the privilege be granted to <span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Merriman <u>provided</u>  that it does not conflict<span class='line-break'> </span>with any Regulation of the Board of Health or<span class='line-break'> </span>Statute of the Commonwealth.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition W. B. Churchill for Rep. #244'><u>Petition W. B. Churchill for Rep. #244</u></span></p>
<p>The request ^116^ of W. B. Churchill, to have a <span class='line-break'> </span>new Petition (contain^in^g a correct list of Residuary <span class='line-break'> </span>Devisees)  for Representation of Lot #244 substituted <span class='line-break'> </span>for the one passed Nov. 12. 1879, was presented</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='granted.'><u>granted.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the new Petition for Rep. of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot  #244 be substituted for the one passed <span class='line-break'> </span>Nov. 12. 1879 &amp; that both be filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Communication P. O. Brien &amp; Son'><u>Communication P. O. Brien &amp; Son</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented a Communication^117^<span class='line-break'> </span>from P. O'Brien and Son requesting a hearing <span class='line-break'> </span>in regard to certain charges made by them <span class='line-break'> </span>as ^to^ treatment received by them at the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='hearing granted.'><u>hearing granted</u>.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That a hearing be granted to <span class='line-break'> </span>P. O'Brien &amp; Son, on Saturday Sept. 25 at 2 P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span><u>provided</u> they present <u>Specifi charges </u> to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary at least one week before the date <span class='line-break'> </span>fixed for the hearing.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>Monthly Bills ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills (2 months) &amp; Schedules <span class='line-break'> </span>of same amounting to $4.479.28 &amp; 4.524.23 presented.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  Taht said Bills be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Pres^t. for his approval &amp; payment by Treas.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<div class="page-content">
<p>264</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sept. 8. 1880.'><u>Sept. 8. 1880.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statmt. Sales accepted &amp; filed.'><u>Statmt. Sales accepted &amp; filed.</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement of Sales <span class='line-break'> </span>of Land reported by Supt &amp; app^d by Com. on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>from July 14 to date.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Statment ^118^ be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P.C. with G.'><u>P.C. with G.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#449'><u>#449</u></span></p>
<p><u>#449</u>  #[Pend?  for $<u>500.</u> [note double underline]</p>

<p><u>4118-19-20</u>}</p>

<p><u>4166-4211</u>}   Amory  :  $<u>1.835</u>[note double underline]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurred in.'><u>Concurred in.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  Tht ^sai^ contracts be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'><u>Representatives Lot Nos.</u></span></p>
<p>Representatiaves were apointed as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='711'>711</span></p>
<p>Susan O. Brooks   of Boston   Widow   of D. P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1363'>1363</span></p>
<p>George B. Upton   "   "   son   "   "   "</p>

<p>William w. Burrage   "   Cambridge   "   "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3496'>3496</span></p>
<p>George R. Baldwin   "   N. Woburn husband   "</p>

<div id="page-1135507">
<h3><a name="page-1135507">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 265</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>265</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sept. 25. 1880'><u>Sept. 25. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><u>September 25. 1880</u></p>
<p>An adjourned meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Saturday Sept 25 at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present,  The President Mess. Bigelow, Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>Cotting, Jones, Rice &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>The reading of the Record of the meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>Sept. 8 dispensed with.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hearing P. O&apos;Brien &amp; Son'><u>Hearing P. O'Brien &amp; Son</u></span></p>
<p>This meeting was held for the purpose of <span class='line-break'> </span>hearing Mess. P. O'Brien &amp; Son in their Petition <span class='line-break'> </span>presented at the last meeting, they having filed <span class='line-break'> </span>Specifications ^119^ with the Secretary in accordance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the Vote passed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Counsel makes Statement'><u>Counsel makes Statement</u></span></p>
<p>Hon. Chas. T. Russell appeared for the <span class='line-break'> </span>Petitioners &amp; made a statement of their case, <span class='line-break'> </span>disclaiming however any desire for a formal <span class='line-break'> </span>hearing &amp; presenting of evidence.  At conclusion <span class='line-break'> </span>of his remarks the Petitioners &amp; their counsel <span class='line-break'> </span>withdrew.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='subject ref^d to Committee on Grounds.'><u>subject ref^d to Committee on Grounds.</u></span></p>
<p>After a full discussion of the matter it <span class='line-break'> </span>was on motion of Mr. Rice</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>  That the whole subject be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Grounds to investigate <span class='line-break'> </span>and report on at the next meeting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees.</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u>   J. Harris Reed</p>
<p>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135508">
<h3><a name="page-1135508">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 266</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. 13. 1880'><u>Oct. 13. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><u>October 13. 1880</u></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>Oct. 13. at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Cotting, Eaton, Jones, Rice, Whitney and <span class='line-break'> </span>Wolcott.</p>
<p>The Record of the meeting of Sept. 8 &amp; 25^th<span class='line-break'> </span>read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Com. on Grounds on P. O&apos;Brien &amp; Son&apos;s Com&apos;n leave to withdraw accepted &amp; adopted.'><u>Report Com. on Grounds on P. O'Brien &amp; Son's Com'n leave to withdraw accepted &amp; adopted.</u></span></p>
<p>The President for the Committee on Grounds,<span class='line-break'> </span>to whom was referred the subject of the Petition <span class='line-break'> </span>of P. O'Brien &amp; Son presented a written Report, ^120^<span class='line-break'> </span>with a recommendation that the Petitioner's have leave to withdraw &amp; on motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Report ^120^ be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>the recommendation therein be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hiram W. Fisher Prop #2786 Proposition in regard to bequest $2.000'><u>Hiram W. Fisher Prop #2786 Proposition in regard to bequest $2.000</u></span></p>
<p>The Proposition ^102^ of Mr. Hiram W. Fisher <span class='line-break'> </span>in regard to a bequest of $2.000 for Lot #2786, <span class='line-break'> </span>which at the meeting of June 9, 1880 was <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Com. on Lots with full power,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; the Deposition ^102 1/2^ explaining said bequest, which <span class='line-break'> </span>at the meeting of July 14. 1880 was laid on the <span class='line-break'> </span>table, were both taken up - after a full expla<span class='line-break'></span>nation &amp; discussion on motion of Mr. Eaton it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted with Bond.'><u>accepted with Bond.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the proposition ^102^ of Mr. Hiram <span class='line-break'> </span>W. Fisher as to the use of the Bequest of $2.000<span class='line-break'> </span>by his father be accepted, <u>on condition</u> that</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. 13. 1880'><u>Oct. 13. 1880</u></span></p>
<p>he executes a Bond ^121^ satisfactory to the President <span class='line-break'> </span>and Mr. Choate, holding the Proprietors harm<span class='line-break'></span>less for the deviation from the terms of the bequest.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'><u>Monthly Bills</u></span></p>
<p>The Monthly Bills &amp; Schedule of the same <span class='line-break'> </span>amounting to $4.761.55 was submitted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Bills be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Pres^t for his approval of payment by Treas^r.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales'><u>Statement Sales</u></span></p>
<p>The Secty. presented a Statement ^122^ of the Sales <span class='line-break'> </span>of Land <del>fr</del> reported by Supt &amp; app^d by Com. on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>from Sept. 8. to Oct. 13.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted &amp; filed'><u>accepted &amp; filed</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Statement ^122^be accepted &amp; filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos; Quartly St&apos;mts ref^d to Com. on Finance'><u>Treas' Quartly St'mts ref^d to Com. on Finance</u></span></p>
<p>The Treas'r's Statements ^123^ for the Quarter ending <span class='line-break'> </span>Sept. 3-. was presented.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That they ^123^ be referred to the Com. on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P.C. with G. #3524 &amp; 3534 Concurred in. '><u>P.C. with G. #3524 &amp; 3534 Concurred in. </u></span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended the <span class='line-break'> </span>Perp. Care with G. of Lots #3524 &amp; 34 {Hammond {Clarke for $700.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That saidContract be concurred in.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='119'>119</span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 10. 1880'><u>Nov. 10. 1880</u></span></p>
<p><u>November 10. 1880.</u></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees was held, as notified, <span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday November 10^th at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>Eaton, Jones, Lawrence, Rice &amp; Whitney.</p>
<p>Records of the meeting of Oct. 13^th read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Spec. Com. on Vote passed at An. meeting to inquire into Relations with Mass. Hort. Soc.  acc&apos;p^d &amp; laid on table.'><u>Report of Spec. Com. on Vote passed at An. meeting to inquire into Relations with Mass. Hort. Soc.  acc'p^d &amp; laid on table.</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented the written <span class='line-break'> </span>Report ^124^  of the Special Committee appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>March 10. 1880 to report full information <span class='line-break'> </span>under the Vote passed at the Annual Meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Proprietors Feby 2. 1880 &amp; recorded on Page<span class='line-break'> </span>250 of this Volume - on motion of Mr Lawrence</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Report be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and laid on the table.</p>

<p>The Petitions ^113^ of the Proprietors ^for names &amp; Nos. see next Page.^ of six Lots</p>

<p>on the Stone Farm, on which Headstones <span class='line-break'> </span>exceeding 2' - 6" have been erected without <span class='line-break'> </span>permission, requesting they be allowed to <span class='line-break'> </span>remain, were presented.  On motion</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Petitions be granted.</p>

<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Statement ^125^ be <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted and filed.</p>

<p>The Com. on Lots recommended the Perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>Care with G. of Lot #22 - Gates for $350.</p>

<div id="page-1135512">
<h3><a name="page-1135512">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 270</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>270</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 10. 1880.'>Nov. 10. 1880.</span></p>
<p>Names of Proprietors &amp; Nos. of their Lots, who petitioned<span class='line-break'> </span>to have Headstones exceeding 2'6" in height (already<span class='line-break'> </span>erected) remain [For action see preceding Page]</p>
<p>#4412 George L. Foot #4533 Geo. W. S. Huse<span class='line-break'> </span>4508 Harriet M. Willoughby 4539 Nehemiah Gibson<span class='line-break'> </span>4531 Thos. L. Smith 4551 William [Muller?].</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 8. 1880'>Dec. 8. 1880</span></p>
<p><u>December 8. 1880</u></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday,<span class='line-break'> </span>Dec. 8. 1880. at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Cotting, Eaton, Jones, Rice,<span class='line-break'> </span>Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>The records of the meeting of Nov. 10. were<span class='line-break'> </span>read &amp; after amendment approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Prest to prepare Annual Report.'>Pres<sup>t</sup> to prepare Annual Report.</span></p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the President be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to prepare the Annual Report of the Trustees to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Spec. Com. on Mass. Hort.&apos;l Soc. taken up, action'>Report Spec. Com. on Mass. Hort.'l Soc. taken up, action</span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 8. 1880 Inexpedient to employ Counsel'>Dec. 8. 1880 Inexpedient to employ Counsel</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That it is, in the opinion of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees, inexpedient to employ Counsel<span class='line-break'> </span>under the Vote passed at the last Metting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Wolcott it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President to Report to Proprietors.'>President to Report to Proprietors.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the President be requested<span class='line-break'> </span>to report to the Proprietors that it is the unan<span class='line-break'></span>mous opinion of the Board of Trustees after<span class='line-break'> </span>a careful examination of the relations<span class='line-break'> </span>existing between this Corporation and the<span class='line-break'> </span>Mass. Horticultural Society that it is not<span class='line-break'> </span>for the interest of this Corporation at the<span class='line-break'> </span>present time to take any steps towards<span class='line-break'> </span>abrogating or disturbing the said relations:<span class='line-break'> </span>and to embody in his Report so much of<span class='line-break'> </span>the report of the Special Committee as may<span class='line-break'> </span>in his opinion be judicious &amp; necessary to<span class='line-break'> </span>explain to the Proprietors the reason of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board for their opinion aforesaid.</p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills &amp; schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>of same amounting to $3.507.33 was submitted,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills refd to Prest'>Monthly Bills ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said bills be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Pres<sup>t</sup> for his approval &amp; payment by Treasurer.</p>

<p>The Secretary presented a Statement^126^ of Sales<span class='line-break'> </span>of Land reported by Supt &amp; app<sup>d</sup> by Com. on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>from Nov. 10. to date</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Statement^126^ be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and filed.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 15. 1881'>Jan. 15. 1881</span></p>
<p><u>January 15. 1881.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Spec. Meeting'>Spec. Meeting</span></p>
<p>A special meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Saturday<span class='line-break'> </span>Jany 15. at 2 1/4 P.M.</p>
<p>Present the President, Mess. Choate, Eaton,<span class='line-break'> </span>Payson, Rice, Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>

<p><u>Dissolved.</u> J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>

<p><u>February 9<sup>th</sup> 1881.</u></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees was held, as notified, on Wed<span class='line-break'></span>nesday Feby 9. at 2 o'clk P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, Mess. Bigelow, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Eaton, Jones, Rice, Sears, Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>

Montgomery Sears</u> For the vacancy in the <span class='line-break'> </span>term ending <u>1884.</u><span class='line-break'> </span></p>
