<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby 9. 1881.'>Feby 9. 1881.</span></p>
<p>Mr. Wolcott having been appointed to collect,<span class='line-break'> </span>sort &amp; count the Ballots for Officers for the ensuing<span class='line-break'> </span>year announced that the whole No. of ballots for</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of President,'>Election of President,</span></p>
<p><u>President</u> was <u>8</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J.M. Spelman</u><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; he was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer,'>Treasurer,</span></p>
<p>whole No for <u>Treasurer</u> <u>9</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>H.B. Mackintosh</u><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; he was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary,'>Secretary,</span></p>
<p>whole No. for <u>Secretary</u> <u>9</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J. Harris Reed</u><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; he was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='&amp; Superintendent'>&amp; Superintendent</span></p>
<p>whole No. of <u>Superintendent</u> <u>9</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J.W. Lovering</u></p>
<p>On motion it was,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary Treas. Secty. &amp; Supt.'>Salary Treas. Secty. &amp; Supt.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the <u>Salary</u> of the <u>Treasurer</u> be<span class='line-break'> </span>fixed at <u>$2.250</u>, and the <u>Salary</u> of the <u>Secretary</u><span class='line-break'> </span>at <u>$1.600</u> for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>. That the <u>Salary</u> of <u>Superintendent</u><span class='line-break'> </span>be fixed at <u>$3.000</u> for the ensuing year and that<span class='line-break'> </span>he shall have the use of a house &amp; the grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>thereto belonging, the use of a horse and vehicle<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; the services of one man at the expense of the Corporation</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Standing Comtees 1881-2.'>Standing Com<sup>tees</sup> 1881-2.</span></p>
<p>As provided by the Rules &amp; Regulations The Pres<sup>t</sup> appointed<span class='line-break'> </span><u>The Standing Committees</u><span class='line-break'> </span>for <u>1881 &amp; 82</u><span class='line-break'> </span>the <u>same as last year</u> [see Page 246 of this Volume]<span class='line-break'> </span><u>except</u> that <u>Mr. Sears</u> was placed last in <u>Com. on Grounds</u>^in place of Mr Lawrence^resigned.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>

<div id="page-1135518">
<h3><a name="page-1135518">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 276</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' July 9 1881'> July 9 1881</span><span class='line-break'> </span>On motion it was<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted: That the Committee of last year having</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Unfins. business'>Unfins. business</span><span class='line-break'> </span>unfinished business be continued.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Neglected Logs Nos. 65. 186. 208.507.992. 1330.'>Neglected Logs Nos. 65. 186. 208.507.992. 1330.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The President presented a list (prepared by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent) of certain neglected Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>numbered as follows: 65-186-208-507-992+1330.<span class='line-break'> </span>after an explanation as to their condition + a<span class='line-break'> </span>discussion as to what action should be taken<span class='line-break'> </span>under Article VI of By Laws on motion of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Choate it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref to Com. on Lots with full power'>Ref to Com. on Lots with full power</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Voted: that subject of the above named<span class='line-break'> </span>neglected Lots be referred to the Com. on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rules and Regulations more strict enforcement of'>Rules and Regulations more strict enforcement of</span><span class='line-break'> </span>With a view to the more strict enforcement<span class='line-break'> </span>of the powers granted to the Superintendent under<span class='line-break'> </span>the Rules + Regulations the President presented<span class='line-break'> </span>the following Votes, which after a full state<span class='line-break'></span>ment were unanimously adopted:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote for purpose of'>Vote for purpose of</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Voted: That the Superintendent be<span class='line-break'> </span>directed to enforce strictly the Rules and Regulations<span class='line-break'> </span>in regard to work done in the Cemetery by persons<span class='line-break'> </span>not employed by the Corporation and that more<span class='line-break'> </span>effectually to ensure his control over such work<span class='line-break'></span>men and ensure obedience to his orders, that<span class='line-break'> </span>all workmen engaged in the care + decoration<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots in the Cemetery by others than the Corporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>be required to obtain a license from the Superintendent.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135519">
<h3><a name="page-1135519">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 277</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>277</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby. 9. 1881.'>Feby. 9. 1881.</span></p>
<p>who is authorized to issue or revoke them at his<span class='line-break'> </span>discretion.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote for purpose of'>Vote for purpose of</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That in order to preserve the<span class='line-break'> </span>main entrance unobstructed and free from<span class='line-break'> </span>annoyance to proprietors &amp; visitors the Superinten<span class='line-break'></span>dent require that all wagons or teams loaded<span class='line-break'> </span>wholly or in part with materials, plants, rubbish<span class='line-break'> </span>or tools must enter and leave the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>by the East Gate in Coolidge Avenue.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote for purpose of'>Vote for purpose of</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That to prevent annoyance to<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors the Superintendent refurse to license<span class='line-break'> </span>workmen who solicit work within the Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery and that such solicitation<span class='line-break'> </span>be sufficient ground for cancelling any license<span class='line-break'> </span>or permit which may have been previously<span class='line-break'> </span>granted to any party so soliciting..</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills &amp; Schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>of same amounting to $2.645.20. was submitted.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='970'>970</span><span class='line-break'> </span>S. Abbie Alley " Boston daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1458'>1458</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Frank Bowker " " son " " "</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3693'>3693</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Charles R. Mason " Lawrence brother " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u> J. Harris Reed, Secty.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary&apos;s Oath 1881.'>Secretary's Oath 1881.</span></p>
<p>Personally appeared J. Harris Reed and<span class='line-break'> </span>made oath that he would faithfully discharge the<span class='line-break'> </span>duties appertaining to the office of Secretary of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Before me<span class='line-break'> </span>H.B. Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the peace.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 9. 1881.'>March 9. 1881.</span></p>
<p><u>March 9. 1881</u></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees was held, as notified on<span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday March 9 at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, Mess. Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Eaton, Jones, Rice, Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fred. E. Weber Petition for Transfer Deposit P.C. with G from #3219 to 4657'>Fred. E. Weber Petition for Transfer Deposit P.C. with G from #3219 to 4657</span></p>
<p>The Chairman of Com. on Lots presented the<span class='line-break'> </span>Petition^132.^of Fred. E. Weber for the Transfer of a<span class='line-break'> </span>Deposit for the P.C. with G. of Lot #3219^3^to #4657<span class='line-break'> </span>lately purchased by him &amp; it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Granted.'>Granted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Petition^132^granted.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watering Streets Refd to Prest'>Watering Streets Ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the subject of watering the streets<span class='line-break'> </span>in the vicinity of Cemt'y for 1881 be ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup> with full power.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 13. 1881.'>April 13. 1881.</span></p>
<p><u>April 13. 1881.</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>April 13. at 2 P.M:</p>
<p>Present The President, Mess. Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Jones, Rice, Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>Records of the Meeting Mch 9. read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #3526-27 Reconveyance of referred to Com'>Lot #3526-27 Reconveyance of referred to Com</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the matter of the re-conveyance<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots #3526 &amp; 27 for Re-location be ref<sup>d</sup> to Com. on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>with full power.</p>

Jackson Jr. " <u>100.</u></p>

<div id="page-1135523">
<h3><a name="page-1135523">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 281</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>281</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 11. 1881'>May 11. 1881</span></p>
<p><u>May 11. 1881</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, on Wednesday May 11<span class='line-break'> </span>at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. Bigelow, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Cotting, Sears, Whitney and Wolcott.</p>
<p>Record of Meeting Apl. 13 read &amp; approved.</p>
<p>The Chairman of the Com. on Lots explaining<span class='line-break'> </span>the reason therefore it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #2 Re-conveyance of for Re-location.'>Lot #2 Re-conveyance of for Re-location.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Secretary be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to accept a re-conveyance of Lot #2 for the<span class='line-break'> </span>purpose of Re-location &amp; issue New Deeds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Additions to #961. 2062. 4077.'>Additions to #961. 2062. 4077.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Secretary be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to issue Deeds for Additions to Lots #961-2062<span class='line-break'></span>and 4077 without a Deposit for the care of grass.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Entrance'>New Entrance</span></p>
<p>The President having stated the necessity for<span class='line-break'> </span>another entrance to the Cemetery it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Opening of Authorized - Gate Keeper for Salary of - '>Opening of Authorized - Gate Keeper for Salary of - </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the President is hereby<span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to have the Southerly Gate on Coolidge<span class='line-break'> </span>Avenue opened &amp; to employ a Gate Keeper<span class='line-break'> </span>at an expense not exceeding Five hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars ($500) &amp; house rent.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The Monthly Bills &amp; schedule of same<span class='line-break'> </span>amounting to $5.277.81 was submitted,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='refd to Prest'>ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u> that they be ref<sup>d</sup> to President for<span class='line-break'> </span>his approval &amp; payment by Treasurer.</p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement^135^of the Sales</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>Representatives appointed as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='142'>142</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Adelaide O. Williams of Boston daughter of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2191'>2191</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Louisa M. Drew " " sister " " "</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 8. 1881'><u>June 8. 1881</u></span></p>
<p><u>June 8. 1881</u></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held, as notified, n Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>June 8. at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, The Pres^t, Mess. Browne, Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>Cotting, Payson,Rice, Sears &amp; Whitney.</p>
<p>The Record of meeting May 11 read and aproved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Relocation Lots #1245 &amp; 3008'><u>Relocation Lots #1245 &amp; 3008</u></span></p>
<p>The Pres^t presented a Petition ^137^ for the <span class='line-break'> </span>re-location of Lots #1245 &amp; 3008, on motion of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Choate it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref^d to Com. on Lots with power.'><u>Ref^d to Com. on Lots with power.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That Petition ^137^ be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Lots with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lamp Posts on Brattle St. Prsn^t to expend $60'><u>Lamp Posts on Brattle St. Prsn^t to expend <i>$60</i></u></span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Choate it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the President be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to contract for Lamp Posts on Brattle Street<span class='line-break'> </span>at a sum not exceeding Sixty dollars ($60)</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly BIlls'><u>Monthly BIlls</u></span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills and <span class='line-break'> </span>schedule of same amounting to $6.479.46 was <span class='line-break'> </span>presented</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Bills be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the President for his approval &amp; payment by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales Land '><u>Statement Sales Land </u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement ^136^ <span class='line-break'> </span>of the sales of land from May 11 to date<span class='line-break'> </span>reported by the Superintendent &amp; approved<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Com. on Lots.</p>
<p>===<u>accepted &amp; filed</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Statemetn ^136 be <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted &amp; filed.</p>

<p>The monthly meeting was notified to be <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday Aug. 10 at 2.P.M.</p>

<p><u> September 14. 1881.</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was notified to be held on Wednesday Sept 14 at 2.P.M.</p>

<div id="page-1135529">
<h3><a name="page-1135529">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 287</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oct. 12. 1881'><u>Oct. 12. 1881</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition E. G. Robinson for Removal of body from #909'><u>Petition E. G. Robinson for Removal of body from #909</u></span></p>
<p>The Petition ^140^ of Edward G. Robinson and <span class='line-break'> </span>Dora Hiddell for the removal of a certain body <span class='line-break'> </span>from Lot #909 was presented.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Choate the following <span class='line-break'> </span>was unanimously adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Removal refused.'><u>Removal refused.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Whereas</u>  it appears that the burial was <span class='line-break'> </span>made by order of Mrs. Rosa C. Stanfield one <span class='line-break'> </span>of the owners in common of said Lot, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees <u>do not consider it proper to order <span class='line-break'> </span>the removal</u>  as prayed for, but refer the <span class='line-break'> </span>petitioners to their legal remedy if any they<span class='line-break'> </span>have.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #897 neglected.'><u>Lot #897 neglected.</u></span></p>
<p>The President made a statemtentas <span class='line-break'> </span>to the condition of Lot #897. Gen J. H. Carleton, dec^d<span class='line-break'> </span>and it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='to be put in order under Art. VI of By-Laws.'><u>to be put in order under Art. VI of By-Laws.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That Lot #897 being in a state of <span class='line-break'> </span>continued neglect and its condition impairing <span class='line-break'> </span>the appearance of the Cemetery the Supt. be ordered <span class='line-break'> </span>to remove the crumbling iron fence &amp; from the <span class='line-break'> </span>proceeds for same put said Lot in order as <span class='line-break'> </span>provided by Art. VI. of the By-Laws, the Secty. to<span class='line-break'> </span>first notify the parties in interest.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Loan for General Fund #5,000  authorized.'><u>Loan for General Fund #5,000 </u> authorized.</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne of Com. on Finance having <span class='line-break'> </span>stated the reasons therefore it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Com. on Finance be <span class='line-break'> </span>authoried to borrow for the General Fund a <span class='line-break'> </span>sum not exceeding Five thousand dollars $5.000</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills for Aug. <span class='line-break'> </span>Sept. &amp; Oct.  Schedules of same amounting respective<span class='line-break'></span>ly to $44945.34:  $4.843.68:  $5.191.28 were presented.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted.</u>:  That they be referred to the Pres^t<span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval &amp; payment by Treas.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas. Quart. Statement ref^d to Com. on Finance.'><u>Treas. Quart. Statement ref^d to Com. on Finance.</u></span></p>
<p>The quarterly Statements^141^ of Treas. presented</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That they ref^d to Com. on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land Statement'><u>Sales of Land Statement</u></span></p>
<p>The Secty presented Statments of ^142^ Sales of Land <span class='line-break'> </span>reported by Supt. &amp; app^d by Com. on Lots from July 13<span class='line-break'> </span>to Oct. 12</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='filed'><u>filed</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Statements ^142^ be filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P.C. with G. '><u>P.C. with G. </u></span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots recommended Contracts for Perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>care of the following Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#35'><u>#35</u></span></p>
<p>*Coffin  <u>$425.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='99'><u>99</u></span></p>
<p>*Davis  <u>500</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='397'><u>397</u></span></p>
<p>*Cook  <u>475</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='515'><u>515</u></span></p>
<p>*Rittell  <u>425.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='764'><u>764</u></span></p>
<p>*Fullerton  <u>350.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1882'><u>1882</u></span></p>
<p>Cooper  <u>175.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3381'><u>3381</u></span></p>
<p>*Thorndike  <u>1,000.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3413'><u>3413</u></span></p>
<p>*Nichols  <u>850.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3367'><u>3367</u></span></p>
<p>Griffith  <u>475.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4160'><u>4160</u></span></p>
<p>Bassett   <u>137.50.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='concurred in'><u>concurred in</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Contracts be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'><u>Representatives Lot Nos.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2'>2</span></p>
<p>Hazel P.  Catherine Dimmock   daugher of D. P.</p>

</div>

<h3><a name="page-1135531">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 289</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>289</p>

<div id="page-1135532">
<h3><a name="page-1135532">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 290</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>290</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 4. 1881.'>Nov. 4. 1881.</span></p>
<p><u>November 4. 1881.</u></p>
<p>A Special Meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Friday<span class='line-break'> </span>Nov. 4. at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the Pres<sup>t</sup>, Mess. Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Eaton, Jones, Rice &amp; Whitney.</p>
<p>Reading of the Record of last meeting dispersed with.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills &amp; schedule of<span class='line-break'> </span>same amounting to $4.265.52 was presented</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='refd to Prest'>ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Bills be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Pres<sup>t</sup> for his approval &amp; payment by Treas.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Visit to Cemetery by Trustees.'>Visit to Cemetery by Trustees.</span></p>
<p>As this meeting was specially called for<span class='line-break'> </span>the purpose of visiting the Cemetery carriages<span class='line-break'> </span>were taken, on arrival at the Cemetery the Supt.<span class='line-break'> </span>explained the change proposed in the location<span class='line-break'> </span>of Snowberry Path, on motion</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Snowberry Path change of location authorized.'>Snowberry Path change of location authorized.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Supt. be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>change the location of Snowberry Path as<span class='line-break'> </span>shown on his plan^143^ as modified in front of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Tufts and Packard Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Following Lots Declared Neglected. *208.-59. 627. 1113. &amp; 1670.'>Following Lots Declared Neglected. *208.-59. 627. 1113. &amp; 1670.</span></p>
<p>After an inspection of certain neglected<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots^144^it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That Lots^144.^numbered 208-Boardman;<span class='line-break'> </span>627 - Gerard; 59 - Haskell; 1113 - Whiton; 1670 - Stevens<span class='line-break'> </span>being in a state of continued neglect and their<span class='line-break'> </span>condition impairing the appearance of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>the Supt. be authorized to remove the Hedge</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135533">
<h3><a name="page-1135533">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 291</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>291</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov. 4. 1881.'>Nov. 4. 1881.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secty to notify Proprietors.'>Secty to notify Proprietors.</span></p>
<p>from Lot #1113 and the Fences from the others &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>put the Lots in order as provided by Article<span class='line-break'> </span>VI. of the By-Laws, the Secretary first notifying<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors^144^ of their condition.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mound Av. change in location &amp; extension'>Mound Av. change in location &amp; extension</span></p>
<p>The President presented a plan^145^prepared<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Supt. for a change in the location of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mound Avenue &amp; its extension on the Stone<span class='line-break'> </span>Farm, after viewing the proposed location it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Authorized.'>Authorized.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Supt. be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to locate Mound Avenue as shown on the plan<span class='line-break'> </span>presented^145.^</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Building for heating apparatus for Greenhouses refd to Prest with full power.'>New Building for heating apparatus for Greenhouses ref<sup>d</sup> to Pres<sup>t</sup> with full power.</span></p>
<p>After an inspection of the Greenhouses and<span class='line-break'> </span>explanation by the Supt. of a proposed building<span class='line-break'> </span>for a heating apparatus for them it was on motion<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mr. Choate</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the subject be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the President with full power.</p>
<p>On motion</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Meeting Nov. 9 dispersed with.'>Meeting Nov. 9 dispersed with.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: The the regular monthly meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>to be held on Wednesday Nov. 9. be dispersed with.</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u> J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135534">
<h3><a name="page-1135534">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 292</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>292</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 14. 1881.'>Dec. 14. 1881.</span></p>
<p><u>December 14. 1881.</u></p>
<p>The Monthly Meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, on Wednesday Dec. 14<span class='line-break'> </span>at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, Mess. Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Eaton, Jones, Rice, Sears, &amp; Whitney.</p>
<p>Record of Meeting Nov. 4 read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Finance Report on Treas&apos; Quarterly Stats. accepted and ordered filed.'>Com. on Finance Report on Treas' Quarterly Stats. accepted and ordered filed.</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne of Com. on Finance reported that<span class='line-break'> </span>they had examined &amp; found correct the Tres' Quarterly<span class='line-break'> </span>Reports ending March 31; June 30; &amp; Sept. 30.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That Report be accept &amp; the Quarterly<span class='line-break'> </span>Reports filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #1697 Corp. in Trust Petition David Watson Ext. for an Interment in of Sarah W. Dewhurst'>Lot #1697 Corp. in Trust Petition David Watson Ext. for an Interment in of Sarah W. Dewhurst</span></p>
<p>The President presented the Petition^146^of Mr.<span class='line-break'> </span>David Watson, Extr. of the Will &amp; Residuary Legatee<span class='line-break'> </span>of Elizabeth W. Williams, deceased, for permission to<span class='line-break'> </span>inter the body of Sarah W. Dewhurst in Lot #1697<span class='line-break'> </span>divised to the Corporation in Trust by the [testatrix?]<span class='line-break'> </span>with restrictions as to interments.</p>
<p>After a full discussion in regard to the legal<span class='line-break'> </span>questions involved it was unanimously</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Granted, agreement to be signed by him.'>Granted, agreement to be signed by him.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Petition^146^of David Watson<span class='line-break'> </span>be granted on condition that he give a proper<span class='line-break'> </span>agreement^147^as Executor &amp; Residuary Legatee<span class='line-break'> </span>holding the Trustees harmless for this dveiation<span class='line-break'> </span>from the terms of the devise of the Lot in Trust.</p>
<p>On motion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Report, Prest to propose.'>Annual Report, Pres<sup>t</sup> to propose.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the President be authorized to prepare<span class='line-break'> </span>the Annual Report of the Trustees to the Proprietors.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135535">
<h3><a name="page-1135535">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 293</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>293</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 14. 1881'><u>Dec. 14. 1881</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Authorized Re-Conveyance of Lots #4673 &amp; 4689'><u>Authorized Re-Conveyance of Lots #4673 &amp; 4689</u></span></p>
<p>The Chairman of the Com. on Lots expaining the <span class='line-break'> </span>reasons therefor it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Secretary be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>accept Deeds of Re-conveyance of Lot # 4689 from <span class='line-break'> </span>Ganville Fuller in exchange  for Deeds of Lots #4695<span class='line-break'> </span>4696 &amp; 4697;  &amp; also of Lot #4673 from James <span class='line-break'> </span>Gilchrist in exchange for Lot #4700, they paying <span class='line-break'> </span>the didfference in each.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Forest Pond alteration of'><u>Forest Pond alteration of</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented a plan ^148^ prepared by <span class='line-break'> </span>Supt. for an alteration in the Banks of Forest <span class='line-break'> </span>Pond, on motion</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='authorized'><u>authorized</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Supt. be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>make the alteration substantially as show on <span class='line-break'> </span>the Plan ^148^.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'><u>Monthly Bills</u></span></p>
<p>The File of Monthly Bills &amp; Schedule of same <span class='line-break'> </span>amounting to $4.156.11 was presented,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref^d to Pres^t.'><u>Ref^d to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Bills be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Pres^t for approval &amp; payment by Treas^r.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Greenhouses Heating of, Pres^t repots to Soct of Building for.'><u>Greenhouses Heating of, Pres^t repots to Soct of Building for.</u></span></p>
<p>The President, to whom at the last Meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred ^with full power^ the subject of a building for a <span class='line-break'> </span>heating apparatus for the Greenhouse reported.</p>
<p>That the cost of material for the construction <span class='line-break'> </span>of the same would be about Four hundred dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>($400) &amp; that the labor would be done by the men<span class='line-break'> </span>whose names would be in the Pay Roll durng the Winter.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land Statmt filed.'><u>Sales of Land Statmt filed.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  Taht the Statement ^149^ of Land sold from <span class='line-break'> </span>Oct. 12 to Dec 14 be accepted &amp; filed.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135536">
<h3><a name="page-1135536">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 294</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>284</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dec. 14. 1881.'><u>Dec. 14. 1881.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P.C. with G.'><u>P.C. with G.</u></span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended Contracts <span class='line-break'> </span>for Perpetual Care with guaranty of following Lots</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#446 &amp; 1645'><u>#446 &amp; 1645</u></span></p>
<p><u>#446 &amp; 1645</u>  Cummings  <u>$500</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1584'><u>1584</u></span></p>
<p><u>1584</u>  Bigelow  <u>600</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1585'><u>1585</u></span></p>
<p><u>1585</u>  Alcott  <u>400</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1131'><u>1131</u></span></p>
<p><u>1131</u>  Bacon  <u>350</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4117'><u>4117</u></span></p>
<p><u>4117</u>  Osborne <u>400</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4358'><u>4358</u></span></p>
<p><u>4358</u>  Rand  <u>400</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurred in'><u>Concurred in</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'><u>Representatives Lot Nos.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2028'>2028</span></p>
<p>Georgianna F. Leonard  of Cambridge  neice  of D. P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2333'>2333</span></p>
<p>Helen E. Lewis  "  Boston  widow  "   "   "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2407'>2407</span></p>
<p>Eveline E. Sturtevant  "  E."  daughter  "  "  "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3822'>3822</span></p>
<p>Sarah W. Cunningham  "  "  Widow  "   "   "</p>
<p>===<u>Petition^150^ Clara G. Ewer to erect Stone over 2 inches-6inches on #4692  Granted.</u></p>
<p>The Petition^150^ of Clara G. Ewer to erect a headstone <span class='line-break'> </span>exceeding 2'-6" in height on Lot# 4692  Clethra Path <span class='line-break'> </span>was presented, on motion</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  The permission be granted Mrs. Ewer<span class='line-break'> </span>to erect the memorial stone on Lot #4692.</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u>  J. Harris Reed,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135537">
<h3><a name="page-1135537">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 295</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>295</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 11. 1882'><u>Jan. 11. 1882</u></span></p>
<p><u>January 11. 1882.</u></p>
<p>The Monthly Meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>Jany 11 at 2 o'clk P.M.</p>
<p>Present The President, Mess. Bigelow, Browne, <span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Jones, Rice, Sears &amp; Whitney.</p>
<p>The Record of the Meeting Dec. 14 read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President&apos;s Annual Report'><u>President's Annual Report</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented the Annual Report ^151^ <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Proprietors</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='ordered printed'><u>ordered printed</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Annual Report  ^151^ as read is <span class='line-break'> </span>hereby approved &amp; adopted as the Report of the Trustes<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Proprietors &amp; ordered printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt&apos;s Report ordered printed'><u>Supt's Report ordered printed</u></span></p>
<p>The Supt's Report ^152^ for 1881 was presented.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the said Report ^151^ be accepted &amp; printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas&apos; Report Ref&apos; to Com on Finance to print'><u>Treas' Report Ref' to Com on Finance to print</u></span></p>
<p>The Treasr's Annual Report ^153^ was submitted.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Report ^153^ be referred to Com. on <span class='line-break'> </span>Finance &amp; ^to^ print the same if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t.'><u>Monthly Bills referred to Pres^t.</u></span></p>
<p>The  usual Monthly Bills and Schedule of same <span class='line-break'> </span>amounting to $2.964.79 was submitted.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said Bills be referred to the Prest for <span class='line-break'> </span>approval &amp; payment by Treas.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly and Annual Statement Sales accp^d &amp; filed'><u>Monthly and Annual Statement Sales accp^d &amp; filed</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement of Sales ^154^ for the <span class='line-break'> </span>year 1881, showing the amount received for Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; a division of the items.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That said statements ^154 &amp; 155^ be accepted &amp; filed.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135538">
<h3><a name="page-1135538">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 296</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>296</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jan. 11. 1882.'><u>Jan. 11. 1882.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P.C. with G. #81  768  concurred in'><u>P.C. with G. #81  768  concurred in</u></span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended <span class='line-break'> </span>Contracts for Perpetual Care with guaranty of the <span class='line-break'> </span>following Lots.</p>
<p><u>81</u> - *Shurtleff  <u>500.</u></p>
<p><u>768</u> - M^c^Burney  <u>225</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>  That said Contracts be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Granite Curbs'><u>Granite Curbs</u></span></p>
<p>Mr. Wolcott called the attention of the Board to <span class='line-break'> </span>the granite curbs &amp; after a statement of his views<span class='line-break'> </span>on the subject it was on his motion</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Subject referred to Com. on Lots'><u>Subject referred to Com. on Lots</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the Com. on Lots be requested<span class='line-break'> </span>to consider the report, at as early a day as practicable, <span class='line-break'> </span>what measures if any can be taken by the Trustees, to <span class='line-break'> </span>reduce without cost to the Proprietors, the number of <span class='line-break'> </span>heavy granite copings surrounding Lots in the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; thereby to restore, so far as may be , the rural character <span class='line-break'> </span>of the grounds.</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u>  J. Harris Reed</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135539">
<h3><a name="page-1135539">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 297</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>297</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby 8. 1882'><u>Feby 8. 1882</u></span></p>
<p><u>February 8. 1882</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday Feby 8. at 2 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, Mess. Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Eaton, Jones, Rice, Whitney &amp; Wolcott</p>
<p>The record of the Meeting Jan. 11 read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees elected Feb. 6. 1882'><u>Trustees elected Feb. 6. 1882</u></span></p>
<p>The President announced that at the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors meeting Feby 6 1882</p>
<p><u>T. Quincy Browne</u><span class='line-break'> </span>and <u>Samuel R. Payson</u> were elected Trustees for the<span class='line-break'> </span><u>term of 6 years</u> <u>ending 1888.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of President'><u>Election of President</u></span></p>
<p>Mr Wolcott having collected, sorted &amp; counted <span class='line-break'> </span>the Ballots for Officers for the ensuing year reported <span class='line-break'> </span>the whole number of Ballots for</p>
<p><u>President</u>  was  <u>6</u><span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for <u>I.M.Spelman</u><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; he was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer'><u>Treasurer</u></span></p>
<p>for <u>Treasurer</u>   <u>7</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>H.B.Mackintosh</u><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; he was declared elected</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary'><u>Secretary</u></span></p>
<p>for <u>Secretary</u>  <u>7</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J. Harris Reed</u><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; he was declared elected</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt.'><u>Supt.</u></span></p>
<p>for <u>Superintendent</u>  <u>7</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J. W. Lovering </u><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; he was declared elected.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135540">
<h3><a name="page-1135540">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 298</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>298</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feb. 8. 1882 Salary Treas. and Secretary'><u>Feb. 8. 1882 Salary Treas. and Secretary</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That the <u>Salary</u> of the <u>Treasurer</u> be <span class='line-break'> </span>fixed at $2.250, and the <u>Salary</u> of the <u>Secretary</u> <span class='line-break'> </span>at $1.600 for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary Superintendent'><u>Salary Superintendent</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>:  That  the <u>Salary</u> of the <u>Superintendent</u> <span class='line-break'> </span>be fixed at <u>$3.000</u> for the ensuing year and that <span class='line-break'> </span>he shall have the use of a house and the grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>thereto belonging, the use of a horse &amp; vehicle and <span class='line-break'> </span>the services of one man at the expense of the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Standing Committees 1882.'><u>Standing Committees 1882.</u></span></p>
<p>The Prest named <u>The Standing Committees for the year 1882-3</u>  as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee on Grounds'><u>Committee on Grounds</u></span></p>
<p><u>Committee on Grounds</u>{  The President ex officio and <span class='line-break'> </span>{Mess. Choate<span class='line-break'> </span>{Cotting<span class='line-break'> </span>{Payson<span class='line-break'> </span>{ &amp; Sears</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee on Lots'><u>Committee on Lots</u></span></p>
<p><u>Committee on Lots</u> {The President and <span class='line-break'> </span>{Messs. Whitney<span class='line-break'> </span>{&amp; Jones</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee on Finance'><u>Committee on Finance</u></span></p>
<p><u>Committee on Finance</u>  {Mess. Browne &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>{Rice</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee on Interments'><u>Committee on Interments</u></span></p>
<p><u>Committee on Interments</u>  {Mess. Bigelow &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>{Eaton</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Birds'><u>Com. on Birds</u></span></p>
<p><u>Committee on Birds</u>   {Mr. Wolcott</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135541">
<h3><a name="page-1135541">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 299</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>299</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby 8. 1882'>Feby 8. 1882</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Committees of last year<span class='line-break'> </span>having unfinished business be continued.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Subject of Curbs. Report on'>Subject of Curbs. Report on</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots to which at the last meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the subject of Curbs made a verbal<span class='line-break'> </span>Report &amp; recommended the following Votes which<span class='line-break'> </span>were unanimously adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote on Curbs in line of Aves &amp; Paths'>Vote on Curbs in line of Aves &amp; Paths</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Superintendent allow no<span class='line-break'> </span>Curbs to be set in future on the line of the Paths<span class='line-break'> </span>and Avenues without the consent of this Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Removal of for Proptrs.'>Removal of for Proptrs.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That when Proprietors desire<span class='line-break'> </span>Curbings which surround their Lots to be removed<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent be authorized to remove the<span class='line-break'> </span>same without expense to said Proprietors and if<span class='line-break'> </span>the value of the stone so removed exceeds the<span class='line-break'> </span>cost of removal to allow such excess to be placed<span class='line-break'> </span>to the credit of said Proprietor.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P.C. Contracts'>P.C. Contracts</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Clause to be added recommended by Com.'>Clause to be added recommended by Com.</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots recommended the adding<span class='line-break'> </span>of a claim to the Contracts for Perpetual Care with<span class='line-break'> </span>guaranty as follows: "and it is further understood<span class='line-break'> </span>and declared that said Proprietors shall not be<span class='line-break'> </span>responsible for any loss or damage originiating in<span class='line-break'> </span>invasions, riots or civil commotions."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Voted to add Charles River R.R. Petition'>Voted to add Charles River R.R. Petition</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the recommendation be<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted and the clause be added to said Contracts.</p>
<p>The President presented the subject of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Petition of the Charles River Rail Road to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Legislature &amp; after an explanation of the route</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135542">
<h3><a name="page-1135542">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 300</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>300</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby 8. 1882'>Feby 8. 1882</span></p>
<p>as shown on a Map submitted it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Prest instructed to sign for Board of Trustees.'>Pres<sup>t</sup> instructed to sign for Board of Trustees.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the President be instructed to<span class='line-break'> </span>sign in behalf of this Corporation the Petition to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Legislature in favor of granting to the Charles River<span class='line-break'> </span>Rail Road Co. the corporate rights &amp; other privileges<span class='line-break'> </span>asked for by said Company.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills and Schedule of<span class='line-break'> </span>same amounting to $3.353.76 was submitted.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Bills be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>President for his approval &amp; payment by the Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perp. Rep. #2962'>Contracts Perp. Rep. #2962</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots recommended Contracts for<span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Care with guaranty as follows:</p>
<p>Lot #<u>2962</u> *<u>Bishop</u>. (see April 12. 1882) <u>$1.100</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurred in'>Concurred in</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Contract be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'>Representatives Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>Representatives were appointed as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='81'>81</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Hiram S. Shutliff of Boston Grandson of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1297'>1297</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Mary L. Thornton " " Daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2641'>2641</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Kate W. Mattingly " Washington DC. Niece " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2647'>2647</span><span class='line-break'> </span>James E. Gilman " Boston son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3086'>3086</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Francis H. Gardner " " " " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u></p>
<p>J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135543">
<h3><a name="page-1135543">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 301</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>301</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary&apos;s Oath 1882.'>Secretary's Oath 1882.</span></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk S.S. March 4. 1882</p>
<p>Personally appeared J. Harris Reed and<span class='line-break'> </span>made oath that he would faithfully discharge the<span class='line-break'> </span>duties appertaining to the Office of Secretary of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Before me<span class='line-break'> </span>H.B. Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the peace.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 8. 1882'>March 8. 1882</span></p>
<p><u>March 8. 1882</u></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday March<span class='line-break'> </span>8<sup>th</sup> at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present The President, Mess. Bigelow, Browne, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Cotting, Eaton, Jones, Rice, Sears &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>The Record of last meeting read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Book on Cemetery publishing referred to Special Com.'>Book on Cemetery publishing referred to Special Com.</span></p>
<p>After a full discussion of the Estimates &amp; plan<span class='line-break'> </span>for publishing a Book with Map &amp; Illustration of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the subject of the Book be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to a Special Committee consisting of Mess. Choate, Jones<span class='line-break'> </span>Sears and The President with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Re-conveyance Lot #563 authorized.'>Re-conveyance Lot #563 authorized.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: The the Secretary be authorized to accept<span class='line-break'> </span>Re-conveyance of Lot #563 for Exchange by W.W. [Greenough?]</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135544">
<h3><a name="page-1135544">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 302</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>302</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 8. 1882.'>March 8. 1882.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills and Schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>of same amounting to $2.762.01 was submitted.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Bill be referred to President<span class='line-break'> </span>for approval &amp; payment by Treas.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales of Land'>Statement Sales of Land</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement of Sales<span class='line-break'> </span>reported by Supt &amp; approved by Com. on Lots from<span class='line-break'> </span>Jan. 1 to date</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Statement be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perp. Repair #1197 3539'>Contracts Perp. Repair #1197 3539</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots having recommended Contracts<span class='line-break'> </span>for Perpetual Care for Lots as follows:</p>
<p><u>#1197</u> Woodbury <u>$500</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>3539</u> *Barstow <u>425</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Contracts be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'>Representatives Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>Representatives were appointed as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='834'>834</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Justin A. Jacobs of Camb. son of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1574'>1574</span><span class='line-break'> </span>William M. Gammon " New York Nephew " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3298'>3298</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Alice O. Leonard " Sandwich daughter " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3996'>3996</span><span class='line-break'> </span>William F. Almy " Boston son " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u> J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135545">
<h3><a name="page-1135545">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 303</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>303</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 12. 1882.'>April 12. 1882.</span></p>
<p><u>April 12. 1882</u></p>
<p>The Monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>April 12. at 2 o'clock.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Mess. Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Jones, Rice, Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>The Records of meeting Mch. 8 read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills.'>Monthly Bills.</span></p>
<p>The usual file of monthly Bills &amp; schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>of same amounting to $4.424.46 submitted.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Bills be referred to Pres<sup>t</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval &amp; payment by Treas.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr Quarterly Statement - Refd to Comt. on Finance - '>Treas<sup>r</sup> Quarterly Statement - Ref<sup>d</sup> to Comt. on Finance - </span></p>
<p>The Treas.'s Quarterly Statements^156^were<span class='line-break'> </span>presented for Quarter ending Mch. 30.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Statement^156^be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales of Land'>Statement Sales of Land</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement^157^of Sales<span class='line-break'> </span>of Land reported by Supt. and approved by<span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Lots from Jany 1. to date,</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That it^157^be accepted and filed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perpl Repair'>Contracts Perp<sup>l</sup> Repair</span></p>
<p>Com. on Lots recommended Contracts for Perpetual Care<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows: Lot #<u>9</u>. *Kimball for <u>$450</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>731.</u> *Tebbetts " <u>400</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>937</u> *Sweet " <u>550</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>2469</u> Bigelow " <u>725</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>#2962</u> - Bishop - <u>$1.000</u> <u>3012 &amp; 3737</u> *Bourne " <u>5.000</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>4181</u> Strong " <u>300</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That said Contracts be concurred in.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135546">
<h3><a name="page-1135546">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 304</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>304</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 12. 1882.'>April 12. 1882.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'>Representatives Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>Representatives were appointed for Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='580'>580</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Ernest W. Longfellow of Cambridge Son of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='664'>664</span><span class='line-break'> </span>John P. Reynolds " Boston " " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2458'>2458</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Sarah R. Ranney " " Widow " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3274'>3274</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Joan Bailey " Watertown " " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u></p>
<p>J. Harris Reed Secty.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 10. 1882'>May 10. 1882</span></p>
<p><u>May 10. 1882</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified on Wednesday<span class='line-break'> </span>May 10 at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present The Pres<sup>t</sup> Mess. Browne, Choate, Jones<span class='line-break'> </span>Payson, Rice and Whitney.</p>
<p>The Record of last meeting read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills.'>Monthly Bills.</span></p>
<p>The usual file of Monthly Bills &amp; Schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>of same amounting to $ submitted:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement Sales of Land'>Statement Sales of Land</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That they be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Pres<sup>t</sup> for approval &amp; payment by Treasr.</p>
<p>The Secty presented a Statement^158^of Sales of Land<span class='line-break'> </span>reported by Supt. &amp; approved by Com. on Lots from<span class='line-break'> </span>April 12 to May 8.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> [?] accept &amp; file said Statement.^158.^<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135547">
<h3><a name="page-1135547">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 305</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>305</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 10. 1882'>May 10. 1882</span></p>
<p>The Com. on Lots recommended Contracts<span class='line-break'> </span>for Perpetual Care as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perpl Repair'>Contracts Perp<sup>l</sup> Repair</span></p>
<p><u>#245</u> *Lowell <u>$1.250.</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>3041</u> Pickering <u>600.</u><span class='line-break'> </span><u>2104</u> Hinckley <u>550</u></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Contracts be concurred in.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lot Nos.'>Representatives Lot Nos.</span></p>
<p>Representatives appointed as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1254'>1254</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Mary A. Wood of Boston daughter of D.P.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1879'>1879</span><span class='line-break'> </span>George Raymond " " son " " "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3023'>3023</span><span class='line-break'> </span>George P. Sanger " Camb. " " " "</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u> J. Harris Reed, Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 14. 1882'>June 14. 1882</span></p>
<p><u>June 14. 1882</u></p>
<p>The regular Monthly Meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees was notified to be held<span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday June 14 at 2 P.M.</p>
<p>Present, The President &amp; Mr. Choate</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='No Quorum'>No Quorum</span></p>
<p><u>No quorum</u> being present dissolved, a<span class='line-break'> </span>special Meeting to be called by President</p>
<p>J. Harris Reed<span class='line-break'> </span>Secty.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135548">
<h3><a name="page-1135548">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 306</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>306</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 20. 1882'>June 20. 1882</span></p>
<p><u>June 20. 1882</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Spec. Meeting'>Spec. Meeting</span></p>
<p>A <u>Special</u> Meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, on Tuesday June 20<span class='line-break'> </span>at noon.</p>
<p>Present: The President, Mess. Browne, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Eaton, Jones, Payson, Whitney &amp; Wolcott.</p>
<p>The reading of the Record dispensed with.</p>
<p>The Chairman of Com. on Lots explaining the<span class='line-break'> </span>reasons therefor it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reconveyance Lot. #1488 Authorized - '>Reconveyance Lot. #1488 Authorized - </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Secty. be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>accept a re-conveyance of Lot #1488 for the purpose<span class='line-break'> </span>of Re-location &amp; to issue Deed of enlarged Lot to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Heir of Alvin Adams without a deposit for the<span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Care of grass.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Deeds of Add&apos;n to #1123 &amp; #4133 without deposit'>Deeds of Add'n to #1123 &amp; #4133 without deposit</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Secty. be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>issue Deeds for Additions to Lots #1123 Heirs of<span class='line-break'> </span>*Peter Mackintosh &amp; 4133 W.J. Liggett without a<span class='line-break'> </span>deposit for the perpetual care of the grass.</p>
<p>On explanation by the President</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Quorum not present - Treas.r to pay Bills App.d by Pres.t'>Quorum not present - Treas.<sup>r</sup> to pay Bills App.<sup>d</sup> by Pres.<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That when a quorum is not present<span class='line-break'> </span>at the regular monthly meetings of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees the Treasurer be authorized to pay the<span class='line-break'> </span>Bills on Monthly schedule subject to approval by the<span class='line-break'> </span>President, said schedule to^be^presented and read at<span class='line-break'> </span>the next meeting of the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Enforce Art. VI. of By-Laws. Lots - #86 &apos; 1287 &apos; 747'>Enforce Art. VI. of By-Laws. Lots - #86 ' 1287 ' 747</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: The provisions of Article VI. of the<span class='line-break'> </span>By-Laws be enforced in regard to the following</p>

<div id="page-1135549">
<h3><a name="page-1135549">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 307</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>307</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 20. 1882'>June 20. 1882</span></p>
<p>Lots #<u>86</u> *Aaron Blood; <u>#1287</u> Joanna Herwig; <u>#747</u><span class='line-break'> </span>F.A. Peterson, which have been reported by the Supt.<span class='line-break'> </span>as impairing the appearance of the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt to pruchase new Boiler - '>Sup<sup>t</sup> to pruchase new Boiler - </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the Supt. be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>procure a new boiler for the Pumping engine, as soon<span class='line-break'> </span>as he shall have reason to believe the present boiler<span class='line-break'> </span>unreliable, first obtaining bids from different<span class='line-break'> </span>boiler makers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Extend Culvert on Fountain Av.'>Extend Culvert on Fountain Av.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the President be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>extend the stone culvert on Fountain Avenue<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Receiving Tomb to the present outlet<span class='line-break'> </span>under Coolidge Avenue in order that the water<span class='line-break'> </span>when foul and muddy may be discharged<span class='line-break'> </span>[thru?]. the same without passing thru. Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>Lake.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Remove Curbing of Auburn Lake ~&amp;c'>Remove Curbing of Auburn Lake ~&amp;c</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the President be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to remove the stone curbing of Auburn Lake &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>finish off the banks of the same in the<span class='line-break'> </span>manner adopted for Forest Pond &amp; Halcyon<span class='line-break'> </span>Lake &amp; to widen Oxalis Path so that carriages<span class='line-break'> </span>may hereafter be able to make a complete<span class='line-break'> </span>circuit of the upper lake.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Subject of Swans &amp;c. refd to a Spec. Comee'>Subject of Swans &amp;c. ref<sup>d</sup> to a Spec. Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>: That the subject of the Swans<span class='line-break'> </span>and other water fowls in the Cemetery be<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to a Special Committee consisting<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mess. Wolcott, Cotting &amp; Eaton with full<span class='line-break'> </span>power.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<p>July 25. 1882</p>

<p>Present the President. Mes<sup>s</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>Choate. Eaton Wolcott. Payson<span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow and Jones^chosen Secy pro tem was duly sworn.^. the latter being<span class='line-break'> </span>^voted to dispense with reading records of last meeting^ the president reported that he<span class='line-break'> </span>had an the 17<sup>th</sup> inst suspended<span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary from duty, and on<span class='line-break'> </span>motion of Mr Payson his action<span class='line-break'> </span>was confirmed, Voted that<span class='line-break'> </span>said suspension be continued.<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted^by ballot^that Mr HB M<sup>c</sup>Kntosh be<span class='line-break'> </span>secy pro tem. dissolved Jerome Jones<span class='line-break'> </span>sec pro tem</p>

<p>- Personally appeared Jerome Jones and<span class='line-break'> </span>made oath that he would faithfully discharge<span class='line-break'> </span>the duties of Secretary pro. tem of the Proprietors of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn. -</p>
<p>- Before me<span class='line-break'> </span>Roger Wolcott -<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the peace</p>

<p>- Personally appeared Henry B. Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>and made oath that he would faithfully<span class='line-break'> </span>discharge the duties appertaining to the Office<span class='line-break'> </span>of Secretary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn -</p>
<p>-Before me<span class='line-break'> </span>Roger Wolcott.<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p>resignation of J. Harris Reed as Secretary, which he had accepted -</p>
<p>-<u>Voted</u>:  The the acceptance of the resignation <span class='line-break'> </span>of J. Harris Reed, Secretary, be ratified &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Meetings 12, o&apos;clock -'><u>Meetings 12, o'clock -</u></span></p>
<p>-<u>Voted</u>:  Until otherwise ordered, that the <span class='line-break'> </span>regular monthly meetings of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>shall be called at 12, o'clock, noon. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reconveyance Lot #1903 authorized'><u>Reconveyance Lot #1903 authorized</u></span></p>
<p>-<u>Voted</u>:  That the Secretary be authorised to <span class='line-break'> </span>receive a deed of reconveyance to the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>of Lot #1903.  Amos T. Frothingham, Proprietor:<span class='line-break'> </span>Said lot be accepted as part payment of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #4730. sold him. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot N^o 1836  additional without dep for per. care.'><u>Lot N^o 1836  additional without dep for per. care.</u></span></p>
<p>-<u>Voted</u>:  That the Sale of 255 feet of ornamental <span class='line-break'> </span>land to the Heirs of J. F. Simons (owner of Lot #1836)<span class='line-break'> </span>without the usual deposit of Perpetual repair <span class='line-break'> </span>be authorised.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Schedules Aug^t 9. Sep^t 13 approved'><u>Schedules Aug^t 9. Sep^t 13 approved</u></span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'><u>Monthly Bills</u></span></p>
<p>-<u>Voted</u>:  That the Schedule of Monthly bills <span class='line-break'> </span>October 7^th be referred to the President for <span class='line-break'> </span>approval &amp; payment by the Treasurer. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treas^r Quarterly Reports.  June 30^th Sep^t 30^th'><u>Treas^r Quarterly Reports.  June 30^th Sep^t 30^th</u></span></p>

<p>-Committee on Lots recommended contracts <span class='line-break'> </span>for perpetual Care, as follows. -</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land'><u>Sales of Land</u></span></p>
<p>-The Secretary presented a statement of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Sales of land, reported by the  Sup^t and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved by the  ommittee on Lots, from June <span class='line-break'> </span>20^th to Sept.^163^ 13^th, &amp; from Sept. 13^th to Oct. ^164^ 7. 1882.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Judge Story Lot. N^o 313. excess of Income'><u>Judge Story Lot. N^o 313. excess of Income</u></span></p>
<p>The President suggested the propriety of <span class='line-break'> </span>devoting the balance of the income of the Story <span class='line-break'> </span>Fund (Lot #313) after defraying the necessary <span class='line-break'> </span>Annual expense of preserving &amp; keeping said <span class='line-break'> </span>lot in good Contition &amp; repair, to the purpose of <span class='line-break'> </span>aiding in the ornamenting &amp; preserving the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>agreeable to the provisions of the will of the late <span class='line-break'> </span>Judge Story:  the fund now is $5.563 73/100.-<span class='line-break'> </span>On motion it was</p>

<p>-<u>Voted</u>, that he be allowed to place the <span class='line-break'> </span>said Stone as a Monument in Said Lot, on <span class='line-break'> </span>Condition that any future erections of Stones in <span class='line-break'> </span>this lot shall conform to the regulation height as <span class='line-break'> </span>expressed in deed of Lot #4741. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition T. M. Merriman 3^d interment.'><u>Petition T. M. Merriman 3^d interment.</u></span></p>
<p>-<u>Voted</u>: that the petition^166^ of T. M. Merriman <span class='line-break'> </span>to make a third interment in Grave #157 St. <span class='line-break'> </span>James Lot, be laid upon the table. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition G. T. Angell.'><u>Petition G. T. Angell.</u></span></p>
<p>-<u>Voted</u>: that it is inexpedient to change the <span class='line-break'> </span>name of Central Square to Band of Mercy,<span class='line-break'> </span>as petitioned for by Geo. T. Angell, proprietor of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #4738. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reconveyance Lot 2220'><u>Reconveyance Lot 2220</u></span></p>
<p>-<u>Voted</u>:  to accept a deed of reconveyance of <span class='line-break'> </span>lot #2220 from the Heirs of Sam^l. Sweetser, for the <span class='line-break'> </span>purpose of relocation. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt^s report.  Boiler.'><u>Supt^s report.  Boiler.</u></span></p>
<p>- At a previous meeting, June 20^th, the Supt. was <span class='line-break'> </span>authorised to purchase a new boiler for the pumping <span class='line-break'> </span>Engine when needed:  The Supt. now reports that <span class='line-break'> </span>the examination of the boiler showed it to be in <span class='line-break'> </span>good contition, &amp; that therefore he had it inspected <span class='line-break'> </span>and insured against explosion, in the Hartford<span class='line-break'> </span>Steam B oiler Insurance Co -</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u>  H. B. MacKintosh,</p>
<p>Sec'y pro. tem.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135558">
<h3><a name="page-1135558">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 316</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>316</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nov^r. 8^th Meeting'><u>Nov^r. 8^th Meeting</u></span></p>
<p><u>November 8^th 1882.</u></p>
<p>-The Monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>Nov^r 8^th at 12 o'clock noon. -</p>
<p>Present -</p>
<p>-The President, Mess^rs. Jones, Rice, <span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow, Sears, Wolcott &amp; Eaton -</p>
<p>-The record of the meeting of October 7^th<span class='line-break'> </span>was read &amp; approved. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Finance Com^t on the Story Fund.'><u>Report of Finance Com^t on the Story Fund.</u></span></p>
<p>-the Finance Committee through Mr. Rice<span class='line-break'> </span>reported on the matter of the Appropriation<span class='line-break'> </span>of the balance of the income of the Story fund<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to them for consideration at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting the following vote which was unan<span class='line-break'></span>imously passed: -<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Story Fund bal. of income may be used'><u>Story Fund bal. of income may be used</u></span></p>
<p>-that the balance of the income of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Story fund (Lot #313) after defraying the <span class='line-break'> </span>necessary annual expense of preserving &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>keeping said lot in good contition &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>repair, be devoted to the purpose of aiding <span class='line-break'> </span>in ornamenting &amp; preserving th Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>ageeable to the provisions of the Will of <span class='line-break'> </span>the late Judge Story. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Finance Comt. on Trea^&apos;s Acct^s.'><u>Report of Finance Comt. on Trea^'s Acct^s.</u></span></p>
<p>- Mr. Rice for the Finance Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>reported that the Treasurer's quarterly <span class='line-break'> </span>statements of accounts for March 31^st ^156.^</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>-the report of the Committee be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; the Treasurer's Statements be placed on file. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reconveyance Lot $#4669 authorized.'><u>Reconveyance Lot $#4669 authorized.</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>-</p>
<p>-That the Treasurer be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>receive a deed of reconveyance of Lot #4669<span class='line-break'> </span>from J. Montgomery Sears Esq,  in part exchange <span class='line-break'> </span>for Lot #4759 recently purchased by him. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sell add^t[?] to Lot #2607 without Perp^t care -'><u>Sell add^t[?] to Lot #2607 without Perp^t care -</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u></p>
<p>-That the Supt. be authorized to sell <span class='line-break'> </span>100 feet of land additional to Lot # 2607<span class='line-break'> </span>owned by the Heirs of Jacob Bancroft, without <span class='line-break'> </span>deposit for perpetual care.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'><u>Monthly Bills</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u></p>
<p>- That the Schedule of Monthly bills <span class='line-break'> </span>Nov7^r 8^th be referred to the President for <span class='line-break'> </span>approval, &amp; payment made by the Treasurer -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land'><u>Sales of Land</u></span></p>
<p>-The Sec'y presented a Statement of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Sales of Land ^167^ from Oct. 11^th to Nov^r 8^th reported <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Supt. &amp; approved by the Committee on Lots.</p>

<p>"1445}  "  "  Geo. Thacher}$600</p>

<p>-Mr. Robt. W. Nason Executor of the will of <span class='line-break'> </span>Augusta H. Hanscom proprietor of Lot #2903,<span class='line-break'> </span>appeared befoe the Board &amp; made a Statement <span class='line-break'> </span>in regard to the Sum of $2.000 bequested by <span class='line-break'> </span>said Augusta N. Hanscom for perpetual care <span class='line-break'> </span>of said lot, claiming that the amount bequeathed<span class='line-break'> </span>was excessive &amp; more than he felt authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to pay:  After hearing his remarks it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>-</p>

<p>- That the whole subject be referred  ^168A^ to<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Choate &amp; that he be requested to confer with <span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Nason &amp; report to the next monthly meeting. -</p>

<p><u>December 13^th 1882</u>-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='No Quorum'><u>No Quorum</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>The Monthly Meeting was notified to be <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday Dec^r 13^th at 12, o'clock noon.</p>
<p><u>No quorum was present.</u></p>
<p>H. B. MacKintosh. -</p>
<p>Sec. pro tem. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='January 10^th Meeting.'><u>January 10^th Meeting.</u></span></p>
<p><u>January 10^th 1883.</u></p>
<p>-The monthly meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified, on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>January 10^th at 12, o'clock noon.</p>
<p>Present-</p>
<p>-The President, Mess^rs. Eaton, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow, Sears, Rice, Wolcott &amp; Payson,. -<span class='line-break'> </span>-The record of the Meeting of Nov^r 8^th<span class='line-break'> </span>was read &amp; approved. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President&apos;s Annual Report to Proprietors.'><u>President's Annual Report to Proprietors.</u></span></p>
<p>-The President presented &amp; read the annual <span class='line-break'> </span>Report to the Proprietors,-^169^</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>-</p>
<p>-  That the Annual report as read, with the <span class='line-break'> </span>insertion of a clause in regard to removal <span class='line-break'> </span>of granite curbs as suggested by Mr Wolcott, be <span class='line-break'> </span>approved &amp; adopted as the Report of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Proprietors &amp; that it be printed &amp; distributed <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Proprietors. -</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
