<p>that said report be accepted &amp; printed.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Treasurer's Annual Report approved by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Finance Committee was presented: - 171.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> -</p>
<p>that said report be accepted &amp; printed.</p>
<p>- Mr Choate reported that he had conferred with<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Robt W. Nason Exector of the Will of Augusta<span class='line-break'> </span>H Hanscom proprietor of Lot #2903, in regard<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Amount bequeathed for the perpetual repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of said lot, &amp; offered the following vote which was<span class='line-break'> </span>unanimously adopted. -</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bequest for Perp. care Lot #2903 Hanscom.'>Bequest for Perp. care Lot #2903 Hanscom.</span></p>

Hanscom<span class='line-break'> </span>the sum of twelve hundred dollars &amp; give the<span class='line-break'> </span>usual Contract for the perpetual care of Lot<span class='line-break'> </span>#2903 &amp; also give a full release for the bequest<span class='line-break'> </span>made by said will for the perpetual care of said <span class='line-break'> </span>lot. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition, E.W Smith Lot #4531'>Petition, E.W Smith Lot #4531</span></p>

Smith^172.^&amp; others was<span class='line-break'> </span>presented for permission to allow a tablet measur<span class='line-break'></span>ing six inches above the regulation height as Ex<span class='line-break'></span>pressed in the deed, to be placed on Lot #4531.,<span class='line-break'> </span>whereupon it was,</p>
</div>

<p><u>Voted</u> -</p>
<p>that the petitioners have leave to withdraw. -</p>
<p>- On motion of Mr Wolcott it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comt. on Lots Notice to Pros on restricted Lots. '>Comt. on Lots Notice to Pro<sup>s</sup> on restricted Lots. </span></p>
<p>that the Committee on Lots consider &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>report upon the expediency of Extending a more<span class='line-break'> </span>general notice to proprietors who have purchased<span class='line-break'> </span>lots under restriction in regard to the height of<span class='line-break'> </span>headstones; and if such notice is desirable,<span class='line-break'> </span>in what form &amp; manner the notice shall be issued.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Compensation of Treasurer for duties of Secretary. ~'>Compensation of Treasurer for duties of Secretary. ~</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u> -<span class='line-break'> </span>that the matter of Extra Compensation to be<span class='line-break'> </span>paid the Treasurer for the performance of<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary's duties since July 1<sup>st</sup> last, be<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Finance Committee to consider<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; report. -</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills.'>Monthly Bills.</span></p>
<p>that the Schedule of Monthly bills Dec<sup>r</sup> 13<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; January 10<sup>th</sup> be referred to the President<span class='line-break'> </span>for approval &amp; payment made by the Treasurer.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives.'>Representatives.</span></p>
<p>that representatives be designated for<span class='line-break'> </span>lots as follows</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot No.'>Lot No.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3542.'>3542.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Sarah H. Quinby, Boston, Daughter.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='906'>906</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Mary E Munroe, Cambridge, Daughter.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3.329'>3.329</span><span class='line-break'> </span>James P. Leeds, Boston, Son.</p>

<p>- The Sec'y presented a statement of the Sales<span class='line-break'> </span>of land from Nov<sup>r</sup> 8<sup>th</sup> to Dec<sup>r</sup> 13<sup>th</sup>, &amp; from<span class='line-break'> </span>Dec<sup>r</sup> 13<sup>th</sup> to January 10, 1883.^174.^ -</p>

<p><u>February 14<sup>th</sup> 1883.</u></p>
<p>The Monthly Meeting was notified to be<span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday February 14<sup>th</sup> at 12<span class='line-break'> </span>O'clock Noon - <u>No quorum was present.</u></p>

<p><u>February 16. 1883.</u></p>
<p>The Monthly meeting was notified<span class='line-break'> </span>to be held on Friday Feby. 16. at 12<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock M. - <u>No quorum was present</u><span class='line-break'> </span>H.B. Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>Adjourned to Feb. 21<sup>st</sup> Secy. pro tem.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='February 21. Meeting ~ '>February 21. Meeting ~ </span></p>
<p><u>February 21. 1883.</u></p>
<p>- The monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held agreeably to adjournment,<span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday February 21. 1883 at 12, oclock M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present -</p>
<p>The President, Messrs Bigelow, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Rice, Jones &amp; Eaton. -</p>
<p>- On motion of Mr Choate it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u> -<span class='line-break'> </span>to dispense with the reading of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Records of the last meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Elected Feby. 5. &apos;83.'>Trustees Elected Feby. 5. '83.</span></p>
<p>- The Prest. announced that at the Annual<span class='line-break'> </span>Meeting of the Proprietors Feb. 5. 1883, the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees Elected were Mess<sup>rs</sup> Alanson Bigelow<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; henry A Rice for the term of six years,<span class='line-break'> </span>Ending 1889.</p>
<p>- Mr Eaton having been appointed</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of President'>Election of President</span></p>
<p>by the Prest. to collect, sort &amp; count the Ballots<span class='line-break'> </span>for Officers for the Ensuing year, announced<span class='line-break'> </span>that the whole number of <u>ballots</u> for <u>President</u><span class='line-break'> </span>was <u>six</u> all of which were for <u>I.M. Spelman</u><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; he was declared Elected. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer'>Treasurer</span></p>
<p>- Whole number for <u>Treasurer</u> was <u>seven</u><span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>H.B. Mackintosh</u> and he was<span class='line-break'> </span>declared Elected. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt'>Sup<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p>-Whole number for <u>Supt.</u> was <u>Seven</u>, all of which<span class='line-break'> </span>were for <u>J.W. Lovering</u>, &amp; he was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec&apos;y'>Sec'y</span></p>
<p>- Whole number for <u>Secretary</u> was <u>Seven</u>, all of which<span class='line-break'> </span>were for <u>Lewis G. Farmer</u> &amp; he was declared<span class='line-break'> </span>Elected. -</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Treasr'>Salary of Treas<sup>r</sup></span></p>
<p>- that the salary of the Treasurer be fixed<span class='line-break'> </span>at $2250 - for the ensuing year -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt'>Sup<sup>t</sup></span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, the Salary of the Supt. $3.000 - for the ensuing<span class='line-break'> </span>year &amp; that he shall have the use of a house<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; the grounds thereto belonging, the use of a <span class='line-break'> </span>horse &amp; vehicle &amp; the services of one man at<span class='line-break'> </span>the expense of the corporation -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec&apos;y'>Sec'y</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u> -<span class='line-break'> </span>- that the Salary of the Secretary be fixed<span class='line-break'> </span>at $500 - for the ensuing year. -</p>
<p>- As provided by the Rules &amp; Regulations<span class='line-break'> </span>the President appointed the Standing Committees<span class='line-break'> </span>for 1883-1884 the same as last year. viz.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>- <u>Committee on Finance</u> -<span class='line-break'> </span>Mess<sup>rs</sup> Brown &amp; Rice</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Interments'>Interments</span></p>
<p>- <u>Committee on Interments</u> -<span class='line-break'> </span>Mess<sup>rs</sup> Bigelow &amp; Eaton.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Birds'>Birds</span></p>
<p>- <u>Committee on Birds</u> -<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Walcott.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Unfinished Business continued'>Unfinished Business continued</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u> -<span class='line-break'> </span>- that the Committees of last year<span class='line-break'> </span>having unfinished business be continued. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Compensation of Treasr pro tem. '>Compensation of Treas<sup>r</sup> pro tem. </span></p>
<p>- The Committee appointed at the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees January 10<sup>th</sup> to whom was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter of Extra Compensation of the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>for the performance of Secretary's duties since<span class='line-break'> </span>July 1<sup>st</sup> last reported that the Treasurer be<span class='line-break'> </span>paid $250 -</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> -<span class='line-break'> </span>- that the report be accepted. -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chant Lot plan of new Ave.'>Chant Lot plan of new Ave.</span></p>
<p>- The Supt. presented a plan of the new<span class='line-break'> </span>Avenue on the Chant Lot - ^175^</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> - <span class='line-break'> </span>- That the plan &amp; the name of the Avenue<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Prest. with full powers.</p>

<div id="page-1135570">
<h3><a name="page-1135570">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 328</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>328</p>
<p>- Commonwealth of Massachusetts -<span class='line-break'> </span>- Suffolk S.S. February 27<sup>th</sup> 1883. -</p>
<p>- Personally appeared Lewis G. Farmer<span class='line-break'> </span>and made oath that he would faithfully<span class='line-break'> </span>discharge the duties of Secretary of the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn. -</p>
<p>- Before me<span class='line-break'> </span>H.B. Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='March 14 Meeting'>March 14 Meeting</span></p>
<p><u>March 14, 1883</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified, on Wed<span class='line-break'></span>nesday, March 14, 1883, at 12 o'clock, M.</p>
<p>Present:<span class='line-break'> </span>The President, Messrs. Jones,<span class='line-break'> </span>Brown, Eaton, Rice, Sears, Cotting &amp; Payson.</p>
<p>The records of the last meeting were<span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills.'>Monthly Bills.</span></p>
<p>The schedule of monthly bills of<span class='line-break'> </span>March 14, was presented, showing a total<span class='line-break'> </span>of $3.307.20. and it was voted that the<span class='line-break'> </span>same be referred to the President for approval,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135571">
<h3><a name="page-1135571">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 329</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>329</p>
<p>and payment made by the Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts, Perpetual Repair'>Contracts, Perpetual Repair</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>contracts for perpetual care, as follows:</p>
<p>Lot #94. Heirs of *Norwood $325.<span class='line-break'> </span>#580. Est. Henry W. Longfellow 400.<span class='line-break'> </span>#4074 Est. Matilda Grant 225.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Lands'>Sales of Lands</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented^177^Statement of<span class='line-break'> </span>Sales of Land from Feb. 14 to March 4,</p>
<p>Voted:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Represent&apos;s'>Represent's</span></p>
<p>That Representatives be desig<span class='line-break'></span>nated for Lots, as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot No. 984'>Lot No. 984</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Mary E. Colley, Boston Widow.</p>
<p><u>Dissolved.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>Lewis G. Farmer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='April 11.'>April 11.</span></p>
<p><u>April 11, 1883</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='No Quorum.'>No Quorum.</span></p>
<p>The monthly meeting was notified<span class='line-break'> </span>to be held on Wednesday, April 11, at 12<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock, M. <u>No quorum was present.</u></p>

<div id="page-1135572">
<h3><a name="page-1135572">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 330</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>330</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1883 May 9. No Quorum.'>1883 May 9. No Quorum.</span></p>
<p><u>May 9, 1883.</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting was notified to be<span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday May 9, at 12 o'clock, M.<span class='line-break'> </span><u>No quorum was present.</u></p>
<p>Lewis G. Farmer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='June 13 Meeting'>June 13 Meeting</span></p>
<p><u>June 13, 1883.</u></p>
<p>The Monthly meeting of the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held as notified on Wed<span class='line-break'></span>nesday, June 13, 1993, at 12 o'clock, M,</p>
<p>Present:<span class='line-break'> </span>The President, Messrs Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Eaton, Cotting, Sears, Jones, Choate &amp; Payson.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Browne, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> - to dispense with the reading of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Records of the last meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Neglected Lots'>Neglected Lots</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr Choate, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u> that Lots^178^numbered 241, Heirs of Fairchild<span class='line-break'> </span>375, Heirs of Meldrum, 487, Heirs of Barnes, 795,<span class='line-break'> </span>Heirs of Kendrick, 1419, Heirs of Wheeler, 1491<span class='line-break'> </span>Bird, 1962, Buck, 2108, Bennett, 3299, Shuetz,<span class='line-break'> </span>4138, Woodward, being in a state of continued<span class='line-break'> </span>neglect, and their condition impairing the<span class='line-break'> </span>appearance of the Cemetery, the Secretary be<span class='line-break'> </span>directed to send notice in writing to the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135573">
<h3><a name="page-1135573">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 331</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>331</p>
<p>last known residence of the Proprietor or<span class='line-break'> </span>Representative of each of said Lots, of the<span class='line-break'> </span>fact of their condition, and that if the same<span class='line-break'> </span>shall remain in such neglected condition<span class='line-break'> </span>for thirty days after the date of such notice,<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent be directed to put the<span class='line-break'> </span>same in proper order, under the direction<span class='line-break'> </span>of the President at the expense of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors, as provided by Article VI of the<span class='line-break'> </span>By-Laws, said notice to be sent by mail.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gridley Fund'>Gridley Fund</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer presented a report^179^that<span class='line-break'> </span>Policy NO. 3594 of the Massachusetts Hospital<span class='line-break'> </span>Life Insurance Company, amounting with<span class='line-break'> </span>interest, to $6363.99, mentioned in late reports<span class='line-break'> </span>after the head of "Permanent Fund," and<span class='line-break'> </span>payable on the decease of certain parties, <span class='line-break'> </span>had been paid (April 26, 1883) - The report<span class='line-break'> </span>was accepted, and it was, thereupon,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bal. of Income may be used.'>Bal. of Income may be used.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, that the balance of the income<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Gridley Fund (Lot 721), after defray<span class='line-break'></span>ing the necessary annual expense of<span class='line-break'> </span>preserving and keeping said Lot in good<span class='line-break'> </span>condition and repair, be devoted to the<span class='line-break'> </span>purpose of aiding in ornamenting and<span class='line-break'> </span>preserving the grounds of the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>agreeably to the provisions of the deed<span class='line-break'> </span>of trust dated January 27, 1862, and<span class='line-break'> </span>recorded in Book of Contracts for Repairs</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135574">
<h3><a name="page-1135574">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 332</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>332</p>
<p>Vol. I. p. 95.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Pictorial Souvenir'>Pictorial Souvenir</span></p>
<p>The Superintendent presented a<span class='line-break'> </span>pictorial Souvenir of Greenwood Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>and gave an estimate of the expense of<span class='line-break'> </span>preparing a similar production relating<span class='line-break'> </span>to Mount Auburn Cemtery, and, after<span class='line-break'> </span>discussion, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, that the Subject be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Lots, with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chant Lot.'>Chant Lot.</span></p>
<p>The Superintendent presented a plan^175^<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Chant Lot, showing the new avenue<span class='line-break'> </span>called Vesper Avenue, and also the pro-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Public Lot.'>New Public Lot.</span></p>
<p>posed new Public Lot, and it was,</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, that the Superintendent, under<span class='line-break'> </span>the direction of the Committee on Lots, be<span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to use such portion of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Chant Lot as lies between Vesper Ave<span class='line-break'></span>nue and the wooden fence, as shown<span class='line-break'> </span>on said plan, for a public lot, and that<span class='line-break'> </span>the same be called Vesper Lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vesper Lot. Petition of Wm. Robinson'>Vesper Lot. Petition of Wm. Robinson</span></p>
<p>A petition^180^was presented from Wil<span class='line-break'></span>liam Robinson, formerly owner of Lot No.<span class='line-break'> </span>2062, reconveyed to the Corporation in trust,<span class='line-break'> </span>for leave to Lydia Webster to remove from<span class='line-break'> </span>said Lot the body of her husband, Charles<span class='line-break'> </span>E. Webster, with the intention of interring the<span class='line-break'> </span>same in a lot to be purchased by her,<span class='line-break'> </span>said petitioner agreeing to hold the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135575">
<h3><a name="page-1135575">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 333</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>333</p>
<p>Corporation harmless.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, that said removal be allowed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Request of Lydia Webster'>Request of Lydia Webster</span></p>
<p>The Superintendent presented a request<span class='line-break'> </span>of said Lydia Webster to be allowed to<span class='line-break'> </span>remove a stone bearing her husband's name<span class='line-break'> </span>from said Lot NO. 2062 to such Lot as she <span class='line-break'> </span>should purchase, but no action was<span class='line-break'> </span>taken thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition of Mary Sloan'>Petition of Mary Sloan</span></p>
<p>A communication^181^was presented from<span class='line-break'> </span>Mrs Mary Sloan, owner of Lot NO. 4628, for<span class='line-break'> </span>leave to raise a headstone therein, upon<span class='line-break'> </span>which it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, inexpedient to grant the request.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition of Mrs. Peleg Aborn.'>Petition of Mrs. Peleg Aborn.</span></p>
<p>A communication^182^was presented from<span class='line-break'> </span>Mrs. Pelog Aborn, owner of Lots Nos. 2441 and<span class='line-break'> </span>2655, that the same might be relocated<span class='line-break'> </span>into lots containing respectively 450 sq. ft.<span class='line-break'> </span>and 150 sq. ft, as shown on a plan drawn<span class='line-break'> </span>on her communication, and it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, that the Secretary be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to receive a reconveyance of said lots<span class='line-break'> </span>as requested and to execute quite claim deeds<span class='line-break'> </span>to said petitioner of said lots divided<span class='line-break'> </span>as proposed by her, upon such con<span class='line-break'></span>ditions as may be imposed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'>Monthly Bills</span></p>
<p>The schedule of Monthly bills of<span class='line-break'> </span>April 11, was presented, showing a total</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="page-content">
<p>334</p>
<p>of $4534.14; that of May 9, showing a total <span class='line-break'> </span>of $5504.93; and that of June 13, showing a <span class='line-break'> </span>total of $6478.14, which last was read by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary, and it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u> that the same be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>President for approval, and payment made <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tresurer&apos;s Quarterly Report.'><u>Tresurer's Quarterly Report.</u></span></p>
<p>The President having presented his <span class='line-break'> </span>Quarterly Report <sup>182.a</sup>, the same was referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Finance.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land'><u>Sales of Land</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented Statements <sup>183.184 ^185</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>of Sales of land from March 14 to June 13.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives'><u>Representatives</u></span></p>
<p>That Representatives be des<span class='line-break'></span>ignated for Lots as follows:</p>

Coveney, agent for the City of Cambridge, <span class='line-break'> </span>in regard to the purchase of land on Cool<span class='line-break'></span>idge Avenue belonging to the Corporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>and adjoining the Cambridge Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>upon which it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,  that the President be insruccted <span class='line-break'> </span>to reply that the Trustees have no wish to <span class='line-break'> </span>sell the property,.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'><u>Monthly Bills</u></span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1884 Jan. 9. No Quorum'><u>1884 Jan. 9. No Quorum</u></span></p>
<p><u>January 9. 1884</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting was notified to be <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday January 9, at 12 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>M.  <u>No quorum was present.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='January 17 Special Meeting'><u>January 17 Special Meeting</u></span></p>
<p>January17, 1884</p>
<p>A Special Meeting of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees was held as notified on <span class='line-break'> </span>Thursday, January 17, 1884. at 1 o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present.</p>
<p>The President, Messrs Bigelow, <span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Cotting, Eaton, Jones and Sears.</p>
<p>The records of the meeting of Octoer <span class='line-break'> </span>10, and subsequent meetings were read <span class='line-break'> </span>and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President&apos;s Annual Report to Proprietors'><u>President's Annual Report to Proprietors</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented and read the <span class='line-break'> </span>Annuyal Report <sup>195</sup> to the Proprietors:</p>
<p>Voted.</p>
<p>That the Annual Report, as <span class='line-break'> </span>read, be approved and adopted as the <span class='line-break'> </span>Report of the Trustees to the Proprietors,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that it be printed and distributed <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Proprietors,</p>
<p>The Superintendent's Annual Report <sup>196</sup></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>for 1883 was presented.</p>
<p>Voted.</p>
<p>That said report be accepted and printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Annual Report'><u>Treasurer's Annual Report</u></span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's Annual Report <sup>197</sup>, approved by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Finance Committee was presented:</p>
<p>Voted.</p>
<p>That said report be accepted and printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition of Mrs. Carrie Hartswell'><u>Petition of Mrs. Carrie Hartswell</u></span></p>
<p>Voted.</p>
<p>That the Secretary be authorized to receive <span class='line-break'> </span>from Mrs. Carrie Hartswell, a conveyance of Lot <span class='line-break'> </span>No. 4715. in part payment for Lot. No. 4832, and<span class='line-break'> </span>on payment by her of the balance then due, <span class='line-break'> </span>to execute to her a deed of said Lot No. 4832.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills.'><u>Monthly Bills.</u></span></p>
<p>The Schedule of Monthly Bills of Novem<span class='line-break'></span>ber 14.1883, was presented, showing a total of <span class='line-break'> </span>$5,080.18;  that of December 12, showing a total<span class='line-break'> </span>of $5075.34; and that of January 9, showing<span class='line-break'> </span>a total of $2,897, and it was</p>
<p>Voted, that the same be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the President for approval, and payment <span class='line-break'> </span>made by the Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perpetual Care'><u>Contracts Perpetual Care</u></span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots recommended Con<span class='line-break'></span>tracts for perpetual care, as follows, the <span class='line-break'> </span>same being approved by the Board:</p>
<p>Lot# 1472  Warren K. Blodgett.  $1000.<span class='line-break'> </span>2462  Harriet H. Bartlett $200</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of land.'><u>Sales of land.</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented Statements <sup>198.197.</sup>  of Sales <span class='line-break'> </span>of Land from October 10, 1883 to January 9, 1894.</p>

<div id="page-1135585">
<h3><a name="page-1135585">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 343</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>343</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1884 February 15. Meeting'>1884 February 15. Meeting</span></p>
<p><u>February 15. 1884.</u></p>
<p>- The Monthly Meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held agreeably to adjournment, on<span class='line-break'> </span>Friday, February 15, 1884, at 12 o'clock, M.</p>
<p>- Present. -<span class='line-break'> </span>- The President, Messrs. Bigelow, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Jones, Payson, Rice and Sears.<span class='line-break'> </span>- On motion of Mr. Browne, it was<span class='line-break'> </span>- <u>Voted</u> -<span class='line-break'> </span>- To dispense with the reading of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Records of the last meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Elected, Feb. 4, 1884.'>Trustees Elected, Feb. 4, 1884.</span></p>
<p>- The President announced that at the<span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Meeting of the Proprietors, held<span class='line-break'> </span>February 4, 1884, the trustees elected were<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs. <u>Charles F. Choate</u> and <u>J. Montgomery<span class='line-break'> </span>Sears</u>, for the term of Six Years, ending 1890.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of President'>Election of President</span></p>
<p>- Mr. Sears having been appointed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>President to collect, sort and count the<span class='line-break'> </span>ballots for Officers for the ensuing year,<span class='line-break'> </span>announced that the whole number of ballots<span class='line-break'> </span>for President was six, all of which were for<span class='line-break'> </span><u>J.M. Spelman</u>, and he was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer'>Treasurer</span></p>
<p>- Whole number for Treasurer, seven, all of<span class='line-break'> </span>which were for <u>H.B. Mackintosh</u>, and he was<span class='line-break'> </span>declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent'>Superintendent</span></p>
<p>- Whole number for Superintendent, seven,<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for <u>J.W. Lovering</u>, and he<span class='line-break'> </span>was declared elected.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135586">
<h3><a name="page-1135586">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 344</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>344</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary'>Secretary</span></p>
<p>- Whole number for Secretary, seven, all of<span class='line-break'> </span>which were for <u>Lewis G. Farmer</u>, and he was de<span class='line-break'></span>clared elected.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Treasurer'>Salary of Treasurer</span></p>
<p>- That the Salary of the Treasurer be fixed<span class='line-break'> </span>at $2,250 for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sup&apos;t'>Sup't</span></p>
<p>- That the Salary of the Superintendent be fixed<span class='line-break'> </span>at $3,000 for the ensuing year, and that he shall<span class='line-break'> </span>have the use of a House, and the grounds thereto<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging, the use of a Horse and Vehicle, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>services of one Man, at the expense of the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec&apos;y.'>Sec'y.</span></p>
<p>- That the Salary of the Secretary be fixed at<span class='line-break'> </span>$500 for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Standing Committees'>Standing Committees</span></p>
<p>- The President announced the Standing<span class='line-break'> </span>Committees for 1884-5, as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Grounds'>Grounds</span></p>
<p><u>Committee on Grounds.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>- The President, ex officio, and Messrs. Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Cotting, Payson and Sears.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots'>Lots</span></p>
<p><u>Committee on Lots.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>- The President and Messrs. Whitney &amp; Jones.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Finance'>Finance</span></p>
<p><u>Committee on Finance.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>- Messrs. Browne &amp; Rice.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Interments'>Interments</span></p>
<p><u>Committee on Interments.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>- Messrs. Bigelow &amp; Eaton.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Birds'>Birds</span></p>
<p><u>Committee on Birds.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>- Mr. Wolcott.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Neglected Lots'>Neglected Lots</span></p>
<p>- <u>Voted</u>, that Lots^201.^numbered 13, Heirs of Mead,<span class='line-break'> </span>53, Heirs of Read, 642, Heirs of Coleman, 743,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135587">
<h3><a name="page-1135587">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 345</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>345</p>
<p>Heirs of Goodrich, 1067, Abbot, 1119, Bush, 1269, Heirs<span class='line-break'> </span>of Boardman, 1622, Smith, 1694, Heirs of Bryant,<span class='line-break'> </span>1720, Heirs of Swasey, 1991, Taylor, 2524, Heirs of<span class='line-break'> </span>Anderson, 2904, Heirs of Sibley, 2913, Heirs of Nye,<span class='line-break'> </span>being in a state of continued neglect, and their<span class='line-break'> </span>condition impairing the appearance of the Ceme<span class='line-break'></span>tery, the Secretary, under the direction of the<span class='line-break'> </span>President, send notice in writing to the last<span class='line-break'> </span>known residence of the Proprietor or Representative of<span class='line-break'> </span>each of said Lots, of the fact of their condition;<span class='line-break'> </span>and that, if the same shall remain in such<span class='line-break'> </span>neglected condition for thirty days after the date<span class='line-break'> </span>of such notice, the Superintendent put the same<span class='line-break'> </span>in proper order, under the direction of the President,<span class='line-break'> </span>at the expense of the Proprietors, as provided by<span class='line-break'> </span>Article VI. of the By-Laws; said notice to be sent<span class='line-break'> </span>by mail</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills.'>Monthly Bills.</span></p>
<p>- The Schedule of Monthly Bills of February<span class='line-break'> </span>13. was presented, showing a total of $3,826.66, and<span class='line-break'> </span>- <u>Voted</u>, that upon approval by the President,<span class='line-break'> </span>payment thereof be made by the Treasurer</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land.'>Sales of Land.</span></p>
<p>- The Secretary presented a Statement^202^of Sales<span class='line-break'> </span>of Land from Jan. 9 to Feb. 13, 1884.<span class='line-break'> </span>- <u>Voted</u>,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lots Nos.'>Representatives Lots Nos.</span></p>
<p>- That Representatives be designated for Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='373'>373</span><span class='line-break'> </span>- Mary A. Cummings of Watertown, widow,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3864'>3864</span><span class='line-break'> </span>- Mary E. Beck " Boston, daughter<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135588">
<h3><a name="page-1135588">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 346</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>346</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perpetual Repair.'>Contracts Perpetual Repair.</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>an additional contract for the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>care of Lot #900, Exor's. of Otis Norcross, $250<span class='line-break'> </span>and the same was approved by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hour of Meeting.'>Hour of Meeting.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,<span class='line-break'> </span>That the hour of holding the monthly<span class='line-break'> </span>Meetings of the Trustees, be changed to<span class='line-break'> </span>1:30 P.M., until otherwise ordered.</p>
<p>Dissolved.<span class='line-break'> </span>Lewis G. Farmer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary&apos;s Oath'>Secretary's Oath</span></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts.<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk, ss. Boston, February 15. A.D. 1884.</p>
<p>Personally appeared Lewis G. Farmer,<span class='line-break'> </span>and made oath that he would faithfully<span class='line-break'> </span>discharge the duties of Secretary of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mt. Auburn.</p>
<p>Before me,<span class='line-break'> </span>Jerome Jones.<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135589">
<h3><a name="page-1135589">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 347</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>347</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1884 March 12 No Quorum'>1884 March 12 No Quorum</span></p>
<p><u>March 12, 1884</u></p>
<p>The monthly meeting was notified<span class='line-break'> </span>to be held on Wednesday, March 12, 1884,<span class='line-break'> </span>at 1:30 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p><u>No quorum was present.</u></p>
<p>Lewis G. Farmer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Alanson Bigelow Resolutions'>Alanson Bigelow Resolutions</span></p>
<p><u>Resolutions^203^upon the decease of<span class='line-break'> </span>Alanson Bigelow, a member<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board of Trustees.</u></p>
<p><u>Resolved</u>: That we desire to enter on<span class='line-break'> </span>our records our appreciation of the worth<span class='line-break'> </span>and services of our late associate, Mr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Alanson Bigelow. Always judicious,<span class='line-break'> </span>prompt and efficient in the perform<span class='line-break'></span>ance of duty, he had endeared himself<span class='line-break'> </span>to our hearts during his term of Seven<span class='line-break'> </span>Years service on our Board, by his uni<span class='line-break'></span>form courtesy of manners and consid<span class='line-break'></span>eration for the opinions and feelings of<span class='line-break'> </span>others.</p>
<p><u>Resolved</u>: That we deeply regret the<span class='line-break'> </span>loss we have sustained, and tended to his<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135590">
<h3><a name="page-1135590">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 348</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>348</p>
<p>wife and family our respectful sympathy<span class='line-break'> </span>in their great bereavement.</p>
<p><u>Resolved</u>: That a copy of these reso<span class='line-break'></span>lutions be presented by the Secretary to<span class='line-break'> </span>Mrs. Bigelow and to the family of the de<span class='line-break'></span>ceased.</p>
<p>The foregoing resolutions were<span class='line-break'> </span>offered for the consideration of those mem<span class='line-break'> </span>bers of the Board of Trustees who were pres<span class='line-break'></span>ent at the meeting called for March, 12. 1884,<span class='line-break'> </span>and after a copy of the same had been<span class='line-break'> </span>signed by all the members of the Board,<span class='line-break'> </span>such copy was sent by mail to Mrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow and family.</p>
<p>Attest:<span class='line-break'> </span>Lewis G. Farmer.<span class='line-break'> </span>April 8th, 1884 Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>

<p>355</p>
<p>The records of the meeting of June 26, 1884, and <span class='line-break'> </span>of subsequent meetings were read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chant and Wattriss Lots'><u>Chant and Wattriss Lots</u></span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Choate, it was <span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>  That the layout out of the Chant and <span class='line-break'> </span>Wattriss Lots, and the naming of Avenues and Paths <span class='line-break'> </span>thereon as shown upon a Plan <sup>211</sup> prepared by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent, dated Novenmber 12. 1884. be,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the same is hereby adopted and approved -<span class='line-break'> </span>said Plan to be placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Same Subject Landscape Lawn Plan'><u>Same Subject Landscape Lawn Plan</u></span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Browne, it was <span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>  That the Landscape Lawn Plan be <span class='line-break'> </span>extended to embrace the Chant and Wattris Lots, <span class='line-break'> </span>and that the Rules and Regulations now in force<span class='line-break'> </span>upon the "Stone Farm" territory, so called be ex<span class='line-break'></span>tended and applied to the Chant and Wattriss Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hanscom Bequest'><u>Hanscom Bequest</u></span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Choate, it was <span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>  That unless the conditions of the <span class='line-break'> </span>vote of the Board passed January 10.1883. re<span class='line-break'></span>lating to the bequest of Augusta H. Hanscom,<span class='line-break'> </span>are complied with, and payment made before <span class='line-break'> </span>December 1. 1884.  the said vote is rescinded.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee on INterments'><u>Committee on INterments</u></span></p>
<p>A suggeston was made as to the exist<span class='line-break'></span>ence of a vacancy in the Committee on Interments, <span class='line-break'> </span>caused by tahe death of the late Alanson Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>and athe President appointed <u>Mr. Jones</u><span class='line-break'> </span>to fill the same</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Old Receiving T omb'><u>Old Receiving T omb</u></span></p>
<p>The question of the discontinuance of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Old Receiving Tomb was presented to the Board</p>

<p><u>January 16, 1885.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>A Special Meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held as notified, on Friday, January 16, 1885<span class='line-break'> </span>at 2:30 o'clock P.M. Present<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs. Browne, Choate, Jones, Payson, Rice,<span class='line-break'> </span>Whitney and Wolcott. The President being de<span class='line-break'></span>tained at home by illness, Mr. Choate was chosen<span class='line-break'> </span>to preside, and acted as chairman.<span class='line-break'> </span>The records of the meeting of November 12, and of<span class='line-break'> </span>subsequent meetings, were read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Report to Proprietors'>Annual Report to Proprietors</span></p>
<p>The Annual Report to the Proprietors^219^was<span class='line-break'> </span>presented and read. The report containing<span class='line-break'> </span>a proposed amendment of the third clause of<span class='line-break'> </span>Article VIII of the By-Laws, the same was con-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendment to By-Laws.'>Amendment to By-Laws.</span></p>
<p>sidered by teh Board, and it was voted to pre<span class='line-break'></span>sent the same in the following form to the Pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietors for their sanction: "All such sums</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135601">
<h3><a name="page-1135601">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 359</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>359</p>
<p>"shall collectively constitute a separate fund, called<span class='line-break'> </span>"the 'Repair Fund', and shall be invested in the pub<span class='line-break'></span>"lic debt of the United States, or in that of the State of<span class='line-break'> </span>"Massachusetts, or in the debt of any of the counties,<span class='line-break'> </span>"cities, or towns of this State, or in mortgages of real<span class='line-break'> </span>"estate in any city in Massachusetts, or in first<span class='line-break'> </span>"mortgage bonds, or debenture bonds of railroads<span class='line-break'> </span>"not mortgaged, of any railroad company in<span class='line-break'></span>"corporated under the authority of this Common<span class='line-break'></span>"wealth which has earned and paid regular div<span class='line-break'></span>"idends for the two years next preceeding such<span class='line-break'> </span>"investment." It was then voted.</p>
<p>That the Annual Report, as read, with the<span class='line-break'> </span>proposed amendment, be approved and adopted<span class='line-break'> </span>as the Report of the Trustees to the Proprietors,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that it be printed and distributed to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Reports of Treasurer Sup&apos;t Mr. Cotting declines'>Annual Reports of Treasurer Sup't Mr. Cotting declines</span></p>
<p>The Annual Reports of the Treasurer^220^ and<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Superintendent^221^ were also presented.<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That the same be accepted and<span class='line-break'> </span>printed, and distributed to the Proprietors.<span class='line-break'> </span>A Communication was received from Mr. C.U.<span class='line-break'> </span>Cotting, declining to be a candidate for re<span class='line-break'></span>election as Trustee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Agreement Bradley Fertilizer Co.'>Agreement Bradley Fertilizer Co.</span></p>
<p>Mr. Browne, on behalf of the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Finance, presented an agreement^222^between the<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation and the Bradley Fertilizer Company<span class='line-break'> </span>and it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135602">
<h3><a name="page-1135602">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 360</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>360</p>
<p>Voted to authorize the President to execute<span class='line-break'> </span>and deliver the same on behalf of the cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration, as follows:</p>
<p>"Boston, January 13, 1885.<span class='line-break'> </span>"The Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Au<span class='line-break'> </span>"burn, in consideration of a mortgage of land<span class='line-break'> </span>"this day executed to it by the Bradley Fertilizer<span class='line-break'> </span>"Co., hereby covenant and agree with said Bradley<span class='line-break'> </span>"Fertilizer Co. that said mortgage will not request<span class='line-break'> </span>"or procure the assessment for taxes of the prop<span class='line-break'></span>"erty conveyed by said mortgage to be made now<span class='line-break'> </span>"or hereafter in its, the mortgage's, name, as may<span class='line-break'> </span>"be done by virtue of chapter 11 of the Public<span class='line-break'> </span>"Statutes, or, under any other law now existing;<span class='line-break'> </span>"and will not obstruct or hinder the said mort<span class='line-break'></span>"gagor from having said property assessed wholly<span class='line-break'> </span>"in its, the mortgagor's, name, irrespective of said<span class='line-break'> </span>"mortgage, so long as the terms of said mort<span class='line-break'></span>"gage are complied with by the mortgagor."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land.'>Sales of Land.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented Statements^223. 224.^ of Sales<span class='line-break'> </span>of Land from November 12, 1884 to January 14, 1885.<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lots. Nos. -'>Representatives Lots. Nos. -</span></p>
<p>That Representatives be designated for<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1390'>1390</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Amos Binney Walpole Grandson</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1391'>1391</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Amos Binney Walpole Grandnephew</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2253'>2253</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Joseph V. Wellington Cambridge Son</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2840'>2840</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Clara Cutler Cambridge Sister<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<h3><a name="page-1135603">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 361</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>361</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills.'>Monthly Bills.</span></p>
<p>The Schedules of Monthly Bills, December<span class='line-break'> </span>10, $5,165.11; and Jan. 14, 1885, $4,496.21, were pre<span class='line-break'></span>sented as having been paid by the Treasurer,<span class='line-break'> </span>after examination and approval by the<span class='line-break'> </span>President.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perpetual Repair'>Contracts Perpetual Repair</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots recommended con<span class='line-break'></span>tracts for perpetual care, as follows: -<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #219. Clarence W. Jones &amp; al. Exr's. $600.<span class='line-break'> </span>#792 Sally R. Brwer. 750.<span class='line-break'> </span>#1276 Noah S. Jenney, Adm'r. 400.<span class='line-break'> </span>#2903 Robert W. Nason, Ex'r. 1200.<span class='line-break'> </span>#2931 James M. Keich, Adm'r. 450.<span class='line-break'> </span>#3660 John J. Stevens 500.<span class='line-break'> </span>#4197 A.A. Gibson 600.<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were approved by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Meeting'>Annual Meeting</span></p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Browne, it was<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted, That the Annual Meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation be held on Monday, Feb. 2, 1885,<span class='line-break'> </span>at Horticultural Hall, at 3:30 o'clock. P.M.</p>
<p>Dissolved.<span class='line-break'> </span>Lewis G. Farmer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135604">
<h3><a name="page-1135604">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 362</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>362</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1885 February 11, Meeting.'>1885 February 11, Meeting.</span></p>
<p><u>February 11. 1885.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>The Monthly Meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, on Wednesday, February<span class='line-break'> </span>11. 1885, at 1:30 o'clock, P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present, The President, Messrs. Choate, Clapp<span class='line-break'> </span>Hodges, Jones, Payson, Rice, Sears, and Wolcott.<span class='line-break'> </span>The records of the last meeting was read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees elected Feb. 2, 1885.'>Trustees elected Feb. 2, 1885.</span></p>
<p>The President announced that, at the Annual<span class='line-break'> </span>Meeting of the Proprietors, held February 2. 1885,<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs. David R. Whitney and Richard M. Hodges,<span class='line-break'> </span>were chosen Trustees for the term of Six Years,<span class='line-break'> </span>ending 1891, and Mr. Channing Clapp was chosen<span class='line-break'> </span>a Trustee to serve until 1889, the expiration of<span class='line-break'> </span>the term of the late Alanson Bigelow.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of President'>Election of President</span></p>
<p>Mr. Wolcott, having been appointed by the President<span class='line-break'> </span>to collect, sort and count the ballots for Officers<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year, announced that the whole<span class='line-break'> </span>number of ballots for President was eight, all<span class='line-break'> </span>of which were for I.M. Spelman, and he was<span class='line-break'> </span>declared elected:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer'>Treasurer</span></p>
<p>Whole number for Treasurer, nine, all of which<span class='line-break'> </span>were for H.B. Mackintosh and he was declared elected:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent'>Superintendent</span></p>
<p>Whole number for Superintendent, nine, all of which<span class='line-break'> </span>were for J.W. Lovering, and he was declared elected:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary'>Secretary</span></p>
<p>Whole number for Secretary, nine, all of which<span class='line-break'> </span>were for L.G. Farmer, and he was declared elected,<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135605">
<h3><a name="page-1135605">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 363</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>363</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Treasurer'>Salary of Treasurer</span></p>
<p>That the salary of the Treasurer be fixed at $2,250.<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sup&apos;t.'>Sup't.</span></p>
<p>That the salary of the Superintendent be fixed at<span class='line-break'> </span>$3,000 for the ensuing year, and that he shall have the<span class='line-break'> </span>use of a House and the grounds thereto belonging, the<span class='line-break'> </span>use of a Horse and Vehicle, and the services of one<span class='line-break'> </span>Man, at the expense of the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary'>Secretary</span></p>
<p>That the salary of the Secretary be fixed at $600<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Standing Committees.'>Standing Committees.</span></p>
<p>The President announced the Standing Committees<span class='line-break'> </span>for 1885-6, as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Grounds.'>Grounds.</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>Committee on Grounds</u><span class='line-break'> </span>The President, ex officio, and Messrs. Choate, Pay<span class='line-break'></span>son, Sears and Eaton.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots.'>Lots.</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>Committee on Lots.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>The President, and Messrs. Whitney and Jones.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Finance'>Finance</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>Committee on Finance.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs. Browne and Rice.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Interments'>Interments</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>Committee on Interments</u><span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs. Wolcott and Hodges.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills.'>Monthly Bills.</span></p>
<p>The schedule of Monthly Bills of February 11,<span class='line-break'> </span>was presented, showing a total of $3,055.61<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted. That, upon approval by the President,<span class='line-break'> </span>payment thereof be made by the Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land'>Sales of Land</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement^225.^ of Sales of<span class='line-break'> </span>Land from January 16 to February 11.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representative Lot #369'>Representative Lot #369</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, that Elizabeth M. Larkin, of Boston, a grand<span class='line-break'></span>daughter of the late Proprietor be designated as the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<div class="page-content">
<p>364</p>
<p>Representative of Lot #369.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perpetual Repair'>Contracts Perpetual Repair</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots recommended contracts<span class='line-break'> </span>for the perpetual care of Lots as follows:<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #424. Estate of Frederick Almy. $450.<span class='line-break'> </span>#2792 William D. Blanchard $300.<span class='line-break'> </span>and the same were approved by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hour of Meeting'>Hour of Meeting</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>. That the hour of holding the Monthly<span class='line-break'> </span>Meetings of the Trustees be changed to 2:30<span class='line-break'> </span>P.M., until otherwise ordered.</p>
<p>Dissolved.<span class='line-break'> </span>Lewis G. Farmer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary&apos;s Oath'>Secretary's Oath</span></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts,<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk, ss. Boston, February 11, A.D. 1885</p>
<p>Personally appeared Lewis G. Farmer,<span class='line-break'> </span>and made oath that he would faithfully dis<span class='line-break'></span>charge the duties of Secretary of the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, before me<span class='line-break'> </span>Jerome Jones.<span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace,</p>

<div class="page-content">
<p>365</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1885 March 11 No Quorum'>1885 March 11 No Quorum</span></p>
<p><u>March 11, 1885.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>The monthly meeting was notified<span class='line-break'> </span>to be held on Wednesday, March 11, 1885,<span class='line-break'> </span>at 2:30 o'clock, P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span><u>No quorum was present.</u></p>
<p>Lewis G. Farmer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1885 April 8 No Quorum'>1885 April 8 No Quorum</span></p>
<p><u>April 8, 1885.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>The Monthly Meeting was notified to<span class='line-break'> </span>be held on Wednesday, April 8, 1885, at 2:30 o'clock P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present. Messrs. Spelman &amp; Rice.<span class='line-break'> </span><u>No quorum was present.</u></p>
<p>Lewis G. Farmer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1885 May 13 Meeting'>1885 May 13 Meeting</span></p>
<p><u>May 13, 1885.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>The Monthly Meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, on Wednesday, May 13,<span class='line-break'> </span>1885, at 2:30 o'clock. P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present. The President, Messrs. Choate, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Eaton, Hodges, Wolcott and Clapp.<span class='line-break'> </span>The records of the last meeting were read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills.'>Monthly Bills.</span></p>
<p>The President reported that he had examined<span class='line-break'> </span>and approved the following schedules of Month<span class='line-break'> </span>ly Bills: March 11, $2,863.60; April 8, $3,500.59, and<span class='line-break'> </span>that the same had been thereupon paid by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer. The schedule of May 13, showing a<span class='line-break'> </span>total of $6,108.56 was read, and it was<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that, upon approval by the President,<span class='line-break'> </span>payment thereof be made by the Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perpetual Care.'>Contracts Perpetual Care.</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots recommended contracts<span class='line-break'> </span>for perpetual care, as follows:<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot #387 David W. Lane $525.<span class='line-break'> </span>#838 Edward Thompson. Ex'r. 500.<span class='line-break'> </span>#920 Robert H. Stevenson 750.<span class='line-break'> </span>#931 Sarah B. Hyde 750.<span class='line-break'> </span>#1409 Frederick W. Thayer 500.<span class='line-break'> </span>#2457 Bryant T. Henry 400.<span class='line-break'> </span>#2643 Adna C. Winning, Ex'r. 150.<span class='line-break'> </span>#4028 Grace Wilson, Ex'rx 275.<span class='line-break'> </span>#4601 Heirs of *Richard Sykes 50.<span class='line-break'> </span>#4881 Lysander Kemp 75.</p>
<p>Approved by the Board. <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='229'>229</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Sarah J. Homer Boston Daughter.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2802'>2802</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Maria E. Hyde Cambridge Widow.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3032'>3032</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Frances L. Morss Somerville Widow</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land'>Sales of Land</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented Statements^226. 227. 228.^ of Sales<span class='line-break'> </span>of Land from February 11 to May 13.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Quarterly Report.'>Treasurer's Quarterly Report.</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer having presented his Report^229^<span class='line-break'> </span>for the Quarter ending March 31, the same<span class='line-break'> </span>was referred to the Committee on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Crematory at Cemetery'>Crematory at Cemetery</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, That the subject of establishing a<span class='line-break'> </span>Crematory at Mount Auburn, or of adopting<span class='line-break'> </span>any other method of taking care of the dead<span class='line-break'> </span>so that sanitary law shall not be violated, upon<span class='line-break'> </span>which the Trustees were instructed to report at the<span class='line-break'> </span>next annual meeting of the Proprietors, be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the President and Messrs. Wolcott and Hodges.</p>

<div id="page-1135610">
<h3><a name="page-1135610">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 368</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>368</p>
<p>to inquire and report to the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Interments in cases of Infetious Diseass'><u>Interments in cases of Infetious Diseass</u></span></p>
<p>Voted.  That the subject of making inter<span class='line-break'></span>ments and removals in cases of death from <span class='line-break'> </span>infectious diseases be referred to the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Interments, with power to take such action <span class='line-break'> </span>as may seem to them expedient and proper,<span class='line-break'> </span>subject, however, to the approval of the President.</p>
<p>Dissolved,</p>
<p>Lewis G. Farmer, Sec'y.</p>

<p><u>No quorum was present,</u></p>
<p>Lewis G. Farmer</p>

<p><u>No quorum was present.</u></p>

<p><u>August 12. 1885.</u></p>
<p>The Monthly Meeting was notified to be held <span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, August 12. at 2:30 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p><u>No quorum was present</u></p>
<p>Lewis G. Farmer</p>
<p>Secretary</p>

<p><u>1885  October 12. Special Meeting.</u>===</p>
<p><u>October 12. 1885.</u></p>
<p>A Special Meeting of the Board of Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held as notified on Monday, October 12. 1855<span class='line-break'> </span>at 12 o'clock, M.   Present:</p>
<p>The President and Messrs Choate, Browne, Eaton, Hodges, Wolcott, Clapp and Jones.</p>
<p>The records of the meeting of May 13. and of<span class='line-break'> </span>subesequent meetings were read and approved.</p>
<p>---<u>Monthly Bills</u>===</p>
<p>The President reported that he had examined <span class='line-break'> </span>and approevd the following Schedules of Monthly <span class='line-break'> </span>Bills:  June 10, $673.07; July 8. $6327.39; August 12,<span class='line-break'> </span>$5457.38; September 9, $5732.73;  and that the same <span class='line-break'> </span>had been thereupon paid by the Treasurer.  The <span class='line-break'> </span>Schedule of October 12. showing a total of $6734.82<span class='line-break'> </span>was read, and it was</p>
<p>Voted = that upon approval by the President,<span class='line-break'> </span>payment thereof be made by the Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Quarterly Reports'><u>Treasurer's Quarterly Reports</u></span></p>
<p>The Treasurer having presented his Reports <sup>230.231</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>for the Quarters ending June 30 and September 30, <span class='line-break'> </span>the same were referred to the Committee on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives Lots No&apos;s.'><u>Representatives Lots No's.</u></span></p>
<p>Voted - that Representatives be designated <span class='line-break'> </span>for Lots as follows: -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='523'><u>523</u></span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2117'><u>2117</u></span></p>
<p>Gertrude E. Wightman  Boston  Daughter</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2678'><u>2678</u></span></p>
<p>Herbert S. Pearson  Boston  Son</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land'><u>Sales of Land</u></span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition for Representation'><u>Petition for Representation</u></span></p>
<p>The matter of altering the form of petitions <span class='line-break'> </span>for Representatation to conform with the provisions of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Public Statues and the Charter of the Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion was referred to the Committee on Lots, with <span class='line-break'> </span>power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Donations in Trust Form of.'><u>Donations in Trust Form of.</u></span></p>
<p>Voted - that the form of Donations in Trust <span class='line-break'> </span>heretofore in use be changed by striking out <span class='line-break'> </span>the clause describing the matter of investment,<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Repair Fund, and inserting in place <span class='line-break'> </span>thereof the words: "in accordance with the pro<span class='line-break'></span>visions of the By Laws in regard to the investment of <span class='line-break'> </span>such funds,"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Single-Chamber Tombs Removal of.'><u>Single-Chamber Tombs Removal of.</u></span></p>
<p>Voted - that the Superintendent be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to remove all single chamber tombs, <span class='line-break'> </span>with entrance above ground, at the request <span class='line-break'> </span>of the owner of the same, to regrade the Lot <span class='line-break'> </span>and to mkae all necessary re-interments <span class='line-break'> </span>without charge, except for brick graves,i.e. sod<span class='line-break'></span>ding and corner posts where the same may be required,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Single Chamber Tombs care of'><u>Single Chamber Tombs care of</u></span></p>
<p>Voted - that no Lot containing single-cham<span class='line-break'></span>ber tombs with entrance above ground, shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be taken by the Corporation under perpetual care <span class='line-break'> </span>with guaranty, unless under conditions that no more <span class='line-break'> </span>interments shall be made in said tombs, or with <span class='line-break'> </span>provision that the Trustees may remove said tombs<span class='line-break'> </span>should they consider them to be unsafe or un-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135614">
<h3><a name="page-1135614">Trustees Records, Vol. 6, 1875, page 372</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>372</p>
<p>healthy, and order all future interments to be <span class='line-break'> </span>made in the ground.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Infectious Diseases Temporary Interment'><u>Infectious Diseases Temporary Interment</u></span></p>
<p>Voted - that where the cause of death is <span class='line-break'> </span>certified as contagious or infectious no body <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be allowed to be placed in the Receiving <span class='line-break'> </span>Tomb; and that the Committee on Lots be, and <span class='line-break'> </span>are hereby authorized to set a part of a Lot for the <span class='line-break'> </span>temporary interments of all such bodies, in lieu <span class='line-break'> </span>of using the REceiving Tomb.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perpetual Care'><u>Contracts Perpetual Care</u></span></p>

<p><u>December 9. 1885</u></p>
<p>The Monthy Meeting of the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held, as notified, on Wednesday <span class='line-break'> </span>December 9. 1885. at 2:30 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present.  The President, Messrs. Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Rice, Eaton, Wolcott, Jones, Hodges,<span class='line-break'> </span>Clapp and Papyson.</p>
<p>The records of the meeting of October 12,<span class='line-break'> </span>were read and approve.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills,.'><u>Monthly Bills,.</u></span></p>
<p>The President reported that he had exam<span class='line-break'></span>ined and approved the Schedule of Monthly <span class='line-break'> </span>Bills, for Nov. 11. amounting to $6,644.07; and<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>

<p>that the same had been thereupon paid<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Treasurer. The Schedule of December<span class='line-break'> </span>9. showing a total of $4,873.59, was read, and<span class='line-break'> </span>it was Voted.</p>
<p>That upon approval by the President,<span class='line-break'> </span>payment thereof be made by the Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land'><u>Sales of Land</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented Statements of<span class='line-break'> </span>Sales of Land from October 12^237. 238.^ to Dec. 9.</p>

<p>The Committee consisting of the President<span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs. Wolcott and Hodges, appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>at the meeting of May 13. last to inquire into<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject of establishing a Crematory at<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn, or of adopting any other method<span class='line-break'> </span>of taking care of the dead, so that sanitary<span class='line-break'> </span>law shall not be violated", presented its<span class='line-break'> </span>report^239^, which was accepted and placed on<span class='line-break'> </span>file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Office.'><u>New Office.</u></span></p>
<p>The subject of the selection of new offices<span class='line-break'> </span>for the Corporation was discussed, and the President<span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs. Choate and Browne were appointed a<span class='line-break'> </span>committee to select an office and report.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1886 January 13 Meeting'><u>1886 January 13 Meeting</u></span></p>
<p><u>January 13, 1886,</u></p>
<p>The Monthly Meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, on Wednesday, January 13, 1886,<span class='line-break'> </span>at 2:30 o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, The President, Messrs. Choate, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Rice, Wolcott, Sears and Hodges.</p>
<p>The records of the last meeting were read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Report to Proprietors'><u>Annual Report to Proprietors</u></span></p>
<p>The President presented and read the Annual^240^ Report<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Proprietors, and it was</p>
<p>Voted. That the Annual Report, as read, be ap<span class='line-break'></span>proved and adopted as the Report of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Proprietors, and that it be printed and<span class='line-break'> </span>distributed to the Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s Annual Report.'><u>Superintendent's Annual Report.</u></span></p>
<p>The Superintendent and Treasurer having pre<span class='line-break'></span>sented their respective Annual Reports^241. 242^, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Annual Report.'><u>Treasurer's Annual Report.</u></span></p>
<p>Voted. that the same be accepted and printed,<span class='line-break'> </span>and distributed to the Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sales of Land'><u>Sales of Land</u></span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a Statement^243^ of Sales<span class='line-break'> </span>of Land from December 9, 1885 to Dan. 13, 1886,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts Perpetual Care'><u>Contracts Perpetual Care</u></span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots recommended contracts<span class='line-break'> </span>for perpetual care as follows</p>
<p>Lot #825. Maria B Bodge $425.</p>
<p>Lot #2921 *John Cowdin by Executors 500.</p>
<p>Lot #4037 *Willard [Dalryuple?] by Heir 500.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Bills'><u>Monthly Bills</u></span></p>
<p>The Schedule of Monthly Bills of January 13,<span class='line-break'> </span>was presented, showing a total of $4501.46,</p>
<p>Voted, that upon approval by the President,</p>

<p>Voted. That the President is hereby author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to construct a Brick Safe in connection<span class='line-break'> </span>with the Superintendent's office in Cambridge,<span class='line-break'> </span>substantially in accordance with the plans<span class='line-break'> </span>presented to the Board.</p>
<p>Dissolved.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='February 11. Meeting.'><u>February 11. Meeting.</u></span></p>
<p><u>February 11, 1886</u></p>
<p>The Monthly Meeting of the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held, as notified, on Wednesday, February<span class='line-break'> </span>10. 1886, at 2:30 o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present - The President and Messrs. Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Rice, Whitney, Wolcott, Clapp and Jones.</p>
<p>The records of the last meeting were read<span class='line-break'> </span>and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees elected Feb. 1, 1886.'><u>Trustees elected Feb. 1, 1886.</u></span></p>
<p>The President announced that, at the Annual<span class='line-break'> </span>Meeting of the Proprietors held February 1.<span class='line-break'> </span>1886, Messrs. Israel M. Spelman and Jerome<span class='line-break'> </span>Jones were chosen Trustees for the term of Six Years<span class='line-break'> </span>ending 1892.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of President'><u>Election of President</u></span></p>
<p>Mr. Wolcott having been appointed by the Pres<span class='line-break'></span>ident a committee to collect, sort and count<span class='line-break'> </span>the ballots for Officers for the ensuing year, an<span class='line-break'></span>nounced that the whole number of ballots</p>
</div>

<p>377</p>
<p>cast for President was six, all of which were<span class='line-break'> </span>for Israel M. Spelman and he was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer'><u>Treasurer</u></span></p>
<p>Whole number for Treasurer, seven, all of<span class='line-break'> </span>which were for H.B. Mackintosh; whole number</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent'><u>Superintendent</u></span></p>
<p>for Superintendent, seven, all of which were<span class='line-break'> </span>for J.W. Lovering; whole number for Secretary, 7, all</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary'><u>Secretary</u></span></p>
<p>of which were for L.G. Farmer; and each of<span class='line-break'> </span>the three last named was declared elected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Treasurer'><u>Salary of Treasurer</u></span></p>
<p><u>Voted.</u></p>
<p>That the salary of the Treasurer be fixed<span class='line-break'> </span>at $2,500 for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent'><u>Superintendent</u></span></p>
<p>That the salary of the Superintendent be<span class='line-break'> </span>fixed at #3,200. for the ensuing year, and that<span class='line-break'> </span>he shall have the use of a House and the grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>thereto belonging, the use of a Horse and Ve<span class='line-break'></span>hicle and the services of one man, at the expense<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary'><u>Secretary</u></span></p>
<p>That the Salary of the Secretary be fixed at<span class='line-break'> </span>$600. for teh ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Clerk'><u>Clerk</u></span></p>
<p>That the Salary of the Clerk be fixed at<span class='line-break'> </span>$1,100. for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Standing Committees.'><u>Standing Committees.</u></span></p>
<p>The President announced the Standing Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittees for 1886-7, as follows:</p>
<p><u>Committee on Grounds.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Grounds.'><u>Grounds.</u></span></p>
<p>The President, ex officio, and Messrs. Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Payson, Sears and Eaton.</p>
<p><u>Committee on Lots.</u></p>
<p>===<u>Lots</u></p>
<p>The President and Messrs. Whitney and Jones.</p>

<p>The schedule of Monthly Bills of February<span class='line-break'> </span>10. was presented, showing a total of $3,087.94;</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, That, upon approval by the President,<span class='line-break'> </span>payment thereof be made by the Treasurer.</p>
